Sector: Internet
Descripción:
WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at Bodas.net (The Knot Worldwide), we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life’s milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

This Data Analyst will work with the Ads & Growth team at TKWW. They will help the team understand performance by developing analytical tools and performing ad-hoc analysis. They will assist with product testing, modeling, data investigations, and visualizations. They will be a valued partner and trusted advisor.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and product engagement
Identify key trends and areas of opportunity for product and business teams
Help provide data and insights to drive up revenue mix by investigating and optimizing the funnel
Assist with setting up, conducting, and interpreting outcomes of A/B testing and other forms of experimentation
Create and manage reports and data assets in dashboarding tools like Metabase, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the team apprised of key trends
Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
Explore novel ways to look at our data
Assist with development of metrics and goals

SUCCESSFUL DATA ANALYST CANDIDATES HAVE:

Background working within a team in a data-driven environment
SQL and database experience
Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery or other event tracking
Experience with financial modeling
2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
Excellent communication and project management skills
You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
Proficiency with R or Python is a plus

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn’t right, you say something.
You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.
You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.
You aren’t afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there’s no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.

Sector: Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst para integrarse en el equipo de pricing para participar en la transformación de los modelos de Pricing y aumentar la automatización, el desarrollo de nuevas herramientas y el análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos con un gran impacto en el negocio de líneas personales.

Tu día a día consistirá en:

Optimización del proceso de preparación, ejecución y análisis de grandes bases de datos.
Automatización de procesos internos de reporting y análisis.
Desarrollo e implementación de técnicas de machine learning para la mejora del pricing y la suscripción.
Construcción de modelos de riesgo, conversión, elasticidad al precio y detección de pocket of loss.
Construcción de herramientas para el análisis de rentabilidad del negocio tanto en nueva producción como en renovaciones.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Esperamos que la persona que se incorpore en el equipo reúna las siguientes habilidades y experiencias:

Licenciado/a en Data Science, Programación, Matemáticas, Ciencias Actuariales, Estadísticas o formaciones relacionadas
Experiencia demostrable en roles de Data Analyst o similares
Conocimientos avanzados de SAS, R y/o Python así como técnicas de Machine Learning.
Capacidad analítica, toma de decisiones fundamentadas y orientación a resultados.
Capacidad de comunicación.
Innovación y proactividad.
Persona con visión de negocio.
Nivel alto de Español, deseable nivel alto de inglés.
Ideal si tiene conocimientos de seguros y conocimientos de pricing

Por ser de Zurich

En Zurich queremos cuidar de ti y estos son algunos de tus beneficios:

Compensación flexible.
Tarjeta restaurante.
Bono oficina en casa.
Flexwork: 20 horas semanales para trabajar donde y cuando quieras.
Plan de pensiones
Seguro de vida.
Oferta bancaria y aseguradora.
Descuento en gimnasios.
Zurich Wellness, actividades deportivas.
Zurich Sports Club, inscripciones gratis en maratones y carreras populares.
Clases de inglés gratuitas.

Quienes somos

Nuestros cerca de 55.000 empleados en más de 215 países y territorios son la base de nuestro éxito. Son ellos quienes permiten que las empresas y las comunidades se puedan enfrentar a un mundo de riesgos con confianza. Imagina si pudieras ayudar a las personas a hacer esto en todo el mundo. Les darías confianza y tranquilidad protegiendo lo que más aman. Es un gran desafío, pero contarás con el apoyo de un gran equipo internacional que está dispuesto a ayudarte para que puedas alcanzar tu máximo potencial y así cumplir con nuestras promesas.

Nosotros ya nos hemos puesto en marcha y estamos cambiando la forma de hacer seguros. ¡Para ello necesitamos gente con talento, ganas de aprender y pasión! ¿Te unes a nosotros?

“ Zurich , 14 años consecutivos como Top Employer ”

Zurich Insurance tiene y aplica una política de igualdad de oportunidades de empleo. Nuestro objetivo es atraer y retener los mejores profesionales sin discriminar por discapacidad, raza, nacionalidad, religión, género, orientación sexual o edad.

Sector: Internet
Funciones laborales: Tecnología de la información Análisis Marketing
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Benoit Martin
Founder & CEO at Popcarte
Enviar mensaje InMail
Data Analyst - Missions en français

En pleine phase de croissance, Popcarte met la Data au coeur de sa stratégie de développement. A la croisée de tous les métiers de la société (Produit, Marketing, Finance, IT, Opérations), la Data est aujourd’hui notre levier clé et fondamental pour la prise de décisions business et l'optimisation du travail des équipes.

Popcarte recherche un(e) Data Analyst pour structurer, rendre accessible et analyser nos Données et asseoir notre démarche “Data Centric”’. 

Au coeur de notre équipe, vous travaillerez avec l’ensemble de nos métiers afin de:


Structurer la donnée Popcarte

Conception et création d’un Datalake
Proposer des évolutions des bases : structure, collecte, harmonisation pour servir les besoins business
Enrichir les données collectées, qualitativement et quantitativement


Analyser et modéliser

Accompagner les équipes dans la définition et l’automatisation de leurs tableaux de bords métiers
Réalisation des analyses ad hoc en fonction des besoins des différents pôles (Marketing, Produit, Finance, Opérations, Service Client…) et émettre des recommandations en vue d’amélioration de l’expérience client interne et externe
Créer de nouveaux processus liés à la Donnée et fournir à nos équipes des rapports et alertes leur permettant de mieux réaliser leurs missions
Participer à l’élaboration de projets de développement stratégiques sous tendus par des analyses fines et poussées de données. Réalisation de modélisations associées
Benchmark des Best Practices Data


Structurer l’activité Data

Promouvoir et accompagner en interne notre démarche data driven auprès des équipes opérationnelles
Mettre en place des process de pilotage et de suivi de l’activité


Il s’agit donc d’un poste très complet car il est à la fois stratégique et opérationnel. C’est aussi un poste transverse qui vous amènera à vous coordonner avec toutes les équipes et qui vous demandera beaucoup de rigueur, de prise d’initiative et d’autonomie.


Nous vous proposons
Un contrat à durée indéterminée avec un démarrage dès que possible
Des bureaux bien placés et agréables à Barcelone, Espagne (Calle Comte de Salvatierra, en plein centre, avec une jolie terrasse et une table de ping-pong)
Une mission qui s’effectue en français
10 jours de télétravail par an (possibilité d'étendre ce nb de jours en fonction évolution Covid)
Une rémunération attractive à définir en fonction de ton expérience
Une mutuelle fournie
Un environnement de travail et une équipe résolument tournés vers l’amélioration continue
Une vie sociale de l’équipe développée avec notamment nos dejs d’équipe mensuels, nos drinks du vendredi et nos traditionnelles Summer & Winter Parties.

Envoyez-nous votre plus beau CV ainsi qu'une lettre de motivation.

Nous cherchons la perle rare. Si vous avez la bonne expérience et une furieuse envie d'écrire l'avenir de Popcarte avec nous, vous passerez 3 entretiens avec Carole notre Head of Marketing, Guillaume notre Head of Product et Benoit notre CEO. Nous vous demanderons aussi de travailler sur un cas pratique.

Un grand merci et à très bientôt !

Sector: Software Internet Videojuegos
Descripción:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!

Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Analyst in our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
What are we looking for?
2/3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
And you are ...
A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn’t stopped us from offering these great benefits!

You’ll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser ’s for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
“An apple a day keeps the doctor away” so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors from some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel industry.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion—by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

In spite of the ongoing global pandemic, we’re continuously growing and adapting to the situation. We’re turning lemons into lemonade—because we’re innovators. We’ve even developed TravelCare, our very own travel risk management tool, to ensure business travelers are safe and sound before, during, and after their trips. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.


What You Need
Data engineering or Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English.
Excellent analytical skills.


You Will Need To Prove The Following
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)
Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data: ETL processes (i.e. Pentaho Data Integration).
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker).
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals.


What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain, 25 in the UK or Germany
Flexibility to work from home most of the time.
Health perks, these vary depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Perks such as language lessons, yoga and office food have been put on hold during Covid-19 and will be reviewed


Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in.
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain, UK or Germany for this position.
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona, London or Berlin twice per week.
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event.
We have core working hours.
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!


We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
Empresa startup ganadora de numerosos premios nacionales e internacionales, que lo está, literalmente petando, cuyo producto es un Marketplace que, a parte de serlo en un sector innovador, ha solucionado y ha tenido un impacto social muy positivo. El equilibrio perfecto entre una gran idea disruptiva y el bien que hace a su sector.
Actualmente buscan un Data Engineer para ser el owner del desarrollo del Data Lake, Data Warehouse, aportando los mejores métodos y de la mejor forma para la ingestión de datos. Desarrollar las herramientas y frameworks útiles para conectar el equipo de Data con el de IT, construyendo pipelines escalables y, al mismo tiempo, haciendo uso de diferentes tecnologías. (esto no parece decir mucho más que cualquier otra oferta, verdad? Pero ahora sigo)
Equipo: Estarás trabajando con otros 3 data analyst, la head de data, y en estrecha colaboración con el DevOps y el equipo IT.

El must de stack: Actualmente están migrando todo su data stack a Google Cloud (Bigquery, Composer). Pero, conocedores de que no es tan común el expertise de esta herramienta en el mercado (aunque cada vez se usa más), estarían buscando a alguien que venga de AWS (Redshift y demás) así como Airflow, y tampoco una excesiva seniority, porque la idea es que tenga los fundamentos y dentro de la empresa poder formarse y crecer. A destacar que como Benefit ellos tienen suscripción a una famosa plataforma de aprendizaje, así como tienen asignado tiempo semanal, en horario laboral, para formarse.
Softskills: Ambiente increíble, dicho por varios miembros del equipo, ya que los conocemos desde hace tiempo. Buscarían a alguien dinámico, que le mole el ecosistema startup, y no le de miedo lanzarse a la piscina a aprender cosas nuevas y últimas tecnologías.
Y esto no es todo, además de un paquete de benefits al que habría que añadir mucho team building, y clases de idiomas, se añade su política 100% remote friendly (aunque restringido por ahora a las personas en el mismo huso horario que España), por lo que, si así lo quieres, y más allá del COVID, puedes continuar trabajando desde tu casa, la cafetería o un lugar paradisíaco de la costa ?
Challengue + la leche de compañía + gran ambiente laboral + 100% remote + muchas más cosas.
Cuál es el salario máximo que ofrecen por esta ganga de oportunidad? 45.000 € bruto/anual
Si te ha interesado lo más mínimo, aplica y te contaré más.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Software Internet
Descripción:
At Domestika we are looking for a Data Analyst.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help us make a positive impact in the decisions we make daily. We believe in creating an environment where data analysts can actively participate in formulating hypotheses, making proposals and follow through in a close relationship with our colleagues in business areas.

We need you to be driven, courageous and ready to learn. While you will work closely with our Senior and Lead Analysts, you will be virtually sitting next to our business users to understand their challenges and help them use analytics to best support their decisions.

We Are Particularly Interested In Profiles With Experience In The Following Areas

As a Data Analyst, you will work with Data every day, finding ways to interpret it so that it makes sense for our users.
Social Media campaigns performance
Digital content performance
CRM and Loyalty programs
Growth performance
Pricing Strategy
Product Analytics
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

What does a Data Analyst do at Domestika?
Help Domestika colleagues in everyday analytics questions.
Deliver actionable insight to business stakeholders.
Understand Domestika business model and key drivers.
Help define performance measurement such as metrics or KPIs.
Operate and support the good use of Analytical tools such Periscope, GA, Amplitude and more.
Follow-through analytical requests to understand its added value to the business.
Actively contribute to our User tracking framework definition and implementation.

Requirements
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a digital company, consumer apps.
Analytical mindset.
Ability to read and write complex SQL.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.
Preferably, a Math/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.
Based within European time zone.
English required at Full professional proficiency.

Would Be a Plus
Familiarity with business intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics, etc.
Experience in designing events and tagging for analytics.
Ability to work independently, take the initiative and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?
Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
Balanced work life with a Remote First approach.
A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
An honest salary according to your experience and profile.

Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Medios de comunicación en línea
Descripción:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Within FP&A, you will join a team (5 people) whose main missions are to define, mutualize, automate, develop and ease access to company Commercial and Financial reporting for Criteo

Your Main Mission Will Be To
Design, develop and maintain SQL scripts, datasets and dashboards that contributes to produce Criteo daily performance metrics (in Power BI technology)
Analyze gathered data, find patterns and propose relevant dashboards/KPI to support key business decisions
Write-up technical and end-user documentations
Train and support end-users on the reporting portfolio and data self-service access
Participate to the Power BI platform support to guaranty a high service level and propose technical optimization to improve automation level, performance and reliability
Animate Sales and Financial operational processes such as quarterly forecasting and monthly reporting processes
Work closely with FP&A/Sales end users to identify future business needs
Who You Are
MS degree in Engineering, Business, Finance or a related degree
2 years proven working experience as data analyst
You demonstrate a high interest in BI and Data such as:
Understanding of database modeling
Experience with one of reporting packages BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense)
Good SQL knowledge,
Sales OPS or FP&A functional knowledge would be a plus
Ease to work in a very iterative manner with prototypes (Agile mode)
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving mind-set
Fluent in English
At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
We are a global scale-up from Barcelona, born in 2015, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We envision a world free from fossil fuels and we believe the first step in this journey is creating solutions that make electric vehicle charging easier for everyone.

We’re devoted to researching and developing state-of-the-art electric vehicle charging solutions for homes, businesses, and cities. And this way, our mission is to create more sustainable ways of using and sharing energy.

We want to empower people to create, use and share renewable energy in ways they never imagined.

Wallbox currently operates in over 50 countries and has offices in Barcelona, Madrid, Shanghai, and San Francisco. We are powered by a culture of trust, innovation and diversity. For us, talent has no borders. We have more than 350 dedicated experts from over 30 different nationalities working together to create the most innovative products and the best experiences for our customers.

This culture has shown to be rewarding in many ways - amongst them, the creation of the world’s first bidirectional charger, the Quasar, and the recognition as the best of CES 2020 in transportation technology. We have recently closed our second tranche of Series A investment, bringing the total round to €23M and we’ve been recognized as LinkedIn's Top 5 Startups 2020 in Spain.

At the end of the day, working at Wallbox is at the same time challenging, fun and rewarding. If you like the idea of a dynamic environment, desire to work alongside an incredibly talented, fast-growing team and believe in the future of sustainable transportation, this is the place for you.

Are you ready to change the world with us?

About The Role

We are looking for a Digital Data Analyst; your primary responsibility will be for Data analysis, from working with 3rd party data to 1st party data by using multiple tools such as Adwords, Search console for but mainly Google Analytics.

The position will be very data and relationship focused. Working in the e-commerce team with our digital agencies, UX team and marketing team.

A strong understanding of Data is essential. Specific tasks will include; working with different analytic tools, stakeholder relations, embedding change. In addition you will also create dashboards for better understanding and data visualization.

You will
Work with a multicultural digital team.
Work with all the global markets.
Work in a growing industry.
Help to create and constantly improve the e-commerce business.


Requirements
High level of English.
Barcelona based.
Minimum 3 years of Experience as a proven Digital Data Analyst, Marketing Insight Analyst, Insight Analyst, or Campaign Analyst
Degree in Marketing, Business, Finance, Statistics or Economics.
Being a Google Analytics expert is absolutely essential.
Previous experience in a e-commerce team.
Experience with Data and analysis in order to bring a data-driven approach to decision-making tactics.
Excel advanced skills are essential (able to work with complex Excel formulas).
It is a plus knowing data visualization tools.
High attention to detail and appreciation for understanding processes.
SQL experience would be plus.
Experience with Amazon platform would be a massive help
Knowledge in any of the following areas Attribution Modelling, Programmatic (DMP, DSP, SSP), Cross-Device Measurement.


Benefits
100% company paid private medical insurance, including dental coverage, after six months
Attractive compensation package
Flexible working hours
Friday afternoons off
Opportunity to advance your payroll (under request)
Unlimited coffee & beverages
Language classes (English & Spanish)
Sports channel, which offers online classes until our gym is opened
Monthly “All Hands” & other team events
Brand new canteen with a variety of breakfast and lunch dishes, everyday, for a discounted price
Brand new offices in Zona Franca
Over 20 different nationalities
No suits! Unless it’s Carnival or Halloween

Please submit CV in English

At Wallbox, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. We currently deliver over +100M annual orders and operate in 22 countries, and in over +300 cities.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst to join the Q-commerce team. Would you rather read numbers than books? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona’s fastest growing Startups – helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

As a Data Analyst in the Q-commerce team you will be responsible for using data to support different business areas unlock their potential, always in the business front-line creating tools that optimise operations, improve marketing effectiveness, and in general developing new ways of doing things.

We are looking for a tech savvy analytics professional with the same passion that we have for creating solutions from scratch in a Groceries business that is scaling like a rocket.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Create customised tools to enable new business operating models such as darkstores and fulfillment
Automate and improve manual processes to relieve pain points from the Groceries local teams
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
A/B test the launch of new features
Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data
Mentor junior colleagues
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders


You Have
2-4 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions
Expertise in business operations within specific function or area
Proficient with SQL
Amazon Redshift experience is highly desirable
Proficiency in Python or R
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview
Previous experience in programming is desirable
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field
Experience managing a small team
Proficiency in English is a must


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Brief Description
This job is for you if you’re an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company – and an industry – where you’ll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience.
Description
This job is for you if you’re an analytical thinker, who is looking to make an impact in a company – and an industry – where you’ll truly make a difference. Business Analysts are critical thinkers who conceptualize and structure problems, perform numerical analysis and extract key insights that underpin our recommendations and solutions for our clients. As an analyst you will be working alongside industry experts and gain invaluable on-the-job experience. You’ll also have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills that make you the ideal team player. The nature of the role means that analysts travel frequently, so you’ll need to be ready to jet-set across the globe.
Here’s what an ordinary day could look like:
Business Analysts will typically perform the following tasks and responsibilities:
- Work in a project module with support and guidance from senior team members
- Facilitate in producing reliable and accurate research for client projects and proposals
- Conduct analysis of quantitative and qualitative data
- Summarize main ideas and findings from work through written, graphical or oral presentations
- Help facilitate discussions within project teams
- Increase proficiency in unfamiliar TMT topics
- Supports senior team members in the development of intellectual capital
Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
Skills and Qualifications
- Undergraduate degree in: Business, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, Management, Strategy, Analytics or a related field, with strong grades (min. 2.1 equivalent grade)
- A relevant internship assuming similar responsibilities
- Interest in the Telecoms, Media and Tech (TMT) industry
- Good problem-solving skills
- Strong quantitative and analytical skills
- A logical and lateral thinker, who is intellectually curious
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with fluency in English (written and spoken)
- A team player, who can work in a truly diverse setting
- Highly motivated individual who is looking to learn and grow with the company
Additional skills that give you the edge
These are advantageous, but not strictly required from all applicants:
- Previous experience within the TMT sector
- Previous experience in a professional services environment
- Knowledge of programming languages and statistical analysis tools
- Additional languages (spoken and written)
- International exposure and work experience
- An entrepreneurial spirit, with previous experience in a start-up or entrepreneurial business venture

Internet
Descripción:
TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000’s and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 150+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 32 nationalities. At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

What you will do

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our analytics department.

In this position, you will play a critical role in setting up critical reporting for one of our fastest-growing products. Excellent technical skills are required to define and implement ETL processes, define SQL queries and visualize data by building a set of automated dashboards.
Thanks to the analytical and business-oriented approach to data, the senior business intelligence analyst will boost product optimization and help to unlock new revenue opportunities.

Responsibilities
Help define and monitor user journey KPIs (such as ARPU., etc.)
Collaborate with marketing teams (CRM, user acquisition,…) to define key metrics and reporting requirements.
Understand marketing questions and dynamics and translate them into analysis and opportunities.
Proactively provide hands-on analyses to highlight trends and discover insights from data.
Owning and developing tracking of the full customer journey across all current and future marketing platforms.
Design, implement and maintain ETL processes for integrating the necessary data sources.
Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making.
Enable self-service data exploration, making data standardized and easily accessible.
Collaborate with stakeholders to collect feedback, educate on new data solutions and promote data culture within the company

Requirements
The ideal candidate will have at least 3+ years of relevant industry experience, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements.

Experience in a similar role and/or a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
High level of expertise with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.
Knowledge of digital marketing & advertising technology ecosystem.
Experience exploiting and integrating external API’s.
Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL pipelines and data modeling.
Strong presentation skills in communicating to both experts and general audiences.
Excellent problem solving, analytical and critical thinking.
Quality driven, attention to detail and pragmatic.
Proactive and positive attitude, self-organized and an excellent team player.
Agile and innovative with the tenacity to thrive in a constantly changing environment and willingness to improve.
Communicative and empathic with stakeholders.
Fluent spoken and written English.

Nice to have experience with not necessarily:
Experience with AWS Big Data stack (Redshift, S3, EMR, etc)
Data modelling expertise with R or Python
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Superset

Benefits
Private Health and Dental Insurance plan for employees.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly internet allowance.
Working from home setup allowance.
Company sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored training and development.
Quarterly company bonus programme.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Remote policy and flexible working hours
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Hybrid remote model office.
*Please note: All applications must be submitted in English

About Ingenuous
 Ingenuous Pty Ltd is a decision support company delivering Financial Crimes Prevention, Compliance and Lending in a single platform called Intuition, a merger of best software engineering and machine learning. It also supplements its software solutions with a comprehensive set of professional services, which are consulting packages aimed at ensuring our clients are maximising their investment in technology.

Intuition by Ingenuous is the latest in fraud prevention and compliance and covers onboarding, transactional monitoring and decisioning. It understands the behavioural patterns of every customer by processing information through every relevant data source.

Why you will love working at Ingenuous:
You will work with a company using latest technology and have an opportunity to shape the company’s growth in new markets.
You will be part of a team comprised of experts in their field.
Ingenuous is a fast growing organisation allowing us to gain exposure to a range of skills and industries.
Our solutions fight financial crime, protecting people from losing their money, and identifying organised crime.
Ingenuous has a culture of learning and innovating, with training and mentoring support.
Benefits include a bonus scheme, career growth opportunities, training and mentoring schemes, generous and flexible leave allowances (annual, personal, carer’s and parental) and social team events.
We promote casual and flexible working environments and arrangements.

About the Role – Business Analyst
 This role reports to the Head of Product and Strategy. You will be an integral part of our product team, but this key role is multifunctional, and you will also continuously contribute to project deliveries, pre-sales, client support, and data analytics.  Any of the following locations are suitable for this role: Bangkok, Barcelona, Jakarta, Kuala Lumpur, Melbourne.

What your day will look like:
Participate actively in solution design workshops, gather and analyse requirements, and understand how to fulfil them with existing and/or new functionality.
Create functional specifications and translate requirements into user stories.
Work with key stakeholders to ensure requirements are correctly understood and met.
Work closely with the data science team to optimise detection rates and automate processes wherever possible.
Provide hands-on analysis to highlight trends and discover insights from customer data.
Prepare system configurations for our SaaS environments used for existing customers, pre-sales, or internal purposes.
Participate in executing Proofs of Concept.
Deliver product training to end-users and run review sessions to optimise the ongoing management of our solution.
Occasionally provide 2nd level product and/or strategy support to clients.
Generate and recommend test cases and support QA tasks (internally and with customers).
Create and update product documentation in support of product marketing and technical writing.

Requirements for this role:
Information Technology or Business-related University degree.
At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst working with web applications, ideally related to financial crimes management.
Strong deductive reasoning and quantitative analysis.
Excellent communication skills, with an emphasis on written communication.
Creativity and Proactivity
Good at problem-solving and researching innovative ways to find solutions.
Self-motivated.
Ability to work in a global environment, with team members and clients around the world.

Beneficial for this role:
An understanding of basic concepts related to any of the following will be of benefit:
SaaS solutions and Cloud technologies
Decisioning solutions related to Financial Crimes Prevention, Compliance and/or Lending
Data analytics and AI/ML models
Web UX/UI design
Elastic stack
Ability to read and understand scripts

Successful candidates will be required to provide a current police/criminal record check with a clear result.

Descripción:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.

Backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving the understanding of our customers (supply & demand).

As part of this role, you’ll study user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics across the customer journey, from acquisition to activation, engagement and retention
Increase our customer knowledge through applied analytics, clustering and segmentation
Quantify the impact of the initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, sharing knowledge and insights across the organization
Design, execute, and evaluate experiments on a global scale (CRM, copy, etc.)
Iterate on our growth strategy (attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modeling, etc.)
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behaviour and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards


What We Are Looking For
Experience as an in-house Data Scientist or Data Analyst. At least 3 years' experience, ideally more.
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Previous experience in some of the following Growth techniques: attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modelling
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must


Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)


What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance


Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We’re obsessed with our customer’s problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.


Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Descripción:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.

With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.

Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.

Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.

In 2018 we launched - the IT community of Veepee. Our teams are widely distributed within the offices in Paris, Lyon, Nantes, Nice, Barcelona, Brussels, Warsaw, Amsterdam and Tel-Aviv.

Veepee is currently in a context of convergence of the three main IS of vente-privee, privalia and vente-exclusive. As a Business & Data Analyst in vpTech you will be a part of the Finance Tribe, to develop the new B2C billing factory and ensure the legacy one keeps on working properly. You will be in contact with: - business key users of Finance around EU to collect group and local requirements and use cases, provide data extracted for different systems, analyse issues and fix data - developers (based in France) to provide user stories and to test the deliverables Your main challenge will be to understand the current model, the group products organisation and their interactions to have a strong understanding about the context and be able to define and execute the roadmap of the product in coordination with the Product Owner.

Main Requirements
2 years of experience as a business analyst, Proxy Product Owner, project manager or developer
Redactional and organisational skills (backlog management, specifications, tickets creation, minutes of meetings, flow charts process designs)
Good knowledge of SQL (SQL Server, PostGreSQL) and reporting tools (SSRS)
To have a strong interest for analysis, identification of anomalies and research of solutions
Ability to challenge and find different ways to bring value to business areas
Proactive, organized and team player: you know how to make things happen and you have convictions
Strong interest for business flows, products and new technologies
Passionate and result oriented
Good english level - speaking and writing

Would Be a Plus
Knowledge of Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
Accountancy basic knowledges (in particular in Account Receivables)
Background on Finance Tools
Knowledge of noSQL db (ElasticSearch)
Knowledge of product management and agile method
What we offer: Dynamic and creative environment within international teams The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform The participation in meetups and conferences locally and internationally Up to 2-3 days remote per week (now we are working remotely) Video games, beer and quizz parties with colleagues Offices in Barcelona Located in Poblenou @22 Flexible retribution package (including Medical Insurance) Autonomy is a key to success in . We are boosting the innovation at every step of product development inside Veepee. In order to reach the group goals in the best and the most efficient way, we stick to the feature team-based structure. Hence, most of our teams are autonomous and self-managed when it comes to choosing the tech stack and determining the road map. So, if you are driven by the quality and teamwork, if you want to make an impact, to learn and share knowledge, to be a part of the fast-paced digital environment, check out our tech stack below https://careers.veepee.com/en/vptech/ and start your journey. https://careers.veepee.com/en/vptech/

Belonging to Veepee, is one of the biggest Tech community in Europe with more than 1000 IT collaborators around Europe.

From Warsaw to Barcelona, through Lyon, Nantes, Lausanne, Tel Aviv, Brussels, Nice, Amsterdam and Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.

If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?

Need more info > https://careers.vente-privee.com/en/vptech/

Job Description

Scrum Master for Technical Enablers team which means acting is the servant leader of a team of approximately 3-12 individuals (including themselves and the Product Owner) who is responsible for protecting the team from influences or impediments which prevent the team from accomplishing its goals. Secondly the incumbent will support Customer Engagement Digital Ordering Data & Integration Lead with designing, building and deploying systems integrations for Customer Engagement and Digital Ordering. She/he will work closely with both internal IT specialists and group of IT suppliers (analysts and developers) against delivering a robust, highly performing and scalable systems integrations for new IT product on our existing global and sector platforms.

Accountabilities
Accountable for the managing one Agile team (technical enablers) and the delivering integrations within a scope of Customer Engagement and Digital Ordering projects within the Europe Sector
Observes team's work and continuously searches for improvement areas to help team achieve higher level of efficiency
Proactively identifies impediments, looks for pragmatic and constructive solutions and escalates when necessary
Actively engages with the key stakeholders in defining and then designing optimal integration solutions to maximize solution commonality and re-usability across markets
Do the quality assurance of built solutions ensuring they meet functional specifications and high end standards of technical reliability (solution is affordable, stable and scalable)
Collaborate with external vendors and global internal IT service providers (e.g. CTO), orchestrate adherence to standard processes and procedures
Focus on Agile metrics: velocity, value, time-to-market when mobilizing an delivering new initiatives
Challenging existing practices and supplies healthy disruptions trough introducing technology innovations
Ensure adherence to IT Architecture principles and guidelines
Understands the best in class industry use-cases and translates them into proposals for our own business
Experience

Qualifications/Requirements

+5 years experience in delivering systems integrations / development

+5 years proven track record of successful delivery of medium / high complexity projects (in area of systems integrations)

+3 years Agile projects and dynamic work environments

Skills

Scrum Master Experience

Digitally savvy and fluent in technology trends and applications

Proficient in written & spoken English

People management skills and experience in managing teams in different time zones and cultural background preferred

Flexibility to travel (25% minimum)

Bachelor’s degree required

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable
Job Type: Regular

As a Business Analyst you are responsible for gathering the business requirements and business process analysis for a functional domain within the client own global e-commerce platform (web and mobile).

We're a team of professional experts united by the burning desire to create beautiful products and experiences, overcoming ever greater technical challenges, day after day. We expect more of ourselves that our clients do, and that's why they trust us to solve their toughest problems. Our agency, SQLI Spain, federates the talents of unique individuals into strong and confident teams.
We're looking for passionate men or women with powerful personalities and direct experiences in leading modern technical projects in an agency context.

Your role:
- Contribute to all phases of requirements engineering (gathering, analyzing, organizing, specifying and modeling the requirements) and supporting to the development team with respect the technical implementation projects
- Creation of deliverables as functional analysis and software
- Designs based on our customer requirements
- Validation of business requirements in regards to functional relevance.

Requirements:
- 3+ years experience as Business Analyst in Digital field
- Working in agile projects
- Technical background, with understanding or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
- Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills, written and verbal communication skills
- Good functional writing
- Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
- To be able of work independently or as a part of a team
- Fluent in English level (min. B2)

Qualifications:
- Master in Computer Science or equivalent
- Agile development: Scrum, SAFe, LeSS

Who we are :
Created in 1990, SQLI is a service and consultancy group dedicated to the world of digital and e-commerce. It assists companies and brands in defining, implementing and managing digital solutions for a brand new customer, partner and employee experience. Its unique positioning where marketing meets technology and consulting means it is able to provide a global solution to the challenges of developing external sales and notoriety (digital & social marketing, client experience, connected commerce, data intelligence, etc.) and internal productivity and efficiency (digitization of operations, collaborative enterprise, mobility and connected objects, CRM, etc.).
SQLI's 2,500 employees are spread across 32 agencies in France, in Spain, in Switzerland, in Benelux, in the United Kingdom, and offshore platforms in South Africa and Morocco. Our agency in Barcelona is leading the Spanish market. We are in full expansion with new costumers and disruptive projects.
You can also take a look to our website : http://www.sqli.com/en

TheFork, a TripAdvisor® Company is the leading online restaurants reservation platform in Europe, Australia and Latin America, with a network of more than 80,000 restaurants worldwide, more than 30.5 million monthly visits and present in 22+ countries around the globe.

TheFork connects restaurants and diners.

Through TheFork (website and application), as well as through TripAdvisor, users can easily select a restaurant according to preference criteria (such as the localisation, type of cuisine, restaurant type and average price), consult user reviews, check real-time availability and instantly book online.

From the restaurants’ side, TheFork provides them with a software solution, TheFork Manager, which enables restaurants to optimize reservations management, streamline operations and ultimately improve service and revenues.

TheFork team aims to inspire and enable people to confidently discover, experience and share food. We operate under a shared set of values that define how we do business and how we interact with our colleagues, our partners, our customers and our food community. We strongly believe that building a diverse workforce of people from all walks of life helps us have a richer, more vibrant, more successful workplace.

As a Business Analyst, your main role will be to improve our customer satisfaction while reducing the fraud generating by restaurants and users. Dedicated to the Quality, Compliance & Fraud team, you will work in collaboration with Sales, Customer Operations and Product teams of the group.

What You Will Do
Manage and prioritize efforts & projects to reduce the irritants generated by and to b2c & b2b users (diners & restaurants), by efficiently running and coordinating global projects.
Run existing fraud projects to detect and catch b2b & b2c fraudsters.
Lead analysis and manage projects focused on Customer Satisfaction & Fraud, in order to measure performances, help improving processes, or increasing agents' productivity
Generate insights from large datasets to support decision making
Provide insights and analytical support to different stakeholders and the team to support effective business decision-making
Assist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business
Scale processes/projects
Build strong relationships with other departments and countries of the group


Who You Are
2/5 years of experience in an analytical role (ideal backgrounds include: a similar business analyst role at a web company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy type positions)
Master’s Degree of a Business or Engineering School
Data lover with excellent Excel and SQL skills as a prerequisite (Tableau is a plus)
Excellent analytical skills involving data analysis, leading to business recommendations
A great team player able to work effectively with different international teams
Proactive with ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communicator and facilitator with good spoken, written and presentation skills
English and Spanish fluent (French would be highly valued)


What Can We Offer
Permanent contract
Competitive fixed salary
Ticket Restaurant
Interesting discount in private health insurance
Compensation for practicing sports in any gym in Barcelona
International working environment
Well-being activities and benefits (massages, fresh fruit, free snacks, team-building events, etc.)

Sector: Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Are you at your most motivated when you get to break things? Do you thrive when you explore all of the possibilities for tech to fail or succeed?

ThoughtWorks is a global software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech.

Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years. They’ve also been writing books, speaking at conferences and helping push software development forward, changing companies and even industries along the way. We passionately believe that software quality is driven by open communication, review and collaboration. That’s why we’re such vehement supporters of open source and have made significant contributions to open source tools for testing, continuous delivery (GoCD), continuous integration (CruiseControl), machine learning and healthcare.

As consultants, we work with our clients to ensure we’re evolving their technology and empowering adaptive mindsets to meet their business goals. You could influence the digital strategy of a retail giant, build a bold new mobile application for a bank or redesign platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You will learn to use the latest Lean and Agile thinking, create pragmatic solutions to solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself every day.

Woven between all of the stages of the development process is the work of a Quality Analyst: the technologist who sees building solutions like a kaleidoscope of possibilities for things to break. By collaborating with each team member—Developer, Business Analyst, Designer, etc.—they ensure quality is thoughtfully examined in both processes and technology. QAs also aspire to be more than testers; they’re team motivators and strive to encourage all teammates to weave quality into their mindsets and code.

You’ll Spend Time On The Following
You will proactively seek out ways to avoid common software-testing problems such as test case duplication, flaky tests, and maintainability
You will pair with devs to read and analyze code and provide feedback about tests
You will seamlessly partner with clients, Business Analysts, and Project Managers to create and prioritize test plans while establishing yourself as a trusted voice with testing methods, strategies, and tools
You will provide input for and champion system testability
Advocate QA expertise to the broader tech community outside of ThoughtWorks, speaking at conferences and acting as a mentor for more junior-level QAs
Strive for quality to be built and aspire to shift quality to the left
Apply theoretical knowledge to practice and willingly offer improvements on code, tests, testability and suggest tools and frameworks to use
You will examine end-to-end processes in addition to backend testing, ensuring quality is embedded throughout
You will produce and implement test strategies during the software development process
Drive the creation of a reliable automated testing suite with strong reporting capabilities that ensures simple, effective analysis of failures for your team to use
Champion high-functioning teams and enable transitions where necessary
Extend your passion for quality assurance practices to enabling the client, helping coach a client’s team to adopt a testing mindset


Here’s What We’re Looking For
You have worked as a Quality Analyst as part of a wider development team, pairing with Devs and ideally Business Analysts, Infrastructure Engineers, and Designers
You have experience with Agile, code management, deployment strategies and different types of nonfunctional testing
You’re a sleuth when it comes to finding bugs, coming up with scenarios and edge cases along with a solid understanding of best practices such as TDD, BDD, CI/CD and the Practical Test Pyramid
You are comfortable with different types and techniques in functional testing including exploratory, boundary value analysis and equivalence partitioning
You have exposure to and experience in using defect tracking and management tools
An understanding of how to perform better white box testing using code
You know what a test strategy is and can produce one and you’re able to zoom out to the big picture and identify gaps in quality
You’re resilient in ambiguous situations and can approach and tackle challenges from multiple perspectives
You are seen as an influential team leader and always advocate for quality as a shared team responsibility, yet are open to change when needed
An ability to assess strengths amongst your teammates and distribute quality-related tasks when needed
Bonus points if you have familiarity with automated deployment processes, notions of configuration management like SVN and GIT, and a track record of innovation in testing

Sector: Entretenimiento Videojuegos
Descripción:
Are you a Data Analyst experienced with SQL and Tableau interested in impacting business decisions with data-driven insights and recommendations? Are you a BI Analyst with experience in mobile and/or game data interested in an opportunity to fully own the analytics piece?

Scopely is the leading mobile touch-screen entertainment startup in LA and Barcelona and we are looking for Data & BI Analysts with strong SQL and analytics experience to join our team in Barcelona. You should be a rare breed of business-savvy and analytics powerhouse capable of digging into terabytes of player, revenue, marketing and game data to understand user behavior and player experience.
This Analyst will have a strong impact in influencing Product Managers and Senior Executives with their insightful analysis of complex and large-scale data problems.

This position is located in Barcelona, Spain.

What You Will Do:
Lead the analytics function by analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions
Own the insights to drive the needle moving improvements by working with all organization from engineering to marketing
Develop frameworks, models, tools, and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from mobile / game data to shape features, game economies and future product roadmaps
Present your findings to a cross functional team members in a presentation setting

What You Will Need:
Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigor, hard-working and a good business intuition are musts!
Five or more years experience at a top-tier institution or firm in an analysis, scientific, research or consulting role
Strong presentation skills; ability to communicate complex results throughout an organization
Passion and experience with small team leadership
Critical thinking and problem solving capabilities
Working knowledge of SQL and comfort working in large data sets – exposure with Hive or Impala a plus
Python/R experience a plus
B.S. (graduate degree a plus) from a top institution in a quantitative or scientific field (Math/Stats, Economics, CS, Engineering, Physics, Psychology or similar)
A love or strong desire to work with mobile / games

About Scopely:
Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors. 
Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status. 

Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

Our client is a global leader in Marketing Technology. They are a high-growth, venture-backed, multi-award winning technology company with offices in the UK, Australia and the US. As one of the UK’s fastest growing businesses (being a member of the Accelerate 250) our client offers an extremely exciting, dynamic and high-potential working environment.

A global business with colleagues worldwide serving North America, EMEA and APAC regions. Our client is recognized for their capabilities through several award nominations and wins, including best Trading Team at the Drum Marketing Awards 2020. Their biggest recognition though is their 90% retention rate which has contributed to them enjoying substantial YOY growth throughout 2021.

They currently have offices in New York, Boston, London, Singapore, Sydney and they just open there new Global Data Hub….in Barcelona! This new opening is a strategic project for our client in order to hold their growth.
They are looking for a dedicated Senior Data Analyst to join the team in their new Data Hub in Barcelona. There are a number of new projects about to start !!!

About the Role

As a Senior Data Analyst, your goal is to cultivate a data-informed culture and create insights that will be leveraged across the entire organization.
This will include gathering and analyzing campaign and non-campaign data and consult with clients about their business goals. You will work with every part of the organization and your analyses will inform decisions and discussions with the clients, the partners and the leadership team.

Key Responsibilities will include:

Conducting client data research and analytics.
Consult with clients about their business goals and propose solutions and strategies that meet their needs.
Present analyses with a bias toward action and outcomes – storytelling with a practical purpose.
Partner with Sales, Marketing and Product to expose the highest-impact and most actionable opportunities for optimization and growth.
Support company-wide metrics creation, alignment, and reporting to create context and clarity through clear and intuitive data definitions and structures.

About you

Good knowledge of SQL (up to types of joins, indexing and basic optimization). You would be trained on any additional use case (columnar storage, windowing, key distribution).
Experience with Python and Jupyter notebooks is a bonus.
Having used any BI tool (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, Looker…)
Good communication skills, particularly with non-technical stakeholders.
Open to collaboration and willing to learn
Great level of English (no need Spanish)

Type of contract: Permanent
Location: center of Barcelona
Salary package: attractive salary + 24 days holidays + remote working + Private Health Insurance

If you consider that your profile could matches with our client requirements, feel free to send me your updated CV in English!
