Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Investigación
Descripción:
Offer Description

Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 1 year of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Descripción:
We like to think of ourselves as unapologetic tech innovators; this means we only build sh*t we can be proud of. Beauty is skin deep, but we know looks aren’t everything. We love a tight… security protocol, low latency and a banging user experience. The future of online entertainment cannot come soon enough – we want to Xcelirate it.
As part of the data team, you will be managing and analyzing website data in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making.
We have grown to a community of diverse nationalities, perspectives and skillsets. You’ll be part of an energetic, motivated team that hails from all corners of the world. We work hard; we play just as hard. Join us for one of the many offsite company gatherings and see for yourself!
Xcelirate is aggressively expanding (size matters, only because we dream big) and looking for bright, fun-loving candidates to join us. If you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you.
Hola! We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona.

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making
*Please note: All applications must be submitted in English

Requirements
General Requirements
Writing SQL queries to extract data from MySQL database
Performing quality checks on data
Creating and maintaining dashboards
Support in A/B test design and analysis
Support in ad hoc analysis for business decisions
Support in ad hoc reporting
Automating reporting where possible

Tech Requirements
SQL (4+ years)
Excel (4+ years)
R/python (4+ years) desirable
Google Analytics (4+ years)
Knowledge of statistical analysis, specifically around A/B and multivariate testing
Knowledge of ML applications desirable but not essential
Bachelor of Science (BSc) degree (math, physics, chemistry etc) desirable but not essential

Benefits
Enjoy delicious daily lunches of your choice delivered directly to the office
Stay in tip-top condition with health Insurance without copayment and including dental coverage
Break a sweat with a gym membership which will give you access to over 3,000 gyms, studios and classes throughout Spain
Weekly business-English classes and Spanish lessons are delivered in the office by leading teachers
In-office chair massages every Thursday by our resident massage therapist
An annual learning budget to be used in the way you see best, ensuring you’re always growing
Spotify and Netflix subscriptions to make sure you’re on top of all the latest music and movies
You’ll be equipped with an awesome new MacBook Air & our branded merchandise
Have access to our incredible office based in Barcelona’s WeWork - it’s full of games, chill out areas, snacks and beer on tap
Access to a global network of co-working spaces for when you’re utilising our 30-day remote work allowance
This is of course besides the 23 days of annual leave and all the Barcelona public holidays to use when you please!

We are Stayforlong, the first hotel marketplace specialized in long stays. We reward people with amazing discounts the more nights they stay in a hotel! Because we consider that it is unfair to pay the same if you are going to spend more time :) 

We have a wide range of hotels and we collaborate with companies such as Trivago, Tripadvisor, Google Hotel Ads and Kayak.

We have digital DNA. We love challenges, moving fast, thinking out-of-the-box and inspiring people who want to take the company to the next level. Besides, we stand out for our multiculturalism, for being flexible and for working in an agile environment.

Would you like to take part in our #teamforlong? Pay attention to this opportunity! 

Currently, we’re developing our Data department and we need a Data Engineer to let us keep growing our data organization.

Main job responsibilities are:

Build the migration to real time architecture.
Build ETLs and all the infrastructure and engineering behind.
Build and maintain data based processes to help other teams to make better decisions.
You’ll help draw out the product roadmap, design experiments to estimate the impact of future releases.
Monitor daily results and improve KPIs performance.
Explore our data to find growth opportunities.
Build fast data visualizations.
Apply statistical methods (and some machine learning) to improve our metrics, reporting, pricing strategies and increase sales through those improvements.

What you need to have:

You’ve at least 4-5 years of experience as a data scientist, data engineering, data analyst, business analyst or something along those lines.
You’ve got experience building queries with SQL or other query languages.
You can code Python, R or similar languages.
You have experience with Java
You have experience with queue systems, Kafka as a preferred.
You have strong programming skills.
You’re comfortable designing and building data architectures.
You’re comfortable talking about mathematics, statistics or computer science.
You can show us how you applied your knowledge to resolve problems.
You’re pragmatic. You value simple and effective solutions over complicated brain-melters.
You can take a complex concept and make it sound simple, using clear visual references to help.

What we offer:

Permanent contract.
Full-time. Flexible schedule.
Competitive salary.
Flexible remuneration. You will be able to include restaurant card, transport card, kindergarten check, health insurance and training.
Possibility to work 100% from home during the Covid-19 situation. Afterwards, you will be able to work from home when you want.
Excellent work environment and tons of coffee for everybody!
Office located in the city center.

Have you become curious? Apply to our job offer and attach your resume. We want to meet you!

Job Description Summary As a member of the Outbound Logistics team, the analyst will perform in a hybrid role to link the scopes of Transport Management software application advisory and detailed logistics data analytics. Job Description

Essential Responsibilities

Transport Management Software advisory
Get and maintain detailed knowledge about tailor made transport management system (RenTM) – features, structure, principles, links, interfaces
Receive, communicate and track application bugs with software developer, drive solutions, be first level support for RenTM users in Europe
Organize and lead trainings of RenTM for new users (internal, external) and refresher sessions
Assess RenTM, server structure performance, identify and solve performance issues
Attend ongoing, new RenTM application developments in liaison with Program Manager, Business contacts and software developer. Ensure system changes are properly scoped (requirement defined)
Support business process translation into system requirements
Data analytics
Gather, process and maintain relevant Outbound Logistics data (focus: time, costs, quality level)
Create and maintain data queries manually, but also in RenTM and ERP applications (Oracle, Unifier, Tableau).
Regularly report data analyses and KPI dashboard maintenance to logistics and project management
Automize data analytics within existing software environment
Re-examine current practices considering changing business environment, parameters and requirements

Qualifications / Requirements
Relevant work experience in software application advisory, preferably transport management systems
Relevant work experience in data mining and operations data analytics, preferably logistics data
Work experience in business process management and development for measuring processes
university degree in information technologies, logistics or related subject to demonstrate applicable knowledge base
Proficiency in ERP operations, preferably Oracle applications to gather and analyze data
Clear thinking mindset to understand complex context and act adequately
Self-confident and persistent characteristics to get users trained and software bugs fixed
High communication skills with the ability to work with and through global, cross-functional teams (internal, external)
Expertise in virtual communication (Microsoft Teams, Skype for Business) for providing trainings and giving ad-hoc support sessions to users
Proven presentation and coaching skills to efficiently lead training session
Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlines
Fluent verbal and writing skills in English, and German or Spanish

Non-national candidates are responsible to know the minimum documentation requirements to be able to be contracted in country: NIE- Social Security Affiliation Number in Spain (NAF) and Bank Account in Spain. They must be in possession of them at the time of start hiring. GE will not sponsor this requirement.

Desired Characteristics
Experience in working at GE, knowledge of GE processes and business operations
Experience with Oracle business suite, Tableau, Unifier software applications
Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

Sector: Artículos de consumo
Descripción:
Saber analizar y extraer datos es clave para ofrecer los mejores productos y servicios a nuestros clientes.

Si te apasiona este trabajo y tienes las habilidades y experiencia que requiere, únete a nuestro equipo como Customer Data Analyst.

Serás una pieza clave para dar soporte analítico y obtención de datos de clientes y negocio, dentro del departamento de Customer Data.

Extraerás datos de distintas fuentes internas y los adaptarás según las necesidades de negocio, transformándolos en entregables operativos para su análisis.

Trabajarás junto a otras áreas de negocio, identificando qué datos pueden ser interesantes para poder analizar, y les apoyarás en la resolución de preguntas.

Desde tu visión analítica y de negocio, ayudarás al resto de equipos y departamentos a resolver preguntas y dudas sobre los datos obtenidos.

Darás soporte en todo el ciclo de vida del dato, revisando periodicamnente la calidad del mismo.

Requisitos

¿Qué esperamos de ti?
Excelentes habilidades para el analisis de datos de clientes y negocio.
Ser un gran jugador/a de equipo, con claras habilidades para la comunicacion con distintas áreas y departamentos de negocio.
Experiencia relevante en la extracción y manejo de datos mediante consultas SQL
Conocimiento del entorno Goggle Cloud platform (deseable).
Pasión por el sector Retail.
Manejo experto de la herramienta Microsoft Excel.
Estudios medios o superiores relevantes.
Conocimientos de Inglés.

¿Que te ofrecemos?
Unirte a un equipo humano con el que disfrutarás trabajando en lo que más te gusta.
Un entorno de trabajo abierto y seguro, que facilita la relación con los compañeros/as, con espacios para comer, relajarte y divertirte.
Condiciones salariales competitivas fijo + bonus trimestral y anual.
Beneficios sociales (seguro médico, descuentos en tiendas,etc..).
Flexibilidad horaria de entrada y teletrabajo.
Formación continua y posibilidades de desarrollo profesional en una empresa en crecimiento y referencia en el sector del Bricolaje en Europa.

Talent Acquisition Specialist at ALG
Enviar mensaje InMail
ALG is a leading global consultancy team with more than 25 years of professional experience working alongside the top players in the transport sector (operators, infrastructure developers and investors, etc.), advising them on how to better prepare to respond to strategic, capacity, infrastructure and operational challenges.
Services:
Strategy & Policy
Transaction & PPP partnership
Business advisory
Organization
Infrastructure development
Operations & Technology
Sector experience:
Aviation (Airlines, Airports, CAA, ATM/CNS, etc.)
Maritime (Port terminals, Port Authority's, Maritime companies)
Land transportation (Intermodal, Railways, Highways, Urban transport)

ALG’s practice consists of more than 100 professionals and the company’s turnover for 2019 is budgeted at 20M USD. ALG has offices in Barcelona, Madrid, Dubai, London, Mexico D.F. and São Paulo. You can find more information in the following link: www.alg-global.com

The role
As a business analyst, you will be part of one of the top global transport and infrastructure consulting companies and you will work with the leading transport operators, infrastructure developers and investors advising them on strategic, commercial and operational challenges.
 You will become part of a global organization offering deep expertise and strategic insights to clients in a multi-disciplinary working environment made up of inspiring people with skills ranging from technical experts to strategic thinkers. You could become an industry-leading subject matter expert or a trusted advisor to senior client management on a wide range of issues.

In particular, this position will be focused on aviation digital transformation, which will mean being involved in digitalization strategies and data science projects, including big data and artificial intelligence developments.

Profile
Master degree from a top-tier university program preferably in Aeronautical Engineering and/or Computer science. MIM is desirable
Experience programming in one or more languages, including Python, R, Matlab, Scala, C++ or Java and eagerness to learn more
Coursework or proven experience in machine learning and working with databases is desirable but not required
Aviation consultancy experience is desirable but not required: Airline Business & operations, Traffic forecast, route development & business plan, Airport Business, operations & infrastructure development, Air transport economic regulations, ATC business & operations
High level of self-reliance and work capacity.
Fluent English is required and fluent French is desirable. (Oral and written skills)
Availability to travel.
Enthusiasm and dedication for aviation consultancy.
Candidates should be proactive team players and possess well-developed communication skills.

Please, attach your CV

Unique, exciting, fun-loving, and fast-growing – Welcome to Docler Holding! Since launching in 2001, we have created products and experiences that entertain millions of people across the globe. We now serve more than 50 million users a day and are consistently among the top visited websites in the world with following in the millions!
Some of our top-ranking websites include:
-Livejasmin.com, a market leader in the live streaming industry
-Jasmin.com, a platform that helps people make authentic connections
-Oranum.com, a pioneer in the online esoteric space and the world’s biggest live esoteric site


With us you will…
Representing the business' interests
Clarifying business requirements
Defining the functional details of a development while taking the best market practices into account
Documenting business requirements in Confluence (use cases, flow charts, wireframes, Given/When/Then scenarios)
Working closely with the designer team regarding designing functional requirements and wireframes
Ensuring good Project Preparation and working closely with PM, EM, BA, UI/UX, EM, LD as well as all other business departments (finance, legal, compliance, copywriters, support etc.)
Ensuring that user stories meet the required criteria so work can be designated as complete
Writing Acceptance criteria (Gherkin language) for all scenarios regarding a feature and constantly collaborating with QA on test cases and detailed requirements
Participating in team planning meetings and ensuring availability to provide advice, clarification, and guidance during the execution of each Sprint
Assisting the development team, QA, POs/PMs and Architects with release planning, functional research, and release testing
Keeping the product documentation up-to-date and detailed, update it constantly with new features
Reviewing completed work from development sprints

What we expect from you...
Being able to see through company-wise projects and features for different products (Collaboration with the other BAs in case of big projects involving more teams)
Able to understand the product portfolio users’ main requirements and expectations regarding the products based on the industry and internal KPIs.
Full project knowledge on product and main knowledge holder to be bridge the gap between development teams & stakeholders
Helping developers to finalize technical plan by getting all the details and answers and constant collaboration with developers during the sprint
Discuss Acceptance Criteria with PO and get approval before development starts
Making sure (together with Designer) that the UX is good - in case of bigger tasks involve UX expert if needed

Personal competences, language and other skills
Interested and being able to analyze a product’s performance and relevant KPIs
Basic technical knowledge, being able to discuss with developers and, understanding technical limitations of a system
Mastery of UMLs, Jira, Confluence, Wireframes
Constantly explores opportunities for service and business improvement
Understands the use of user testing and the benefits of qualitative data at specific stages of project preparation. Can drastically shift requirements based on results
Willing to learn and develop and follow technology improvements
Ability to present proposals and sell solutions to various stakeholders – efficiently prepare decisions
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively, and to think analytically to overview complex systems
Excellent time-management
Be proactive and self-motivated to perform under minimal supervision
Capable of managing his/hers own tasks with the ability to multi-task and prioritise
High level of attention to detail and professionalism
Able to receive feedbacks and flexibility to adapt based on them
Team player
Proficiency in English (verbal and writing)

What’s in it for you
The opportunity to have huge and amazing influence, in what we know will be a career-defining role.
The skills and experience you bring add to our collective strength. In addition to all the exciting things that lay in store for you, we offer an attractive compensation package along with a generous relocation package to help you move.
We take pride in ensuring that you remain healthy and offer private health insurance for when you don’t feel so great.
We believe in working hard as well as taking time off to recharge. On top of the 26 days of annual leave, you get additional days the longer you work with us.
And lastly, a fun, friendly and collaborative work culture where we guarantee there is never a dull day!

Docler Holding is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the power of a diverse team and we strive to create an inclusive environment that helps everyone be their authentic selves at work. Our squad is made up of more than 30 nationalities and it is this diversity that makes us who we are today.
Join the #DoclerSquad to create new and exciting things, to have fun, and help shape the #LifeAtDocler.

Are you ready to unleash your power?

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Olga Vellido Pelechá
People Specialist en Colvin
Enviar mensaje InMail
Colvin is born to disrupt the €30Bn European floral industry through an optimized supply chain direct from the growers, long-lasting flowers at a lower market price and a modern brand with a frictionless, simple, and elegant user experience! 
 Do you love data? Do you want to work with a modern data stack using Stitch, Google Composer, dbt, BigQuery, Looker, learn them and participate in choosing the next ones? Do you love SQL? Do you love transforming data and reducing 20 lines of code into 5? Do you want to use ELT instead of ETL? Do you believe the data team should adopt version control, data testing and data documentation processes? Do you also want to solve problems for the various stakeholders at a  company and make their lives easier and work collaboratively with them and the data team? 
 If you say yes to some of these questions, apply now!
 We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our Data team. 
What you will do:

Work closely with data analysts and backend engineers to understand business requirements and provide data ready for analysis.
Design high-performance, reusable, and scalable data models for our data warehouse to ensure that our end-users get consistent and reliable answers when running their own analyses.
Be a SQL whiz! You know how to write SQL which is easy to understand, simple to troubleshoot and that is highly performant.
Schedule data transformation and analysis pipelines using airflow (Google Composer)
Continuously discover, transform, test, deploy and document data sources
Apply, help define, and champion data warehouse governance: data quality, testing, coding best practises, and peer reviews
Apply advanced aggregations and data wrangling techniques for predictive analytics
Contribute towards the strategy and design of self service analytics reporting in Looker.
Apply software engineering best practices like version control and continuous integration to the analytics code base.
Coach analysts and data scientists on software engineering best practices 


What we are looking for:
 Experience:
Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience).
Experience working as part of a data team; preferably as either a data analyst or data engineer.
Excellent SQL skills, Data Modelling and Python
Working experience with Google Cloud Platform/Amazon Web Services
Experience with task orchestration tools (Ex.Airflow, Luigi)
Cloud Data Warehousing experience in Bigquery or another distributed platform (e.g. Redshift or Snowflake)
Import and transform data from many third-party APIs
Experience of GitHub actions a plus
Nice-to-haves: prior experience modelling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)

Skills:
Fluent in Spanish.
You are a team player. You understand the only way to have an exponential growth is to work together as a team.
Have a partner-centric mindset with business. When you create something, you care about the business partners and try to provide the best experience possible.
Quality in mind. You can easily detect whether a data result is good or bad in terms of quality and you understand that building good code with strong testing is key to growth and sustainability
Curiosity, open to learn new things and share the ones you expertise.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You have experience designing and implementing features in collaboration with product owners, reporting analysts/data analysts, and business partners within an Agile / Scrum methodology.



What are we offering?
Join a talented, international and young team where all ideas count and we take care of your development really seriously.
Continuous learning and internal training programs such as Coursera subscriptions and language classes.
Competitive Salary. 
Remote first culture & flexible working hours.
Possibility to work in our coworking in Barcelona open 24h with services like free gym.
Flexible retribution for kindergarten, transportation and food.

If you have read until here you should write to us. We want to know more about you!

Wall Street English is now looking for a Business Analyst to join our International team in Barcelona.

The Business Analyst has demonstrable experience working with business and technology stakeholders to understand and document their requirements for software applications. You work closely with Product Management, Technology Partners, Program Managers, Engineering, and QA as a member of an agile squad and provide detailed requirements. You are a self-starter, a strong communicator and are able to quickly establish a trusted relationship with cross-functional team members. You thrive on investigating complicated requirements with unknown dependencies and finding order within chaos. You are a ‘go getter’ with a desire to ‘work hard’. Creativity and strong communication skills are a must!

Essential duties and responsibilities:
· Work proactively to anticipate business and customer needs and requirements
· Plan, conduct, and manage the analysis of business problems to be solved through software or infrastructure solutions
· Facilitate requirements gathering/clarification sessions for complex projects with multiple business and technology stakeholders
· Translate complex business requirements into technical requirements
· Document and maintain business, functional and technical requirements
· Respond to questions from a wide range of functional roles
· Working closely with Product Owners and Technology Partners, provide detailed feature and capability requirements for the members of an agile development team or teams
· Coordinate closely with QA team on test planning, writing of test cases, test execution and defect investigation
· Work with Product Management and User Experience to coordinate periodic testing throughout the development process including, but not limited to, proofs of concept, user research, trials, pilots, sneak previews, and User Acceptance Testing though Early Adopter programs
· Document final functionality of new/updated features when epics and features are completed
· Become the point of contact for internal and external teams about general product features, integrations, releases, and communications

Technical skills and Qualifications:
· Bachelor’s Degree in computer science (or equivalent experience), graduate coursework is desirable
· Minimum of 5 years of directly related experience
· Experience in another IT role (e.g. software development, testing, project management) preferred
· Experience working with geographically distributed teams

Sobre JLL

Somos una firma de servicios profesionales especializada en el sector inmobiliario. Ayudamos a organizaciones en todo el mundo a lograr sus aspiraciones invirtiendo en el sector inmobiliario.

Si estás buscando impulsar tu carrera, JLL es el lugar perfecto. También harás conexiones profesionales duraderas compartiendo diferentes perspectivas, y te sentirás inspirado por los mejores. Conseguiremos sacar lo mejor de ti.

Soporte al Head Online Markets JLL
Gestión de la operativa diaria del canal online
Propuesta y seguimiento de las campañas SEM

Descripción:
Stuart (Geopost Group) is an eco-friendly 🌱 last-mile delivery company 📦 that connects retailers and e-retailers to a fleet of geo-localised couriers 🚴🏽‍♂️. 🚙. across several countries in Europe. Our mission is to build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world shared, efficient and reliable, as conscious consumers value more and more environmental responsibility besides speed of delivery and convenience.

Stuart is growing to fulfill that vision. In 2020 we doubled in size and continue to grow strong. We are a melting-pot of 400 people working from 🇫🇷 🇬🇧 🇪🇸 🇵🇱 & remote.

More than 2 000 companies work with us already across Food, Grocery, Retail and Pharmacy to deliver all types of goods, among which essentials for people on lockdown / self-isolating because of the coronavirus. We are at the right moment and the right place to make an impact on millions of people, as home delivery services hit a record high ! 🚀

Liveops & Support is in the heart of Stuart by enabling and regulating the operation with human touch at every point there is a need. While our operation is constantly scaling into new countries and cities, here we are working to create the best structure to manage its necessary counterpart human interaction. Data and reporting is in the center of this effort; carrying live interaction into databases, creating visibility for our executives, assisting their decision making and making the team prepared for tomorrow's challenges.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our award winning Liveops & Support team reporting to Çagri Azcan, Snr. Data Analyst. If you enjoy wrangling data, generating insights with SQL queries; visualizing the findings and creating robust reports with Tableau; and predict the tomorrow with the tools Python provides, then you are the person we are looking for! The ideal candidate has strong communication and problem-solving skills. Understanding the stakeholders and their needs is arguably the biggest enabler of the performance in this role. This is a great opportunity to grow your career at a young and agile yet global company and have a real impact on Stuart’s business, partners and customers.

Get to know more about our Innovative Liveops & Support team
How Slack helps delivery platform Stuart thrive in an on-demand world
Intercom to engage and proactively support their clients - at just the right time
Stuart and Pontica - the right partnership at the right time


Responsibilities
Understand Liveops & Support team's challenges, data/reporting needs and business requirements
Manage and manipulate data sets via SQL, including defining variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address business requirements
Building both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis from multiple data sources (Tableau)
Proactively developing new analyses and insights, to drive decisions for workload reduction of agents and customer satisfaction increase
Debugging and problem solving issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics
Provide hands-on Python development, with data processing and analysis automation


Requirements

Skill we are looking for
Strong analytical and quantitative skills in statistics and prior experience in empirical analysis
Ability to write complex SQL queries to analyze our databases
Designing good ways of communicating, visualizing or reporting results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
Analytical coding with tools such as Python, Excel, Gsheets
Data collection and manipulation scripting with Python/Pandas (JavaScript/Node.js is a plus)
Passionate about data, creative, highly meticulous, able to work under tight deadlines and are a team player
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
English business proficiency


Benefits
International team
Good work-life balance work from home, flexible hours, extra days leave
Meal vouchers - Restaurant Tickets
Monthly gym allowance to use in any gym or for any sport class (40 € per month)
Excellent private medical insurance
Learning and training opportunities, access to online courses...
Tangible career development possibilities as we grow strong 🚀
After-works, Team-Buildings, annual company offsite – Ibiza in 2019!


Contract
Permanent
Full-time


After reading all this, just a few last but important words we want you to take on a role you love and we want you to come to a place you’re proud and happy to work every day.

If this sounds like you - apply! Get in touch with us, we want to hear more about you today!

“Logistics for a sustainable world.” That is the mission at the heart of Stuart Delivery. While customer expectations around the delivery experience are skyrocketing, cities are limiting traditional logistics methods to improve congestion, pollution and liveability. The convergence of these two trends means that a disruptive approach to last-mile delivery is not a nice-to-have but rather an inevitability.

Stuart sits at the crossroads of the future, using our best-in-class proprietary dispatch technology to connect small and big businesses alike to a shared fleet of geolocalised couriers. The result? Efficient, reliable, eco-friendly delivery to help retailers to meet their customers’ demands.

We launched in 2015 with a big vision and a handful of clients. Three and a half years later, couriers on our platform complete tens of millions of deliveries annually for the biggest brands across retail, eCommerce, grocery and food.

Stuart is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Descripción:
Junior Data Analyst
Business Intelligence
Barcelona, Barcelona

EXOGROUP is a set of companies made up of +150 talents and offering a wide range of services within the digital business landscape with headquarters in Barcelona and offices in Dublin, Porto, Valencia, Madrid, Tarragona and Buenos Aires.

We are revolutionising the online ad-serving industry for advertisers, publishers and networks alike and are seeking to recruit a Talent Acquisition and Retention Specialist for our Barcelona office.

Role

As a Junior Data Analyst you will be part of the Business Intelligence team at EXOGROUP, which is a small and highly skilled and qualified department that has diverse responsibilities.

Together with the Head of Business Intelligence and Data Analysts you will develop and maintain weekly, monthly and quarterly reports that provide critical business visibility on key revenue and profit trends, by product, market, vertical and traffic sources. Additionally, based on detailed analysis of the segment, you will collaborate with the IT team to identify potential improvement in the intelligence platform by analysing and designing algorithms.

Tasks

Structure masses of information, identify data-driven trends and understand what really matters and why. Collect KPIs and design/define visualizations. Deliver insights and analytics across the company's operation and advertising departments. Ability to identify and escalate issues and opportunities ahead of time helping to reduce impact and improve financial / performance implications. Together with the Business Intelligence team, you will develop and promote actionable insights to increase the profitability of the company.

Skills

You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind. Degree in information technology, business administration or mathematical sciences. Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks. You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work. You have programming experience in Python. You are familiar with SQL. Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus. Strong verbal and written communication skills. The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.

What we offer

We offer a position in a young, dynamic and international team made up of 33 nationalities.

We offer exceptional working conditions in unique offices high up in the Torre Mapfre, one of Barcelona's world-renowned landmarks, located right on the city's seafront.

Additionally, we offer the opportunity for permanent training, personal development, ambitious career growth and a very competitive salary.

Most of all, we offer a position in a team that thrives on achievement, success and leadership within our industry. Our core company value is innovation: where people and creativity drive innovative technology. If you have an innovative, winning mentality, this position is for you!

Our company benefits: Flexitime - Private health insurance - Your Birthday off as a paid holiday - Flexible compensation plan: travel, meals & childcare - EXOGROUP University, our in-house training - Employee referral program bonus - Off-site team building days out - Office games room/chill-out zone - Organic fruit - Friday team breakfast - Yoga classes - Massages - English & Spanish classes - Subsidised lunches

The companies that are part of EXOGROUP are the data controllers regarding your personal data, in order to consider your application for present or future vacancies in our organization. For more information about the processing of your personal data and on how to exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation, portability and opposition please visit the Protection Informative Clause Candidates.

Project: F2P Mobile Games

OPM are proud to be working with one of the worldwide leaders in mobile games with an incredibly talented international team based in the diverse and beautiful city of Barcelona. They are looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist to join their team.

The successful candidate will work to understand their gamers’ behaviour, work with the game teams to enhance the product, drive retention & user conversion. You will gain business insights that provide real value to the company by applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming

Strong experience utilising analytics to solve business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in mobile games.

Descripción:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a Principal Business Performance Analyst to be a senior member of our growing Central Analytics team at King. Working with stakeholders from across King, you will provide critical insights into the state and trend of our business that enable better decision making and drive impact. Your work will be crucial to help push the boundaries of how we understand our players and games. As a senior part of the Central Analytics team, you will set the standard for outstanding, holistic business insights. Your reporting will seamlessly combine King’s own data with player insights and market intelligence.

Your role within our Kingdom
You will be working collaboratively across all parts of the business to crack company- wide problems in how we can grow our business.

Reporting To The Director Of Central Analytics, You Will
Deliver actionable insights that can support and drive impactful decisions
Lead the business, including King’s Leadership Team, in understanding key performance trends and identifying opportunities for growth
Provide accurate data, insights, analysis and forecasts for decision makers and stakeholders
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis on our portfolio of games and player network
Communicate results in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualisation and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sources
Foster strong relationships with other key functions across King, such as Finance, Corporate Strategy and Marketing
As a senior member of Central Analytics and the whole data community at King, be an advocate for high quality, impactful data deliverables
Position yourself as key expert on our own business, industry trends and the competitor landscape to evolve our thinking
Identify opportunities for growth, influence key stakeholders and drive initiatives to a successful outcome.

Skills To Create Thrills

You are a highly analytical, passionate problem solver. You have the ability to draw data driven business insights that will add real value to King. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly.
Experience working in a commercial data team, providing business insights and models which lead to data informed business decisions
You can see the forest, not just trees. You understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then find the right data, analysis or interpretation to translate into actionable insights
Methodological and pragmatic with a hands- on approach that can get straight to the point when needed
Strong communication skills: you can communicate the most complex insights concisely and clearly in writing and in person
Great relationship building and influencing skills, and experience in managing and satisfying senior stakeholders’ needs
Masters or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics. Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for numerical analysis
Prior experience in an industry with very short implementation cycles such as e- commerce, online products/services or games
Experience in working with highly- skilled peers in analytics, data science and engineering, consumer research, and Business Performance
Bonus Points
Solid understanding or enthusiasm for the games industry
Skills to create reports and dashboards that allow teams to understand and optimize initiatives using tools such as Python/R, Looker and BigQuery (GCS)
Knowledge of and/or interest in dashboard & reporting tools
Open to feedback as a way of learning and improving
Pragmatic problem- solver – someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problems

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

Descripción:
Company Description

Ubisoft’s 19,000 team members, working across more than 40 locations around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their dedication and talent has brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile brings together dedicated, experienced professionals focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, or our respect and care for one another.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our Data team. This person will report to the Data & Analytics Manager.

Your Daily Adventure
Manage and manipulate SQL data sets, including: defining variables, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address business requirements.
Provide hands-on R development, data processing automation, and statistical models deployment
Building both large systematic reports and one-off small pieces of analysis from multiple data sources (Tableau).
Proactively developing new analyses and insights, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention and monetization.
Debugging and problem solving issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics.
Identify, document and design data to be tracked.
Design and help development team to implement/deploy new features, systems, experiments/ABTs, etc.
Qualifications

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you’ll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Math, Computer Science or related field. Masters degree in any of these disciplines is a Plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis
Ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases.
Analytical coding: using tools such as R, Python, Excel, et al.
Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
Passionate about data, creative, highly meticulous, able to work under tight deadlines and are a team player.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment and to meet changing priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Interest in mobile F2P games.
Have an excellent communication and presentation skills.
English business proficiency.
Have a work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.

Additional Information

Your Life At Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile (and Perks)
25 vacation days per year + day off in your Ubi-Birthday.
Flexible Working Hours & Working from Home policy.
Reduced schedule on August, Easter, Christmas and special dates such Sant Jordi and Sant Joan.
Flexible compensation with Ticket Restaurant.
Mobile device grant based on seniority.
Cigna private Health insurance.
Physiotherapist special rates in the office.
Professional development programs and tickets to international events.
English, Spanish and French free lessons in the studio.
Great discounts in our games.
Gym special rates and discounts in other services.
Nespresso coffee, organic fruit and other beverages.
Company parties and events.
Friday’s beers.
Relocation Package (when needed).

Sector: Marketing y publicidad
Descripción:
What's Landbot

Landbot is a no-code communication automation platform that empowers non-technical users to automate business processes through conversational experiences. COVID19 is accelerating digitalization at both the consumer and enterprise level, so the adoption of communication automation solutions therefore is skyrocketing.

In three years Landbot has gone from a chatbot builder MVP to a product with thousands of recurring customers who use it daily to get more and better leads across the whole world. This is possible thanks to our builder, a centerpiece of the product, which allows non-technical people to build engaging conversational experiences.

What's The Opportunity

We’re looking for a Data Analyst to become a centerpiece in the company as the first member in the Business Intelligence Team.

You’ll work together with all departments (Marketing, Sales, Product, Finance...) in order to build a data-driven culture and improve our performance.

You’re excited to switch between working with sales and customer success team to minimize churn one day, marketing to set up their attribution tracking systems the next, while structuring the product analytics team the other day.

You’re intimately familiar with the technical side of business intelligence work, but at the same time are able to think on a company-wide, strategic level.

You will be responsible to setup the foundation for data frameworks, resources and tools with freedom to define such centerpieces at the company level.

Your challenge
Understand the business needs and produce insightful analyses for sales, marketing and product teams.
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions such as "what is the effect of one product change over other KPI’s" into insights and opportunities.
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders.
Help colleagues to access to the right data and understand what it reveals.
Create hypothesis, collect data to either support or disprove the hypothesis and recommend solutions to help move a metric.
Identify business opportunities based on a combination of internal and external data sets.
Synthesize complex data and present clear recommendations to senior management.
4+ years in a similar role at a SaaS company.
Deep understanding of SaaS business and metrics to provide KPI insights and data guidance.
Degree ideally in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science or related degree or Economics/Business.
Strong knowledge of SQL – optimization of big data queries and Airflow are a plus.
Knowledge of Data Modelling, be able to program in Python and/or R.
Extremely organized with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects within tight timelines.
Proven track record of defining and executing key analysis with minimal supervision.
Strong attention to detail.
The ability to data mine across a large and varied business area or key priority for the company.
Great reporting skills being able to transform data into intuitive dashboards, reports and insights.
Very strong communicator, both written & verbally.
You are fluent in English and Spanish (it's a must).
Eligibility to work in Spain


Benefits
A competitive salary package in a fast-growing start-up.
Great culture & working atmosphere, we have a young, upbeat, and international work environment.
Live and work in sunny Barcelona.
Remote friendly.
Friday happy hours after our weekly team meetings.
Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it.
Bonus transport tickets, educational content, and all you need to feel empowered.
Referral Bonus if you bring other talented people like you.
Top-notch work equipment.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Analyst, Pricing & Promotion, Data & Analytics, Spain Remote
Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Ingeniería industrial o mecánica
Descripción:
Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

Do you want to bring science and craft to the art of pricing and promotion optimization? We are crafting this dedicated role to work with our 20+ Pricing & Promotion team members and the different country organizations to support decision making for price & promotion optimization. We are looking for an experienced analyst that will autonomously generate meaningful, robust insights that teams trust and act on. Join us on this journey!

What You Will Do
Develop insights from multiple data sources and methodologies to distill relevant metrics to measure impact (e.g., customer lifetime value drivers, customer behaviors) understand the impact of opportunities identified through insights tools.
Collaborate with the data product teams who develop productized capabilities (e.g., list price recommender, promotional depth optimizer) as well as the Pricing & Promo embedded specialists (embedded in countries) and help jointly identify relevant metrics for data product success measurement Tell the story of our data products‘ performance through meaningful, iterative test & learn agendas using a variety of experimentation techniques (e.g., A/B, pre/post, simulation) and help synthesize insights to deliver recommendations for next steps.
Prototype reusable impact reports in Vistaprint’s infrastructure (e.g., Looker, Optimizely) to oversee trends and drivers and enable non-technical users to get easy access to impact metrics
Bring novel and untested ideas to the table to constantly innovate how we define and measure success of our work for customers and the business

Your Qualifications
Proficient in SQL. Experience with visualization tools (either Tableau, Looker, Power Bi
You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques
Demonstrated ability in handling sophisticated problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to determine solutions.
Excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners

Nice To Have
Python and/ or R are a plus
Web analytic tools (Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics)
E commerce experience

Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey - and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

Job Purpose
The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes. She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyze information and make recommendations. An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

The team is also responsible for roll-out Cloud solutions to all Tech Data entities in Europe (21 countries +). The team will collaborate with all of Tech Data's Business Unit leaders and their key partners, to develop the right strategies, and strive to deliver best in class systems with maximum impact and synergy across Europe.
Responsibilities:
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies.
Create process maps and document key business requirements needed to evaluate opportunities.
Create value stream maps to identify and highlight potential areas of improvement.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional / cross-organization meetings between stakeholders on various end-to-end business processes.
Conduct root cause analysis of process inefficiencies by examining material flow, scheduling, production capacity, constraints.
Document Operational “As-is” processes and the desired “Future State” processes.
Define SLAs and measure results.
Deploy new operational processes and escalate them as needed.
Maintain, manage and constantly improve central processes
Document all process accordingly: Ensure all necessary procedures and management processes are implemented to guarantee homogeneous and up-to-standard across locations within regional scope.
Ensure appropriate training and self–actualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Knowledge Skills and Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Solid understanding of eCommerce
Knowledge of finance and accounting processes is a plus.
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international results driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful

Sector: Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Our opportunity

A re you passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world’s leading insurance groups!

In this role as a Reporting Business Analyst / Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the “Analytics and Reporting” team within Group Investment Management. You will collaborate closely with IT functions and a diverse range of end user in different countries and translate their analytical and reporting needs into requirements and solutions.

Your role

As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your main responsibilities will involve

Develop analytical, regulatory and operational reports using SAP Business Objects, BEX, SAP Analysis for Office, Microsoft Power BI and other analytical tools
Maintain key business applications (based on SAP/BW, BW4/HANA) and support/lead new business initiatives
Perform impact analysis of application changes, holding an end-to-end view of the system
Support the continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure
Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs
Run requirement gathering workshops; create requirements documents and design concepts
Ensure compliance and data quality

Your Skills And Experience

As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:

Minimum 5 years of experience as a business analyst/ business intelligence specialist
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or equivalent
Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, data analytics, query design, modelling and reporting front-end tools
Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g. analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Basic knowledge of financial processes and investment instruments are a plu
Knowledge of SAP FSCM-FAM is a plus
Spanish language skill is a plus

TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE:

Strong skills in SAP/BW & SAP BW4/HANA, Query Design, SAP front-end tools
Advanced skills in modern Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PBI)
Data analysis skills in R/Python are a strong plus

Additional Information

Primary work location is Barcelona. This position requires some light traveling. You can apply by clicking on the button “Apply online”

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:

Wide range of internal and external trainings

Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Life Insurance
Exclusive employee discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depends on the business needs

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You’d give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It’s a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Internet Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones
Descripción:
TheFork, a TripAdvisor® Company is the leading online restaurants reservation platform in Europe, Australia and Latin America, with a network of more than 80,000 restaurants worldwide, more than 30.5 million monthly visits and present in 22+ countries around the globe.

TheFork connects restaurants and diners.

Through TheFork (website and application), as well as through TripAdvisor, users can easily select a restaurant according to preference criteria (such as the localisation, type of cuisine, restaurant type and average price), consult user reviews, check real-time availability and instantly book online.

From the restaurants’ side, TheFork provides them with a software solution, TheFork Manager, which enables restaurants to optimize reservations management, streamline operations and ultimately improve service and revenues.

TheFork team aims to inspire and enable people to confidently discover, experience and share food. We operate under a shared set of values that define how we do business and how we interact with our colleagues, our partners, our customers and our food community. We strongly believe that building a diverse workforce of people from all walks of life helps us have a richer, more vibrant, more successful workplace.

As a Business Analyst, your main role will be to improve our customer satisfaction while reducing the fraud generating by restaurants and users. Dedicated to the Quality, Compliance & Fraud team, you will work in collaboration with Sales, Customer Operations and Product teams of the group.

What You Will Do
Manage and prioritize efforts & projects to reduce the irritants generated by and to b2c & b2b users (diners & restaurants), by efficiently running and coordinating global projects.
Run existing fraud projects to detect and catch b2b & b2c fraudsters.
Lead analysis and manage projects focused on Customer Satisfaction & Fraud, in order to measure performances, help improving processes, or increasing agents' productivity
Generate insights from large datasets to support decision making
Provide insights and analytical support to different stakeholders and the team to support effective business decision-making
Assist with ad hoc queries and provide analytical support to our fast-growing business
Scale processes/projects
Build strong relationships with other departments and countries of the group


Who You Are
2/5 years of experience in an analytical role (ideal backgrounds include: a similar business analyst role at a web company, a data-based consulting role, or other data strategy type positions)
Master’s Degree of a Business or Engineering School
Data lover with excellent Excel and SQL skills as a prerequisite (Tableau is a plus)
Excellent analytical skills involving data analysis, leading to business recommendations
A great team player able to work effectively with different international teams
Proactive with ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communicator and facilitator with good spoken, written and presentation skills
English and Spanish fluent (French would be highly valued)


What Can We Offer
Permanent contract
Competitive fixed salary
Ticket Restaurant
Interesting discount in private health insurance
Compensation for practicing sports in any gym in Barcelona
International working environment
Well-being activities and benefits (massages, fresh fruit, free snacks, team-building events, etc.)

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
The mission of the Senior Content Business Analyst is to support Content teams with analyzing all our available data, supporting business decisions in order to maximize the Content impact on the business. The Senior Content Business Analyst should understand and communicate the financial and operational impact of any changes that may occur by determining the data requirements, metrics and delivering business analysis of a project or program, and keeping a clear line of communication with stakeholders.

What will your responsibilities be?
Be able to translate complex business analysis into digestible explanations while providing non-area related use-cases & examples
Build case studies and what-if analyses to evaluate impact of new products, business features and pricing changes.
Build meaningful and appealing self-service dashboards independently.
Fully understand how a change in your area will impact the entire company and be able to anticipate risks & opportunities.
Be able to turn business problems into data definitions.
Understand the concept of statistical significance and the ways of reporting it by mastering basic statistical methods.
Identify new opportunities for the business.
Be able to anticipate a potential risk or opportunity within your area before it happens.
Provide input to discussions on areas of strategy, and reach out to teams and groups within and outside of your team, to gather information from stakeholders.
Come up with repository/development process improvements within the team.
Be proactive and try to eliminate obstacles which are slowing down you or your team.
Keep clear communication with the stakeholders. Proactively communicate any analytical finding and propose possible actions.
Act as a stand-in for the Team Lead and help with onboarding and mentoring of your colleagues.
What are we looking for?
3 to 5 years of experience in the (Business) Analyses role supporting profitability-wise business decisions (preferably from travel industry - e.g. airline pricing/GDS knowledge)
Strong business acumen applied in analyses, ability to define the scope, track, execute, and communicate on projects.
Great analytical skills and flawless attention to details
Good problem-solving skills
Experience with Data Visualization, retail analytics and Modelling are a plus
Experience with BI tools (Looker, Tableau, ect.)
SQL knowledge is a plus
Fluent English
Intellectually curious, analytically rigorous, hard-working and a good business intuition are musts!
Ability to communicate complex results to less quantitatively sophisticated users
Easiness to conceptualize (including setting the right requirements in terms of Data & modelling capabilities) and extract insights from Data
You use a variety of communication methods to communicate and drive others.
You are eager to work in a fast-paced environment where things change quickly and you can have a great impact on company growth and development.
Things that we offer and you might love about us:
We believe we’re a fun bunch to work with, and you will get to see how a young, vibrant yet global company disrupts the travel industry. You’ll work in one of the most promising tech companies (awarded Forbes Startup of 2017, Super-brand Award 2017, Deloitte Technology Fast 50 – the fastest growing technology company in Central Europe).
We visit and speak at conferences and technological events worldwide.
We use our work time wisely with a friendly vacation policy and work schedule.
We also like to party and hang out together.
We work, play, relax, workout and even nap in our offices (complete with sauna, gym, masseur, sleeping spots, canteen, chillout zones, free refreshments, etc).
Dogs, kids, and parties are welcome in our offices.
We also enjoy common benefits, such as meal vouchers, flexible benefits scheme, sick days, VIP Medical Care, flight vouchers, multisport card, etc.
Besides a fair salary, we can also look forward to quarterly bonuses dependent on overall company performance.
We’re a great team of passionate and fun-loving people from across the globe who you’ll love working with. We look forward to you joining our team-buildings and parties!
Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it’s finished, we’re going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/

Sector: Bienes inmobiliarios comerciales
Descripción:
Job Title: Interim / Contractor Business Analyst
Location : Barcelona (flexible)


About the company

IWG is the global operator of leading workspace providers. Our companies help more than 2.5 million people and their businesses to work more productively. We do so by providing a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services.
Digitalization and new technologies are transforming the world of work. People want the personal productivity benefits of living and working how and where they want. Businesses want the financial and strategic benefits. Our customers are start-ups, small and medium-sized enterprises, and large multinationals. With unique business goals, people and aspirations. They want workspaces and communities to match their needs. They want choice.
Through our companies we provide that choice, and serve the whole world of work: Regus, Spaces, No18, HQ and Signature. We create personal, financial and strategic value for businesses of every size. From some of the most exciting companies and well-known organizations on the planet, to individuals and the next generation of industry leaders. All of them harness the power of flexible working to increase their productivity, efficiency, agility and market proximity.
Join us at www.iwgplc.com.


Responsibilities:

We are seeking interim Business Analysts to build a detailed view of what is coming next in the business and get these ideas delivered. To understand and anticipate what the business is thinking about and who needs to be involved to get things produced. It’s a highly influential role and is exposed to advanced business and technology concepts (early on).

Develops quality and well-structured pragmatic specifications (coordinating across teams where relevant).
Guides the idea owner through the development process, review progress at set stages, ensure simplicity, lead well thought through solutions, deliver specifications on time and always question and check that the idea is being designed in the best possible way (Overall Solution, Simplicity, Quality, Optimal UX, Design, Third Party Integration, Speed of Delivery etc…)
Works with PMs and System Owners to plan delivery dates
Schedules and runs demos for new features and capabilities
Maintains all documentation in our different documentation tools
Supports post-go live issues management and escalations (via support team)
Maintains deep system and business knowledge.

Qualifications/Experience:

Specific Business Analyst training or certifications
Extensive IT Experience
Specific Business Analyst training or certifications
Understanding of Software Development, System design, Digital, Web, Mobile, UX standards, solutioning and specification
Agile software development (how specifications are written using Agile)
Experience working with Executive and C-Level Mgt
Working with and interfacing to global delivery teams
Proven experience managing agile methodologies delivering business value IT Solutions
Ability to deliver results on time and to the very highest standards.
Ability to quickly gain the required business acumen and technical, behavioural and contextual elements of a project.
Running large and small-scale projects.
Key /technology understanding, how to manage Technology teams and discussion with SMEs in IT
Excellent English communication and executive level presentation skills
