The Company.

Our Client is an international Shared Service Center based in Barcelona. They provide outstanding services for companies all over the world. They aim to create opportunities to reach the full potential of people.

The Job.

As a Business Analyst Your Responsibilities Will Be To

– Collaborate with the Product Owner and Solution Architect, gathering detailed business requirements and developing user stories

– Write and document user stories that are clear, concise and easy-to-understand for the business and Global Process Owners, while sufficiently comprehensive, structured and technically-oriented to be translated into technical solutions by the development team

– Communicate efficiently and work together within a multi-stream program, fostering the open and collaborative culture and act as a bridge between the different streams

– Capture the process impact and functional impact of each sprint, optimizing the BA inputs for functional test preparation and execution

– Support User Acceptance Testing; providing key inputs to UAT scripts as well as executing part of the UAT

– Provide support to end users during UAT sessions

– You are familiar with Agile methodology

– You are analytical, creative and curious mind

– You have excellent organization skills and the ability to work under pressure & manage deadlines

The Offer.

– Temporary contract of 12 months with the possibility to stay regarding your performance

– Salary based on your level of experience + additional benefits (meal vouchers, life insurance, pension plan, etc.)

– Career opportunities

– International and multicultural environment

– A company with a worldwide reputation

– Start date: ASAP

Sector: Investigación Biotecnología
Descripción:
Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Are you currently studying and looking for an internship experience within an international company and market leader? It's time to put theory into practice - and there's nowhere better to do so than in our pioneering and solutions-driven environment.

This is your opportunity to join our team as an Intern, and gain experience working in a Customer Service & Support Operations environment with highly experienced professionals. Under the supervision of the Agilent EMEAI Quality Manager, you will contribute to the evolution of the Quality Management System (QMS) for the Support Organisation.

As an Intern, you will be assisting/ supporting the team in the following activities:
Maintain our Quality documentation updated and support potential document system/ repository-migration,
Facilitate access to Quality documentation for our Engineers,
Expand Quality documents to other Business areas

This internship opportunity can be based in the following locations: Barcelona/ Madrid (Spain), Waldbronn/ Karlsruhe (Germany), Paris (France), or potentially Manchester (UK).
The internship should ideally be in full-time dedication (negotiable), for a duration of 6 months (or longer).

Who Are We Looking For

We are looking for an aspiring student with a strong work ethic, studying towards an academic degree in a relevant field, including (but not limited to) business studies or engineering, or other engineering fields. Even more critical than your area of studies is an interest in Quality Management Systems. Ideally, you are in your last 1-2 years of studies.

To be successful in your internship, you would also ideally need to be/ have:
Organized, self-motivated, able to manage priorities & to work independently
Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking skills along with written and oral communication skills
Potentially already a basic understanding of Quality Management System (ISO 9001:2015 typically)
Potentially already familiar with understanding and application of appropriate quality improvement process methodology
Able to collaborate across organizational boundaries
Strong in quantitative data analysis skills
Easy with tools like Microsoft suite, Qlik, SAP, etc.

If you are highly motivated and results oriented, then we are the perfect partner.
Agilent is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Interested?
We are looking forward your application! Please, complete the application process online.
The position will remain open for applications until a suitable candidate has been identified.

For any questions on the application or selection process, please contact our recruitment colleague, Ms. Cecilia Bengtsson (cecilia.bengtsson@non.agilent.com).

Puesto ofertado: Data Analyst Intern, Large Customers (6 months)
Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Medios de comunicación en línea
Descripción:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

We are looking for a talented, energetic and detailed oriented intern, to join our Analytics team in Barcelona. This 6-month internship is an incredible opportunity to understand better the Ad tech industry and contribute to very impactful analysis for our business.

What you'll do
Advertiser Analysis and Optimization
Analyzing complex data from multiple sources, youll learn how to detect problems with the performance of our campaigns, and suggest improvements that will have immediate impact
Reporting tools and metrics
Youll use your knowledge of our system to develop reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business
Technical studies and analysis
You will work on ad hoc projects that will inform roadmap for the development of the Criteo Product, and run real world tests on new developments.
Campaign control and oversight
You have responsibility for managing and maintaining the smooth running of our campaigns. This involves making sure our ad server is correctly set up and updated, and validating the setup of new campaigns.
Who you are
You are Fluent in English. A good Spanish proficiency would be nice to have.
You are currently enrolled in a Bsc/Msc in Engineering, Mathematics or any other relevant subject.
You like being involved in problem solving
Ideally, you have good technical skills in SQL and other programming languages (R programming, Python).
Previous international experience will be a plus.
You are interested in analysis and statistics.
You are versatile, dynamic, detailed oriented and data enthusiast!
You have a real interest in online Advertising market and the impact of a high-performance technology in this market.
Why you'll love us
At Criteo, life is full of contagious energy, hard work, passion and the occasional scooter race
Everything at Criteo is driven by their hunger to succeed and fueled by a little bit of madness
Criteo has many perks and quirks
Every office is filled with equal measures of hard work and playfulness. From yoga to rooftop parties, early morning kale smoothies to late night karaoke sessions we do it all, together!
Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. Descripción:
Job Brief

Tropicfeel does more than travel gear. It’s a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be achieved.

We look for people who can grow, think, dream, and create. Our culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders, and visionaries. At Tropicfeel, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.

With a combination of analytical expertise, combining data and systems knowledge to generate business insights, the Growth Business Insights Analyst answers and anticipates critical business questions and opportunities and delivers insights to business in ways that make significant impacts.

Responsibilities
Deliver insights in several business domains including:
Biz Dev business cases & forecasting
Performance marketing analysis
e-Commerce analysis
A/B testing
CRM analysis
Social media analysis
Build analytic capabilities to grow the organization’s knowledge.
Develop in-depth business, analytical, and systems knowledge to improve/build analytical solutions, approaches and business recommendations
Demonstrating data visualization (Snowflake, Tableau, Excel) and analytic tools( Google Analytics, Own Media Analytics) to grasp the business insights from our mountain of data.
Collaborate with multi-functional teams (Bizz Dev, B2B, Performance, Marketing, Ecommerce, Customer Experience, CRM)

Skills & Background
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills; capable of interfacing well across multiple skills within and across the company
Stellar written and verbal English communication skills, particularly the ability to communicate clearly, persuasive proposals, emails and presentations.(Power point)
Critical Thinking
BI Implementation & software knowledge
Solid understanding of data analysis methods such as Google Analytics, Snowflake.
Solid understanding of data visualization (Tableau)
Have experience and vision in integrated marketing strategy and coordination; from creative, digital, analytics, demand generation
Proven experience in Digital Marketing & Data Analysis for at least 3 years
Bachelor's degree, preferably in engineering, statistics or business.

What do we offer?
The opportunity to redefine two industries at the same time, the travel & fashion industries, two of the bigger polluter industries in the world
A position with the best career development possibilities
Competitive salary & bonus
Social benefits such as fresh fruit & fun after works
Having a good time is serious business for us, enjoy Garage Beer craft beer on tap for free in our rooftop with 360º Barcelona views
Job located in cool offices based in trendy Barcelona, Poblenou (L4), 10 min away from the beach. WFH has come to stay. Flexibility is key for us.

About Tropicfeel

Global tourism is more popular than ever before, and as a result, it’s endangering the very fabric of our society, planet earth, and locals and travelers alike can already see its noticeable impact. It is essential that we change the way we understand traveling, so let’s begin by doing what is necessary to make a difference, today.

As a brand powered by innovation, we are harnessing the power of collaboration to challenge the status quo, walking alongside modern-day travelers in complete harmony, towards a more responsible future.

Let’s change the way we travel!

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Are you looking for a career where you can innovate, fail, learn and GROW! If that’s your case, Glovo is your place. Glovo is amongst the highest growing startups in the world and expanding very fast.

You will be a key member in the Commercial Intelligence Team, working hand-by-hand with Global Commercial, Regional and Head of Sales and AMs of each different market. At Glovo, it is in our DNA to do more with less and your job will be to optimize the sales department across all regions.

Glovo is a hyperlocal marketplace featuring the most trendy places in each city, and delivers their products in less than 45 mins. The Sales team is directly responsible for partnering with both local stores and with bigger brands to display them in the Glovo platform.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be part of the Commercial Data team
Be key in the Self Service projects analytics (Sales Automation)
Define and develop tools and processes to improve our sales teams productivity and revenue
Define and develop our ETL processes
Automate manual processes
Develop and present studies with our Regional teams
Find new BI tools or processes to improve our reporting
Use a variety of tools to extract and analyze data generated by online user activity
Working with web development and marketing teams to implement your solutions
Understanding the behavior and expectations of online visitors


You Have
Bachelor in Engineering, Maths, Physics or Informatics
Master degree in Data Analytics, Data Science or Programming languages is a plus
+2 years experience in Analytics or Data Science positions
+1 year of experience in web analysis, online commerce or related fields
Programming languages required: python, SQL. Other Languages are a plus
Web Analytics experience required: Interpreting Web Traffic Data, Website Dynamics, Events creation, Experience with Testing and usability
Google Analytics Experience is required
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools: Data Studio, Qlik, Board or similar
Salesforce or other CRM knowledge is required
Proactive, organised, and obsessed with detail and accuracy
Have excellent communication skills. Detail oriented, strong grammar and writing skills
Self-starter who is able to work in a highly demanding environment.
Preferably with experience in a high-growth digital startup business


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Spanish lessons
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.


If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Descripción:
Description

Nous, c’est papernest.

Nous avons un rêve : un monde sans paperasse. Un monde où les phobiques administratifs comme nous vivent enfin protégés de l'angoisse du formulaire et des majorations pour retard de paiement.

Par contre, on ne va pas te mentir, il y a du boulot. C’est pourquoi nous cherchons des personnes investies et hyper enthousiastes pour nous accompagner dans l’aventure.

Car depuis 2015, nous n’avons pas chômé. Avec 4+ millions de déménagements par an en France, et 76% des Français qui se disent stressés par l’événement, nous avons décidé d’attaquer le sujet en commençant par cette opportunité-là. Résultat : nous avons créé la seule plateforme qui permette de transférer tous ses contrats lors d’un déménagement, 100% gratuitement, 100% en ligne. A l’heure où nous soufflons notre 5ème bougie, nous sommes 700 collaborateurs, avons accompagné plus de 600 000 utilisateurs, avons ouvert les marchés français, espagnol et italien et sommes présents à Paris et Barcelone.

Nous voyons les choses en grand - notre ambition : une équipe bouillonnante d'idées aux quatre coins du globe, et des millions d'utilisateurs ayant recours à papernest tous les mois pour leurs démarches, en 1 clic.

Pour relever ces défis, nous recrutons en VIE un(e) Data & CRM Analyst - VIE.

Au sein de l’équipe marketing, tu participeras au développement de notre stratégie CRM en faisant progresser la connaissance que nous avons de nos clients et de nos partenaires pour en tirer des insights actionnables, susceptibles d’améliorer l’expérience que nous leur délivrons, et ainsi impacter favorablement notre business.

Concrètement, tu auras l’opportunité de conduire des analyses, formuler des recommandations stratégiques sur la base de ces analyses et les mettre toi-même en application en implémentant / optimisant les workflows CRM destinés à nos différentes cibles.

Data Analyse

Tu seras amené(e) à assurer les missions suivantes :
Analyse des différents parcours utilisateurs par provenance (Partenariats, SEO, SEA ...), par canal (application, call), par verticale (énergie, box internet...), par pays (FR, ES, IT)... afin d’identifier des leviers de croissance et de monitorer la performance.
Analyse et segmentation de la base client et de notre base de partenaires pour affiner notre compréhension de nos différentes cibles et personnaliser notre stratégie CRM de façon pertinente.
Monitoring et analyse de la performance CRM (KPI intermédiaires : délivrabilité / ouverture / clic... et KPI finaux : taux de transformation, taux de cross-sell, NPS...)
Elaboration de dashboards (dataviz) pour mettre en valeur / partager la connaissance avec les équipes concernées
Proposition de synthèses et recommandations marketing à l’issue des analyses, visant à agir sur nos KPIs
Réalisation d’études ad-hoc en support de prise de décisions pour toutes les équipes de la BU, à partir de grandes sources de données, sur demande explicite ou de manière spontanée
Calculs de KPIs prédictifs faisant appel à des algorithmes de machine learning afin d’affiner nos ciblages automatiques.

CRM B2B (animation de notre réseau de partenaires B2B) :
Participation active à l’élaboration de plans d’animations CRM pour animer notre réseau de partenaires. L’objectif sera de maximiser l’engagement de nos partenaires dans la durée afin de soutenir la croissance exponentielle de papernest : Notre acquisition client repose en grande partie sur notre collaboration avec des milliers de partenaires B2B (agences immobilières, banques, …) qui recommandent l’utilisation de papernest à leurs clients. Il est donc clé pour papernest de développer une relation pérenne avec ses partenaires B2B. A date, nous comptons plus de 8 000 agences immobilières partenaires et ce n’est qu’un début !
Élaboration, test et optimisation des workflows pour réaliser de campagnes automatisées (Marketing Cloud / Zapier)
Création des messages (emails, sms...) et des contenus adaptés (HTML) aux cibles définies (SQL Queries)

Requirements
Diplômé d’une École d’Ingénieur (ou École de commerce avec spécialisation data)
Passionné(e) par le digital et l’écosystème startup
Excellentes compétences d’analyse et de problem solving
Une première expérience réussie en manipulation de données
Capacité à comprendre les enjeux stratégiques et à se mettre à la place du client
Créatif(ve), débrouillard(e), curieux(se) et autonome. Tu es capable d’apprendre rapidement et de monter en compétences sur de nouveaux sujets


Tu Apprendras

Benefits
à manipuler à la perfection les données en SQL (BigQuery) et en Python afin de produire des analyses qui ont de l'impact
à faire des visualisations pertinentes pour faciliter les prises de décision (DataStudio)
à gérer des projets complexes avec de nombreuses parties prenantes
à travailler avec des équipes variées (data analystes, data engineer, product owner, commerciaux, designers, …)
à utiliser Salesforce & Salesforce Marketing Cloud
à maîtriser et mettre en place parcours clients complexes

Ton équipe

Pierre, notre Head of CRM, Customer Experience & Brand

Sous ses airs de bon élève, paisible et réservé, se cache un vrai caméléon aux multiples facettes. Avant de rejoindre l’univers des startups, il a fait ses premières armes…dans l’armée comme lieutenant parachutiste, avant de faire le saut dans le monde des grandes entreprises en infiltrant tour à tour un cabinet de strat, une agence de marketing digital puis une chaîne de télévision.

Gaëlle CRM & Data Project Manager

Diplômée des Ponts et Chaussées, Gaëlle adore plonger dans les chiffres et les requêtes SQL … mais se passionne également pour l’animation de la relation avec nos partenaires. Sourire et joie de vivre font partie intégrante de son quotidien, tout comme les cours de danse, les dégustations de cocktails … et de bonbons qui piquent !

Pourquoi papernest ?

Pour avoir de l’autonomie, de l’impact et relever de vrais challenges. Occuper un poste à responsabilités qui est clé pour le développement de l’entreprise. Travailler au contact d’équipes motivées, dynamiques et engagées.

Process de recrutement
1er call avec l’équipe recrutement
Un entretien avec Gaëlle
Un test SQL
Un entretien avec Pierre (directeur CRM)
Un appel avec Quentin (CMO)


Si ce challenge est le tien, nous avons hâte de te rencontrer !

papernest est une entreprise handi-accueillante.

Descripción:
Company Description

At Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing we’re part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.

Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the world’s most recognized brands.

As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.

Our teams are based in some of the world’s most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 48 different nationalities.

And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?

Job Description

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks
You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills.
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.
Qualifications

What do we require?
Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Readiness to travel (up to 50% depending on project)
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

What Makes Us Smile, When Looking At Your Profile…
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

Additional Information

At Netcentric You Get
Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system
Continuous training and coaching
Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish
Dynamic and international team
Private health insurance
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport)
An office location in the bustling district 22@
Many off-site company events, including our annual company summit
Apple work equipment
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Annika Faßnacht
Manager Talent Acquisition at albelli - join the team!
Enviar mensaje InMail
Do you have great interpersonal skills with the ability to explain and present insights and make your team more enthusiastic about data and experimentation? Do you want to work for a growing eCommerce company with ambitious goal? Then get in touch, we might have a great role for you!

Purpose
As a Conversion Specialist / Analyst at albelli you will analyze and optimize experience of the albelli photo product editors which include online and downloadable editors as well as a mobile app. You will bring an understanding of web analytics and conversion rate optimization and translate it into stunning user experience leading to commercial benefits.

You will significantly contribute to the data driven product development by translating data into actionable insights, communicating them to the team, and proactively driving the A/B testing process. You will present your findings to your product owner, conversion specialists, and other stakeholders.

You will work with in-house UI/UX designers, copywriters, developers, and analysts to get most out of our data with the use of variety of tools. The role is highly influential and you will be able to validate your data driven hypotheses on real visitors and customers.

You will have a chance to exchange experience with other talented conversion specialists and analysts. As a professional willing to learn, you are encouraged to join relevant conferences and meetups. All that in an open environment which gives you flexibility and also room for making mistakes.

Responsibilities:
Define KPI’s for photo product editor performance and experiments;
Proactively identify opportunities for improvements, using data and research;
Create hypotheses for experiments;
Cooperate with the team to build prototypes;
Setup experiments independently or with developers;
Monitor, evaluate experiments and present recommendations;
Coach and educate your team and the business about the data and experimentation.

Requirements:
Minimum of 3 years of related work experience;
Hands-on experience with conversion optimization;
Research driven mindset and passion to work with data;
Experience with analytics / user feedback tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Hotjar, Usabilla etc.;
Experience with A/B testing tools such as Adobe Target, Visual Website Optimizer, Google Optimize, Optimizely etc.;
Basic knowledge of SQL, ideally basic experience with R (or the interest to learn);
Knowledge of UX principles and best practices.

We offer
A fast-growing e-commerce environment
An international company with over 40 nationalities
Competitive compensation
An informal, fun and driven culture

COVID-19 update
For the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our Amsterdam and Nijmegen offices are closed while our production facility in the Hague is operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority. For the time being, most of you will be working from home until further notice. This situation can change at any time.

WHO WE ARE
Scal-e is a Digital Marketing Hub for large and medium-sized B2B or B2C companies willing to leverage customer insights to reduce the cost of customer acquisition and retention.
Through no-code functionalities, Scal-e meets the needs of agility requested by digital marketers, analysts and ITs to integrate new communications channels or data sources. Together with a native integration of all modules, Scal-e agile digital marketing hub for all-channel results, reduce total cost of ownership (TCO) and boost brands productivity when it comes to:
Cleanse and transform customer data from online & offline data sources,
Manage customer privacy,
Create consistent B2C or B2B 360 customer profiles,
Orchestrate Segment-of-One digital marketing campaigns, loyalty programs, distributed marketing approaches or data driven chatbot communications, and,
Build custom dashboards.
Today, Scal-e extend the value of its platform by connecting it to the Martech ecosystem of modern brands like X, Y, Z and Z’ willing to accelerate growth and build smart omnichannel CX. Headquartered in Paris, Scal-e was acquired by LBO and renamed in 2018 by serial entrepreneurs and is backed by sister companies belonging to the same entrepreneurs in Russia, Spain, China, US and Thailand.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Scal-e is seeking a Sales Solutions Consultants (also called presales) fluent in French to join our global sales organization.

YOUR DAY TO DAY
Create and deliver customized product demonstrations for prospects, customers, and partners on-site and remote
Participate in the completion of RFI/RFP and Development of formal sales plans
Engage with sales and colleagues in ongoing knowledge sharing and subject matter growth.

WHY YOU ARE THE PERFECT FIT
You bring a lot of good vibes … and willingness to share and demonstrate your technical proficiency (Data Scientist, Structured and Unstructured Data concepts) and digital marketing knowledge
Few years’ experience as a data analyst/consultant or implementation engineer working for a SaaS company and/or an agency
You are fluent in French, proficient in English (Spanish might be a big plus)
Based in Barcelona and ability to travel




By applying, submitting or sharing your information through any channel (i.e. email, our website, ATS, etc.) you agree to the collection, use and transfer of your data as described in this Privacy Policy. We therefore ask that you take time to read carefully through this Privacy Policy.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Data Analyst (Vendor Analytics) - Digital Markets
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Servicio de información Investigación
Funciones laborales: Gestión Consultoría Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a team with a no-limits mindset that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company that steers clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment with exceptional training and career development. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here !

About Gartner Digital Markets

Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology choices and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three top brands—Capterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.

What You’ll Do

As part of the central analytics organization, you will have the opportunity to help support the Vendor Analytics Team at Gartner Digital Markets (GDM). You will identify new areas to apply analytics to increase software vendor engagement with GDM. You will develop a deep understanding of our auction model and the economics of supply and demand for software leads to help drive software lead prices. You will analyze vendor behavior and identify opportunities to increase vendor satisfaction and retention. You will help improve the volume and quality of leads for software vendors. You will support the business development and customer success teams through improved prioritization of vendor outreach and improved access to critical data.

The Specific Responsibilities Of The Position Include
Use analytics to support Gartner Digital Market’s mission to be the leading resource for software buyers and sellers
Design, develop, execute and manage analytics projects, recurring reports and dashboards for key internal customers across GDM’s sales, client service, vendor marketing and reviews teams
Synthesize qualitative and quantitative data from multiple sources to support analytics goals and business partner objectives
Produce ad hoc and project-based analysis to support key business initiatives
Quantify the impact of major business initiatives and communicate findings to key stakeholders
Support the planning and forecasting process as needed to accurately predict the performance of key metrics
Provide data-driven recommendations and guidance to drive business performance

What You Will Bring To The Team
BA/BS from a top-tier university
Degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics or another quantitative field preferred
Minimum of 2+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, data science or similar role
Experience working with cloud-based or traditional relational database management systems
Experience with business intelligence and data visualization systems (Tableau, Power BI)
Experience in high-volume data businesses (preferably Internet, software or technology industries)
Proficient with SQL or similar database scripting languages
Proficient with the Google suite (Sheets, Docs, Slides) and Microsoft suite of business applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
Experience working with web analytics tools a plus (Google Analytics, Omniture)

Who You Are
Data driven and analytical by nature with demonstrable passion for data and analytics
Self-sufficient and driven to acquire the skills necessary to accomplish complex tasks
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with partners
Excellent organizational and time management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities
Comfortable working independently to achieve successful results with minimal guidance
Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to clearly present complicated analysis
Resourceful and resilient with the ability to take a creative approach to problem solving
Check out our video to learn about who we are, and what we do:

vid.gartner.com/digitalmarkets

What We Offer
Limitless growth and learning opportunities.
A collaborative and positive culture — join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you.
A chance to make an impact — Your work will contribute directly to our strategy.
Frequent social activities such as movie night, laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!
Modern approach to work - Flexible hours, Friday afternoons free, remote work, and more.
New offices (to be inaugurated soon) close to Glòries and the beach in the fantastic, “innovation and tech” 22@ district of sunny Barcelona.
Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Beer O’Clock on Friday afternoons.
Relocation Assistance - A specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork.

What You Will Get
Competitive compensation.
23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December.
Private Medical and Dental Care.
Life and Disability Insurance.
Public Transport Subsidy.
Ticket Restaurant Card.
Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia).
Pension Scheme.
Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
Employee Assistance Program.
Gartner Gives Charity Match.

Who We Are
Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen.
Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We’re humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development.
Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually.

Please Note

Applications must be submitted in English.
A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000 tutors with 80,000 monthly learners from all over the world.

Founded in 2012 and backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalised learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving our products and user experience.

As part of this role, you’ll study and understand user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences
Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behavior and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards


What We Are Looking For
Experience as an in-house Data Scientist or Data Analyst. At least 3 years' experience, ideally more
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Experience with A/B testing frameworks
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must


Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)


What We Offer
Competitive salary according to candidate’s experience
Join a top talented team with a strong data mindset from all over the world
Easy-to-reach location in the city centre
Monthly allowance to learn new languages on Preply.com
Possibility to become a part of a truly big story at the start of its development


Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We’re obsessed with our customer’s problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.


Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Descripción:
Job Description

15 Petabyte of data hosted, 49 countries supported, 15000 servers and thousands of devices to connect locations and businesses. Information is clearly one of Novartis` most valuable asset. In ISRM (Information Security and Risk Management), we implement and maintain solutions that secure the Novartis environment, protect our data and provide the necessary control framework to enable compliance with the various regulations associated with the healthcare industry.

105,000 outstanding individuals work with Novartis all with different needs and aspirations. Aligned to a single inspirational purpose to reimagine medicine for millions of patients across the world.

Join us and directly contribute to Novartis’ vision to Reimagine Medicine.

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Effectively investigate to identify root cause, including attack vector, exploitation, and other techniques utilized to bypass security controls
Accurately diagnose impact, damage, and mitigation techniques needed to restore business operations and minimize reoccurrence
Identify technology and process gaps that affect CSOC services; develop solutions and make recommendations for continuous improvement
Provide oversight and support for first level monitoring and triage to ensure effective operations and mitigation of lower impact incidents
Good cultural orientation and strong influencer of information risk management, information security, IT security, to be embedded across IT, OT and Medical Technologies


Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:
Experience in Incident Response / Computer Forensics / CSOC team / Threat Hunting or related fields
Experienced IT administration with broad and in-depth technical, analytical and conceptual skills
Experience in reporting to and communicating with senior level management (with and without IT background, with and without in depth risk management background) on incident response topics
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills; interpersonal and collaborative skills; and the ability to communicate information risk-related and incident response concepts to technical as well as nontechnical audiences
Excellent understanding and knowledge of general IT infrastructure technology and systems
Proven experience to initiate and manage projects that will affect CSOC services and technologies
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and exude the appropriate level of judgment and maturity


Desirable requirements:
Experience with security incident monitoring and response related to medical devices / pharmaceutical industry
Good mediation and facilitation skills


Why consider Novartis?

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?
We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Descripción:
At Domestika we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst - Remote - Time Zone GMT and GMT +2.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to create an impact on the decisions we make daily. At Domestika, we are creating an environment where data analysis is valued as a driving force for our decisions and strategies. In our organization, our Analysts work closely with decision-makers to create and measure real impact.

We need you to be driven, brave, and ready to learn. While you work closely with our Lead Data Analysts, you will be virtually sitting next to our business users to understand their challenges and help them use analytics to best support their decisions.

We Are Particularly Interested In Profiles With Experience In The Following Areas

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work with Data every day, finding ways to interpret it so that it makes sense for our users.
Social Media campaigns performance
Digital content performance
CRM and Loyalty programs
Growth performance
Pricing Strategy
Digital Product Analytics
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

What does a Senior Data Analyst do at Domestika?
Conduct key Data Analysis such as C-Level requests.
Team mentoring in terms of Analysis and Tech skills.
Deliver actionable insight to business stakeholders.
Stakeholder management to increase the value of deliveries.
Help define performance measurements such as metrics or KPIs.
Establish and promote the Data Analysis peer-review process.
Co-own analytical tools such as Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics.
Proactively improve team delivery.

Requirements
6+ years of experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a digital company, consumer apps.
Track record of leading analytical projects.
Ability to read and write complex SQL.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.
Preferably, a Math/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.
English required at Full professional proficiency.

Would Be a Plus
Familiarity with Business Intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics, etc.
Experience in designing events and tagging for Analytics.
Ability to work independently, take the initiative, and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?
Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
A balanced work-life with a Remote First approach.
A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
An honest salary according to your experience and profile.

Friesland Campina Iberia (GMGA/ Consumer Diary) is looking for the best candidate to fill the Sales Analyst position. From this role, you will support the Sales Organization, provinding data and analytics to the team and helping the organization to focus and achieve the best results.

FrieslandCapina Iberia is transforming itself on a growth journey in order to become a key player in the Spanish and Portuguese diary market.

Bachelor's Degree
Able to work and communicate in Spanish and English
Strong analytic skills and outstanding Excel Management

Results oriented

The IT Business Analyst Senior (BA Senior) is a member of the APD (Global Applications and Platform Development) Community of Expertise and whose main responsibility is to provide outstanding support and innovative IT solutions to the PPG business. The APD CoE is recognized as a strategic partner within the organization, and within that, the Business Analyst supports Global and Regional applications (Non ERP) by assisting other Business Analysts with the resolution of system issues.

Key Responsibilities
Comprehend PPG’s Applications model and configuration
Assists project teams with developing solutions to meet specific business requirements to improve business processes and participates in project life cycles from inception, development and testing, through implementation
Develop and cultivate effective working relationships with both functional team members and IT personnel
Resolve system incidents and issues, create and update documentation, and participate in or conduct workshops and training sessions for colleagues and Key users
Act as application owner for some applications/platform and project manager (or Product Owner – Agile) for all project related to these applications


Qualifications
A 5-year degree in Information Management, Computer Science or other business-related fields.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a business analyst within IT organization.
An outstanding self-starter with a commitment to delivering high quality work in a dynamic fast-paced environment.
Finance and/or Supply Chain and/or Manufacturing (TBD) skills
Basic IT Technical skills; Analytical and conceptual expertise
Waterfall and/or Agile methodology skills.
Excellent communicator in spoken and written English with a diverse workforce across different time zones
Available on working remotely, especially with the communication styles required, and lack of face-to-face time with colleagues and managers.
Tight-knit collaboration and interpersonal abilities
Strong systems and process orientation
Strong desire to build business and functional expertise

Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You’ll Get To
Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.


What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity


It’s Great If You Have
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL
Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Sector: Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Are you at your most motivated when you get to break things? Do you thrive when you explore all of the possibilities for tech to fail or succeed?

ThoughtWorks is a global software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech.

Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years. They’ve also been writing books, speaking at conferences and helping push software development forward, changing companies and even industries along the way. We passionately believe that software quality is driven by open communication, review and collaboration. That’s why we’re such vehement supporters of open source and have made significant contributions to open source tools for testing, continuous delivery (GoCD), continuous integration (CruiseControl), machine learning and healthcare.

As consultants, we work with our clients to ensure we’re evolving their technology and empowering adaptive mindsets to meet their business goals. You could influence the digital strategy of a retail giant, build a bold new mobile application for a bank or redesign platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You will learn to use the latest Lean and Agile thinking, create pragmatic solutions to solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself every day.

Woven between all of the stages of the development process is the work of a Quality Analyst: the technologist who sees building solutions like a kaleidoscope of possibilities for things to break. By collaborating with each team member—Developer, Business Analyst, Designer, etc.—they ensure quality is thoughtfully examined in both processes and technology. QAs also aspire to be more than testers; they’re team motivators and strive to encourage all teammates to weave quality into their mindsets and code.

You’ll Spend Time On The Following
You will proactively seek out ways to avoid common software-testing problems such as test case duplication, flaky tests, and maintainability
You will pair with devs to read and analyze code and provide feedback about tests
You will provide input for and champion system testability
Advocate QA expertise to the broader tech community outside of ThoughtWorks, speaking at conferences and acting as a mentor for more junior-level QAs
Strive for quality to be built and aspire to shift quality to the left
Apply theoretical knowledge to practice and willingly offer improvements on code, tests, testability and suggest tools and frameworks to use
You will examine end-to-end processes in addition to backend testing, ensuring quality is embedded throughout
You will produce and implement test strategies during the software development process
Drive the creation of a reliable automated testing suite with strong reporting capabilities that ensures simple, effective analysis of failures for your team to use
Champion high-functioning teams and enable transitions where necessary
Extend your passion for quality assurance practices to enabling the client, helping coach a client’s team to adopt a testing mindset


Here’s What We’re Looking For
You have worked as a Quality Analyst as part of a wider development team, pairing with Devs and ideally Business Analysts, Infrastructure Engineers, and Designers
You have experience with Agile, code management, deployment strategies and different types of nonfunctional testing
Solid understanding of best practices such as TDD, BDD, CI/CD and the Practical Test Pyramid
You have experience with API automation, are comfortable in databases, and love to write simple code in order to test applications
You are comfortable with different types and techniques in functional testing including exploratory, boundary value analysis and equivalence partitioning
You have exposure to and experience in using defect tracking and management tools
An understanding of how to perform better white box testing using code
You know what a test strategy is and can produce one
You can zoom out to the big picture and understand the impact of changes to the product
You’re resilient in ambiguous situations and can approach and tackle challenges from multiple perspectives
You enjoy influencing others and always advocate for quality as a shared team responsibility, yet are open to change when needed
An ability to assess strengths amongst your teammates and distribute quality-related tasks when needed

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Investigación
Descripción:
Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 1 year of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Puesto ofertado: Jr. Business Analyst – Temporary Position (12 Months)
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Description

Position at Tokio Marine HCC

Tokio Marine HCC (TMHCC) is a leading specialty insurance group with offices in the United States, the United Kingdom, Europe, Ireland, and other exciting locations. With the strength and stability that comes from being a member of the Tokio Marine group, and more than forty years of growth, profitability, and stability, we offer important insurance products that most people don’t even know exist.

Just as we invest in our company, we invest in our employees’ careers. We provide our employees a collaborative and rewarding environment within which to gain the knowledge, skills, and experience that lead to a rewarding career. Our products allow our customers to take on opportunity with confidence. In turn, our competitive salaries, attractive benefits, and potential for career growth allow you to take on opportunity with confidence.

Jr. Business Analyst – Temporary Position (12 Months)

Description

The Business Analysis department at Tokio Marine HCC is part of the Operations department and analyses business processes, problems and opportunities, recommending solutions that enable the company to improve quality and efficiency and ultimately to reduce costs and achieve company goals.

As a Junior Business Analyst, based in our Barcelona Office, you will form part of a dynamic team of professionals that work as a liaison between the Front and the Back Office in order to improve the current operating systems.

You are asked to analyze, communicate, and validate requirements for changes to business processes and information systems to ensure the company´s departments run smoothly.

Your role is key to support the company’s objectives and standards.

The Junior Business Analyst will directly report to the Business Analysis Manager.

Responsibilities
Be a point of reference for any underwriting system queries from different departments (Underwriting/ Finance/ Compliance/ Operations).
Manage the Financial Lines PAS (Policy Administration System) Bugs Inbox by logging the PAS Bugs and keeping the bugs list up-to-date.
Participate in the Wave deployments by:
Testing the bugs/stories in the UAT (User Acceptance Testing) environment.
Communicating the UAT results/Wave Deployments.
Be the expert for the NewGen Tool for automatic Policy Document Generation.
Draft basic requirements for business processes and/or system changes.
Analyze any system impact due to changing business requirements.
Communicate updates and system improvements to different stakeholders (e.g. emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations).
Work in an Agile environment (attend Scrum Meetings, log bugs/stories in TFS, prioritize bugs, communicate test results).
Deliver system trainings to employees and make sure monthly releases are understood (through UWA (Underwriting Assistants) trainings for example).
Attend meetings with the project team regularly (triage/surgery meetings) to review project deliverables and deadlines.
Create and maintain issue/bugs logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries, updates, determine daily priorities and follow the proper escalation paths.
Document and keep up to date the PAS Systems and BA (Operations) manual / training material.

Requirements
Bachelor degree.
Excellent English written communication skills; advanced English verbal communication skills, any other language (preferably Spanish) is an asset.
Preferably experience in/knowledge about the Insurance sector.
Proficiency in standard software Office applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point).
Visio, Agile Frameworks (such as Jira/Visual Studio) and Pega/SBS Eclipse knowledge is a plus.

Profile
Strong analytical skills for projects.
Able to multitask and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
A proactive approach to problem solving, taking ownership of his/her responsibilities.
Service oriented, to both external clients and employees.
Punctual, loyal and reliable.
Team player.
Ability to work across multiple business units/teams.
Be able to transfer knowledge.

Company Description

Interested in working for an exciting company that is redefining the way people play video games? Interested in working for a world class company in a fun, and rewarding environment in Barcelona? Then Gameloft is the company for you!

About Gameloft

Leader in the development and publishing of mobile games, Gameloft® has established itself as one of the top innovators in its field since 2000. Gameloft creates games for all digital platforms, two of which are featured in the “Top 10 Games by All-Time Worldwide Downloads” from App Annie. Gameloft operates its own established franchises such as Asphalt®, Order & Chaos, Modern Combat and Dungeon Hunter and also partners with major rights holders including Universal, Illumination Entertainment, Disney®, Marvel®, Hasbro®, Fox Digital Entertainment, Mattel® and Ferrari®. Gameloft distributes its games in over 100 countries and employs 4,600 people worldwide. Every month, 114 million unique users can be reached by advertisers in Gameloft games with Gameloft Advertising Solutions, a leading B2B offering dedicated to brands and agencies. Gameloft is a Vivendi company.

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

About Gameloft Advertising Solutions

With a monthly audience of more than 113 million unique players and an inventory of 2.4 billion impressions, Gameloft Advertising Solutions offers advertisers a unique level of visibility and engagement. To date, Gameloft Advertising Solutions has delivered more than 3000 campaigns for prestigious brands such as Air France, Coca-Cola®, Ford, FOX™, Kellogg’s®, McDonalds, ©Netflix, Procter & Gamble, Samsung and Unilever, in over 40 countries around the world (North America, Latin America, Middle East, Africa, Europe, Asia, etc.).

All trademarks referenced above are owned by their respective trademark owners.

Job Description

We are currently looking for a User Acquisition Data Analyst to complement our Global Data Science team.

You will be part of our HQ data science team, and collaborate very closely with our UA team as well. Together with other data analysts, data scientists in the team, you will continuously deliver actionable insights from our vast amount of UA and in-game data, with the goal of driving our games’ growth and improving UA efficiency.

From the beginning of your adventure with us, you will be called to
Explore our data warehouse and grow deep understanding of UA and game tracking data
Master marketing data dimensions and measure definitions
Perform 360 analysis to answer questions from stakeholders in a timely manner
Turn your analyses into valuable actions that can be taken by the UA or game team
Understand statistical analysis and can apply that to UA testings

Qualifications

Essential (must-have)
Minimum 1 year of professional experience in a similar role (e.g. data analyst, UA analyst etc.)
Excellent SQL skill, you would consider yourself an SQL expert.
Sensitivity for data quality and deep quantitative analysis skills
Ability to deliver clean, accurate and understandable data visualization and dashboards
Familiarity with marketing terms such as CPI, RoAS, creative optimization
Understanding of statistical analysis
Positive attitude and interest in interacting with other teams
Excellent sense of organization and great autonomy, enjoy individual and team work.
Good knowledge of English (written and oral).
Passion for games!
Desired
High level of proficiency in relevant scripting language(s), e.g. R or Python
Prior experience in working on marketing/UA teams
Good understanding of mobile attribution and UA performance measurement

Additional Information

Why Join the World of Gameloft?
Because you want to be part of an exceptional experience within a company that is constantly growing!
Because you want to work with talented people who are industry pioneers!
Because you want to join a global company and meet great people around the world from all walks of life.
Or, just because you’re looking for a great place to work!


Benefits
Permanent contract, full-time job and excellent Social Benefits.
The offer includes relocation assistance, a merit based salary progression system and a competitive initial salary package.
Career-development opportunities.
An exceptional, dynamic, demanding and motivating working environment within a fast growing company.
Challenging and rewarding work on the next great frontiers in games.
Exceptional library of diverse games with broad distribution.
An international environment which offers daily contact with other countries & cultures
Excellent local working conditions (quality of offices, geographical location of office in the centre of Barcelona).
All qualified candidates will be asked to take a skills assessment test.

We can’t wait to find our next great talent!

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted and your CV will be saved in our files for a period of 6 months.

Want to know more? Please visit our Website www.gameloft.com

If the offer interests you, Join the Game!
______________________________________________________________________

Additional Survey

Thanks for agreeing to take part in this survey and your interest in our Company.

As part of our Recruitment process, we would like to know more about your interests when applying in Gameloft.

The survey may take you less than 5 minutes to complete, and is totally anonymous. Your honest answers will have no impact on whether you will get the job or not.

They will only be used to support our continuous efforts to match our Employer brand with our candidate’s expectations.

https//www.surveymonkey.com/r/PVFDD2P

Many thanks for your help!

Kind regards
