Descripción:
TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000’s and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 150+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 32 nationalities. At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

What you will do

We are looking for a Senior Performance Marketing Analyst to join our Analytics Department. As you establish a Marketing Analytics role, you will play a key role in the development of our acquisition channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google, Youtube, Search, Shopping Ads, Display, Affiliates etc.

Your experience with these channels will help you analyze the data, automate critical processes, and improve campaign performance.

Using your strong technical background, you will work directly with the marketing and tech teams on the implementations of various tracking systems, as well as solutions to automate and manage at large-scale advertising campaigns through APIs, and with the help of Data Science, you will build advanced models for multi-touch attribution or retargeting.

Responsibilities
Owning and developing tracking of the full customer journey across all current and future marketing platforms. Taking care of data quality, governance, integrations and enhancements of our data lake.
Leveraging data to understand, acquisition, activation, and retention dynamics, and help identify key growth and efficiency opportunities for our marketing team.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Data Engineers, Data Scientists) to plan, facilitate, and develop Marketing Analytics projects.
Supporting our marketing experts to run A/B test campaigns by designing a clean experiment framework, gathering data, and analyzing results, in order to optimize and scale marketing operations.
Managing key projects for tracking implementation, attribution models, or advanced marketing techniques, such as segmentation or retargeting.

Requirements
The ideal candidate will have an interest in performance marketing, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements, while exhibiting deep expertise in marketing multi-touch attribution and tracking systems.

5+ years experience in a similar role as a Performance Marketing Analyst.
Experience working with different ad platforms/channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google Ads, Display, Affiliates.
Expert in Google Analytics and Google Ads (especially data collection and event tracking with Google Tag Manager)
Good knowledge of SQL, comfort working in large data sets in R or Python.
Good understanding of key performance marketing concepts (campaign measurement, audience targeting, etc.) and knowledge of industry trends.
Experience with leveraging marketing attribution models (3rd party or in-house solutions).
Project management experience creating advanced solutions for marketing performance optimization and tracking systems.
Must have strong commercial sense and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Strong interpersonal management skills and ability to work in indirect/remote teams, if needed.
Fluent in English.

Nice to have
Marketing automation tools or Google360.
Shopify integration with other tracking systems for example GA.
Cross-domain tracking.
Familiar with product analytics tools such as Mixpanel or Amplitude.

Benefits
Private Health and Dental Insurance plan for employees.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly internet allowance.
Working from home setup allowance.
Company sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored training and development.
Quarterly company bonus programme.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Remote policy and flexible working hours
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Hybrid remote model office.
*Please note: All applications must be submitted in English

Descripción:
FREE NOW is looking for a highly motivated and committed Senior Zendesk Admin to join our Operations Support team in Lisbon (able to work remotely anywhere within the 11 countries in Europe where FREE NOW has an office).

The team sits within the wider Service Operations team of FREE NOW and works in close alignment with the Customer Care Hub Managers as well as several Product teams within the FREE NOW Group.

What Winning Looks Like:

Obsessed with super-serving FREE NOW customers indirectly by creating a seamless experience utilizing the Zendesk tool
Utilizing the whole Zendesk Enterprise Suite (i.e. Support, Guide, Explore, Talk, Chat)
Architecting company-wide ticket forms and thinks through impacts on businesses and customers
Contributing to culture of continuous improvement and implementing industry best practices
Partnering with our CS Data Analyst and developing reporting capabilities, metrics & executive dashboards with Zendesk
Using API endpoints to develop integrations and business applications
Ability to prioritize work in order of importance, create project requirements and meet deadlines
Keen awareness of upcoming Zendesk updates/EAPs and how they will impact our businesses and customers

How you'll make an impact:

You're a strategic thinker who can translate business problems into Zendesk solutions
Serve as the primary system administrator for the Zendesk environment, partnering and collaboration with key stakeholders across the FREE NOW organization to gather, prioritize and execute business requirements and solutions.
Complete regular intern system audits and prepare for upgrade
Manage Zendesk data feeds and other integrations
Effectively act as the liaison between all teams utilizing the platform
Optimize systems architecture and business processes to continually reflect the growth and scale of the business

Experience / Skills Needed to Win:

Experience in strategy formulation around customer service tools/systems, ideally with a focus on self-service/automation
3+ years of experience within a Zendesk Administration capacity, preferably within a high-growth start-up work environment
We'd prefer you to have a Zendesk Certification (e.g. Support or Guide) but it's not a requirement
Clear thinker and excellent communicator both written and verbal able to create internal and external awareness of the strategy and the vision of the customer service tools, coupled with ability to roll up sleeves
Native or fluent English speaker

What we'd love to see:

Experience building Zendesk from the ground up within a go-to-market environment, you understand the business acumen of a marketplace organization
Strong project management along with best practices and functionality
Strong data management abilities, along with the demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Team player with a documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
Understanding of the platform with the ability to implement apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity
Ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption
Proven expertise integrating tools within 3rd party integrations
Bonus points for direct experience within the mobility environment.
Bonus point for strong understanding of Aircall, along with best practices and functionality

Diversity and inclusion:

At FREE NOW, we commit to being an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age. We celebrate diversity and have a clear vision: to be the place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay and do their best work. Together with passionate, creative and collaborative colleagues, we are following our purpose of making mobility available for everyone.

Move like you

At FREE NOW we have colleagues from over 70 nations! We value open communication and welcome everyone as they are. We are all one team and follow the same goals – that's why we share our insights and results to get on track together every month.

Your wellness and work-life balance matters to us. We offer trust-based and flexible working hours as well as the option to work from home. In the office, you can enjoy our free drinks and daily fresh fruit. Do you like to be active? Take part in our subsidized gym membership. Bigger plans? Take a sabbatical leave and get out there!

Let's grow together! We believe in a transparent career growth plan, quarterly development sessions with your team lead as well as regular 1:1s to help you thrive! For your own ideas, you're welcome to set up initiatives and projects.
Need a lift? Check out our language classes and internal peer-to-peer trainings.

More Benefits? 👏 Monthly budget for FREE NOW rides, quarterly team events, company-wide onboarding days at our HQ in Hamburg, relocation assistance for internationals, birthday-off, kudos and many more!

About FREE NOW:

FREE NOW is the multi-service mobility joint venture backed by BMW Group and Daimler AG. Next to ride hailing, FREE NOW also offers micro-mobility services and car sharing. It consists of the services FREE NOW (10 European markets), Βeat (5 Latin American and 1 European market) and hive (e-scooter and e-bikes in 3 European markets). Summed up, those services currently attract 45 million users in 17 markets and more than 150 cities. FREE NOW is therefore the biggest multi-service mobility provider in Europe and the fastest-growing ride-hailer in Latin America. FREE NOW works with various third party providers to offer their customers an even wider range of options to get from A to B. In total, more than 2,200 employees in around 35 offices work for the services of FREE NOW, which is led by CEO Marc Berg.

Descripción:
Do you like traveling?
Do you like solving challenges through Technology?
Do you have an Agile mindset?

If all your answers are YES, this is for you!

Exoticca’s mission is to offer the best holiday packages experiences at unbelievable

prices. With Exoticca you can find the best trips hand crafted by curators with every

detail included. Our customers can book trips online or by phone with the best user

experience.

Your Role in the Team

The Product Web team is looking for Web Product Owner with experience in some of

the following areas
Experience with UX, UI, User Experience Optimization, Benchmarking, Feedback
loops.
Experience in web analytics to improve User Experience, AB Testing with tools
such as Google Analytics or Hotjar.
Experience in managing and organizing product Roadmaps
Experience with Agile methodologies. Ideally exposure to roles such as Product

Owner, Scrum Master, Project Manager or being part of an agile squad/team.

We work in Squads within a Product Organization. In the Web Squad you will be able

to be and active part in the Design, Use Experience, Development and Leverage of

many innovative Products and Features. You will have a real impact in the company

Roadmap.

Requirements

We are looking for a Web Product Owner that is
Organized and Autonomous. Ideally with experience in Project Management,
Scrum or Kanban and relevant tools such as Jira, Confluence or other.
Creative and with Entrepreneur mindset. Attention to details. You will manage
projects End to End from ideation to execution and delivery.
Data driven mindset. You like to base decisions in the experience of the team
and prove it with data. Experience with Data and BI tools is a plus Tableau,

Looker, PowerBI, QlikView.
3+ years of work experience in a similar in roles such as Digital Project
Manager, Product Owner or Web Analyst. Preferably in a B2C environments.
Customer centric mindset to deliver exceptional Customer Experience.
BA in Engineering or Business Administration or relevant working experience.
Excellent Analytical skills and Data-Driven mindset, you love analytics, metrics

and statistics with the ability to make data-driven decisions.
Advanced Excel user and comfortable with Data Visualization tools.
SQL knowledge is also a plus.
Fluent English

Benefits
Competitive salary package, in line with the job’s responsibilities.
Immediate incorporation and permanent contract.
Benefits package flexible schedule, remote working, trainings, and the

possibility of travelling at reduced prices!
And most importantly… becoming part of a highly successful multicultural
team!

Descripción:
In a constantly changing world, we work together with our people, clients and communities to enable them to fulfill their potential to do great things. We believe that by bringing everyone together, we can solve problems using innovative technology that can create a world that is sustainable and secure. At NTT, we encourage you to remain continuously curious, as that is what keeps you fast, flexible and relevant. No two days will be the same but that is what will help you grow and realize your full potential.

The power is in your hands to do great things. It’s time to lead the change, be the authentic you, to solve difficult challenges, to set the pace of change and to unleash your potential.

Want to be a part of our team?
The Compliance and Data Protection Analyst is responsible for the assisting in the assessment of the company’s compliance and risk posture as they relate to its information assets. The purpose of this position is to execute the planned activities of the information security and service risk management program, report on their outcome and resolve deviations from the defined thresholds. Responsibilities require project management experience to ensure effectiveness system-wide analysis; controls testing and improvement; risk assessment; maintain related awareness and education; and improvement of policies, standards and guidelines.

Working at NTT

Key Responsibilities
Ensure that the IMS (ISO 27001, ISO 20000-1and GDPR) is maintained in the organization.
Responsible for the company policies to be updated and aligned to group and business needs.
Generating monitoring reports related to IMS performance and effectiveness.
Monitor their achievement of the define the objectives of the Integrated Management System.
Ensure that non-conformities and corrective actions are managed.
Monitor and maintain ISO support processes.
Monitor and report the continuous improvement of the IMS.
Coordinating audits of existing CMS compliance standards related to Information Security and Services.
Improve risk management framework and supervise compliance with Risk Management policy.
Maintenance of the company risk register, follow-up of risk treatment plans and report risk to relevant stakeholders.
Ensure and monitor activities and process related to GDPR (records of processing activities, third parties contracts review, vendor risk assessment, etc).
Coordinate activities related to PCI DSS (Audit plan, coordinate PCI vendor propose, etc).
Establish, implement and test a Business Continuity Plan.
Provide Integrated Management System awareness training to organization personnel

What will make you a good fit for the role?

Proven Experience Of
Knowledge of information security, service management and risk management frameworks and compliance practices such as ISO/IEC 20000-1, ISO/IEC 27001, PCI-DSS, GDPR, SOC2.
Understanding of relevant business operations, policies and strategy, and the ability to deliver risk mitigation at the speed of a dynamic technology company.
Excellent logical and structured ability to effectively understand and decompose business needs, goals, and objectives into tangible requirements, solutions, and alternatives.
Demonstrated ability to work within a global team and effectively manage onshore and offshore personnel and vendors.
Ability to think critically through complex situations, with a knack for persuasion and consultation.
Demonstrated knowledge of developing compliance reports, and IT policies, procedures, and practices.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills, including formal report writing experience targeted to technical, business, and executive audiences in verbal and written formats.

Preferred Experience
Between 1 and 3 years of experience in an IT Audit, Governance, Risk or Compliance role performing information security audits or risk assessments.
Project Management skills.
A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject (IT or other related field) is required for this job; Master’s desired.
Experience within a Global Organization preferred.
Experience working with cross functional teams.
Broad base of technical skills.
Skills in documenting risk and compliance activities.
One or more current relevant industry certifications such as ISO Lead Implementer, PCI Professional, CRISC.

Language Skills
Written and spoken English (fluent / native).
Written and spoken Spanish (fluent / native

Descripción:
Are passionated about data analytics and you are a machine building beautiful visualizations? Join us as a Senior Data Viz Analyst!

With over 100M+ users across seven #1 mobile games, a career at Scopely offers countless ways to have a huge impact with a small and collaborative team of engineers. You will join a great team in Publishing Platform which is in charge of building systems to support millions of players in dozens of top mobile games, helping us understand how to improve each title and the in-game experience of each player. We enjoy challenging work, but try to find simple solutions. When you join our growing team, you can expect to own your work from ideation and product definition through production deployment and continued feature maturation. We’re looking for people who take pride in their work and seeing it impact real people.
 What you will do:
Working with Product teams to gather requirements and build specifications for Portfolio Data Products
Design and build beautiful visualizations to support our extensive portfolio of titles
Efficiently build data structures on top of our portfolio data models to support data visualization needs
Collaborate with the BI engineering team to deliver faster and more actionable KPIs
Be a steward of data quality, ensuring that metrics and KPIs are consistently reported across the catalog of dashboards and data products
Work closely with stakeholders across the board to improve our data culture and data accessibility
 What you will need:
Will to learn and work with a team of highly-motivated individuals
Experience with accurate and performant SQL including complex queries using big data technologies (BigQuery is a plus)
Experience building data products in Looker (Tableau or other BI tools a plus)
Proven track record successfully building and evolving robust data products
Positive attitude
Programming experience in Python, JS, R (a plus)
Experience with data modeling techniques (a plus)
Experience with ETL in SaaS environments such as Airflow (a plus)
Competency working in a Linux OS environment, shell scripts, github (a plus)
Ping Pong/Mario Kart skills (a plus)
 About us:
Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Star Trek™ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes™ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival™, YAHTZEE® With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune®: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company’s ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’ and #2 on Deloitte’s ‘Technology Fast 500’ as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people’s lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors. 
 Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status. 
 Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://scopely.com/scopely-candidate-privacy-notice/

Descripción:
If you are a Google analytics + excel expert and you are a confident English speaker, then keep reading!

Who We Are

Marfeel is a publishing platform that that revolutionizes the way publishers create, optimize and monetize mobile websites. Over 850 publishers, including USAToday, Euronews, and El Confidencial use Marfeel to serve a billion mobile sessions, every month.

We take a Technology-First approach and have a commitment to developing new tools for digital publishers to reach their audience. Our innovative technology, including PWAs, SEO and engagement tools, monetization and experimentation makes us proud of what we can offer to our clients: faster speeds, greater performance, and worldwide distribution.

Our team now has more than 130 members, made up of 30 different nationalities. With headquarters in Barcelona and offices in New York and Bogotá, our people and our diversity are the reason behind our world-class product, and we’re still growing.

This Is You
You can prepare reports (data tables, graphs, etc.) in your sleep
You are passionate about analytics and web metrics
You are a wizard at interpreting data from several sources in order to have a global vision of the business and anticipate needs.
You always think “Challenge accepted” when it comes to identifying problems and improvements based on the data you collect
You have an analytical mind and can’t stop thinking about data metrics.
You are a great listener, a quick thinker and know how to communicate with clients.
Resolving issues with our clients is something you look forward to and you know how to propose improvements to increase profits.
You are an international team player.
You are hands-on and proactive
You have lots of stamina and like fast-paced environments filled with challenges
You have a high level of English (it is a must)


You Should Be Excellent In
Google Analytics
Complete mastery of Excel (simple formulas, pivot tables, etc.)
If you have experience in DFP it would be awesome.

This will be you as part of the Marfeel team:
Open-space, light-filled and eco-conscious office with large sunny terrace
Unlimited refreshments including coffee, tea & soft drinks
Ping-pong, video games, table football and other games for down-time
Free language and yoga classes at the office and online
Subsidized monthly plan to a huge network of health & wellness centres (Andjoy)
Transport, restaurant & kindergarten tickets
Subsidized health insurance for you and your partner/family
Flexible working hours and early finish on Fridays
Loyalty sabbatical and vacation days
Access to training platforms, courses and materials
Referral bonus for talent brought to us by you

Descripción:
Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst

About The Job

Our opportunity Are you passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a motivated team and help us make a difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world's leading insurance groups!

In this role as a Reporting Business Analyst / Business Intelligence Specialist, you will be part of the " Analytics and Reporting " team within Group Investment Management.

You will collaborate closely with IT functions and a diverse range of end user in different countries and translate their analytical and reporting needs into requirements and solutions.

Responsibilities

Your role As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your main responsibilities will involve Develop analytical, regulatory and operational reports using SAP Business Objects, BEX, SAP Analysis for Office, Microsoft Power BI and other analytical tools
Maintain key business applications (based on SAP/BW, BW4/HANA) and support/lead new business initiatives
Perform impact analysis of application changes, holding an end-to-end view of the system
Support the continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure
Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs
Run requirement gathering workshops; create requirements documents and design concepts
Ensure compliance and data quality

Your Skills And Experience As a Reporting and Analytics Business Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
Minimum 5 years of experience as a business analyst/ business intelligence specialist
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or equivalent
Strong knowledge of business intelligence principles, data analytics, query design, modelling and reporting front-end tools
Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g. analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)
Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment
Strong Communication skills in written and spoken English
Basic knowledge of financial processes and investment instruments are a plu
Knowledge of SAP FSCM-FAM is a plus
Spanish language skill is a plus


Technical Knowledge
Strong skills in SAP/BW & SAP BW4/HANA, Query Design, SAP front-end tools
Advanced skills in modern Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, PBI)
Data analysis skills in R/Python are a strong plus

Additional Information
Primary work location is Barcelona. This position requires some light traveling. You can apply by clicking on the button "Apply online"

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:
Wide range of internal and external trainings
Ticket restaurant
Option to work remotely up to 50% of time weekly
Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company
Life Insurance
Exclusive employee discounts
Free English and Spanish classes depends on the business needs

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Recursos humanos
Descripción:
Description

CloudBlue is a technology solution startup born from the need to digitally transform a multibillion-dollar enterprise. The CloudBlue platform orchestrates ecosystems for customers worldwide, including the largest B2B Cloud Marketplace in the world. We have spent 15+ years innovating and investing in digital transformation, subscriptions, and multi-level partner ecosystems. Today, hundreds of customers rely on CloudBlue to orchestrate their ecosystems and scale their businesses globally.

By joining the CloudBlue team, you’ll be playing a significant role in our growth, having an opportunity to make an immediate impact on the business. Our entrepreneurial scope means we operate with the agility of a high growth start-up, but with the confidence & backing of a Fortune 100 corporation, Ingram Micro.

At CloudBlue you'll work with a diverse and multi-cultural team that spans cultures, continents, and time zones to serve our global customer base. You’ll be a part of a culture that emphasizes trust, open communication, and continuous learning.

Responsibilities

Support on the discovery, analysis and selection of target segments and use cases for rapid expansion.

Data collection, transformation and curation. Maintains up to date databases on prospects, competitors and competitive solutions.

Support on planning and execution of market research activities designed to increase sales growth and expand market share.

Support on innovation programs. Execution co-innovation initiatives with customers.

Maintains customer and competitor research data, executes customer surveys, marketing and customer profiling practices.

Supports in the creation of thought leadership content and marketing assets

Liaises with other departments to ensure a unified approach to customer success.

Position Summary

Supports different Product Marketing and Sales Outbound activities. Works with Global Product and Sales Managers on various product marketing initiatives including research, sales collateral, prospecting databases and other materials as required. Ability to handle multiple projects and meet tight deadlines is a must.

Job Qualifications

To perform this job function successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Passion for innovative high-tech products and for technological advances
Skills in analyzing market trends and the competitive landscape
Experience with data-driven approach by analyzing data and monitoring metrics
Good skills on data management and visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau and similars
Accustomed to working with data, interpreting data, producing graphs and visualizations and telling stories based on data insights
Ability to quickly understand different business models
Critical thinking, “constant learning” mindset that enables continuous improvement of processes
Excellent organizational skills, can create and follow a timeline meeting deadlines.
Excellent English (both written and verbal)

Education

Degree in Marketing Research, Business Administration or similars. Masters in Marketing and / or Sales Preferred

Experience

3 years minimum of Marketing, Product Marketing or Data analyst experience

Kristina Kysova
Technical Recruiter @ Vistaprint - We're hiring!
Enviar mensaje InMail
Who We Are

Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do
Be immersed in diverse teams (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers
Support Agile Campaigning and Reading test results to inform personalization strategy and testing roadmap.
Be a part of the overall CRM team providing insights and analysis to drive better customer experiences - across channels and touchpoints
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to drive marketing efficiency in our advertising and improve the customer experience to acquire valuable customers and promote repeat shopping behavior.
Design and execute a/b/n tests to optimize the customer experience and analyze results to provide insightful recommendations to the business. Support customer lifecycle flow tests with long-term reads in addition to A/B testing. Experience with Optimizely and customer lifecycle marketing a plus.
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often

Your Qualifications
Passionate about data and technology. You are proficient in SQL. Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R) are a plus. Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics) a plus.
Inquisitive by nature. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data.You bring your perspective on results and seek ways to improve. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker is a plus.
Experienced. 3+ years in an eCommerce environment and a bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or related field.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

At Vistaprint, we put extraordinary importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include language courses, flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, “Vistabreak”, Summer hours and Public Holidays, to name a few!

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

Descripción:
Description

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon in a promising new market segment?
Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you?
Amazon is seeking a Transportation Performance Analyst to join Amazon's European Special Handling (EU SH) team. EU SH team is responsible for the end-to-end Heavy/Bulky journey in the fulfilment, supply chain and transportation daily business and its strategic vision in Europe.
Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day to day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to take our important business decisions.
Our ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes working with large transactional volumes and big data, enjoys the challenge of highly complex business contexts (that are typically being defined in real-time), and, above all else, is passionate about data and analytics.
As an Analyst you will be developing SQL/ETL queries, accessing data warehouse and redshift clusters, creating automated reports through macros, creating relevant KPIs and metrics for performance of team as well as for transportation operations. Publish daily/weekly performance reports. You will give us business insights based upon data to further improve our operations and processes.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results.

You should have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities and strong technical skills.

Responsibilities
Create metrics, performance dashboards and reports
Drive root cause analysis
Engage with cross-functional teams and/or carriers/vendors for implementation of project/program requirements
Managing multiple projects/initiatives
Communication at all levels with the ability to present information professionally & concisely with supporting data

Basic Qualifications
VBA, SQL or other coding experience to support automation initiatives
Working experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Quicksight.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in business process improvement, Lean/Six Sigma
Proven independent decision making skills in an often times ambiguous environment.
Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes
Previous experience within transportation or logistics.
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates

Descripción:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

We are looking for a Senior Business Performance Analyst to be a member of our growing Central Analytics team at King. Working with stakeholders from across King, you will provide critical insights into the state and trend of our business that enable better decision making and drive impact. Your work will be crucial to help push the boundaries of how we understand our players and games. As part of the Central Analytics team, you will set the standard for outstanding, holistic business insights. Your reporting will seamlessly combine King’s own data with player insights and market intelligence.
Your role within our Kingdom
You will be working collaboratively across all parts of the business to crack company- wide problems in how we can grow our business.

Reporting To a Director Of Central Analytics, You Will
Deliver actionable insights that can support and drive impactful decisions
Work with the Central Analytics team to lead the business, including King’s Leadership Team, in understanding key performance trends and identifying opportunities for growth
Provide accurate data, insights, analysis and forecasts for decision makers and stakeholders
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis on our portfolio of games and player network
Communicate results in a clear and concise manner, with an understanding of data visualisation and the importance of drawing accurate conclusions from multiple data sources
Foster strong relationships with other key functions across King, such as Finance, Corporate Strategy and Marketing
As a member of Central Analytics, the wider CIA and the whole data community at King, strive to deliver high quality, impactful data deliverables
Ensure your work is delivered in context of our business, industry trends and the competitor landscape to evolve our thinking
Skills to create thrills
You are a highly analytical, passionate problem solver. You have the ability to draw data driven business insights that will add real value to King. You are proactive and demonstrate the ability to learn quickly.
Experience working in a commercial data team, providing business insights and models which lead to data informed business decisions
You can see the forest, not just trees. You understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then find the right data, analysis or interpretation to translate into actionable insights
Methodological and pragmatic with a hands- on approach that can get straight to the point when needed
Strong communication skills: you can communicate the most complex insights concisely and clearly in writing and in person
Great relationship building skills and experience in working with a wide range of stakeholders across the business
Masters or PhD Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics. Economics, Engineering or similar field or work experience
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for numerical analysis
Prior experience in an industry with very short implementation cycles such as e- commerce, online products/services or games
Experience in working with highly- skilled peers in analytics, data science and engineering, consumer research, and Business Performance
Solid understanding or enthusiasm for the games industry
Skills to create reports and dashboards that allow teams to understand and optimize initiatives using tools such as Python/R, Looker and BigQuery (GCS)
Knowledge of and/or interest in dashboard & reporting tools
Open to feedback as a way of learning and improving
Pragmatic problem- solver – someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problems

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

Descripción:
¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Analista de datos para integrarse en el equipo de Calidad y mejora continua para responsabilizarse de liderar la gestión del dato en el área de Negocios. Tu objetivo será la creación, diseño y explotación de información analítica con la intención de entender, analizar y proponer medidas que mejoren los principales KPI´s planificados.

Tu día a día consistirá en…

Diseño y ejecución de los principales Dashboards del área de negocios
Realizar los análisis y reportes de rendimiento, saturación, rentabilidad y calidad del servicio
Analizar, detectar y proponer soluciones cuando existan desvíos en los principales indicadores
Diseño y ejecución de estudios operativos ad hoc
Análisis y propuestas de solución con especial foco en calidad y mejora continua
Asignación de recursos entre verticales para balancear cargas de trabajo y/o asegurar tiempos de respuesta
Maximizar el rendimiento de las actuales herramientas de explotación de datos
Participación en proyectos de mejora continua y/o operativa ámbito nacional o internacional.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Que seas una persona con capacidad de análisis de datos y visión “Out of the box”
Que aportes experiencia previa mínima de 3 años en posición similar.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Conocimientos avanzados en Datawarehouse, PowerBI y paquete Office, especialmente en Acces y Excel.

Quienes somos

Nuestros cerca de 55.000 empleados en más de 215 países y territorios son la base de nuestro éxito. Son ellos quienes permiten que las empresas y las comunidades se puedan enfrentar a un mundo de riesgos con confianza. Imagina si pudieras ayudar a las personas a hacer esto en todo el mundo. Les darías confianza y tranquilidad protegiendo lo que más aman. Es un gran desafío, pero contarás con el apoyo de un gran equipo internacional que está dispuesto a ayudarte para que puedas alcanzar tu máximo potencial y así cumplir con nuestras promesas.

Sector: Organización cívica y social
Descripción:
GENERAL CONTEXT
Médecins Sans Frontières is an international independent medical-humanitarian organization, which offers assistance to populations in distress, to victims of natural or man-made disasters and to victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and irrespective of race, religion, creed or political affiliation.
MSF is a civil society initiative that brings together individuals committed to the assistance of other human beings in crisis. As such MSF is by choice an association. Each individual working with MSF does it out of conviction and is ready to uphold the values and principles of MSF.
The MSF movement is built around five operational directorates supported by MSF’s 21 sections, 24 associations and other offices together worldwide. MSF OCBA is one of those directorates. The operations are implemented by field teams and the mission coordination teams; together with the organizational units based in Barcelona, Athens and decentralized in Nairobi, Dakar and Amman. The field operations are guided and supported by 5 Operational Cells, the Emergency Unit and other departments supporting operations, including the Human Resources Department.

POSITION BACKGROUND
In 2020, the Tembo Transformational Investment Programme was award the possibility to scale-up the successful early deployments of a personal learning and development environment (PLDE) – a learning approach and system that helps learners to take control and manage their own learning and, therefore, their own development (known as Tembo).
TEMBO helps MSF staff to solve their immediate needs, and at the same time offer effective means to boost their motivation and develop knowledge and competencies for their professional future, in a versatile way. This is being implemented across the organisation through cultural change and a mindful effort to diminish or eliminate those barriers that prevent our people from learning and developing themselves effectively. TEMBO offers staff a technical solution, strategies and tools to enhance their control over their own learning and development.
The Business Analyst will be part of the Digital Learning Ecosystem (DLE) team which is charged with the improvement and enhancements of the Totara TEMBO. S/he will need to actively interact with other members of the DLE team, reporting to the IT Product Coordinator.

CURRENT STATUS OF THE PROJECT
After almost four years of investments developing the grounds of the project and learning from the initial pilots, the program is in the middle of the phase of adoption and scaling-up the use of TEMBO in all operational centres and their field projects as well as improving the current system’s qualities and features.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
• Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
• Participating in ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
• Review end user’s stories as a key information to be used in the elaboration of the UAT testing scenarios to be
agreed with the local stakeholders.
• Gathering requirements and acceptance criteria and scoping new projects.
• Performing requirements analysis and documenting and communicating the results to the necessary project stakeholder team.
• Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
• Collaborates in the handover process for completed development projects to the E-Learning Services (ELS) team.
• Share and report lessons learned for development projects and maintenance updates.
• Supporting the business blueprint development process with our external service provider, Catalyst.
• Staying up-to-date on the latest trends and IT advancements of Totara and other related technologies and integrations to automate and modernize systems.
• Support in ensuring end-user proficiency with new developments/enhancements.
• Provide advice and consultation to other DLE team members on more difficult and complex assignments and implement ways to reuse requirements across projects.
• May assist in creation of training and system documentation.
• Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
• Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
• Provide advice and recommendations on emerging IT trends.

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA
• University Degree, preferably related to engineering and technology disciplines (Computer Sciences,Telecommunications, Industrial Engineering) or relevant work experience
• At least 3 years of proven experience in technical business analysis in a related industry/organisation.
• Experience in software testing, preparation of documentation and instructions
• Some experience with design and implementation of technical environments using various technologies and languages
• Demonstrated teamwork collaboration in a professional setting with experience leading remote and high performance teams
• Stakeholder management skills
• Quick adaptability to complex structures
• Ability in problem-solving and decision-making
• Oriented to objectives
• Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders at different levels of the organization and with Software providers,
• Ability to manage stress and deal with challenging deadlines
• Strong work ethic coupled with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong written and verbal English

DESIRABLE CRITERIA
• Experience and proficiency with knowledgebase, defect tracking, and requirements related software systems (such as ServiceNow, JIRA, etc.)
• Certifications in business analysis, software systems or project management
• Experience in SDLC methodologies, (such as AGILE), preferred
• Programming knowledge
• Desirable experience working with Learning Management Systems (LMS) development and implementation preferably Moodle or Totara
• Experience in NGOs, Humanitarian and Medical organization is an asset
• Genuine interest in understanding of, and commitment to the humanitarian principles and challenges of MSF.
• French, Spanish and/or Arabic

CONDITIONS
• Position based in any MSF OCBA Hub (Barcelona, MSF-Spain delegation offices, Buenos Aires, Amman, Dakar or Nairobi)
• Contract: fixed-term contract until December 2021 or end of Program TIC 2
• Full-time job
• Annual gross salary: HQ-3B + secondary benefits based on MSF OCBA Reward Policy.
• Practical working conditions while in the field are as per the MSF-OCBA guideline.
• Starting date: ASAP

HOW TO APPLY

Please submit your CV and cover letter:
Closing date: March 21st 2021, 23:59 CET (Central European Time)

Replies will only be sent to short-listed candidates

MSF OCBA is a people-focused humanitarian organization that offers a diverse, collaborative, and inclusive work environment. We believe this approach enhances our work and we are committed to equity in employment. We embrace diverse backgrounds of people working together to exhibit their passion in action for the social mission of MSF.

Médecins Sans Frontieres, as a responsible employer, under article 38 of “Ley de Integración Social del Minusválido de 1982 (LISMI)” invite those persons with a recognized disability and with an interest in the humanitarian area to apply for the above-mentioned position

Descripción:
Descripción de la empresa

Adevinta Spain es una gran familia de marketplaces y seguro que ya nos conoces. ¿Te suenan Fotocasa, habitaclia, InfoJobs, coches.net, motos.net y Milanuncios? Sí, ¿verdad? Eso es porque juntos llegamos cada mes a 18 millones de usuarios activos y somos la mayor empresa digital española. Nuestros usuarios y las más de 1.000 personas que forman la compañía nos convierten en una de las empresas tech de referencia en nuestro mercado.

Como empresa tecnológica, tenemos un ADN digital. Nos encanta desafiar lo establecido y pensamos nuevos modos de hacer las cosas. Trabajamos a través de PEAK Performance, una forma de trabajar basada en OKRs, ágil y con equipos autosuficientes y autoorganizados. Creemos en la cultura del feedback y en un estilo de liderazgo cercano. En definitiva, creamos soluciones cada vez más inteligentes para ofrecer la mejor experiencia a nuestros usuarios y clientes.

Si te gustan los retos y crees tanto como nosotros en el poder del matchmaking... ¡Únete a nuestro equipazo!

Descripción del empleo

El equipo de Data & Insights Cross es un equipo de alto rendimiento con una gran vocación de mejora contínua. En nuestro equipo tendrás la oportunidad de liderar proyectos, de tratar directamente con nuestros stakeholders y de trabajar mano a mano con nuestros Data Engineers.

Si eres una persona proactiva, con ganas de seguir creciendo profesionalmente, y quieres trabajar en un equipo con un muy buen ambiente de trabajo y con una visión 360º de todos nuestros marketplaces, nos gustaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo.

Estas Serán Tus Funciones
Trabajar junto a Producto, Advertising y equipos de Ingenieros para optimizar funcionalidades existentes o crear nuevas.
Hacer análisis para entender mejor el comportamiento de nuestros usuarios y proponer soluciones de manera proactiva.
Acompañar a los diferentes equipos para formarles, asesorarles y eliminar las barreras que existan con el fin de facilitar la autonomía analítica de los equipos.
Tener un papel clave en seguir expandiendo la cultura data-driven en la compañía. Mostrar la importancia de los datos, y explicar conceptos estadísticos a diferentes perfiles.
Generar dashboards que permitan seguir tanto la evolución de los proyectos como para necesidades concretas o puntuales.
Colaborar con los Data Engineers del equipo para mantener y seguir desarrollando productos de datos.
Requisitos

Si eres una persona proactiva, analítica, data-driven, te apasiona el mundo digital, y además necesitas trabajar en equipo.

Y Además Tienes
Experiencia mínimo 5 años en ecommerce o en una empresa online.
Acostumbrada a trabajar con equipos con metodologías Agile.
Experiencia en definición, implementación y medición de producto online.
Advanced user en digital analytics tools (adobe, google analytics).
Habituado a trabajar con BBDD y conocimiento avanzado de SQL.
Conocimientos de Python.
Conocimiento básico de Git y línea de comandos.
Usuario avanzado de herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau o Qlik.
Imprescindible que tengas capacidad de síntesis, sensible a la calidad del dato y orientación al cliente.
Capacidad analítica: saber interpretar los datos para extraer insights relevantes y ser capaz de traducir las preguntas de negocio a necesidades analíticas.
Deseable experiencia en A/B testing.
Deseable conocimientos de Airflow y PDI.
Se valorará muy positivamente el tener conocimientos y experiencia del ecosistema de Publicidad Online.

Información adicional
Trabajar con los mejores profesionales en una empresa referente y que apuesta por la innovación
Oficinas en la zona del 22@ (a 5 minutos de la estación de Glories).
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes.
Jornada intensiva durante los meses de verano y semana santa.
Plan de retribución flexible.
Beneficios sociales y descuentos como Gimnasio y Seguro Médico.
Formación continua (workshops o meetups internos).
Laboratorios una vez al mes para aprender algo nuevo que te interese.
Portátil MacbookPro o Dell & Movil iPhone XR o Samsung S10.
Desayuno y bebidas gratuitas.
Parking subvencionado.

Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Medios de comunicación en línea
Descripción:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

The Analytics teams at Criteo are black box openers. They unveil the magic of the Criteo engine for our local team and for our clients and partners, providing actionable insights and recommendations which help making informed business decisions, to generate more revenue for our clients and for Criteo. Their mission is to transform Big Data into Smart Data.

Working closely with commercial and technical teams in our respective markets, we provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry in order to meet the objectives set by our advertisers, and we focus on delivering improvements that will have immediate and measurable impacts. We get to play with exciting technologies such as Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau and R to grow the portfolio of analyses that we offer to internal and external stakeholders. We are always excited to take initiatives and enjoy the process of starting from an idea, then carrying out a complex data analysis, developing the results with the sales team and presenting it with them to our clients.

The Data Analyst will initiate, develop and lead analytical projects within the Southern Europe Data Science & Analytics team, and help local teams to achieve business targets through actionable insights.

What You will do
Advertiser analysis and optimization: analyzing complex data from multiple sources, youll learn how to detect problems with the performance of our campaigns, and suggest improvements that will have immediate impact
Reporting tools and metrics: youll use your knowledge of our system to develop reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business
Technical studies and analysis: you will work on ad hoc projects that will inform roadmap for the development of the Criteo Product, and run real world tests on new developments
Campaign control and oversight: you have responsibility for managing and maintaining the smooth running of our campaigns. This involves making sure our ad server is correctly set up and updated, and validating the setup of new campaigns.
Who you are
You are fluent in English and Spanish
You have previous experience in problem solving end to end
Ideally, you have good technical skills: SQL, Python, R, etc
You have previous international experience
You are interested in analysis and statistics
You are versatile, dynamic
You have a real interest in online advertising market and the impact of a high-performance technology in this market
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restriction.
Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

#JT-JS

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Descripción:
We like to think of ourselves as unapologetic tech innovators; this means we only build sh*t we can be proud of. Beauty is skin deep, but we know looks aren’t everything. We love a tight… security protocol, low latency and a banging user experience. The future of online entertainment cannot come soon enough – we want to Xcelirate it.

As part of the data team, you will be managing and analyzing website data in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making.

We have grown to a community of diverse nationalities, perspectives and skillsets. You’ll be part of an energetic, motivated team that hails from all corners of the world. We work hard; we play just as hard. Join us for one of the many offsite company gatherings and see for yourself!

Xcelirate is aggressively expanding (size matters, only because we dream big) and looking for bright, fun-loving candidates to join us. If you’ve got what it takes, we’d love to hear from you.

Hola! We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona.

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making
Please note All applications must be submitted in English

Requirements

General Requirements
Writing SQL queries to extract data from MySQL database
Performing quality checks on data
Creating and maintaining dashboards
Support in A/B test design and analysis
Support in ad hoc analysis for business decisions
Support in ad hoc reporting
Automating reporting where possible

Tech Requirements
SQL (4+ years)
Excel (4+ years)
R/python (4+ years) desirable
Google Analytics (4+ years)
Knowledge of statistical analysis, specifically around A/B and multivariate testing
Knowledge of ML applications desirable but not essential
Bachelor of Science (BSc) degree (math, physics, chemistry etc) desirable but not essential


Benefits
Enjoy delicious daily lunches of your choice delivered directly to the office
Stay in tip-top condition with health Insurance without copayment and including dental coverage
Break a sweat with a gym membership which will give you access to over 3,000 gyms, studios and classes throughout Spain
Weekly business-English classes and Spanish lessons are delivered in the office by leading teachers
In-office chair massages every Thursday by our resident massage therapist
An annual learning budget to be used in the way you see best, ensuring you’re always growing
Spotify and Netflix subscriptions to make sure you’re on top of all the latest music and movies
You’ll be equipped with an awesome new MacBook Air & our branded merchandise
Have access to our incredible office based in Barcelona’s WeWork - it’s full of games, chill out areas, snacks and beer on tap
Access to a global network of co-working spaces for when you’re utilising our 30-day remote work allowance
This is of course besides the 23 days of annual leave and all the Barcelona public holidays to use when you please!

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class CRM Data Analyst. This position will be dedicated to our Growth department, and more specifically to our Lifecycle CRM Team.

Do you prefer to read numbers than books? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona - helping to build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you!

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools or using the available ones
Generate tangible insights and metrics about customer behaviours and campaigns
Collaborate with your CRM stakeholders to translate their needs and requirements into insightful reports
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decision
Understanding of CRM journeys is a plus (e.g. onboarding, churn, cross-sell, etc)
Knowledge of various analytical/data mining techniques
A/B test the launch of new campaigns
Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data
Build reports on performance / present insights to non-technical users
Analysis of large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build robust relationships with your next CRM stakeholders


You Have
At least 2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary insights to make the right decisions, with data coming from different sources
Proficient with SQL
Experience with visualization tools like like Looker or Tableau is a must
Amazon Redshift SQL experience is highly desirable
Knowledge in Python or R is desirable
Previous experience in programming is desirable
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field
Proficiency in English is a must


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Flexible compensation - transport, childcare, restaurants etc via our 3rd party company called Cobee
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment
Flexible Time Off


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Descripción:
About Cobblestone

Cobblestone Energy is an independent trading firm. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Although we have experienced very strong growth so far, we are still near the start of our journey. We have ambitions to go a lot further.

Energy in one form or another is fundamental to almost all the world's economic activities. By understanding the demand, supply, and logistics of these commodities, we can better understand the world.

We specialize in the proprietary trading of the short-term wholesale electricity markets across Europe. We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

Over the years we have grown organically. As part of our journey to be the best in all markets we enter, we would like to welcome a Talent Analyst into our HR (Human Resources) team. For this role we are looking for someone who has a passion for numbers and ability to use data to make decisions. HR experience is not mandatory however an interest in HR is important.

Cobblestone Values
Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people


HR Talent Analyst - Dubai, UAE

Starting Remuneration of 35,000 USD per annum, 0% Tax environment.

Are you passionate about finding and placing top talent and you know how to reach and engage candidates on a human level?

As a talent analyst, you will be responsible for executing our strategy for talent acquisition and continuously enhancing our selection process using data and candidate insights. Hiring is a key aspect of our operations and people play the greatest role in our advancement and success. We are looking for an ambitious and highly efficient resources that can deliver results. A professional that can match our hiring process with the best candidates across the world to ensure that we have the most talented individuals for our team.

What We Offer In This Role
A full-time position on our HR team
Opportunity to work closely with the management team.
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
Great compensation and rewards
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
An opportunity to work on new things from scratch and make independent decisions.
Ability to work remotely.


Responsibilities
Determine and meet the company's current staffing needs.
Support in developing talent acquisition strategies and hiring plans.
Provide sound analysis and advice to business heads on the selection process.
Manage all candidate communication.
Prepare hiring dashboards.
Conduct in depth analysis on the selection process and use the insights to make improvements to the process.
Identify and partner with recruitment agencies and job sites.
Build strategic tie ups with reputed colleges for campus placement.
Manage job postings on social media.
Meet agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for hiring.
Lead employment branding initiatives.
Perform sourcing to fill open positions and anticipate future needs.
Plan and ensure recruitment and selection processes (interviews, screening calls etc.) are conducted on time.
Take steps to ensure a positive candidate experience.
Organize and/or attend career fairs, assessment centres or other events.
Manage other HR activities as required.


Requirements
Strong numerical and research skills.
Passion for data analysis.
Proficient in the use of social media and job boards.
Willingness to understand the duties and competencies of different roles.
Excellent communicator.
Strong EQ skills.
Good Organization and reporting skills.
A passion for building talented teams.
Resilience and a determination to succeed.
Independent thinkers with growth mindset.
Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly.
Strong sense of integrity.
Personal values that match our company values.


Desirable Qualities
1-2 years of experience in recruiting and talent acquisition.
Experience in full cycle recruiting and sourcing.
A passion for developing employer branding.
Proficient in the use of social media.
Experience in data processing, excel, SQL, databases.
Working knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and databases


Job Location:

The role will be based in our Corporate office in Dubai.

Office Location:

Jumeirah Business Centre 2, Cluster V, Jumeirah Lake Towers, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Puesto ofertado: Security Protections & Insights - Senior Product Manager
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
Elastic is a free and open search company that powers enterprise search, observability, and security solutions built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real-time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Barclays, Cisco, eBay, Fairfax, ING, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe. Learn more at elastic.co.

Elastic is looking for an outstanding product mind to join the Elastic Security product team and help define the future of security solutions. Elastic Security is a new kind of security solution that is combining SIEM and host based security use cases to protect the world’s data from attack. As a Senior Product Manager on our team, your job will be to define and help the team execute the features needed to deliver world-class pre-built protections and insights into our unified security solution.

What you will be doing:

Build and evolve insights capabilities to deliver a differentiated analyst experience by leveraging product analytics and telemetry from protection/detection performance and Elastic security product usage.
Define roadmap and maintain prioritized feature backlog to derive actionable information about protection/detection performance and security product usage.
Work closely with data scientists, data engineers and security researchers to address security analyst persona challenges by identifying untapped potential in event data.
Work closely with other PM’s to build thought leadership on utilizing insights and recommendations to drive customer experiences of the future.
Design, maintain and own library of KPIs to reflect Elastic Security product usage and protection results.
Beyond product development, support Sales and Product Marketing efforts related to the Security solution, including competitive analysis, marketing collateral, and demand generation activities.

What you bring along:

5+ years experience as Product Manager of cybersecurity products.
Experience working closely with data scientists and data engineers to deliver production grade capabilities.
Knowledgeable in modern ingest pipelines, ETL processes, statistical analysis techniques and data visualizations.
Outstanding spoken and written communication skills.
Empathy for customer challenges and needs, turning them into opportunities in the short and long-term.

Additional Information - We Take Care of Our People

As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.

Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
Generous number of vacation days each year
Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)
Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love
Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is committed to diversity as well as inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to the principles of affirmative action. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. If you require any reasonable accessibility support, please email candidate_accessibility@elastic.co.
