Sector: Industria farmacéutica
Funciones laborales: Análisis Tecnología de la información Ingeniería
Descripción:
Job Description

15 Petabyte of data hosted, 49 countries supported, 15000 servers and thousands of devices to connect locations and businesses. Information is clearly one of Novartis` most valuable asset. In ISRM (Information Security and Risk Management), we implement and maintain solutions that secure the Novartis environment, protect our data and provide the necessary control framework to enable compliance with the various regulations associated with the healthcare industry.

105,000 outstanding individuals work with Novartis all with different needs and aspirations. Aligned to a single inspirational purpose to reimagine medicine for millions of patients across the world.

Join us and directly contribute to Novartis’ vision to Reimagine Medicine.

Your key responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Effectively investigate to identify root cause, including attack vector, exploitation, and other techniques utilized to bypass security controls
Accurately diagnose impact, damage, and mitigation techniques needed to restore business operations and minimize reoccurrence
Identify technology and process gaps that affect CSOC services; develop solutions and make recommendations for continuous improvement
Provide oversight and support for first level monitoring and triage to ensure effective operations and mitigation of lower impact incidents
Good cultural orientation and strong influencer of information risk management, information security, IT security, to be embedded across IT, OT and Medical Technologies


Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:
Experience in Incident Response / Computer Forensics / CSOC team / Threat Hunting or related fields
Experienced IT administration with broad and in-depth technical, analytical and conceptual skills
Experience in reporting to and communicating with senior level management (with and without IT background, with and without in depth risk management background) on incident response topics
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills; interpersonal and collaborative skills; and the ability to communicate information risk-related and incident response concepts to technical as well as nontechnical audiences
Excellent understanding and knowledge of general IT infrastructure technology and systems
Proven experience to initiate and manage projects that will affect CSOC services and technologies
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and exude the appropriate level of judgment and maturity


Desirable requirements:
Experience with security incident monitoring and response related to medical devices / pharmaceutical industry
Good mediation and facilitation skills


Why consider Novartis?

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?
We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Who we are: We are a workforce on-demand company that heavily relies on tech. We integrate the complete process of selecting, hiring, and managing employees, being the first in digitizing all the steps, introducing Artificial Intelligence solutions in multiple phases, obtaining faster and higher-quality service for our clients, and great satisfaction and loyalty for our workers.
Our Impact on Society: Our vision is to create a long-term job security condition for our workers while providing flexible solutions to our clients. We can do this by concatenating different short-term contracts and minimizing–or completely removing–their unemployed time. We want to remove the need for finding a job ever again. 
Data-Driven: Being the owner of the entire hiring funnel, workforce management, and working experience, give us very unique data that we transform into powerful knowledge to make better decisions, improve job-candidate matches, estimate quality and affinity, and share performance feedback with our workers and clients. We are the most advanced workforce on-demand company thanks to our data and the way we use it.
Great Challenges for the Data Team: Integrating very different AI solutions to improve the experience for both our workers and employers (Shift Optimization, Machine Learning algorithms, Quality Score Estimations, Document recognition, etc.), relying on a very powerful ETL that permits endless automatizations while keeping the focus on data quality.
Growth Overview: An annual growth of 170%, available in multiple countries: the UK, Spain, Germany, Sweden, Mexico, Colombia, France, and more are coming. HQ in Madrid with a second big presence in Barcelona and some remote workers in the UK, The Netherlands, and the USA. And finally, some of our great clients are Amazon, XPOLogistics, Cabify, Santander, Just Eat, etc. 

Join us in one of the hottest startups in Spain, breaking into a new market worldwide, learning and contributing with your expertise in innovating the entire job market!
 Be the main referent of our Python code, help to raise the quality bar of any Python code we use. 

We use Airflow as our ETL, a very powerful Python framework that allows us to break down any complex problem/process into smaller ones. Each component can be implemented directly in Python, or in any other language since they could be docker images executed in ECS instances. 

The main priority is a senior profile with extremely solid Python skills, previous experience with Data/ETL is nice-to-have but it is not mandatory.

Overall, we can resume the main responsibilities as follow:
Raise the level of our Python good practices, code structure, cleaning, and testing.
Design and implement high-quality and performant Python code within our powerful ETL.
Automate external integrations with our Data Lake and Data Warehouse.
Automate complex solutions that might require to train, build, and deploy a series of Machine Learning algorithms (no previous experience with ML required). 
 In addition, we are looking for a senior profile that could be interested in:
Mentor mid- and junior- Python Engineer: given the great impact of our ETL on the entire company, we want to grow a team dedicated to it, capable of improving, maintaining, and boosting it even further.
Sharing her/his knowledge inside and outside Jobandtalent, raising the quality standards of the entire team with the aim of growing together.
Contributing to Open Source projects: we are using different Open Source frameworks and libraries, and one of our wishes would be to contribute to some of those projects, dedicating part of our time when possible. 

Requirements and Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Engineering, Stats, or Quantitative field.
4+ years of proven experience programming in Python with production-ready code (not scripting code).
Extremely skilled programmer (e.g., unittest, production/staging experience).
Experience with
Different kinds of standard databases (e.g., RDBMS, NoSQL).
Container development with Docker or Kubernetes.
The leadership of projects, services, or products. 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management, as well as the business and technical communities.
(Nice to have) Previous experience with
ETL, data pre-processing, or data analysis.
Supervising junior and mid-level developers.
Experience with Big-data frameworks and OLAP DBs 
Stream processing framework (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka, Spark, Flink).
A valid work permit to be employed in Spain.
Fluent in English is a must.

Examples of Projects and Responsibilities
You receive a Jupyter Notebook made by one of our Data Analysts which contained a prototype of a data processing pipeline that generate very important data for our stakeholder. The Data Analyst has previously confirmed the data is corrected, but the code is definitely not ready for production. You need to understand it, define which is the best way to automate it (Airflow Python DAG, using Spark, external tools, etc.), and start the implementation by yourself or together with other team members.
The previous example works in a similar way for Data Scientists when they come requesting help with automation about how to train a Machine Learning model that we want to re-evaluate on a weekly basis. Ideally, we want the results of the evaluation to be automatically computed and shared via a Slack channel, so we can quickly review them and decide if the model can be moved to production.
We are expecting you to raise the quality bar of our code: helping your team members understanding which is the best way to structure the code for a specific problem, defining better protocols, introducing metrics when they are missing, improve the code performance, etc.

Offer in Short
Great ownership of the projects with a direct impact on the product.
Salary in the 55-70k range (wide range, depending on experience).
Transparent Equity package.
Discount on Health insurance.
A yearly budget for Conferences/meetup/self-learning.
Working in an international and multidisciplinary team 
You will be working in the Data Science team (read the last blog posts), together with Full-stack Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts.

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.
Backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.
Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.
As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.
Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving the understanding of our customers (supply & demand).
As part of this role, you’ll study user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.
You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.
As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics across the customer journey, from acquisition to activation, engagement and retention
Increase our customer knowledge through applied analytics, clustering and segmentation
Quantify the impact of the initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, sharing knowledge and insights across the organization
Design, execute, and evaluate experiments on a global scale (CRM, copy, etc.)
Iterate on our growth strategy (attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modeling, etc.)
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behavior and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards

What We Are Looking For
2-3 years' experience as an in-house Data Scientist, Data Analyst or a similar role.
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Previous experience in some of the following Growth techniques: attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modelling
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must

Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)

What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance

Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We’re obsessed with our customer’s problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.

Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion
Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Descripción:
The Company.

Our Client is an international Shared Service Center based in Barcelona. They provide outstanding services for companies all over the world. They aim to create opportunities to reach the full potential of people.

Tasks
The Job.

As a Business Analyst your Responsibilities will be to:

– Collaborate with the Product Owner and Solution Architect, gathering detailed business requirements and developing user stories – Write and document user stories that are clear, concise and easy-to-understand for the business and Global Process Owners, while sufficiently comprehensive, structured and technically-oriented to be translated into technical solutions by the development team – Communicate efficiently and work together within a multi-stream program, fostering the open and collaborative culture and act as a bridge between the different streams – Capture the process impact and functional impact of each sprint, optimizing the BA inputs for functional test preparation and execution – Support User Acceptance Testing; providing key inputs to UAT scripts as well as executing part of the UAT – Provide support to end users during UAT sessions

Requirements

Your Profile.

– You have at least 3 to 5 years of experience as a business analyst or assuming Business analysis responsibility as part of your role – You have previous successful experience in the consultancy sector in a customer facing role – You have experience with salesforce – You speak fluently English and another EU languages – You are familiar with Agile methodology – You are analytical, creative and curious mind – You have excellent organization skills and the ability to work under pressure & manage deadlines

Benefits

The Offer.

– Temporary contract of 12 months with the possibility to stay regarding your performance – Salary based on your level of experience + additional benefits (meal vouchers, life insurance, pension plan, etc.) – Career opportunities – International and multicultural environment – A company with a worldwide reputation – Start date: ASAP

Descripción:
Job purpose

Tech Data is at the forefront of enabling the IT channel transformation in how cloud is bought and sold in the small, medium and enterprise sized business segments. As a Business Analyst you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our cloud platforms strategy by identifying, vetting, and addressing business needs across Tech Data regions and empowering stakeholders by delivering documentation, demonstrations and training.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Capture, triage and document business needs by connecting with business stakeholders across regions.
Understand new business needs, quantify ROI and manage prioritization across multiple stakeholder requests.
Provide feedback on feature design during grooming, development and post-deployment.
Document functionality for business audiences, including Tech Data vendors and partners.
Create training material and deliver training sessions on new functionalities
Define UAT Test scenarios to be executed during Change Management activities and support business teams during UATs.
Support Product Marketing and Technical Writers with communications around new features.
Provide pre-sales support along with platform and vendor specialists. This including platform presentations to large partners and vendors in front of C-level audiences.

What You Will Need To Succeed In This Role
Experience and knowledge of software design methodologies and tools.
Excellent communication skills, with emphasis on written communications.
Able to work in a fast-paced and multi-tasking environment.
Comfortable working in an international, results driven organisation.
Ability to work effectively at all levels in an organization.
Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently.
Strategic and analytical skills.
Experience with the IT software distribution channel a plus (including large ISVs such as Microsoft, AWS, IBM, etc.)
Experience in e-commerce a plus.
Project management experience a plus.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree preferred
3+ years of similar experience in a multinational environment.

Working Conditions
Occasional travel within EU and US.
Mostly a remote working position. 100% Remote working at this stage due to Covid.
The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. Other duties may be assigned as needed.

Cultural Competency Requirements:
Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

Descripción:
Are you a specialist in data analysis with extensive experience in collecting, transforming and analyzing data as well as communicating findings across the organization?

In this role, you’ll be… Pivotal in the execution of a three years roadmap to achieve a more preventive, customer focused and data driven Quality approach at Markem-Imaje. This role will specifically focus on Data Analytics and statistical analysis related to Product, Service, Process quality and performance and will be influential in improving those. This position is reporting directly to the Global Quality Shared Services Manager.
You’ll have an opportunity to… work in a cross-functional environment, partnering closely on all levels of the organization to ultimately improve the quality and performance of our products, services and processes using your data analysis, machine learning-based tools and IT skills.
You should possess… a passion for leveraging data to drive decision making across the business and be a forward-thinking individual to look beyond the immediate.

Great package including bonus, career growth and great benefits.

Principal Activities / Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes. Your main responsibilities will include:
•Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
•Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
•Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
•Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
•Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.

Experience & General Skills:   
•Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role including experience as Data analyst.
•Bachelor’s degree in business, Science or Engineering/University degree in Data Analysis.
•Mastering programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
•Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
•Fluent in written and spoken English.
•Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
•SAP CS/SD/MM and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.
•Independent, quick learner with a very structured approach.

Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Ingeniería industrial o mecánica
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Sofia Puigtió 2º
Talent Acquisition @Vistaprint - Hiring dreamers, designers and doers
Enviar mensaje InMail
Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do

Are you inquisitive by nature with passion about data and technology? You will be part of the creation of Vistaprint’s time-series analysis and forecasting capability! You will explore and visualize data, making recommendations and building scalable data products that help Vistaprint become more data-driven in its planning processes!
Collaborate in a complementary team (e.g. Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) on analyses, bringing forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into business drivers: Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding.
Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to help us better understand customer behavior and give to product-level demand forecasting: Data Analysis and Modeling.
Design and execute experiments to optimize our forecasting data products for accuracy and usefulness.
Focus on delivering customer value early and often in a fast-paced and agile environment.

Your Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.
Experience with SQL or with another programming languages to support analytics, such as Python or R.
Sophisticated level with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques that are driven to find relevant patterns and trends in the data.
Experience with data modelling, visualization and data exploration tools such as Tableau or Looker, is a plus. And previous experience with time-series or forecasting analysis is desirable.
Minimum 3 years working in an analytics environment.

Why You'll Love Working Here

Being at Vistaprint means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey - and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.

Remote First-Culture

In 2020, Vistaprint adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers everyone to be their best and most brilliant self. Vistaprint also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so or believe in office working will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 20 US States as well as several countries in Europe: Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

Sector: Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones Marketing y publicidad
Descripción:
We are looking for a proactive and determined person to join Digital’s Agency as a Digital Team Lead in Analytics team. You will be the subject matter expert of Digital Analytics in the company and will help our clients understand their digital business using data. You will work with different platforms and tools to find areas for improvement in our clients’ digital assets and will make proposals to increase their performance.

As a Digital Team Lead Analyst you will:

Serve as the subject matter expert in Digital Analytics.
Work to design the digital measurement solutions according to business requirements from clients.
Find insights and turn them into actionable ideas in order to improve the performance of our clients’ digital assets.
Generate data-driven hypotheses, to be tested in A/B and/or multivariate experiments.
Work closely with other Digital Analytics colleagues, as well as with specialists in areas such as UI, UX, creative, development, SEO or Paid Acquisition.
Overview the implementation, configuration and validation of tag management and analytics tools.
Identify business opportunities and prepare ad hoc proposals to potential clients.
Provide training, both internally and to clients.

We’re definitely looking for you if you have:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Statistics or Engineering.
Experience of minimum 3 years in Digital Analytics and Marketing projects, preferably from an agency perspective. Having developed project management tasks in the past is a strong plus.
Strong knowledge of Digital Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Hotjar, CrazyEgg, Adobe Analytics, Matomo, Mixpanel, Google Tag Manager…).
Strong knowledge of Excel and comfortability working with large datasets.
Strong knowledge of testing and personalization tools (Optimize, Optimizely, VWO…).
Knowledge of reporting tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI…).
Project management skills, proactivity and autonomy.

Descripción:
At Domestika we are looking for a Lead Product Data Analyst.

We are looking for an experienced Lead Product Data Analyst to help us shape our growing Product Analytics team. You would be part of a brand new adventure at Domestika. This role will put you in a position to bring a positive impact from day 1. We are looking for a candidate that is experienced in a user experience centric product focused. In addition to the conversion of the sale experience, we are strong believers that our Learning Experience at Domestika is key for our success.

You will work directly with all Product Managers, our Directors of Product, and will report to our Director of Data.

We are building a dedicated team that will allow us to support and guide all our Product teams. This team will work hand in hand with stakeholders to create a direct impact on insights that influence the way we build our e-learning platform. We want to embrace everything Data has to offer, finding insights, optimizing our processes and even rethinking them.

As our Lead Product Data Analyst, you will build and lead a team of Data Analysts that matches our needs and product strategy. You will mentor the analysts and create the environment to set the team for success. You will play a key role in our organization with an expectation of proactivity.

Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.

Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.

What does a Lead Product Data Analyst do at Domestika?
Drive for actionable insight gathering, and evangelize a data-driven product culture.
Partner with Domestika’s product leadership in building its product strategy and roadmap.
Work with our product teams in all stages of the product life cycle, from ideation to performance analysis.
Mentor the product analytics team members and set them up for success.
Hire and nurture our Product Data Analysis team.
Support the teams in designing A/B tests and analyzing their results.
Oversee, review and optimize our decisional analytical framework.
Identify opportunities for data enhancement.
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
Actively contribute to our User tracking framework definition and implementation.
Coordinate with other Lead Data Analysts to create synergies between teams.

Requirements
6+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in a B2C company, preferably consumer apps.
3+ years leading a Product focused team of Data Analysts covering a wide range of product topics.
Analytical mindset.
Ability to read and write complex SQL.
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.
Preferably, a Math/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.
Based within European time zone.
English required at Full professional proficiency.

Would Be a Plus
Familiarity with business intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics, etc.
Experience in designing events and tagging for analytics.
Ability to work independently, take the initiative and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?
Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
Balanced work life with a Remote First approach.
A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
An honest salary according to your experience and profile.

Descripción:
The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee.
This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.
With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a billion Euro turnover as of 2018.
Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.
Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible you eager to learn?Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly.
Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.
In 2018 we launched- the IT community of Veepee.
Our teams are widely distributed within the offices in Paris, Lyon, Nantes, Nice, Barcelona, Brussels, Warsaw, Amsterdam and Tel-Aviv.
Veepee is currently in a context of convergence of the three main IS of vente-privee, privalia and vente-exclusive.
As a Business & Data Analyst in vpTech you will be a part of the Finance Tribe, to develop the new B2C billing factory and ensure the legacy one keeps on working properly.
You will be in contact with: - business key users of Finance around EU to collect group and local requirements and use cases, provide data extracted for different systems, analyse issues and fix data - developers (based in France) to provide user stories and to test the deliverables Your main challenge will be to understand the current model, the group products organisation and their interactions to have a strong understanding about the context and be able to define and execute the roadmap of the product in coordination with the Product requirements:

2 years of experience as a business analyst, Proxy Product Owner, project manager or developer
Redactional and organisational skills (backlog management, specifications, tickets creation, minutes of meetings, flow charts process designs)
Good knowledge of SQL (SQL Server, PostGreSQL) and reporting tools (SSRS)
To have a strong interest for analysis, identification of anomalies and research of solutions
Ability to challenge and find different ways to bring value to business areas
Proactive, organized and team player: you know how to make things happen and you have convictions
Strong interest for business flows, products and new technologies
Passionate and result oriented
Good english level - speaking and writing

Would Be a Plus

Knowledge of Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
Accountancy basic knowledges (in particular in Account Receivables)
Background on Finance Tools
Knowledge of noSQL db (ElasticSearch)
Knowledge of product management and agile method
What we offer: Dynamic and creative environment within international teams The variety of self-education courses on our e-learning platform The participation in meetups and conferences locally and internationally Up to 2-3 days remote per week (now we are working remotely) Video games, beer and quizz parties with colleagues Offices in Barcelona Located in Poblenou @22 Flexible retribution package (including Medical Insurance) Autonomy is a key to success in .
We are boosting the innovation at every step of product development inside Veepee.
In order to reach the group goals in the best and the most efficient way, we stick to the feature team-based structure.
Hence, most of our teams are autonomous and self-managed when it comes to choosing the tech stack and determining the road map.
So, if you are driven by the quality and teamwork, if you want to make an impact, to learn and share knowledge, to be a part of the fast-paced digital environment, check out our tech stack below ***** and start your journey.

Descripción:
Company Description

Adevinta is a global digital player, the biggest marketplace specialist in Europe. We are a family of local brands – because we believe all great marketplaces are local. Our +30 online marketplaces serve people where they live, acknowledging what’s special about every culture and every place, helping local economies to grow sustainably.

We want to make a positive change in the world by helping everyone and everything find new purpose. We believe every house can be a home, every person has a role to play, and every object can live a second life

With leading generalist marketplaces across Europe, exciting growth companies in Latin America and Eastern Europe a, plus technology hubs in Barcelona and Paris, our teams balance local insights with a global scale to develop innovative digital products and services.

Job Description

The Trust & Transactions tribe will play an instrumental role in supporting marketplaces in our joint mission.

Our Product Portfolio Consists Of Three Strong Products

We will achieve this by working closely with marketplaces to solve their main problems within these domains.
Messaging: Our in-app chat product
Serenity: Our fraud prevention application
Trust: Our product aimed at increasing the trust between buyers and sellers

Responsiblities

You will lead the Insights team formed of 3 data analysts responsible for

We are looking for a proactive lead of Product Data Analytics to help us take Trust and Transactions to the next level.
Measuring the impact of the Trust and Transactions products
Defining experiments and analysing the results and make recommendations
Prepare analysis and reports to help the product teams prioritise improvements
Produce user and product insights to identify opportunities to increase the impact of Trust and Transactions.

Key Responsibilities
Lead the insights team, coach them and help them develop their careers
Provide technical guidance to the data analysts to help them develop their analytical skills and produce sophisticated reports efficiently
Produce hands-on detailed reports to support the business
Help define complex A/B tests to prove product hypotheses
Define and implement processes and best practices that help the team scale up the quantitative insights and data analysis that they produce
Work with your product, engineering and UX colleagues to better understand how data analysis can help them be more effective in their roles
Work with Marketplaces counterparts to understand the end-to-end business impact and identify any gaps
Work with other tribes like Data and Privacy to ensure that the team needs are covered from a infrastructure and tooling perspective
Help the leadership team of Trust and Transactions make business decisions of investment and prioritisation based on data
Be an ambassador of a data driven culture, helping non-data roles to become more self sufficient when analysing data

Technical Skills

Qualifications
Deep knowledge of statistical methods
Advanced knowledge of Python/Scala/R
Experience with Jupyter Notebook
Deep knowledge of SQL
Experience with Data Visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, Looker, etc.
Experience with experimentation and AB testing
Experience with Agile methodologies
Strong understanding of performance, scalability, and implementation constraints.
You are constantly up to date with the latest data standards and practices
Proactive and can do attitude to overcome challenges and persevere, challenge the status quo and drive continuous improvements
You are a strong team player that believes that the success of the group brings more value than the individual success
You are curious, proactive, and genuinely interested in helping our business partners being successful and delivering value to our end users
Strong stakeholder management skills, used to collaborate in big and complex environments, you are empathetic, diligent and organized.
Having great communication skills, verbal and written in English, as you will be an ambassador of our tribe and of a data driven culture
PLUS
Experience in e-commerce data analysis
Experience in designing events and tagging for analytics
Understanding of Machine Learning algorithms
Experience with Apache Spark
Experience with AWS cloud platform

Additional Information

We can offer you
Play a critical part in defining the marketplace products of tomorrow.
A competitive salary plus benefits package.
Working together with a diverse, international, and highly qualified team at Adevinta.
Friendly company culture where we encourage ourselves and others to try new things, learn and succeed.
Regular learning and training opportunities.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

With over 250 million monthly active users under our belt, global teams and local expertise, we've got a winning combination, so why not take the first step and apply now!

Descripción:
Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.
Maintain communication with ELIXIR platforms, communities, and leadership; participate in their regular meetings and discussions.
Contribute to supervise junior members at the INB/ELIXIR-ES units.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 2 years of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Vast experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on workflow managers such as Galaxy, Nextflow or similar.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to represent the team at international project meetings.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Descripción:
We are papernest

We have a dream a world without paperwork. A world where administration phobics like us live finally protected from the anguish of the form filling and surcharges for late payments.

On the other hand, we will not lie to you, there is much work to do. That’s why we are looking for committed, creative, and enthusiastic people like you.

Since 2015, we’ve been working hard. In France there are 4+ million moves per year, and 76% of people feel stressed about moving - this is the big problem we decided to solve. As a result, we have created the only platform that allows you to transfer all your contracts when you move, 100% free, 100% online. Celebrating our fifth anniversary, we have more than 650+ employees, based in Paris and Barcelona; and we have been serving over 500,000 users in France, Spain, UK and Italy.

We think big bubbling ideas all around the world towards a future where our entire administrative life is as simple as a single click.

As a Workforce Management Team Leader you’ll have a central position in our operational delivery being responsible for producing accurate forecasts and administering our ambitious capacity plan. You’ll have to convey the papernest mindset and ambition to your team, and deliver scheduling for more than 600 hundreds employees.

In order to do so you’ll have to coordinate forecasts, scheduling, and real time monitoring.
Deploy our operational roadmap. You’ll be responsible for meeting our QoS objectives, and designing our international (5 countries) planning strategy.
Define agent requirements according to the levels of service committed through the realization of different forecasting and planning scenarios. Deliver a clear recruitment plan with talent acquisition and operational managers.
Manage WFM Analytics and reporting, and monitor on an intraday and daily basis our forecasts assumptions. You’ll have to monitor very closely any KPIs that impact our QoS and Productivity. Take any corrective action that is needed in case of a deviation.
Feed and monitor our external partners with forecasts and objectives. You’ll be the owner of the relationship with their WFM Team, and for reviewing with them any deviation.
Responsible for scheduling 500 agents, you can understand and take in hand very quickly our current scheduling tool and make it fit perfectly with our needs.
Responsible for all the WFM communications we might need to send (Holidays, Bank Holidays…), you’ll have to make sure that all production decisions that might impact staffing are duly reported to the WFM team.
Manage and structure WFM Team. Coordinate and streamline communication with operational and marketing teams.
Follow-up with papernest growth and new challenges coming in next few months + 200 employees to schedule, a new WFM tool to deploy and integrate into our current infrastructure and structure WFM Team !


Requirements
At least 5 years of experience in WFM
A managerial experience
Perfect English speaking is compulsory, French Speaking is a plus
KPI’s & data-driven mindset
Excellent mastering of Excel / Gsheet
Great sense of communication
Good knowledge of spanish labor legislation


Benefits

Why papernest?
You will be working with talented, smart, and great people
You will have high responsibility and autonomy to make as much impact as you can imagine
You will be working in a fast-growing and internationally expanding company with great opportunities for you to step up in your career
You will work in a meritocracy with test-and-learn and fear-nothing attitude where truths rule and politics have no space
And not mention our much loved monthly theme paper-party and other events


Your manager

You will be managed by Pauline, our Operations Data Analyst. As comfortable on a football field as on a dataset, Pauline knows how to juggle operational urgency and analytical distance. For more than 2 years in papernest, the database holds no more secrets for her, and she will know how to sharpen your analytical mind and make you a SQL champion!

Selection process
First call with the recruitment team
An Excel test
Interview with Pauline (Your future manager)
Interview with Clément (Barcelona site director)
Interview with Quentin (Head of Operations)


If this challenge is yours, we look forward to meeting you!

Descripción de la empresa

Adevinta Spain es una gran familia de marketplaces y seguro que ya nos conoces. ¿Te suenan Fotocasa, habitaclia, InfoJobs, coches.net , motos.net y Milanuncios? Sí, ¿verdad? Eso es porque juntos llegamos cada mes a 18 millones de usuarios activos y somos la mayor empresa digital española. Nuestros usuarios y las más de 1.000 personas que forman la compañía nos convierten en una de las empresas tech de referencia en nuestro mercado.

Como empresa tecnológica, tenemos un ADN digital. Nos encanta desafiar lo establecido y pensamos nuevos modos de hacer las cosas. Trabajamos a través de PEAK Performance, una forma de trabajar basada en OKRs, ágil y con equipos autosuficientes y autoorganizados. Creemos en la cultura del feedback y en un estilo de liderazgo cercano. En definitiva, creamos soluciones cada vez más inteligentes para ofrecer la mejor experiencia a nuestros usuarios y clientes.

Si te gustan los retos y crees tanto como nosotros en el poder del matchmaking... ¡Únete a nuestro equipazo!

Descripción del empleo

El equipo de Data & Insights Cross es un equipo de alto rendimiento con una gran vocación de mejora contínua. En nuestro equipo tendrás la oportunidad de liderar proyectos, de tratar directamente con nuestros stakeholders y de trabajar mano a mano con nuestros Data Engineers.

Si eres una persona proactiva, con ganas de seguir creciendo profesionalmente, y quieres trabajar en un equipo con un muy buen ambiente de trabajo y con una visión 360º de todos nuestros marketplaces, nos gustaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo.

Estas Serán Tus Funciones
Trabajar junto a Producto, Advertising y equipos de Ingenieros para optimizar funcionalidades existentes o crear nuevas.
Hacer análisis para entender mejor el comportamiento de nuestros usuarios y proponer soluciones de manera proactiva.
Acompañar a los diferentes equipos para formarles, asesorarles y eliminar las barreras que existan con el fin de facilitar la autonomía analítica de los equipos.
Tener un papel clave en seguir expandiendo la cultura data-driven en la compañía. Mostrar la importancia de los datos, y explicar conceptos estadísticos a diferentes perfiles.
Generar dashboards que permitan seguir tanto la evolución de los proyectos como para necesidades concretas o puntuales.
Colaborar con los Data Engineers del equipo para mantener y seguir desarrollando productos de datos.

Requisitos

Si eres una persona proactiva, analítica, data-driven, te apasiona el mundo digital, y además necesitas trabajar en equipo.

Y Además Tienes
Experiencia mínimo 5 años en ecommerce o en una empresa online.
Acostumbrada a trabajar con equipos con metodologías Agile.
Experiencia en definición, implementación y medición de producto online.
Advanced user en digital analytics tools (adobe, google analytics).
Habituado a trabajar con BBDD y conocimiento avanzado de SQL.
Conocimientos de Python.
Conocimiento básico de Git y línea de comandos.
Usuario avanzado de herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau o Qlik.
Imprescindible que tengas capacidad de síntesis, sensible a la calidad del dato y orientación al cliente.
Capacidad analítica: saber interpretar los datos para extraer insights relevantes y ser capaz de traducir las preguntas de negocio a necesidades analíticas.
Deseable experiencia en A/B testing.
Deseable conocimientos de Airflow y PDI.
Se valorará muy positivamente el tener conocimientos y experiencia del ecosistema de Publicidad Online.

Información adicional
Trabajar con los mejores profesionales en una empresa referente y que apuesta por la innovación
Oficinas en la zona del 22@ (a 5 minutos de la estación de Glories).
Flexibilidad horaria y jornada intensiva los viernes.
Jornada intensiva durante los meses de verano y semana santa.
Plan de retribución flexible.
Beneficios sociales y descuentos como Gimnasio y Seguro Médico.
Formación continua (workshops o meetups internos).
Laboratorios una vez al mes para aprender algo nuevo que te interese.
Portátil MacbookPro o Dell & Movil iPhone XR o Samsung S10.

Descripción:
Description

We’re working to become the most customer-centric company on Earth. As we continue to open up more opportunities, we are seeking a savvy, motivated Graduate Business Analyst to join our world-class Fulfilment & Operations network. You’ll function as a trusted Business Analyst, Business partner and advisor within the Finance team for the Spain fulfilment network.

About This Key Role

In this role you’ll do far more than manage spreadsheets. Our ideal Business Analyst doesn’t just manage our books and make our ends meet; they help drive the company forward. So while one aspect of this role is about understanding our numbers and budgets, equal aspects of the position require the big vision and drive of an ambitious Business Analyst. You’ll make huge impact, not just on the bottom line performance of the Spain fulfilment network, but on the overall customer experience.

You’ll employ every facet of finance data mining to ensure your partners, colleagues and leaders have the most up to date, reliable information at hand, helping them make the best possible financial decisions they can.

You’ll Be Responsible For
Managing and participating in finance and accounting activities
Implementing policies and programmes through the fulfilment network that guide Operations towards maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability
Creating a “learn by doing” environment, by engaging with the on-the-floor Associates and managers, and cross-site
Working with data source providers and technology teams, ensuring that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely
Standardize reporting processes and reports in order to achieve best in class quality in the fulfilment network

Basic Qualifications
Recent graduate from a degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering or other related discipline
Fluent in Spanish and English (verbal and written)
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel (e.g. pivot tables, macros, VBA, etc.)
Experience of working with large-scale data mining and reporting tools (e.g. SQL, MS Access, Essbase and/or Cognos), alongside other financial systems (e.g. Oracle, SAP, Lawson, JD Edwards)
Ability to employ root cause analysis to identify issues quickly, while uncovering their causes
Demonstrable analytical acumen in delivering data interpretation of business impact and results
Preferred Qualifications
Advanced problem solving and root cause analysis ability, combined with confident communication skills for conveying your conclusions
Highly analytical and detail-oriented, and bring a strong sense of business acumen
Ability to manage and prioritize your workload in a fast-paced, high-growth, and occasionally ambiguous environment
Previous experience in positions requiring analysis and reporting of finance results
Proven expertise in standardization and upgrades of existing finance processes and reporting deliverables
Previous experience in a manufacturing, distribution centre or logistics environment is a strong plus
Willingness to relocate for potential advancement opportunities
We’re looking forward to receiving your application, preferably in English.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Amazon takes your personal data protection seriously and respects EU and local data protection laws. Unless you express otherwise, by submitting your CV you authorize the hiring Amazon company to store your personal data in the electronic database maintained by Amazon Corporate LLC. in the USA or one of its affiliates for the purpose of assessing your suitability for this and future job vacancies and to pursue your recruiting process.

If at any time you want your personal data to be deleted, you simply need to notify the hiring Amazon company. Amazon will not share your personal data with any third party without your prior consent. As part of your interview process with Amazon you may be asked to authorize the hiring Amazon company to separately verify your application data and personal background through a third party service provider.

Descripción:
TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000’s and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 150+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 32 nationalities

At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

We are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to join our Analytics Department. As you establish a Marketing Analytics role, you will play a key role in the development of our acquisition channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google, Youtube, Search, Shopping Ads, Display, Affiliates etc.

Your experience with these channels will help you analyze the data, automate critical processes, and improve campaign performance.

Using your strong technical background, you will work directly with the marketing and tech teams on the implementations of various tracking systems, as well as solutions to automate and manage at large-scale advertising campaigns through APIs, and with the help of Data Science, you will build advanced models for multi-touch attribution or retargeting.

Responsibilities
Owning and developing tracking of the full customer journey across all current and future marketing platforms. Taking care of data quality, governance, integrations and enhancements of our data lake.
Leveraging data to understand, acquisition, activation, and retention dynamics, and help identify key growth and efficiency opportunities for our marketing team.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Data Engineers, Data Scientists) to plan, facilitate, and develop Marketing Analytics projects.
Supporting our marketing experts to run A/B test campaigns by designing a clean experiment framework, gathering data, and analyzing results, in order to optimize and scale marketing operations.
Managing key projects for tracking implementation, attribution models, or advanced marketing techniques, such as segmentation or retargeting.

Requirements

The ideal candidate will have an interest in performance marketing, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements, while exhibiting deep expertise in marketing multi-touch attribution and tracking systems.

Necessary skills
5+ years experience in a similar role as a Performance Marketing Analyst.
Experience working with different ad platforms/channels like Instagram, Facebook, Google Ads, Display, Affiliates.
Expert in Google Analytics and Google Ads (especially data collection and event tracking with Google Tag Manager)
Good knowledge of SQL, comfort working in large data sets in R or Python.
Good understanding of key performance marketing concepts (campaign measurement, audience targeting, etc.) and knowledge of industry trends.
Experience with leveraging marketing attribution models (3rd party or in-house solutions).
Project management experience creating advanced solutions for marketing performance optimization and tracking systems.
Must have strong commercial sense and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).
Strong interpersonal management skills and ability to work in indirect/remote teams, if needed.
Fluent in English.

Nice to have
Marketing automation tools or Google360.
Shopify integration with other tracking systems for example GA.
Cross-domain tracking.
Familiar with product analytics tools such as Mixpanel or Amplitude.


Benefits
Private Health and Dental Insurance plan for employees.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly internet allowance.
Working from home setup allowance.
Company sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored training and development.
Quarterly company bonus programme.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Remote policy and flexible working hours
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Day off for your birthday.
Hybrid remote model office.

Please note All applications must be submitted in English

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors in some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from the travel industry.

We’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by the SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market, worth over $1.3 trillion, by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

If you’re ready to take off with us, keep reading!

We are searching for a world class individual to join our Strategic Planning and Analysis team, reporting to our Head of Corporate SP&A. We are seeking someone who has proven modelling skills, and can translate complex analysis into impactful insight.

Role

Our role is to inform and drive some of Travelperk’s most important business decisions by

We are a dynamic Strategic Planning and Analysis team that enjoy solving the business challenges that come with rapid scaling. Our goal is to grow Travelperk as fast as possible, but in an efficient way.
Providing data driven insight and connection across multiple functions, segmenting by time (quarter, year, multi-year), and among varying levels of data (high-level external metrics to detailed operational indicators).
Linking that context directly to our corporate and business strategy.
Objectively assessing the impact of the decision on our business.

Do you have an analytical mind? Are you good storytelling? Let´s talk!

What You Will Do
Use of best practice techniques to design 3 statement financial models, with multi-year scenario planning
10X our performance reporting capability in order to bring impactful and actionable insight to decision making across TravelPerk
Creating and explaining analysis for C-Level and other stakeholders. This will require experience in presenting at exec and senior manager level, as well as to the board, highlighting an ability to simplify high level details into digestible summary and actions
Working closely with our accounting and data science teams to ensure accurate and robust actual data and forecast
Cultivate and foster strong cross-functional relationships and collaboration across the company
Promote Travelperk’s brand and values in a friendly, professional manner


Who You Are
5 years post qualified experience, made up of the FinTech and SaaS sectors.
Experience in business travel a big bonus but not essential
High-performing track record in a top technology/software company, where involvement in financial analysis and modelling has been of fundamental importance
Slide creation and ability to tell a compelling story, through the eyes of the different readers
Advanced Excel, Powerpoint, SQL and VBA experience
You are curious and will take ownership of a task/project/action
You are tech savvy. You love the world of tech. You know what is going on in the market. You use tech at home and at work to make life easier and constantly looking for cutting edge technology to help & automate processes
Role can be based in Barcelona or London, with an element of business travel required for the role

What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain or 25 in the UK
Flexibility to work from home most of the time
Health perks, these vary depending on your location (private healthcare in Spain & UK)
A "Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary

Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain or UK for this position
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona or London once per week
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up 3-5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event
We have core working hours between 10:30-16:30 CET
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!

We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office.

Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Kristina Kysova
Technical Recruiter @ Vistaprint - We're hiring!
Enviar mensaje InMail
Data and Analytics at Vistaprint

Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all passionate about providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do
Be immersed in diverse teams (e.g., Product Owners, Marketing, Developers) where you will collaborate on analyses and continually bring forward ideas and insights to drive value for our customers.
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding. Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analyses and present views that will provide visibility into our performance.
Data Analysis and Modeling. Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to find opportunities to drive marketing efficiency in our advertising and improve the customer experience to acquire valuable customers and promote repeat shopping behavior.
Design and execute a/b/n tests to optimize the customer experience and analyse results to provide insightful recommendations to the business. Experience with Optimizely a plus.
Collaborating in a fast paced, agile environment that focuses on delivering customer value early and often.

Your Qualifications
Passionate about data and technology. You have experience in SQL. Other programming languages (e.g., Python, R) are a plus. Experience with web analytic tools (i.e., Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics) a plus.
Inquisitive by nature. You are comfortable with exploratory analysis and statistical techniques and are driven to find meaningful patterns and trends in the data. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker is a plus.
A resourceful and driven problem solver. You enjoy and/or have demonstrated ability tackling complex problems, drawing inferences from data, and using your analysis skills and eye for business to identify solutions. You have excellent organizational skills, strong attention to detail and ability to effectively deliver on projects supporting multiple business partners.
Team-minded and versatile. You have experience and an interest in partnering with multi-functional team members who come to the table with different perspectives. You are open to creative approaches to solving problems.
Experienced. 0 to 3+ years in an analytics environment and a bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or related field.

Why You’ll Love Working Here

At Vistaprint, we put phenomenal importance into the wellbeing of our employees, which is why we offer perks that ensure an excellent work/life balance. Perks include language courses, flexible schedules, work from home capabilities, and very generous time off, including our outstanding sabbatical-like program, “Vistabreak”, Summer hours and Public Holidays, to name a few!

About Us

As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vistaprint is a dynamic organization that maintains an exciting, entrepreneurial culture. With founder Robert Keane’s return as CEO, we’ve renewed our focus on empowering and helping small businesses. To do this, we create customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We thrive on providing opportunities for exploration, collaboration, innovation and growth - for both our customers and our team.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Barcelona and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks  

You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills. 
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.

What is required?

Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages 
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications 
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

What makes us smile when looking at your profile

Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) 
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

What we can offer you:

Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system
Continuous training and coaching
Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish
Young and international team
Private health insurance
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport)
An office location in the bustling district 22@
Many off-site company events, including our annual company summit
Apple work equipment
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization
