Sector: Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
¿Qué buscamos?

En la Unidad de Fraude de Siniestros, estamos buscando un Data Analyst para unirse a nuestro equipo. Tú tendrás la responsabilidad, entre otras, de gestionar nuestro conjunto de datos maestros, proponer ideas para la optimización de las herramientas de detección de fraude, creación de informes y resolución de problemas en los datos. Para tener éxito en este puesto, se necesita una gran atención al detalle, experiencia como analista de datos y un avanzado conocimiento de herramientas o sistemas de gestión de datos.

Diseñar, administrar y mantener las bases de datos de gestión de casos.
Asignar las tareas.
Procurar la calidad de los datos, incluyendo la limpieza de los mismos.
Extraer datos de fuentes internas y externas.
Analizar e interpretar conjuntos de datos, tendencias y patrones a fin de proponer medidas para optimizar tanto los procesos internos como las herramientas (automáticas o no) de detección de fraude.
Contribuir en el análisis, desarrollo e implementación de nuevas herramientas de detección de fraude. Interlocución con el equipo de Advance Analytics y otros.
Elaborar informes de gestión y estadísticos, así como cuadros de mando.
Mantener la confidencialidad y velar por el cumplimiento de la legislación vigente en materia de protección de datos personales.

¿Qué necesitamos?

Esperamos que la persona que se incorpore en el equipo reúna las siguientes habilidades y experiencias:

Titulación universitaria. Se valorará titulación o conocimiento en las ramas de matemáticas, estadística, informática, ciencia de datos, ingeniería en matemática aplicada al análisis de datos, etc.
Se valorará Master en Data Science y Análisis de Datos.
Dominio de Excel y Access. Se valorará conocimiento de otros sistemas de gestión de datos.
Se valorará conocimiento de las aplicaciones de siniestros tales como INFO, ZCAS, IBA.
Se valorará conocimiento en la tramitación de siniestros y en materias relacionadas con la detección y prevención del fraude en seguros.
Se valorará inglés fluido.

Por ser de Zurich

En Zurich queremos cuidar de ti y estos son algunos de tus beneficios:

Compensación flexible.
Tarjeta restaurante.
Bono oficina en casa.
Flexwork: 20 horas semanales para trabajar donde y cuando quieras.
Plan de pensiones
Seguro de vida.
Oferta bancaria y aseguradora.
Descuento en gimnasios.
Zurich Wellness, actividades deportivas.
Zurich Sports Club, inscripciones gratis en maratones y carreras populares.
Clases de inglés gratuitas.

Quienes somos

Nuestros cerca de 55.000 empleados en más de 215 países y territorios son la base de nuestro éxito. Son ellos quienes permiten que las empresas y las comunidades se puedan enfrentar a un mundo de riesgos con confianza. Imagina si pudieras ayudar a las personas a hacer esto en todo el mundo. Les darías confianza y tranquilidad protegiendo lo que más aman. Es un gran desafío, pero contarás con el apoyo de un gran equipo internacional que está dispuesto a ayudarte para que puedas alcanzar tu máximo potencial y así cumplir con nuestras promesas.

Nosotros ya nos hemos puesto en marcha y estamos cambiando la forma de hacer seguros. ¡Para ello necesitamos gente con talento, ganas de aprender y pasión! ¿Te unes a nosotros?

“ Zurich , 14 años consecutivos como Top Employer ”

Zurich Insurance tiene y aplica una política de igualdad de oportunidades de empleo. Nuestro objetivo es atraer y retener los mejores profesionales sin discriminar por discapacidad, raza, nacionalidad, religión, género, orientación sexual o edad.

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo (glovoapp.com) is looking for a world-class Data Analyst. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona’s fastest growing Startups – helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

The routing team mission is to provide accurate, reliable and business-driven estimations around the logistics of each order in real time, contributing to a top-class user experience and to maximize the efficiency of the fleet. Engineers, data scientists and data analysts work together to develop and productionalize machine learning models, explore and roll-out new features, and to solve complex problems through the means of data.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and produce insightful analyses for internal teams to make the right decisions
Closely collaborate with data scientists to understand models impact on KPI, suggest improvements and coordinate rollouts
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customised tools or using the available ones
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
A/B test the launch of new features
Assist colleagues in gaining access to the right data
Build robust relationships with key business stakeholders


You Have
At least 2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions
Proficient with SQL
Amazon Redshift experience is highly desirable
Experience in Python or R
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview
Data Science understanding is desirable
Proficiency in English is a must


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Descripción:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Building an advertising platform that answers our client marketing objectives requires strong product managers and great software developers, but it also demands excellence from the commercial and operations teams. To connect both product and operational worlds, Criteo can count on Product Experts whose goals are to ensure that products are best brought to market, correspond to client expectations and that their revenue grows.

The Creative Product Expertise team is, therefore, co-accountable for the customer success and growth of our products, with a particular mandate over the management of creative and analytical knowledge across our field operations teams as well as the collection of market feedback. As part of the Global Operations team, members build a relationship and have a direct line with product management and field operations, granting them great autonomy to influence the full cycle of a products life.

Every day, you will

Develop understanding and in-depth knowledge of the Criteos Creative Product, including technical inner workings of products, their business functionality and performance, their managed and self-service controls and best practices, and our product improvement strategy and roadmap.

Review the product line strategy, the Creative product roadmap and the R&Ds objectives and key results (OKRs),

Attend and participate in recurring discussions with Product Management, Product Analytics and other internal groups,

Assist Product Management in the writing of technical documentations in a way that is broadly digestible,

Dig into technical specifications and data models to get a complete understanding of the products underlying architecture.

Act as an analytical expert as well as a Creative product evangelist, providing support and opportunities to field creative consultants (CS), field analytics (AX), and advertising operations (AdOps) teams in order to converge toward the most successful use and extension of our Creative products.

Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, responding to business/creative product priorities.

Leverage your expertise to deliver actionable insights to the field.

Prepare operations team with trainings, processes and tools to build a product expertise on the field (i.e., in all our markets),

Collect and answer creative and analytical questions in a way that contributes to maintaining a global expertise,

Monitor, fix or escalate technical issues around existing creative product reports to maintain their performance,

Exchange and debate the need of new features that contribute to customer success and revenue,

Identify data storytelling opportunities that could solidify our products position on the market.

Become a trusted advisor to our product managers and product solutions strategists, best connecting our client marketing objectives with our services, increasing customer success and participating in the rollout, growth and maturity of products.

Challenge the roadmap to ensure that our products are performing and run smoothly,

Provide relevant inputs into product improvements with business cases collected from field teams,

Help in the design of new features, test new development releases and provide immediate feedback,

Track product performance, both adoption rate and outcome for clients, and look for levers of improvements.

In exchange, youll enjoy...

Competitive compensation, because youre the best

Career advancement and global mobility opportunities

Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile

Generous vacation policy (although who wants to leave Spain?)

Game and sports area when you need a break

Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going

As for our dream candidate

A thoughtful communicator who is excellent at communicating through a variety of channels that require both written and verbal skills,

Passionate about innovative problem solving for customers and end users,

Self-motivated, eager to learn and thrive in a collaborative environment,

Capable of adapting quickly to changing priorities,

Familiar with customer and/or technical support by experience,

You are willing to grow your technical expertise. Proficiency in SQL, Tableau and Python is a plus.

Fluent in English as it would be the day-to-day working language.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Puesto ofertado: Senior SAP Data Analyst – QM/EAM (Temp - 6 months)
Sector: Artículos de consumo Alimentación y bebidas
Descripción:
Auto req ID: 229879BR

Job Description

Purpose of the role
PepsiCo is a leading food and beverage company in Europe, with presence across many complex markets where we have a broad range of categories and products. This very successful business is launching a multi-year business transformation program which is relying on an SAP S4 backbone and other integrated strategic solutions being rolled out. The purpose of this role is to lead the SAP S4 data design and data conversion for the value stream Order to Cash (OTC) as part of Europe template deployment.

Our first program deployment is focusing on our UK and Poland business units with a project office near London, while our teams are based across multiple hubs around Europe and the World. The team consist of functional experts, business analyst and development/integration experts as well as vendor partners, consultants and internal/external service groups

The broader team
We are a diverse multi-cultural group of excited and purpose-driven professionals located across Europe, driving business transformation and collaborate across teams and functions. Our projects are often complex and challenging but always business driven and cross-functional. Our core values include transparency, inclusion, trust and to deliver as a team. We are agile, with a positive and innovative mindset and we find important to keep each-other energized and to have some fun on the journey.
The ideal Candidate
You drive your agenda with passion and pride, inspiring team members to grow. You set the agenda and embrace risks and ambiguity that comes from complex problems and the broader matrixed organization and continuously find mitigations and solutions to succeed. You set an example within your team with your own personal growth and you even influence peers and other teams with your proactivity and coaching approach. You can get things done with an effective combination of formal and informal collaboration across the organization. You have a sense of humour and you’re not afraid of using it.

Further Details of the role

Relationships
Reports to the SAP Business Data Lead
Works closely with project IT, Business and Value Streams
Partners with SAP Global Template teams
Partners and closely collaborates with business value stream teams
Deliverables:
Senior SAP Data Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting the Data Collection and Cleaning activities working closely with Business and Project Team (Process Leads and Data Migration Team)
Oversees and ensures delivery of all aspects of QM and EAM data objects: data readiness, data quality issue resolution
Ensures compliance with SAP Global Template Data standards for business process areas: Quality Management and Enterprise Asset Management
Work with legacy IT system experts to understand legacy data designs
Accountabilities
Lead data readiness activities for respective area
Partner with process leads, migration and conversion team
Work with the Data Conversion & Readiness team to review results of legacy data profiling to identify data cleansing opportunities and optimized approach for cleansing
Supports data quality issue resolution during testing and migration activities
Ensure data is fit for purpose and aligned to business needs and PGT Design

Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum of 5 years of experience supporting or deploying SAP ERP (ECC or S/4) implementations, with a strong focus on the QM and EAM Value Stream area
Good understanding of following business process areas: Quality Inspections Processes, Plant Maintenance Process
Good understanding of Data Objects in QM Area: Inspection Plans, MICs, QMIR, Inspection Methods
Good understanding of Data Objects in EAM Area: Functional Locations, Measurement Points, Equipment BOM, Tasks etc
Strong analytical skills, as shown by the advanced use of data analysis tools and concepts, such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, Data Migration (ie: LSMW, Hana Cockpit)
Previous experiences of ERP Data analysis, Data Cleansing and migration activities is a must
Ability to understand complex data requirements, and be able to identify and offer multiple solution options to facilitate the best outcome (e.g. automated transformation vs. manual enrichment)
Strong influencing, facilitating, and consulting skills in working with stakeholders at all levels in the organization and across departments
Excellent oral and written skills to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts, and provide clear documentation to the management and project leadership
Service oriented attitude balanced with “doing what is right for the project/business”, even if that is not a popular decision.
Ability to quickly adapt to changes in timelines and sequences, deal with ambiguity, and succeed against in a high-pressure environment
Knowledge and experience in the Agile Methodology and related tools (such as MS Azure DevOps) desired
Ability to work flexible hours based on varying business requirements
Knowledge and experience in the following tools, disciplines and processes are nice to have: SAP SolMan 7+ , MS Azure DevOps, HP ALM

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable
Job Type: Pipeline

Descripción:
As a Senior Digital Analyst You Will

We are looking for a proactive and determined person to join Rocket Digital’s Analytics team as a Senior Digital Analyst. You will be the subject matter expert of Digital Analytics in the company and will help our clients understand their digital business using data. You will work with different platforms and tools to find areas for improvement in our clients’ digital assets and will make proposals to increase their performance.

Serve as the subject matter expert in Digital Analytics at Rocket Digital.
Work to design the digital measurement solutions according to business requirements from clients.
Find insights and turn them into actionable ideas in order to improve the performance of our clients’ digital assets.
Generate data-driven hypotheses, to be tested in A/B and/or multivariate experiments.
Work closely with other Digital Analytics colleagues, as well as with specialists in areas such as UI, UX, creative, development, SEO or Paid Acquisition.
Overview the implementation, configuration and validation of tag management and analytics tools.
Identify business opportunities and prepare ad hoc proposals to potential clients.
Provide training, both internally and to clients.We’re definitely looking for you if you have:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Statistics or Engineering.
Experience of minimum 3 years in Digital Analytics and Marketing projects, preferably from an agency perspective. Having developed project management tasks in the past is a strong plus.
Strong knowledge of Digital Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Hotjar, CrazyEgg, Adobe Analytics, Matomo, Mixpanel, Google Tag Manager…).
Strong knowledge of Excel and comfortability working with large datasets.
Strong knowledge of testing and personalization tools (Optimize, Optimizely, VWO…).
Knowledge of reporting tools (Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI…).
Project management skills, proactivity and autonomy.

It Would Be Nice If You Had Knowledge Of

Marketing tools (Google Ads, Facebook Business Manager, Campaign Manager).
Experience with channel attribution tools.
Practical knowledge of programming and/or database querying languages (JavaScript, R, HTML, CSS, SQL…).Benefits

Sofia Piquero Monge 2º

Enviar mensaje InMail
Your mission will be to:
Provide relevant data to the internal commercial network to empower and support the correct customer relationship management, sales performance control and contracts profitability follow-ups in compliance with the company internal policies, as well as meaningful and proper on-time-in-full analysis for regional and EU business decision makers
 You will be responsible for:
Data Analysis and Modeling: Incorporate multiple data sources and methodologies to identify commercially relevant information and transform into sales insights. Evangelize the follow-up of key performance indicators (both leading and lagging)
Data Exploration, Visualization, and Dashboarding: Identify trends and drivers, perform exploratory data analysis and present views that will provide visibility into our performance
Policy deployment: support local leaders on the deployment and sustainment of business strategy, as well as the proper activation and follow-up of problem-solving processes to identify root-causes and countermeasures on systematic deviations
Map and improve existing processes (including but not limited to sales budget and forecast reviews, predictive sales models, sales target setting/achievements, etc.). Support development and deployment of daily management frameworks and business problem-solving process. Identify non-field related activities and create tools and frameworks that will help Sales Force and non-sales-related Leaders to reduce waste on their processes and activities
Incentive Plan strategy: be the local voice to drive incentive plan design and recommendations, collect feedback from commercial teams, influence key stakeholders. Develop and support relevant activities for the calculation and approval Sales Incentives
CRM and BI gatekeeper: own CRM-related processes, be able to identify required areas of education that will help to improve the efficiency of CRM usage and data quality. Ensure correct level of access. Provide trainings and guarantee adherence to the global Standard of Work. Partner with Global IT and Sales Enablement team for new implementations and provide support in UAT waves in compliance with business requirements. Be the key representative member of local BI and SW in European BI forums acting as Subject Matter Expert of local reporting processes
Pricing: Support the development of processes and methods for price setting and price getting. Maintain local CPQ (Configuration, Pricing, Quoting) solutions and be able to develop new if required. Support the preparation of an offer to the customer with special focus on profitability
 Required skills:
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:
B.Sc./M.Sc. in Engineering, Economics
Proficient in data modeling in Microsoft Excel (including VBA scripting) and Access
Experience with BI tool (e.g., Power BI) and SQL is a plus
Experience in Sales Operations preferably in Sanitary/Pharmaceutical Sector is a plus
Proficient in English and Spanish (spoken and written) is a must. Portuguese is a plus.
 Soft skills:
Excellent problem-solving skills with ability to dis-aggregate issues, identify root causes, identify potential improvements and recommend solutions in daily operations and translate it into workable solutions.
Detail-oriented and with ability to work under pressure. Logical, Rigorous and disciplined approach.
Flexibility, patience, and an understanding of fluid, demanding, and unstructured environments where priorities evolve constantly, capable to effectively deal with uncertainty and ambiguity
Entrepreneurial and proactively thinking about potential improvements to how things are done
Exposure by experience to Lean Change Management Models is a plus

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Investigación
Descripción:
Offer Description

Context and Mission

ELIXIR (European Life Science Infrastructure for Biological Information) is a pan-European organization founded in 2014, which aims to integrate and harmonize European bioinformatics infrastructures. ELIXIR coordinates the participation of more than 20 countries, engages with other strategic European initiatives and projects e.g. ESFRI, Research Data Alliance, EUDat, EGI; promotes specific training activities and workshops on ELIXIR resources, partners with industry, and play a key role in shaping the bioinformatics landscape. Spain is a member of ELIXIR since 2015, with the INB as the Spanish national node. Within ELIXIR, the INB is responsible for the bioinformatics infrastructure offered by Spain, and therefore, should guarantee its alignment to the strategic areas put forward by ELIXIR.

The INB has recently incorporated two overarching objectives: increase the alignment of its activities with ELIXIR, and increase the translational impact of INB actions towards the Spanish National Health System (SNS). For the later objective, the INB has created and support TransBioNet (Translational Bioinformatics Network) which aims to structure, bring together and work with bioinformatics groups at healthcare settings with a special focus on the Health Research Institutes (IIS) recognized by the ISCIII.

The INB is looking for a Bioinformatics Data Analyst who will join their team in the framework of a new project to organise COVID-19 data in Spain, contributing to develop a computational infrastructure for secure data storage and analysis across regions. This work will involve close coordination with other groups in Spanish health Centres, and with infrastructure providers within and outside the BSC.

Key Duties
Contribute to the development of a computational infrastructure for secure COVID-19 data storage and analysis.
Manage and support users of the INB computational resources, including computational equipment, databases, and software infrastructure.
Develop, document and maintain the processes for extracting and organizing COVID-19 data from projects belonging to the ISCIII-funded project on this area.
Develop, document and maintain software for the integration and biological data, following the guidelines of ELIXIR and the European COVID-19 data portal.
Maintain communication with ELIXIR platforms, communities, and leadership; participate in their regular meetings and discussions.
Contribute to supervise junior members at the INB/ELIXIR-ES units.

Requirements

Education
BSc or MSc. in bioinformatics, computational biology or computer sciences with significant bioinformatics experience.

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
At least 2 years of professional experience with a similar role.
Experience in cloud computing.
Experience in data management APIs and most common bioinformatics data sources and formats.
Experience in database design and management (SQL and noSQL): MySQL/MariaDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite or similar; MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Cassandra or similar.
Experience with advanced software packaging procedures.
At least 2.5 years of professional experience on programming languages ecosystems such as C++, Perl, Python, PHP and/or Java.
Vast experience working with Unix/Linux systems.

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Experience on the development, generation and use of software containers, e.g. Docker, Singularity, as well as their orchestration and deployment, e.g. using docker compose, kubernetes, ansible and/or similar technologies.
Experience on workflow managers such as Galaxy, Nextflow or similar.
Experience on developing project technical specifications.
Competencies
Ability of understand scientific literature, and software documentation.
Ability to communicate scientific results.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to represent the team at international project meetings.
Used to work under pressure under strict deadlines.
Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Life Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (40 hours a week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Temporary - 1 year renewable

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: as soon as possible

Descripción:
Then This Might Be For You

Are you looking for an opportunity to work in an international company on global scale projects.

The Company.
For one of our clients, an international Shared Service Centre based in Barcelona, we are currently recruiting for a Business Analyst specialized in Business Intelligence and Reporting to join the team.
The Job.
This role you would be a member of the Business Analyst team and working as a liaison among stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements of existing and new IT solutions and services.

Your Responsibilities

– Collaborate with business stakeholders at all levels to identify, qualify and agree on business requirements or KPIs definitions
– Ensure that business stakeholders are informed about the collected data and the outcome of it
– Document and maximize the quality of the requirements gathered
– Supports the solution architects/development teams to identify and articulate options for potential solutions that meet the business requirements
– Consider and assess already available options in relation to the business requirements which include details on cost/benefits, impacts, risks
– Obtain sign-off from the different stakeholders for Business Requirement, Solution Specification Document, and for final deliverables
– Create / Update documentation on KPIs definition from a technical and functional point of view
– Work towards the harmonization of platform and processes across the globe
– Acceptance and follow up: ensure that the final deliverables of a task or project meet the stated business requirements and have been delivered and measured against original design specifications
– Running end-user interviews
The Profile.
– You have an excellent level of English (any additional language would be a plus)
– You have min. 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst / Business Intelligence
– You have a degree in Business Intelligence, Business administration or equivalent
– You have experience with BI solutions (MicroStrategy, IBM Cognos BI, Tableau, Qlik, Information Builder, etc.)
– You are familiar with MS Excel and Visio (or similar tools)
– You have a good understanding of Business Intelligence concepts
– You have a basic knowledge of Database structure and basic query languages
– You have an analytical, creative and curious mind
– You have the ability to understand why things happen, why processes are set up, and people behaviors
– You can work autonomously, but also in a team
The Offer.
– Salary based on the level of experience
– Career opportunities
– International and multicultural environment
– A company with a worldwide reputation
– Start date: Beginning-end of August

Descripción:
This is Ekkiden

Ambition and innovation are our driving force. We aim high, act quickly, and acquire the wherewithal that we need to achieve our objectives. Our organisation is shaped by the requirements of both our clients and our teams. Becoming a European benchmark requires hard work, quality and respect. We pave our own path, with international teams committed to sustainable growth. We help clients to innovate and we make sure we question ourselves at all times. At Ekkiden everything is possible. Our managers are trained to bring out the best in every team member. If you are daring, creative, and have great people skills, if you want to live an extraordinary human experience and you don’t want to keep reminding yourself why you get up in the morning, it's time to meet up.

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Responsibilities
Work with the team (technical Lead/Architect/other team members) and customer focal point to understand the business need and design/implement the technical data management solution
Design and implement Data Warehouses and Data Lakes solutions, mainly Microsoft Cloud and AWS data services, based on the customers’ business requirements
Design and implement complex ELT/ETL processes using Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory or AWS Glue or others
Design and develop Analysis Services OLAP Cubes and Tabular Views
Develop scripts accordingly to the data need (Stored Procedures with T-SQL, Python or R, eventually PowerShell).
Design conceptual and logical data models and data flowcharts
Design Data-as-a-Service solution, on-premises and Cloud based, based on Data API Gateway and other Cloud services.
Implement Data Catalog solutions
Migrate data from legacy systems to new data platform solutions
Improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
Optimize new and current database systems
Perform other duties as required


What We Are Looking For
+5 years of experience in similar positions
Strong knowledge in C# development
Strong knowledge on Azure Functions
Excellent knowledge in LogicApps and development in Azure
Excellent knowledge of AWS BI and data services
Experience with Data analysis and modelling
Experience with Database scripting (T-SQL, stored procedures, etc.)
Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence modules covering Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Analysis Services (SSAS)
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS Athena/RDS or Redshift
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI
Experience working with OData
Experience working with SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience with Service Management tools (ticketing systems)
Experience with Service Management methodologies (ITIL) and Change Management
Experience with Agile project development
Microsoft SQL Server certification is a plus
Microsoft BI certification is a plus
Fluent in English. Spanish and Italian are a plus


What we offer
Participate in the creation of a European technology and organisational consulting group
A unique, innovative and dynamic working environment
A career path tailored to your personality, both in terms of job position and location
The opportunity to express yourself, assert your opinion and make an impact within our organisation and/or further afield
You say it, you own it. Once your idea has been given the go-ahead, it is up to you to make it happen
A demanding and innovative training program delivered by our greatest experts
Age is just a number, what really matter are achievements. We have a fast-track promotion system for employees who deliver
Our working conditions are concentric with our values and ambitions

This vacancy may offer a work-from-home start until it’s safe to work in-house or relocate to the location.

Project: Mobile Games

OPM’s client is redefining the way you play mobile games! With a monthly audience of more than 113 million unique players they are setting new benchmarks in mobile gaming.

The successful candidate will be a determined User Acquisition Specialist who will join a team working on games that are played by millions of users.

Requirements
Strong professional experience overseeing, growing, and optimising mobile acquisition campaigns through Facebook, Google, Ad networks, DSP, and other media platforms.

En Ogilvy estamos buscando a una persona interesada en incorporarse a nuestro departamento de Data; en un equipo dinámico y creativo, en el que podrás trabajar con clientes y marcas de renombre internacional.

En el puesto de trabajo podrás encargarte de analizar datos de diferentes fuentes (base de datos, google analytics, herramientas de comunicación...) y realizar propuestas de valor.

Lista de las principales tareas que se realizan en el puesto

Interlocución con los otros departamentos de la agencia, especialmente el departamento de cuentas, los Project managers y el departamento de tecnología, para la interpretación del briefing de cliente, la definición del proyecto y la gestión del mismo.
Identificar, analizar e interpretar tendencias o patrones en los datos proporcionados.
Desarrollo e implementación en la explotación del dato.
Análisis de resultados mediante técnicas estadísticas para proveer de insights y mejoras a los proyectos en curso.
Elaboración de informes continuos y cuadros de mando.
Localizar y proponer oportunidades de mejora a nuestros clientes basándonos en la información recopilada y analizada.

Estudios

Estudios universitarios de informática, económica o estadística.

Experiencia Requerida

Experiencia en el mundo de análisis de datos, especialmente en análisis de programas CRM, Web y social media.
Experiencia en email marketing.
Experiencia en la preparación de informes y propuestas de mejora.

Conocimientos

Conocimientos de analítica digital, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager y Omniture. Muy valorable certificaciones en Google Analytics.Conocimientos de herramientas de comunicación, especialmente Salesforce Marketing Cloud y Selligent. Valorable conocimientos de programación (XML, Javascript o ETL)
Valorable el conocimiento de programas estadísticos (R, SPSS, SAS)
Valorable conocimientos de Google Adwords, SEM, SEO

Capacidad analítica.
Capacidad de síntesis.
Atención al detalle.
Organización.
Capacidad de abstracción.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

The Growth Analytics team at Glovo is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to support our Pricing team by analyzing and visualizing data to make more educated decisions on how to optimize our core pricing strategies. You will also be responsible for nurturing the relationship between Pricing HQ and a subset of countries.

You will interact with stakeholders across all levels of the organization on a regular basis and hence require the ability to compartmentalize requests and formulate applicable data-driven solutions. You will require a sharp business focus, a collaborative style of working, and a proactive and critical mindset. Excellent interpersonal, communication, and writing skills are crucial, as is the ability to synthesize complex issues, drive desired outcomes.

Glovo is a fast moving, dynamic environment where flexibility and adaptability are key attributes. The successful candidate is a self-starter with a passion for data analytics and continuously demonstrates an ability to tackle complex problems and implement solutions.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be responsible of the pricing strategy for a subset of countries
Collaborate in redesigning the pricing algorithm. Develop, test and productionize an improved pricing algorithm
Identify commercial opportunities using data to understand user-buying behavior and define our pricing strategy. Designing frameworks to assess price elasticity of demand - to be able to assess which consumer will stay, which will drop
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Work closely with cross-functional leads to develop technical vision and drive the team direction
Work in hand with the product team to define the process and tools to effectively translate strategies into products
Provide guidance and support to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data in support of critical business needs and goals
Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches


You Have
Minimum 2 years of prior experience in a data-driven environment delivering actionable insights
Strong quantitative background
Excellent software development skills in one or more of Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with large data sets
Command line skills
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novices
Fluent spoken and written English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Flexible compensation - transport, childcare, restaurants etc via our 3rd party company called Cobee
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment
Flexible Time Off


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
TeamCMP is a digital entertainment company founded in Rochester (NY) in the early 2000’s and with offices in Barcelona since 2007.

We're 170+ people energized about our future and enjoying everything a high-growth company has to offer. We're technologists, marketers, business operators, video producers and VR experts from over 33 nationalities

At TeamCMP we are passionate about innovation! We take a cutting-edge approach to development by utilizing the latest technologies and experimenting with all the new gadgets

Big volumes = big challenges

We field more than 250 million HTTP sessions per-day from our collection of some of the world's most well trafficked sites and our B2C products lead in their respective markets. We are committed to amplifying our presence and accelerating growth through our passionate, entrepreneurial and innovative workforce.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our analytics department.

In this position, you will play a critical role in setting up critical reporting for one of our fastest-growing products. Excellent technical skills are required to define and implement ETL processes, define SQL queries and visualize data by building a set of automated dashboards.

Thanks to the analytical and business-oriented approach to data, the senior business intelligence analyst will boost product optimization and help to unlock new revenue opportunities.

Responsabilities
Help define and monitor user journey KPIs (such as ARPU., etc.)
Collaborate with marketing teams (CRM, user acquisition,…) to define key metrics and reporting requirements.
Understand marketing questions and dynamics and translate them into analysis and opportunities.
Proactively provide hands-on analyses to highlight trends and discover insights from data.
Owning and developing tracking of the full customer journey across all current and future marketing platforms.
Design, implement and maintain ETL processes for integrating the necessary data sources.
Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making.
Enable self-service data exploration, making data standardized and easily accessible.
Collaborate with stakeholders to collect feedback, educate on new data solutions and promote data culture within the company


Requirements

The ideal candidate will have at least 3+ years of relevant industry experience, possess good communication skills, and a growth mindset. We are looking for someone who is passionate about challenging tech and data problems, enjoys finding insights in data, and applying conclusions to drive clear and practical business improvements.
Experience in a similar role and/or a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
High level of expertise with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Qlikview, etc.
Knowledge of digital marketing & advertising technology ecosystem.
Experience exploiting and integrating external API’s.
Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL pipelines and data modeling.
Strong presentation skills in communicating to both experts and general audiences.
Excellent problem solving, analytical and critical thinking.
Quality driven, attention to detail and pragmatic.
Proactive and positive attitude, self-organized and an excellent team player.
Agile and innovative with the tenacity to thrive in a constantly changing environment and willingness to improve.
Communicative and empathic with stakeholders.
Fluent spoken and written English.

Nice to have experience with not necessarily
Experience with AWS Big Data stack (Redshift, S3, EMR, etc)
Data modelling expertise with R or Python
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Superset


Benefits
Private Health Insurance plan for you and your kids.
Subsidized gym memberships and fitness classes.
Monthly Internet allowance.
Working-from-home setup allowance
Sponsored Spanish, Catalan and English classes.
Sponsored external training and development programs.
Quarterly Company bonus and recruitment referral programs.
Top notch Apple equipment.
Flexible Bank Holidays. Design your own working calendar with a lengthy consecutive vacation day policy.
Day off for your birthday.
Beautiful offices with amazing city view terraces, right in the centre of Barcelona.

Sector: Equipos informáticos Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
It's rewarding to work at a company where YOU make a difference! If you're passionate about the ever-changing IT industry and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative progressive environment, you'll thrive at Tech Data! Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!
Job Purpose
The Cloud Systems & Services team is responsible to optimize the business processes required for these businesses. This includes offering shared services through Tech Data owned Shared Service Center outsourced to service partners in EMEA.

The Marketplace and Process Analyst will work on projects designed to improve quality, reduce errors and design new operational business processes.

She /he will work with management, local sales teams, internal departments, platforms owners, IT teams, customers and vendors to gather and analyse information and make recommendations.

An important role for this consultant will be to work closely with Tech Data Country sales teams to ensure appropriate service levels are provided to Super Users, End Users, and Customers. The consultant will also work closely with vendors to ensure appropriate understanding, documentation, and use of their platforms as applicable. Other project orientated duties may be assigned as needed.

The Process analyst can be called upon to design new processes, such as a new automated system for billing and procurement or a new support service for a new platform. She/he should be able to analyse existing processes to reduce errors and breakdowns and improve quality. Process analysts also work on quality improvement projects and document business processes.

Responsibilities:
Mapping of process flows across Operations teams, the collection, documentation and analysis of data, the identification of process gaps and support of process improvement initiatives to increase operational efficiencies.
Create process maps and document key business requirements needed to evaluate opportunities.
Create value stream maps to identify and highlight potential areas of improvement.
Coordinate and facilitate cross-functional / cross-organization meetings between stakeholders on various end-to-end business processes.
Conduct root cause analysis of process inefficiencies by examining material flow, scheduling, production capacity, constraints.
Document Operational “As-is” processes and the desired “Future State” processes.
Define SLAs and measure results.
Deploy new operational processes and escalate them as needed.
Maintain, manage and constantly improve central processes
Document all process accordingly: Ensure all necessary procedures and management processes are implemented to guarantee homogeneous and up-to-standard across locations within regional scope.
Ensure appropriate training and self–actualization of skills for all staff for new processes or with outsourced parties.
Manage constant communication with countries and other stakeholders around processes.
Ensure relationship with countries and other stakeholders under excellency metrics


Knowledge Skills And Experience

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.
Solid understanding of eCommerce
Experience with evaluating ROI is a plus but not mandatory.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work autonomously and independently
An out of the box thinking mentality
Exceptional customer service orientation.
Be proficient in the use of analytic tools such as data gathering and analysis, spreadsheets, flow-charting and process diagramming.
Comfortable working in an international result driven project organisation.
Project Experience of Software Licensing, Support, or Customer Service functions definite advantage. Understanding of the IT Software / Services / SaaS industry are helpful
Technical Know-how / understanding on Tech Data tools such as: SAP, MS office products, hardware, and operating systems as well as knowledge of programming languages, diagnostic utilities, monitoring tools, etc is a plus.
IT Channel experience, Pan European distributors or Software vendor are a definite advantage
Significant experience working with large multinational accounts
Exceptional written and oral communication and presentation skills in English language, additional European languages being a plus.
Intercultural experience is a plus
Excel advance knowledge considered a plus but not mandatory
Cultural Competency Requirements:
For this position, you will be expected to understand, communicate, and collaborate effectively with people across various identities and cultures.

Sector: Internet Marketing y publicidad Medios de comunicación en línea
Descripción:
Who We Are

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. With offices around the world, our incredible team of 2,600 Criteos collaborates to create an open & inclusive environment. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and be impactful. All of this supports us in our mission to power the worlds marketers with trusted & impactful advertising.

Overview

Do you enjoy working on real-world business problems that can be solved using data? Its not just about crunching numbers we transform business problems into business solutions through the use of data. We use these statistics to tell stories that are used to make strategic decisions.

As a Data Analyst in the Customer Experience & Strategy team you will use an analytical, data-driven approach to understand our clients needs and provide insights. You will be working closely with the largest Mid-Market clients to optimize their campaigns, present actionable insights, and answer challenging analytical questions.

This role involves dealing with a considerable amount of complex data and requires a candidate who is comfortable thinking of innovative ways to analyze data and solve problems. The ideal candidate will be able to properly convey the business impact of their analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences.

What youll do
Develop a deep knowledge of Criteos technology, products, and position in the marketplace
Identify and develop innovative analysis to address business challenges and client needs
Provide end-to-end analysis, including formulation of business needs, data gathering, data exploration, analysis and communication of results
Collaborate with cross-functional business units to provide strategic recommendations to the commercial teams
Act as a business partner to strategic leadership teams, to help drive client strategy and direction
Effectively communicate complex analysis to multiple levels of stakeholders
Manage controlled A/B test design, execution, analysis and presentation of results
Who you are
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment, which often requires the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Outstanding analytical, interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to present analytics to a wide range of constituents in a relatable and understandable manner
Ability to participate in project scoping and planning for a large program of work
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau & Excel (experience with Python, R, Hive/Hadoop is a plus)
A data visualization expert someone who can take a business question and visualize the results to impactfully tell a story with data
A good grasp of statistical modeling
A passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes
Strong organizational skills to work with remote managers and teams, as well as internal/external stake holders
The ability to work in a fast-paced environment, which often requires the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
A degree in business, economics, finance, math, or statistics
You are fluent in English
Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restriction
Why you'll love us
Competitive compensation
Career advancement and global mobility opportunities
Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile
Generous vacation policy
Video and sports games area when you need a break
Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going
Join us to contribute to one of the fastest growing, leading edge technologies in online industry. We work hard, play hard and we share the same passion for e-Commerce, Advertising and Technology. We value team work, openness, technical innovation, and results-orientated thinking.

At Criteo, we are committed to creating an environment where all Criteos feel a sense of belonging. We nourish our diversity by listening to all cultures within Criteo - and there are many. We are proud to be a global team and conscious that it takes people with different perspectives, thoughts and cultures to succeed.

Criteo collects your personal data for the purposes of managing Criteo's recruitment related activities. Consequently, Criteo may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to the different Criteo entities across the world. By clicking the "Apply" button you expressly give your consent.

Tecnología de la información

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Company Description

We are a world leading online classifieds business that reaches more than 200 million people each month through our household name brands across 12 countries. Our brands include Leboncoin, OLX, fotocasa, Infojobs and Shpock to name a few.

Our brands are supported by global tech hubs in Paris and Barcelona. Their goal is to develop common global product & innovation platforms which all of our brands can use; this means using bleeding edge technology to create highly scalable, highly customisable and secure products and components to free up the development time of our brands and leverage our access to global data.

The Messaging team at Adevinta owns the software and infrastructure that sends over 5 million messages every day and serves millions of customers worldwide. Up to 16 Marketplaces from the Adevinta group all over the world use our infrastructure and integrate their applications using our SDKs to enable chat in their web sites. Our team is formed by a group of 30 multicultural individuals from different areas such as UX, Product, Data and Tech that work together to develop top-of-the-line software products.

Job Description

We are currently looking for a really experienced data engineer to join our team of engineers in Barcelona. As a member of the Messaging team, you will join our journey as we discover how to build state of the art data processing solutions for Adevinta, with emphasis on both volume, velocity and privacy. The event data we collect from all Adevinta sites around the world is essential to our business - including feeding marketplaces with low-latency (“realtime”) updates, visitor insights analysis and targeted advertisement. We are solving exciting problems at scale while keeping users privacy and data security in mind.

As part of the global Adevinta organization, you will also have the opportunity to learn from and share knowledge with data scientists and engineers across Adevinta. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for the state-of-the-art in big data processing at the same time as building reliable and highly scalable services.

Responsibilities
Ensure the traceability of the data from the origins to the decisional and analytical data structures
Setup and maintain the data infrastructure
Work with Data Analyst to understand their need and provide solutions to solve them
Develop comprehensive data capture, transformation and visualization solutions
Guarantee data infrastructure in all environments.
Ensure that quality standards and data governance are being achieved
Advocate for data governance strategies

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

In this role you’ll get to

This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market.

Key Activities Involved Include But Not Limit To
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to identify opportunities for business improvements and support your recommendations
Own end-to-end project or roll out new experiments to validate in-market impact of an initiative within Partner Development
Build dashboards, identify new and track key metrics to closely monitor team’s performance and identify quick and long term opportunities for improvements
Work closely with cross-functional teams of analysts, regional team leads, product managers and business owners to drive changes based on opportunities identified
Support global Partner Development related initiatives, including experimentation infrastructure-building and methodology standardization


What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s degree in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline
Minimum 8 -year experience working in a business analysis, data analysis, reporting or business strategy role
Excellent problem-solving skills including the ability to analyze and resolve complex problems using data
Team player with strong interpersonal, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills
Coding skills for analytics and data manipulation (SQL, R, Python, Pandas, Scala)
Data visualization tool experience such as with Tableau or your weapon of choice.
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English), with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction

Descripción:
En el equipo de Experience Optimisation de everis Barcelona, estamos buscando un/a Senior Digital Analyst, para incorporarse de forma inmediata a proyectos de Digital Analytics, Optimización y/o SEO.
Experience Optimisation, forma parte del equipo de Technology and Advance Solutions y trabajamos a diario con los equipos de User Experience (UX) y las áreas de desarrollo.

Te dedicarás a proyectos analíticos relacionados con el marketing digital, con un papel fundamental en el análisis de la información con el fin de optimizar los objetivos de negocio e IT de nuestros clientes. Proactividad,  con sensibilidad por la calidad del dato, gestión de proyectos y personas y que te encante extraer información, montar dashboards/reports y análisis de datos.
  Entre sus principales funciones y responsabilidades se encuentran:
  ·         Definir e implementar estrategia de analítica digital, identificación de audiencias, segmentos de usuarios para un análisis de datos preciso.

·         Uso de herramientas de Analítica Digital como Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics o Piwik/Matomo.

·         Análisis e interpretación de datos capturados en Webs y Apps.  

·         Uso y validación de tags y triggers en Tag Managers, como GTM, Tealium, Tag Commander, Adobe Launch, DTM.

·         Asegurar la calidad de la información capturada y propuesta de acciones de mejora.

·         Elaboración de dashboards e informes. Seguimiento y actualización de indicadores.

·         Apoyo a los equipos internos, tanto de tecnología como de Business, dando soporte a peticiones de reporting y análisis. Debe participar en el desarrollo de la hoja de ruta de las herramientas, roadmap, solicitando nuevas funciones y mejoras de capacidades.

·         Analizar la situación actual SEO de nuestros clientes y su competencia. Así como desarrollar un plan de acción para mejorar los resultados.

·         Realizar integraciones de herramientas como Google Analytics con otros sistemas como bases de datos propietarias, CRMs o ERPs.

·         Conceptualización e implementar de Tests A/B mediante herramientas como Google Optimize, Adobe Target, Optimizely.

·         Presentación de conclusiones a los equipos de negocio internos y clientes finales.

·         Impartición de formaciones.
  Aptitudes y conocimientos deseados:
  Experiencia demostrable en puestos similares, mínimo 3 años, se valora positivamente más de 5 años.
Perfil analítico, organizado, autónomo, orientado a solucionar problemas y detección de deficiencias, con atención a los detalles, proactivo y buen trabajador en equipo.
Haber utilizado herramientas de analítica web (google analytics, adobe analytics o piwik)
Capacidad para dimensionar y priorizar tareas.
Se valorará muy positivamente experiencia previa como desarrollador.
Se valorará muy positivamente experiencia previa como analista de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Se requiere conocimientos básicos de JavaScript para implementar Tags y  otros lenguages como  SQL, Phyton, o R para automatizar tareas de extracción y normalizado de datos.
Será valorable conocimientos de herramientas de BI (Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Qlikview/QlikSense)
Conocimientos de SEO (OnPage & OffPage). Se valora conocimientos de SEM y Digital Advertising
Capacidad para el perfilado de audiencias y personalización de contenidos con fines de CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) a través del testing y la optimización.
Idiomas: Inglés y español (ambos fluidos hablado y escrito)
Disponibilidad para viajar puntualmente.
    ¿Qué te ofrecemos?
  ·         Revisión anual de salario/categoría. Oportunidades de desarrollo y crecimiento dentro de la compañía.

·         Un entorno donde aprender y desarrollarse con planes de formación específicos y un plan de carrera individualizado.

·         Ambiente de trabajo excelente, que fomenta el compañerismo.

·         Retribución competitiva y Contrato indefinido.

·         La oportunidad de participar en grandes proyectos para grandes marcas nacionales e internacionales.

·         Formar parte de una consultora con un excelente ambiente de trabajo, un equipo joven y en unas oficinas modernas y creativas.

·         Nuestro principal activo son las personas que formamos la organización.
 Por ello, trabajamos para crear un entorno feliz de trabajo y promovemos el desarrollo personal y profesional. Creemos que esta es la mejor manera de conseguir nuestros retos.

Descripción:
As a Business Analyst you will provide accurate financial reporting in Spain & Portugal. You will manage and prepare month end management accounts and make accounting adjustments as required. You will integrate into each SBU leadership team and will become the main point of contact for all finance issues. Upon guidance from the GBFS Manager, and in partnership with EMEA SBU Analysts, produce annual budgets, control budget against actuals, and lead on the monthly forecasting processes. Work alongside the Market Director and Commercial Excellence Manager to improve business finance support to all SBUs within scope.

Key Responsibilities

Reporting
Collaborate in the monthly closing process and prepare the monthly reporting and interpret financial results against Profit Plan and Prior Year. Provide financial information in a form and content to drive business decisions
Drive initiatives to ensure financial reporting accuracy; Provide financial analysis to assess business investments
Implement standard reporting tools that will ensure an efficient analysis of performance; Support implementation of new IT tools or system as far as the financial aspects are concerned
Develop an ongoing approach of strong financial management working within the local teams. Understand business cost drivers in detail and collaborate with our BRNO Financial Center
Understand PPG Corporate reporting requirements and provide support to implement Corporate policies; ensure that accounting practices are aligned with PPG and SOX internal control requirements in a timely and correct manner; improve internal controls and internal processes
Help to build & maintain a well-adapted and controlled account reconciliation process with support of Brno (quarterly AA, monthly analysis, BS analysis etc); Perform quality check (audit) on balance sheet reconciliation.
Internal control & audit
Support interim, year-end US Gaaps & statutory audits as required, depending on annual scoping.
Support annual update of the AICC (PPG’s internal controls certification tool)
Other
Assist in implementation of projects and provide local support and drive cost reduction action plans
Supervise inventory monitoring, adjustments and annual physical inventory
Working with the credit organization with the scope to create further improvement in the main metrics focusing on underperforming areas


Qualifications

The position requires accounting experience, a strong finance background, a high degree of planning, analytical and interpersonal abilities.

Functional/Technical Skills & Knowledge
University degree in Finance with validated accounting background
Proven track record in Finance reporting and controlling
Proficient expertise in IT tools (e.g. Oracle, Access, Word, Excel, Hyperion)
Outstanding analytical skills in order to produce financial analysis on business performance.
Adaptability to change and drive continuous performance and efficiency improvements.
Proficient in English language
Flexible - Outstanding communication - Extraordinary Teammate
Willing to travel (below 20%)


About Us

Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.

PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™

Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company. The PPG Way

Descripción:
Description

Transportation Data Analyst - Barcelona
Work schedule will be Mon-Sun 5 days per week in 8-hour rotating

Do you want to learn how the most complex transportation network is managed on a daily basis?

Amazons business is focused on delighting our customers. We strive to stay agile from the second an order is placed online and throughout the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes. That can be described in one of our core Leadership Principles, which is Bias for Action. This means that our teams band together, roll up their sleeves, and aren’t content with just standing still. We’re aiming to become the most customer-centric company on Earth.

That’s why we’re seeking a Transportation Data analyst/logistic Scheduler with a passion for innovation, problem solving, and the ability to create world-class customer experiences.

You will…
As a logistics scheduler within the Central Operations team your role will focus on forecasting, scheduling and routing, playing a key role in our delivery stations operations. You will be responsible for executing daily forecasts, labour scheduling and routing, affecting tens of thousands of packages. This will be done through the use of tools and coordination within the station, you will be accountable for cost, customer experience, and delivery partner experience. In addition, you will be instrumental in developing best practices and standard work for the network. You will ensure that targets and service deadlines are met, according to regulatory requirements.
You will play a proactive role in written and verbal communication with various departments, as you maintain Amazon’s exceptionally high levels of service, both for our customers and suppliers. We need you to step back at strategic intervals to take in the bigger picture and to be comfortable conducting research into process improvement initiatives


Basic Qualifications
Experience of using several different software platforms combined with the ability to learn new ones quickly. Possess strong computer literacy skills
Data gathering and data analysis experience.
Microsoft Excel knowledge and use within a working environment to invent a solution/simplify a process, including the ability to understand and manage Excel data reports and performance metrics to drive business results.
Multi-tasking aptitude in a high demanding environment
Communicate to a highly competent level in written and spoken.Write emails and reports with correct grammar and in a professional tone
The use of KPIs and self-driven actions to improve
Team work and building high trust relationships with internal and external stakeholders
High affinity to numbers and Mathematics
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a Logistics or Transportation environment.
Working knowledge of SQL/Phyton/Tablau
If you are engaging, innovative, supportive, or a problem solver we want to hear from you!

Why Amazon? Since our beginnings in 1995, Amazon has been propelling the boundaries of possible further and further. Whether it’s exploring successful new business lines, advancing our technology and processes to get the very quickest delivery times for our customers or delivering record volumes, Amazon has achieved incredible feats in defining industries. Our journey to become the Earth’s most customer-centric company is one full of exciting innovation, pace and change. From the second an order is placed online to the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes, we strive to stay agile, fluid and intentional in what we do. Our employees move this business forward and hiring great people allows us to continually set records. Come and join us in building our future!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.
Amazon takes your personal data protection seriously and respects EU and local data protection laws. Unless you express otherwise, by submitting your CV you authorize the hiring Amazon company to store your personal data in the electronic database maintained by Amazon Corporate LLC. in the USA or one of its affiliates for the purpose of assessing your suitability for this and future job vacancies and to pursue your recruiting process. If at any time you want your personal data to be deleted, you simply need to notify the hiring Amazon company. Amazon will not share your personal data with any third party without your prior consent. As part of your interview process with Amazon you may be asked to authorize the hiring Amazon company to separately verify your application data and personal background through a third party service provider.
