Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Business Analyst for Glovo’s Partner Operations team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fastest growing startups of Barcelona - helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and provides data led insights to enable decision making process for the Project Management team
Act as an internal consultant to translate business questions into insights
Identify opportunities to improve dashboards, tools and data handling processes to improve productivity
Lead high priority program of reporting and insights for Partners
Liaise with the product and central BI team - you will play a central, pivotal role in building reliable sources for data and insights
Propose strategic changes to the way we track, maintain and use data


You Have
2-3 years of work experience as a business analyst
High Excel and SQL proficiency. Experience with Python/R is a plus
Demonstrated project management skills
Problem-solving attitude and ability to prioritize effectively with solid backing of data
Great communication skills and ability to influence different stakeholders
Fluency in English. Spanish is a plus but not mandatory


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we’re currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://jobs.glovoapp.com/en/careers

Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

The Opportunity

The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company.

In This Role, You’ll Get To
Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisation
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at developing conceptual and data-modelled frameworks to optimise business performance on the Supply-side
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiency


What You’ll Need To Succeed
A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics or Mathematics
A strong understanding of statistics and the underlying mathematics behind Machine Learning/ Deep Learning techniques
A basic understanding of computer science and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations


It’s Great If You Have
Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Master’s degree in Statistics, Operations Research, or Data Science

We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Telecomunicaciones
Descripción:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.

Data Engineer role

Introduction

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your role

To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions

Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise
Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution

Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations

Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.

A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.

Design the integration with legacy data sources.

Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.

Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.

Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts

Skills You Will Need

Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP.

SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL

NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB

Other database tools, e.g. SCADA

Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS

Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred)

Unix and Unix-like systems

Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud

Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio

Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA.

Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query

Puesto ofertado: Manager/Senior Manager, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Sector: Internet
Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

The Opportunity

As a Manager/Senior Manager, CRM you will be at the forefront of Agoda’s communication and engagement efforts. You will lead a team of 2 and own, plan and deliver large scale campaigns reaching millions of Customers, analyzing and leveraging rich datasets to build new innovative products and flows.

And on top of that you will be working with some of the smartest people in the industry not just in Marketing but also in Product, IT, Partner Services, etc.

This Role Is Good For You If You
Value independence and ownership: you will get goals and projects, not tasks
Have the ambition to make a difference: innovation and drive are necessary to succeed
Want to be a great coach: your contribution scales when you teach others
Are ready to challenge anything: data matter, not opinions, seniority or common knowledge


In This Role, You’ll Get To
Lead: you will work together with 2 Analyst/Campaign managers who will help you manage and execute on new ideas and projects, many of which cross-functional and that will require you to be the representative for Customer Marketing there.
Analyze: new ideas come from data and tests. Segment the userbase, understand their patterns, react to change in demand and identify new opportunities to deliver value.
Test: prove your findings by A/B testing changes to any of our communication products. Define your hypothesis, design the framework, launch the campaign, collect and analyze the results of large scale, quick delivery tests.
Innovate: Learn and develop new features, develop models we can use for optimization, build business cases for completely new implementations, and help us push the boundaries a little further every day.


What You’ll Need To Succeed
4+ years of Digital Marketing, Consulting or Strategy/Business Operations experience
Ability to communicate fluently in English
At least a basic understanding of SQL
Good numerical reasoning skills
Intellectual curiosity


It’s Great If You Have
At least 1-2 years of people management experience
Experience in the Travel space and/or in a CRM function
Master’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative or marketing subject (statistics, engineering, digital marketing, financial modelling, etc.)

Sector: Equipos informáticos Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Job Purpose:
To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.
Responsibilities:
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.

Cultural Competency Requirements:

Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a creative problem solver to join our Barcelona HQ. Working in the Global Supply Excellence team you will be focused on improving courier quality and behaviours. You will be the one to deep dive into the operational issues and processes, understand the root causes and come up with solutions to help couriers get the most out of the platform, while delivering the best customer and partner experience. Your responsibilities will also include finding scalable approaches to automate tasks, in a way that they can remain adaptable to local needs and practices, while minimising manual work. This role will require an ability to think outside of the box when normal methods don’t work to complete a task. The knowledge and previous experience working with automation and programming languages such as Python, SQL, JavaScript are highly desirable.

The Global Supply Excellence team is at the center of working with regional and local operations and Glovo product teams, which will give you a chance to learn a lot about various aspects of Glovo business and make a difference. We are looking for curiosity and desire to continuously improve our platform.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Deep dive into Glovo operational metrics and processes to understand behavioural patterns of the couriers and the areas for improvement
Build the operational tools and design processes from scratch
Run A/B tests fast and smartly to get new insights
Be in touch with our Data/Tech team to request and implement new product features
Make good use of internal data to build dashboards that measure and track the impact of your actions
Roll out the tools you build to different markets, adapting them to local need


You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
2-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role: operations preferred
Excellent SQL skills
Redshift experience is highly valued.
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analysing experiments (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Strong analytical knowledge and experience with reporting, driving insights, and data-driven optimisation
You are able to act as an owner / lead for large scale and complex data analysis projects that impact global, strategic business roadmaps & operations
Hands-on: you are willing to get your hands dirty and are looking to bring your ideas to life and find a way to get things done
You have an amazing attention to detail and a great appetite to learn
You have strong organisational skills, ability to prioritise and multitask, work well under pressure, handle multiple issues simultaneously in a dynamic environment
Good communication skills: you are able to manage various stakeholders and know how to structure the information
Strong drive for continuous improvement
Proficiency in English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of 2020, we’re currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://jobs.glovoapp.com/en/careers

Descripción:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.

Data Scientist role:

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital technologies. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your Goals

Your objective would be to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of predictive process control

Your role will require the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline

Develop innovative thought leadership and contribute to the creation of points of view on re-usable models in Supply Chain.

Key Responsibilities

Responsible for the development of predictive models and the generation of data-driven insights to solve industrial problems or challenges.

You’ll be responsible for development, training and validation of mentioned models, and the visualization of the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.

Manage and manipulate data sets, including: variables definition, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business needs.

Outline and structure the project tasks and best approach, along with team senior members, from the detailed understanding of client’s problem statement and their specific business requirements.

Provide specific training and guidance to development factory to ensure data integration activities around base and feature-enriched tables align with the analytical models.

Develop and maintain analytical models.

Demonstrate a high degree of ownership, accountability for your output and commitment to the task.

Mentor and train junior developers and modelers.

Support Management team on client proposals and other sales activities.

Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with offshore development teams and provide guidance to ensure quality deliverables.

Skills you will need:

You should have working knowledge of process data visualization, statistics/statistical testing, machine learning, data mining, and database structure and management.

Passion in statistical analysis.

Critical thinking and attention to detail.

Statistical analysis/programming in tools like R, SAS, PYTHON, SCADA, Spark, MATLAB, Tensor Flow, Torch, Caffe, Excel, CNTK.

Knowledge of full life cycle development methodologies

Descripción:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.

Data Engineer role

Introduction

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your role

To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions

Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise
Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution

Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations

Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.

A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.

Design the integration with legacy data sources.

Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.

Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.

Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts

Skills You Will Need

Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP.

SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL

NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB

Other database tools, e.g. SCADA

Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS

Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred)

Unix and Unix-like systems

Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud

Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio

Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA.

Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
As Global JR Business Analyst, you will be part of the Glovo Brand Marketing Services, which provides a suite of services designed to help Glovo's most strategic cpg brand-s. Your priority will be to work close to local teams in order to unlock growth of local BMS revenues. In addition, you will be responsible for the usage optimization of our assets.


You Have
Support “Global BMS Manager” on global deals with no Brand Specialist (close deals and coordinate execution).
Develop tools which optimize local operations (example: Data studio reporting)
Support smaller markets
Help to develop global templates for best practices sharing across markets.
Follow up on main KPIs of the department

Analytical skills

Ability to communicate efficiently both internally and externally

Description

Logistics Planner - Barcelona
Work schedule will be Mon-Sun 5 days per week in 8-hour rotating Morning-Afternoon.

Do you want to learn how the most complex transportation network is managed on a daily basis?

Amazons business is focused on delighting our customers. We strive to stay agile from the second an order is placed online and throughout the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes. That can be described in one of our core Leadership Principles, which is Bias for Action. This means that our teams band together, roll up their sleeves, and aren’t content with just standing still. We’re aiming to become the most customer-centric company on Earth.

That’s why we’re seeking a Transportation Data analyst/logistic Scheduler with a passion for innovation, problem solving, and the ability to create world-class customer experiences.

You will…
As a logistics scheduler within the Central Operations team your role will focus on forecasting, scheduling and routing, playing a key role in our delivery stations operations. You will be responsible for executing daily forecasts, labour scheduling and routing, affecting tens of thousands of packages. This will be done through the use of tools and coordination within the station, you will be accountable for cost, customer experience, and delivery partner experience. In addition, you will be instrumental in developing best practices and standard work for the network. You will ensure that targets and service deadlines are met, according to regulatory requirements.
You will play a proactive role in written and verbal communication with various departments, as you maintain Amazon’s exceptionally high levels of service, both for our customers and suppliers. We need you to step back at strategic intervals to take in the bigger picture and to be comfortable conducting research into process improvement initiatives


Basic Qualifications
Experience of using several different software platforms combined with the ability to learn new ones quickly. Possess strong computer literacy skills
Data gathering and data analysis experience.
Microsoft Excel knowledge and use within a working environment to invent a solution/simplify a process, including the ability to understand and manage Excel data reports and performance metrics to drive business results.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a Logistics or Transportation environment.
Working knowledge of SQL/Phyton/Tableau
Multi-tasking aptitude in a high demanding environment
Communicate to a highly competent level in written and spoken.Write emails and reports with correct grammar and in a professional tone
The use of KPIs and self-driven actions to improve
Team work and building high trust relationships with internal and external stakeholders
High affinity to numbers and Mathematics
If you are engaging, innovative, supportive, or a problem solver we want to hear from you!

Why Amazon? Since our beginnings in 1995, Amazon has been propelling the boundaries of possible further and further. Whether it’s exploring successful new business lines, advancing our technology and processes to get the very quickest delivery times for our customers or delivering record volumes, Amazon has achieved incredible feats in defining industries. Our journey to become the Earth’s most customer-centric company is one full of exciting innovation, pace and change. From the second an order is placed online to the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes, we strive to stay agile, fluid and intentional in what we do. Our employees move this business forward and hiring great people allows us to continually set records. Come and join us in building our future!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.
Amazon takes your personal data protection seriously and respects EU and local data protection laws. Unless you express otherwise, by submitting your CV you authorize the hiring Amazon company to store your personal data in the electronic database maintained by Amazon Corporate LLC. in the USA or one of its affiliates for the purpose of assessing your suitability for this and future job vacancies and to pursue your recruiting process. If at any time you want your personal data to be deleted, you simply need to notify the hiring Amazon company. Amazon will not share your personal data with any third party without your prior consent. As part of your interview process with Amazon you may be asked to authorize the hiring Amazon company to separately verify your application data and personal background through a third party service provider.


Company - Amazon Road Transport Spain, S

Reporting to Global Head of Customer Experience (CX), you will be part of a small A-team of super-achievers, aiming to deconstruct, synthesize, and deploy initiatives to drive best-in-class customer experience. Ownership and Responsibilities will be given to you since Day 1. You will be 'thrown' at different tasks and problems that are identified as key areas for improvement that affects customer happiness. The team is by nature cross-functional, so most of the time and energy are spent collaborating with multiple departments from Operations and Customer Service to Finance and Tech. Specifically this role will require a heavy collaboration with the Growth team for consumer/market research.

Translate business needs to insightful analyses for the Customer Experience team to make the right decision

Problem-solving attitude, great communication and stakeholder management skills
Entrepreneurial drive and the ability to achieve goals in a fast paced environment complete your profile
Curiosity by nature, have great attention to detail, and have the attitude and aptitude to make things better

Data Analyst

Barcelona / Farmacéutico / Full-time

Te gustaría formar parte de una Multinacional en pleno proceso de transformación digital?

Estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst con experiencia previa para su Headquarter en Barcelona, que se encargará de contribuir a la compañía a través del análisis de datos para la optimización del negocio digital.

PUESTO DE TRABAJO

Localización. Barcelona

Responsabilidades
Extracción de información para estudios y análisis (Matching diferentes BBDD, limpieza y depuración datos, selección indicadores para el análisis).
Análisis de datos y tratamiento estadístico de BBDD.
Aplicación de modelos de machine learning (clúster, predictivos, estadísticos, de relación).
Elaboración de informes y conclusiones estratégicas.
Que Buscamos
Grado en ingeniería, matemáticas, estadística o similar.
Experiencia mínima demostrable de 2 años en posición de analista digital.
Inglés avanzado.
Dominio avanzado de Google Analytics.
Experiencia en Google Tag Manager.
Dominio de lenguaje SQL.
Experiencia en creación y mantenimiento de dashboards/reports con Tableau, Data Studio o similares.
Capacidad de hacer QA de etiquetados mediante data layer.
Experiencia con algún lenguaje de programación orientada a datos. Deseable Python.
QUE OFRECEMOS
Formar parte de una empresa dinámica, certificada como TOP EMPLOYEE.
Paquete retributivo competitivo y beneficios sociales.
Fecha prevista de incorporación. Febrero 20121
Jornada. Completa

Nombre: Nerea Madrid

About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day. We currently deliver over +100M annual orders and operate in 22 countries, and in over +300 cities.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for a world-class Data & Operations Research Analyst to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

The Matching team is responsible for improving time efficiency for our couriers, while guaranteeing low delivery times for our customers. The team leverages machine learning, combinatorial mathematics, and operations research techniques to build services that make smart matching decisions and minimize the staleness of the fleet.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Work closely with product managers and engineering teams to define, monitor, and provide visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Optimize and tune new product’s features to improve team performance and Glovo’s KPIs using mathematical optimization and simulation techniques.
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions.
Generate, prototype, and execute on ideas for product discovery to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions.
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics


You Have
Background studies in Engineering, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, Computer Science, or Mathematics (MSc is preferred)
2-4 years of experience in mathematical optimization (metaheuristics, linear optimization, constraint programming, etc) and discrete-event simulation would be very beneficial
Ability to manipulate and analyze large amount of data, using analytical tools such as: Python, R, Julia (knowledge in SQL is desired)
Ability to communicate and present complex ideas to stakeholders and get buy-in thanks to ability to understand business needs.
Ability to juggle multiple strands of work and priorities on complex projects.
Fluent spoken and written English

About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Would you rather read numbers than books? Are you looking for a challenging experience in one of Barcelona’s fastest growing Startups – helping build a product that will disrupt the on-demand market? If your answer is YES, we are looking forward to meeting you.

The primary purpose and function of the Senior Analyst is to act as Workday subject matter expert and HR processes designer, to lead Workday system configuration, enhancement, and deployment efforts. Additionally, this individual will serve as the liaison between Tier 1 team and third party vendors for other HR applications (e.g. Greenhouse).

The Senior Analyst will demonstrate HR systems maintenance experience as well as proficiency in analytics and reporting, processes analysis and design, and configuration.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Be Glovo’s HR Process and Technology expert in order to build scalable HR tools that will address all our business & employees’ needs.
Configure, enhance, and support selected Workday modules, e.g. Core HR, Performance Management, Onboarding, Compensation, Learning.
Maintain and administer Workday security groups.
Partner closely with business and Tier 1 team to understand system end-user needs and provide recommendations to keep Workday processes simple and efficient.
Take ownership of reporting of KPIs by creating customised tools or using the available ones.
Ensure these tools are scalable and up-to-date.
A/B test the launch of new features.
Conduct and/or support continuous improvement projects.
Provide end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitor reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identify potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.
Work closely with other team members to brainstorm, strategize and complete ad hoc requests creatively, effectively and efficiently.
Design and document HR processes (Process Flows, SOPs, Job Aides).
Build Training materials and train users on Workday and HR processes.


You Have
At least 3 years of experience with configuring and maintaining HRIS/HCM system, with focus point on Workday.
Experience in designing and documenting HR processes.
Bachelor degree in quantitative field and/or human resources.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Detail-oriented thinking, exhibiting strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Team spirit by contributing valuable ideas and feedback.
Ease in working with ambiguity, shifting priorities and rapid change.
Ability to work with sensitive employee data, maintaining confidentiality in all situations with a keen eye for detail, quality and accuracy.
Proficiency in English.
Workday Certification & API experience as a strong plus.

Sector: Equipos informáticos Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Job Purpose:
To support the IPP Analyst team in maintaining and strengthening trading relationships with all relevant vendors and with Product Marketing to obtain competitive advantage for Tech Data via professional inventory planning and procurement.
Responsibilities:
Placing orders based on profiles produced by the IPP Analyst team taking into account any logistics efficiency requirements (i.e. pallet, layer, carton etc.).
Back to back ordering of products with no established run rate.
Place direct ship purchase orders on vendors. To check order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates and to invoice customers on receipt of proof of shipment or delivery.
Ensure that all purchase orders raised are within authorised and agreed sign off limits.
Check vendor order confirmations for correct product, quantity, pricing and delivery dates, and updating system (SAP) accordingly.
Expedite all open orders to maximise customer satisfaction and take responsibility for highest degree of due date accuracy in SAP. Supporting texts to be added if necessary for POD (proof of delivery) requests and queries.
To assist the IPP Analyst team with vendor price changes by ensuring correct cost prices are reflected within SAP.
Stock Rotation: a) request authorisation reference from the vendor for either contractual or negotiated terms within prescribed timescales b) once reference obtained, raise Return to Vendor quotation order and record on central database c) validate all stock is returned to vendor in accordance with RMA.
Support IPP Analyst team in resolution of Logistics (primarily Goods In) and Finance queries within prescribed timescales.
To work within set policies and procedures and to continually review and update where necessary.
To own and manage through until completion, any ad hoc projects as defined by IPP Management.
Provide high level of service, support and accuracy to the IPP team
To consistently achieve set targets
Represent Tech Data at all times in an efficient and professional manner
Deliver maximum stock availability, minimise customer backlog and inventory depreciation costs, whilst maintaining stock levels in line with our key performance indicators.
Provide a first class and high availability stock profile (best in Group/IT distribution) with justified commercial risk and cost.
Knowledge Skills and Experience
Effective communication with internal & external partners
Must be proactive and self-motivated
Strong attention to detail
Ability to organise and prioritise daily routine to support a rapidly changing environment
Solid working knowledge of current IT technologies
Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word) and inventory replenishment systems (SAP R3) would be advantageous.
Commercial and financial acumen - to balance inventory value and recovery margin.
Good analytical skills - to analyse data and take appropriate action.
Must have a focused, pro-active and committed attitude - to set and achieve action plans.
Sound knowledge of basic purchasing and inventory principles and practices.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Business Analyst – Partner Programs (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Sector: Internet
Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

Partner Programs and Display Network is fast growing and dynamic team within Strategic Partnerships department of Agoda. The team is responsible for developing and scaling a range of marketing solutions for accommodation partners focusing on growth, visibility and conversion, as well as advertising and display marketing solutions for businesses and travel organizations. The team scope includes business development and sales, project management, trainings, contracting operations, risk assessment and collections operations, product development work and data analytics.

The Opportunity

Business Analysts in the Partner Programs team play an integral part by supporting decisions and projects with actionable data insights, reports and tools used by thousands of account managers and business development managers, as well as hotels worldwide.

In This Role, You’ll Get To
Performance tracking and modeling: Analyze data generated by supply and supply teams, develop models we can use for performance tracking and optimization, draw recommendations on your analysis.
Support and participation in projects: Provide input on initiatives to reach business targets of the strategic projects you will be working on, run and then assess your proposed actions in collaboration with the relevant teams
Building tools: Create and deliver dashboards, automated reports, calculators and data feeds to optimize and improve processes related to our products and operations


What You’ll Need To Succeed
Minimum 2 yearsof experience working in business analysis / data analytics / business intelligence/ consulting or financial modelling roles in e-commerce, tech, consulting or financial services companies
Bachelor’s Degree or higher from a top university in a business analytics, engineering, statistics, quantitative, data or finance subject (e.g., BI, science, math or financial analysis)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Familiarity with SQL, Tableau, advanced Excel skills, which you were using on real work projects before.
Proven track record in using data to measure performance, build reports and tools and make decisions
Intellectual curiosity, ability to learn fast
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced/rapidly changing environment


It’s Great If You Have
Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality
Master’s degree in statistics, operations research, or data science

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Cook Room is our delivery-only kitchen vertical: we provide a shared-kitchen infrastructure solution to our partner restaurants to expand their operations fast and lean and make delicious and diverse types of cuisines available for our customers!

As a result of our growth, we are looking for a Cook Room Business Analyst that will support us in growing this exciting vertical! The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented and analytical, and be passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship.

Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing Start-ups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people´s day-to-day and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Analyse our vertical performance in growth and profitability
Analyse our partners performance and happiness
Identify growth opportunities within our existent cook rooms and in new markets
Assist in the launching of new pilots with other teams
Assist in building tools and insights to help our local teams grow cook room faster
Get to know the market and our customers in detail and thus have comprehensive information on trends, opportunities and challenges


You Have
1-2 years of work experience leading analysis and turning insights into actions
Strong business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management
Strategic and 360 mindset
Hands-on attitude: you’ll have to roll up your sleeves!
Strong project management skills
Ability to think big
Excel proficiency


Nice-to-haves
Experience in setting up strategy and growth models for new businesses
Passionate about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Ability to influence stakeholders


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

As of 2020, we’re currently present in more than 22 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You’ll Get To
Take ownership of analytical projects end to end from extracting and exploring data, generating hypothesis, building a structured analysis, and rigorously evaluating methods and results
Provide analytical and valuable insights for decision-making support for key projects and management
Work closely with various business functions to identify opportunities, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using different techniques and tools such as R studio or Tableau
Communicate findings and propose actionable recommendations to address the problems


What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Statistics/Math or Engineering or Economics and Finance
5+ years in Data Analyst position or otherwise in projects involving big data
People management and strong commercial acumen
Proficient in business intelligence tools and data warehouse i.e. SQL, Tableau and MS Excel
Must be data savvy and love crunching numbers
Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations
Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)


It’s Great If You Have
Experience in R studio, data modeling, hypothesis testing is a plus

Sector: Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información Internet
Descripción:
Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to help Amazon Search NLP to build an Search evaluation data set. It is a short (5-month) full-time job starting ASAP. We are looking for an individual interested in search and search relevance (quality), with the patience to analyze hundreds of queries and search results, and with the ingenuity to propose new leads. The work is likely to lead to a publication and the creation of a public dataset, which could be well cited. Basic coding and data manipulation skills are required, as well as some experience analyzing data qualitatively and English writing skills. Background in IR theory or ML is not necessary.

A Typical Day May Consist Of
Manually Evaluate queries and query search results, annotating them with information about query types, relevance, issues, etc.
Write simple Python notebook code to sample data, to compute evaluation metrics, etc.
Write documentation describing the datasets and their statistics.
Design new experiments, query types, and mechanisms for sampling and evaluating.
The Search NLP team is responsible for developing and deploying state of the art machine learning and NLP models to extract semantic information from product search queries, item descriptions, reviews, and many other sources of information created by millions of Amazon customers each day. You will be working alongside world-class scientists and engineers to build next generation search systems.

Amazon Science (www.amazon.science) gives you insight into the company’s approach to customer-obsessed scientific innovation. Amazon fundamentally believes that scientific innovation is essential to being the most customer-centric company in the world. It’s the company’s ability to have an impact at scale that allows us to attract some of the brightest minds in artificial intelligence and related fields. Our scientists continue to publish, teach, and engage with the academic community, in addition to utilizing our working backwards method to enrich the way we live and work.


Basic Qualifications
M.S. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics or a related quantitative field
1+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis for large scale applications
1+ years hands-on experience in Python, Perl, Scala, Java, C#, C++ or other similar languages
Experience in designing experiments and statistical analysis of results.
Superior verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
Ability to convey mathematical results to non-science stakeholders. Strength in clarifying and formalizing complex problems.
Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D. (or enroled in PhD program) in Search, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field.
1+ years of practical industry experience in Search, Data Analysis, or Information Retrieval.
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing architectural concepts and algorithms,
A passion for innovation
Excellent critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present your beliefs clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form.

#nichetechESP

Sector: Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
The purpose of Zurich is...

What are we looking for?

You will join the Data & Analytics team, consisting of data scientists who are passionate about building cutting edge solutions to solve real-world business challenges.

Leverage data to develop innovative models using latest machine learning & advanced analytics techniques.
Ensure data quality through data cleaning.
Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data to highlight patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
Work with business stakeholders to understand the business needs, develop and defend actionable solutions to business challenges.
Communicate results and solutions to diverse audience across the organization, within the Spanish Business Unit and at Global level.
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: forecasting, A/B testing, customer analytics (churn prediction, cross sell), personalization & recommender design, fraud detection, graph analytics, text analytics, image recognition.

What do we need?

At least 2 years relevant data-intensive project/ industry experience as a data scientist.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying analytical solutions; experience in deploying analytical solutions in Cloud (AWS) would be considered a plus.
Detailed knowledge of statistical and predictive modelling concepts and disciplines.
Academic experience, preferably at Master level, in one or more of the following areas: Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Finance, or other data/math intensive field.
Proven track record of programming in Python.
Knowledge of ML libraries: sklearn, pandas, pyspark, nltk, different OCRs, web APIs, MLOps practices is considered a plus.
Fluent Spanish and English are fundamental pre-requisites and international experience is considered a plus.
Highly collaborative working style.
Strong drive for excellence.
Proactive.
Good communication skills. Ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely.

For being from zurich

At Zurich we want to take care of you and these are some of your benefits:

Flexible compensation.
Restaurant card.
Home office voucher.
Flexwork: 20 hours a week to work where and when you want.
Pension plan - Life insurance.
Bank and insurance offer.
Discount in gyms.
Zurich Wellness, sports activities.
Zurich Sports Club, free registration for marathons and popular races.
Free English classes.

About Us

Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You would give them confidence and peace of mind by protecting what they love the most. It is a great challenge, but you will have the support of a great international team that is ready to help you so that you can reach your full potential and thus fulfill our promises. We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us?

"Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer"

Zurich Insurance has and applies an equal employment opportunity policy. Our goal is to attract and retain the best professionals without discriminating on disability, race, nationality, religion, gender, sexual orientation or age.

Sector: Software
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Julia Abad Castelló
Talent Acquisition Specialist en WIRIS
Enviar mensaje InMail
We are WIRIS, a software development company founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Barcelona with offices in the USA, Long Beach (California) since we acquired Design Science company in 2017. We are currently more than 60 people doing what we like, with deep knowledge in advanced technology and science.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named as “The Makers of MathType”, revolutionizing the educational field with innovative methods. In spite of the recent global pandemic, we’re continuously growing and keep developing new products and continually improving our value proposition for a global audience.
 Our Business Intelligence team is growing and we are looking for a Data Engineer to be responsible for expanding our data pipelines, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The right candidate will be a person who’s able to understand the business, and is able to provide solutions.
 Key Responsibilities
Collect, process, and clean data from different sources to be stored in our data lake
Design, implement and maintain scalable ETL data pipelines using cloud technologies that produce reliable insights
Design and develop visualizations and dashboards to support business analysis 
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related problems and support their data / information needs.

Experience with serverless (Lambda, Glue) technologies (AWS solutions in particular)
Experience of Git, GitHub actions (or other CI/CD solutions) and Docker 
Experience working with modern BI tools (like Quicksight and Tableau)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills

Competitive salary + optional flex salary plan

JOB

Koalaboox is a fast growing FinTech developing over Europe with > 40 employees. Since 2012, we offer a SaaS platform allowing small business owners to manage their business while providing a seamless financing solution.
 With > 400 Mio € financing volume / year, Koalaboox invoice financing solution is one of the most efficient worldwide. All credit decisions are instant and automated.
 Koalaboox is recruiting a junior data scientist to integrate its credit risk & modelling team. Reporting to the head of credit risk you will be tasked with analytical problems to explore and solve, related with the business and operations at Koalaboox. In addition, you will have the opportunity to be directly involved in model development and model monitoring using on our machine learning framework. 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 Understand the business and identify points of interest to study and explore analytically using the analytical tool in place. 
Participate on ETL/data structures’ development to support analytical studies and model development. 
Master the machine learning platform in place to ensure model’s performance follow-up. 
Identify new statistical or analytical methods and keep in touch with news from the scientific community. 

 YOUR PROFILE
 Background in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science or similar. 
Experience in predictive model’s development and analytical studies. 
Experience in SAS will be preferable (Python experience will also be considered a plus). 
Autonomous and proficient, being rigorous in the work delivered. 
Fluent in english (french will be a plus). 

 OUR OFFER
 Integration in a smart company with great environment, strongly oriented for fintech and innovative products. 
To be directly involved in a machine learning end-to-end process allowing to gain full experience on the subject. 
Participate in internal projects and developments having direct influence on Koalaboox’s business and result. 
Attractive salary according with experience.

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors from some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel industry.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion—by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

In spite of the ongoing global pandemic, we’re continuously growing and adapting to the situation. We’re turning lemons into lemonade—because we’re innovators. We’ve even developed TravelCare, our very own travel risk management tool, to ensure business travelers are safe and sound before, during, and after their trips. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.


What You Need
Data engineering or Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English.
Excellent analytical skills.


You Will Need To Prove The Following
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)
Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data: ETL processes (i.e. Pentaho Data Integration).
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker).
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals.


What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain, 25 in the UK or Germany
Flexibility to work from home most of the time.
Health perks, these vary depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Perks such as language lessons, yoga and office food have been put on hold during Covid-19 and will be reviewed


Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in.
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain, UK or Germany for this position.
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona, London or Berlin twice per week.
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event.
We have core working hours.
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!


We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.
