Sector: Software Internet Videojuegos
Descripción:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!

Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist in our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.
What are we looking for?
3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
And you are ...
A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn’t stopped us from offering these great benefits!

You’ll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser ’s for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
“An apple a day keeps the doctor away” so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for world-class Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical models
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time series analysis & forecasting, A/B testing, customer analytics, personalisation & recommender design as well as operational research & optimisation
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics
Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing amongst others


You Have
Research and development experience in industry or academia. Holds at least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisation
Experience working with large data sets will be a plus
Python and/or R experience;; can independently prototype solutions to problems
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Scala and Spark) and AWS is desirable
Command line skills
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novices
Fluent spoken and written English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Descripción:
Job Description

Can be based in either Barcelona or Madrid

Understands complex and critical business problems from a variety of stakeholders and business functions, formulate integrated analytical approach to mine data sources, employ statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to contribute solving unmet medical needs, discover actionable insights and automate process for reducing effort and time for repeated use. High agility to be able to work across various business domains. Integrate business presentations, smart visualization tools and contextual storytelling to translate findings back to business users with a clear impact. Independently set strategy, manage budget, ensuring appropriate staffing and coordinating projects within the area supervised. -If managing a team: empowers the team and provides guidance and coaching, with limited guidance from more senior managers.

Your responsibilities:
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Innovate by transforming the way to solve a problem using Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
Articulates solutions/recommendations to business users. Presents analytical content concisely and effectively to non-technical audiences and influences non-analytical business leaders to drive major strategic decisions basis analytical inputs.
Coordinates, prioritize and efficiently allocates the team resources to critical initiatives: plans resources proactively, anticipates and actively manages change, sets stakeholder expectations as required, identifies operational risks and enable the team to drives is -sues to resolution, balances multiple priorities and minimizes surprise escalations
Collaborates with internal stakeholders, external partners and Institutions and cross -functional teams to solve critical business problems, propose operational efficiencies and innovative approaches.
Proactively evaluates the need of technology and novel scientific software, visualization tools and new approaches to computation to increase efficiency and quality of the Novartis data sciences practices
Provides agile consulting, guidance and non -standard exploratory analysis for unplanned urgent problem
Independently identifies research articles and reproduce/apply methodology to Novartis business problems
Publishes in peer reviewed journals, helps organizing sessions at external professional conferences and contributes to cross


Minimum Requirements

Descripción:
Empresa startup ganadora de numerosos premios nacionales e internacionales, que lo está, literalmente petando, cuyo producto es un Marketplace que, a parte de serlo en un sector innovador, ha solucionado y ha tenido un impacto social muy positivo. El equilibrio perfecto entre una gran idea disruptiva y el bien que hace a su sector.
Actualmente buscan un Data Engineer para ser el owner del desarrollo del Data Lake, Data Warehouse, aportando los mejores métodos y de la mejor forma para la ingestión de datos. Desarrollar las herramientas y frameworks útiles para conectar el equipo de Data con el de IT, construyendo pipelines escalables y, al mismo tiempo, haciendo uso de diferentes tecnologías. (esto no parece decir mucho más que cualquier otra oferta, verdad? Pero ahora sigo)
Equipo: Estarás trabajando con otros 3 data analyst, la head de data, y en estrecha colaboración con el DevOps y el equipo IT.

El must de stack: Actualmente están migrando todo su data stack a Google Cloud (Bigquery, Composer). Pero, conocedores de que no es tan común el expertise de esta herramienta en el mercado (aunque cada vez se usa más), estarían buscando a alguien que venga de AWS (Redshift y demás) así como Airflow, y tampoco una excesiva seniority, porque la idea es que tenga los fundamentos y dentro de la empresa poder formarse y crecer. A destacar que como Benefit ellos tienen suscripción a una famosa plataforma de aprendizaje, así como tienen asignado tiempo semanal, en horario laboral, para formarse.
Softskills: Ambiente increíble, dicho por varios miembros del equipo, ya que los conocemos desde hace tiempo. Buscarían a alguien dinámico, que le mole el ecosistema startup, y no le de miedo lanzarse a la piscina a aprender cosas nuevas y últimas tecnologías.
Y esto no es todo, además de un paquete de benefits al que habría que añadir mucho team building, y clases de idiomas, se añade su política 100% remote friendly (aunque restringido por ahora a las personas en el mismo huso horario que España), por lo que, si así lo quieres, y más allá del COVID, puedes continuar trabajando desde tu casa, la cafetería o un lugar paradisíaco de la costa ?
Challengue + la leche de compañía + gran ambiente laboral + 100% remote + muchas más cosas.
Cuál es el salario máximo que ofrecen por esta ganga de oportunidad? 45.000 € bruto/anual
Si te ha interesado lo más mínimo, aplica y te contaré más.

Eurecat Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña

CATALÀ

Eurecat, Centre Tecnològic de Catalunya (membre de Tecnio), aplega l’experiència de més de 650 professionals i dóna servei a més de 1.700 empreses. R+D aplicat, més de 200 projectes realitzats, serveis tecnològics, formació d’alta especialització, consultoria tecnològica, 88 patents, 7 spin-ofss i esdeveniments professionals són alguns dels serveis que Eurecat ofereix tant per a grans com per a petites i mitjanes empreses de tots els sectors. El valor afegit que aporta Eurecat accelera la innovació, disminueix la despesa en infraestructures científiques i tecnològiques, redueix els riscos i proporciona coneixement especialitzat a mida de cada empresa.

CASTELLANO

Eurecat, Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña (miembro de Tecnio), aglutina la experiencia de más de 650 profesionales y presta servicio a más de 1.700 empresas. I+D aplicado, más de 200 proyectos realizados, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica, 88 patentes, 7 spin-off y eventos profesionales son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa.

ENGLISH

Eurecat, Technology Centre of Catalonia (member of Tecnio), brings together the expertise of 650 professionals and serving more than a 1.700 companies. Applied R + D, more than 200 projects, technological services, highly specialized training, 88 patents, 7 spin-offs, technology consulting and professional events are some of the services that Eurecat offers for both small and medium-sized companies of all sectors. The added value provided by Eurecat accelerates innovation, decreases spending on scientific and technological infrastructures, reduces risks and provides specialized knowledge to each company.

Descripción de la oferta

Eurecat desea incorporar a su equipo de BIG DATA ANALYTICS:

DATA SCIENTIST

Funciones y Responsabilidades
Participación en diferentes proyectos de innovación con componentes de ciencia de datos centrados en diferentes casos de uso y sectores (principalmente: comercio minorista, turismo, transporte, administración electrónica).
Desarrollar tareas de procesamiento, limpieza y verificación de la integridad de los conjuntos de datos.
Realizar análisis ad-hoc y presentar los resultados de forma clara.
Diseñar, implementar y probar algoritmos ML/DL.
Apoyar al personal de desarrollo de negocio con ofertas a clientes.

Experiencia en técnicas y algoritmos de aprendizaje automático, como k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.

ETL,
aseguramiento de la calidad de datos y software,
herramientas de visualización,

Descripción:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000 tutors with 80,000 monthly learners from all over the world.

Founded in 2012 and backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalised learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving our products and user experience.

As part of this role, you’ll study and understand user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences
Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behavior and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards


What We Are Looking For
Experience as an in-house Data Scientist or Data Analyst. At least 3 years' experience, ideally more
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Experience with A/B testing frameworks
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must


Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)


What We Offer
Competitive salary according to candidate’s experience
Join a top talented team with a strong data mindset from all over the world
Easy-to-reach location in the city centre
Monthly allowance to learn new languages on Preply.com
Possibility to become a part of a truly big story at the start of its development


Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We’re obsessed with our customer’s problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.


Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Sector: Software Marketing y publicidad Videojuegos
Descripción:
Who we are:

Chartboost is the leading in-app monetization and programmatic advertising platform. We reach a mobile audience of over 900 million monthly unique users globally and process over 200 billion ad requests. The Chartboost SDK is the highest-integrated independent mobile ad SDK and through the Chartboost Exchange, Ad Network, DSP and other services, we empower mobile app developers to build businesses, while connecting advertisers to highly engaged audiences. We’re rapidly growing and looking for passionate people to expand our team in Barcelona.

About the job:

We are seeking world-class data pipeline engineers to join our team, helping us build and maintain a data platform that supports diverse uses — including data analysis, exploration, aggregation, and external & internal APIs — delivering significant value to our game developers, advertisers and internal clients.

In this role you are expected to be comfortable working to high standards as a professional data engineer, dealing with huge amounts of business-critical data (hundreds of TBs), and to contribute across a full spectrum of responsibilities from architecture to ops.
Our stack currently includes Spark, Presto, Qubole, EMR, Cloudera, Hive, Kafka, Airflow, Scala, Python, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Spinnaker, and Kubernetes, running in AWS. You will also have opportunities to join us in exploring new technologies and use them to design, deploy and operate highly performant systems. 

As part of a startup you will be a key player in our small, nimble, internationally-distributed team and drive significant impact all across the company's data technology and business.

What you’ll do:

Develop high-quality reliable data pipelines that convert data streams into valuable information
Design, implement and deploy both real time and batch data processing pipelines for internal and external customers
Develop tools to monitor, debug, analyze and operate our data infrastructure
Design and implement data technologies that can scale for hundreds of millions of users
Collaborate with our product and business teams to deliver valuable new features and functions

Who you are:

2+ years of professional experience in data engineering environments
2+ years of experience with SQL and programming in any of Python / Java / Scala or similar HLL
Experience with data pipelines in Spark/Hive processing larger than 10TB of data is a plus
Experience working in cloud environments, ideally with AWS/EMR
Strong experience in improving performance of queries and data jobs and scaling the system for exponential growth in data volumes and traffic
Expert debugging skills and enthusiasm for automation to deliver high-quality reliable systems
Comfortable with modern development tools such as Git and Confluence and working in a distributed agile team environment with both high autonomy and regular collaboration
BS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent experience

What we offer:

Incredible work environment, drawing from the best elements of the Barcelona and Bay Area tech scenes
Competitive salary
Stock options after 1 year of employment
Healthy snacks, coffee and cool office space in the center of Barcelona near the subway
Private health insurance
English/Spanish lessons and/or other investments in your professional development
Flexible schedule based on trust and deliverables vs. hours behind your desk
The opportunity to shape the company culture of our Barcelona office and make it both Charboosty and unique

More about us:

We are proud of the product we've built and appreciate the impact it has on other people's businesses and lives. We want to be surrounded by people who are always finding opportunities to try something new and grow. We love data and anything that helps drive intelligent decisions and always design with the user in mind. Sounds like a fit? Join us, and be part of the team that will change the future of mobile gaming!

We are an equal opportunity employer — we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and make our hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Sector: Videojuegos Software Entretenimiento
Descripción:
Craft

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description

YOUR ROLE WITHIN OUR KINGDOM

As a Principal/Lead Data Scientist, you will be part of a team of 3 to 5 very experienced Data Scientists reporting to the Central Data Science Director. You will be working with stakeholders across King on ambitious projects aiming to have a direct impact in all our games and business. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ data science & analytics experts in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment.

Specifically, You’ll

Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data- driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games

Provide your experience and expertise in modelling player/customer behaviour in digital products or services
Be self- motivated to learn and drive your teams’ development while improving methodology and working practices across the company
Provide an analytics perspective to discussions and prioritisation within your team, so that the overall team selects the right ideas to work on
Be the pro- active owner of the entire data chain for your work

Skills To Create Thrills

Our ideal candidate will have solid experience leading technical projects in an analytical team in a commercial environment. There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:
Modelling Expertise: The ability to think, build and work with models (Mechanistic, Statistical or Algorithmic) in order to better understand players and how they interact with our games
Stakeholder Management: The ability to recognise dependencies, build relationships and influence others
Business Insight : The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions
Communication : Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
SQL : The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with over a billion players and work with relational database systems
Analytical coding : Using tools such as R or Python for analytical purposes
BONUS POINTS
Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:
Work in the games industry or similarly customer- facing digital businesses
Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)
Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design
Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)
Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.

About King

King is a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, with people all around the world playing one or more of our games, including franchises such as Candy Crush, Farm Heroes, Pet Rescue and Bubble Witch.
We have 249 million monthly active users as of fourth quarter 2019 across web, social and mobile platforms. King was acquired by Activision Blizzard Inc. (Nasdaq ATVI) in February 2016 and operates as an independent unit of the
company.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players – and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!

Applications needs to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

Gauss & Neumann is creating a new Data group and we are looking for Data Scientists, with strong background in mathematics, to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at the company has a tech background.
We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the users. We create techniques and technologies that help our clients deliver a perfect responses with their products and provide value to the final customers that search on Google or Bing. 
 What we look for:
Young professionals with a bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem solvers with initiative that pushes the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to get things done. We look for people that enjoy working in highly professional environments and create a great atmosphere with their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top. 
 
Responsibilities:
Data research and visualization
Find competitive advantage data gaps, that could be leveraged by the campaigns team.
Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time
Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures
Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry

What you need to have:
Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Software Engineering or similar engineering degree.
Programming skills ( Python, SQL, PHP, R…). 
Statistics knowledge

Other skills we value:
English fluency (written and verbal)
Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers
Being up to date with programming libraries
Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary.

Enviar mensaje InMail



Overview
If you are passionate about building high quality SaaS solutions that customers love, UserZoom is the place for you. UserZoom is the leading platform for Usability Testing & User Experience Analytics. We focus on quantitative and qualitative research solutions to help UX/CX, Product Managers and Marketing professionals test and measure all aspects of web and mobile properties.





Job Description
The User Experience (UX) Researcher at UserZoom is a strategic function in the product team that is responsible for helping define and drive the future of our products. As a UX Researcher, your job will be to understand, identify, and champion customer needs.


We are looking for an experienced researcher to join our team. You will work with cross-functional teams like Design and Product Management to conduct research, inspire change, deliver oral and written presentations, evaluate qualitative and quantitative data, and help the broader R&D team understand what would make a user's experience more intuitive, accessible, and seamless. You are an advocate for the user and for user research, and continually find new ways to ensure that research is a central step in the Product Development Lifecycle (PDLC).


A successful researcher in this role will have experience with methods like unmoderated surveys, card sorts, tree tests, click tests, and usability tests, as well as qualitative think out loud and moderated study design. UserZoom and/or UserZoom GO (formerly Validately) experience is a nice to have, although not required.





Key Responsibilities
Conduct formative and summative user research.
Conduct and evaluate quantitative and qualitative research.
Perform competitive and discovery research.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify and evaluate research topics.
Plan and implement user research strategies and methodologies.
Advocate research findings to diverse audiences through written and oral presentations.
Ask questions, gather data, and analyze data.

Requirements:

3 - 7 years experience as a UX researcher.
Bachelor's or MS in a human behavior related field (or equivalent and demonstrable work experience)
Ability to quickly and effectively share research results
Ability to perform all research-related tasks including research, planning, evaluating, and iteration
Ability to formulate specific, answerable, and practical questions
Ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders and act as a strategic partner in product decisions
Experience with remote testing tools
A strong desire for creative problem-solving with a positive attitude
Excellent time-management skills
Must be a strong public speaker, comfortable in front of large, senior groups, and a solid writer
Excellent people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties - the consummate team player

Benefits:

Career plan
StockOptions
Opportunity to grow professionally in a challenging environment
International working environment

At UserZoom, we believe real success starts with hiring the very best people, empowering those people to get the job done, and making sure our people have a lot of fun along the way. Our team and company are experiencing massive growth. If you're looking for a place to learn & grow with exceptionally talented colleagues, UserZoom might be the place for you!


We have European offices in London, Manchester, Barcelona and Madrid as well as in the heart of Silicon Valley in San Jose, Denver and New York.






* Please, keep in mind that only CV's submitted in English will be considered, thank you.


Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
qualitative research
quantitative research
ux research

Company Overview
Rakuten TV is the first Video On-Demand platforms in Europe combining TVOD, AVOD and SVOD services, providing users an all in one content universe just on a click. While TVOD service provides a true cinematic experience with the latest new releases, AVOD service includes a range of thematic channels for free, including news, kids content, Hollywood movies and exclusive and original Rakuten TV content. On the subscription side, the platform also includes the international SVOD service, StarzPlay, as a premium content provider of movies and TV series.

Rakuten TV is available in 42 countries and forms part of Rakuten, Inc., one of the world’s leading internet services companies, offering a wide variety of services for consumers and businesses, with a focus on e-commerce, fintech and digital content. Rakuten, headquartered in Japan, is also known for its partnerships with FC Barcelona, the NBA, the Golden State Warriors, Davis Cup and Spartan Race.

ROLE: Data Engineer
Rakuten TV is looking for a highly analytical Data Engineer to join our Business Intelligence team, in Barcelona. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with huge volumes of data, streaming directly from our Products and shape this data using the latest technologies. You will also be working with teams from around the Globe, in Barcelona, Paris and Tokyo.

Responsibilities
Development of data pipelines to ingest, normalize and clean data.
Developing and monitoring ETL process to assure data integrity and timely delivery.
Collaborate with the Business and Technical developers in the design process
Effectively communicate results and insights with other stakeholders throughout the organization through regular KPI reporting and analysis

Requirements and Experience

3+ years of related experience as a Data Engineer.
Strong knowledge of SQL and scripting languages (python, bash).
Experience with ETL or other workflow orchestration tools.
Experience in Cloud based platforms such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Services
Data Storage: Relational DB’s, object storage, etc.
Experience working with version control (GIT)

Desirable:

Knowledge of Docker / Kubernetes
Interest in App Development.
A solid understanding of appropriate statistical, data mining and machine learning methods for various analysis situations.
Some understanding of Data visualization tools as Tableau and Power BI.
Ambitious and eager to rise to the highest levels of an industry leading organization.

Some good reasons to apply

Opportunity to work for leading company within the rapidly growing OTT market.
Great work environment 2 blocks away from Poblenou’s beach
Culturally diverse environment with people from approx. 22 different nationalities
Regular company outings, off-sites and team-building events
Private Medical Insurance or extra money for meal card/commuting card
Free Language Classes on-site and interesting trainings and sponsorships
Free massage for all the team

Enviar mensaje InMail
The Machine Learning and Applied Research team in Adsmurai is looking for an enthusiastic Data Engineer to join us in our Product Development Team. You will work hand-in-hand within a group of researchers creating new disruptive solutions powered by Machine Learning for Social Media Marketing.
 We are a team of passionate machine learning specialists who are always looking for new ways to contribute to Adsmurai’s success. As such, we are constantly learning new skills and trying new things. One way we achieve this is by constant training and devoting time to work on our own ideas (and aligning them with Adsmurai’s goals). We strongly believe that the best way to achieve great things is through teamwork and constant communication and continuous improvement. We periodically revise the way we work and try new methodologies and approaches in order to improve ourselves.
  What we do:
 We work on areas of the company where data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence can have an impact on user needs. Examples of this include improving the discovery of content in social media through object detection, assisting the dynamic generation of creativity by means of image classification, and optimizing marketing performance with the help of time series forecasting.

As a cross-functional self-organized team we take all the necessary steps to see our models deployed into the real world. For that, all team members take part to some extent in all product development steps; from product discovery to monitorization of the solution, by way of data gathering, modelling, API development, continuous delivery and integration to name a few.
 What we need from you:
 We are looking for a Data Engineer who shares our team’s spirit and values. We expect you to have a greater impact in areas related to the most technical challenges the team is facing. That is, we expect you to focus mainly on ensuring that data is available and easily accessible and bringing models to production.
 In order to do so you will be involved in tasks such as:

Designing the team’s data infrastructure.
Keeping data pipelines up to date.
Ensuring high availability of our products.
Monitorization of deployed solutions.


We don’t place much importance in a particular set of technologies since we are always looking forward to expand our toolkit in order to find the technology better suited for the problem at hand. Even so, knowledge of technologies we have used in the past is a plus. Some of these technologies include: Airflow, Gitlab0s CI-CD, Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Storage, Composer, SQL), Docker and Python. Additionally, knoeledge about Redis, Scala, Spark, Kubernetes and ML-related frameworks such as Tensorflow would be awesome. 


We offer:
 Will make you feel at home in one of the best offices in the centre of Barcelona (Passeig de Gràcia) with roof terrace and barbecue.
You will be part of a team with a flat structure and Agile orientation that maximizes self-organization and team ownership.
Friendly and flexible working environment.
Control and responsibility of your developments.
Regular and fun team activities.
Choose your HW option.
English classes.
Gym Arrangement.
We cultivate and actively participate in internal and external training.
Fresh fruit and coffee.
Flexible compensation plan (transport, restaurant, day care vouchers...).
Permanent contract.
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Software Internet
Descripción:
About Typeform

One sunny Barcelona morning, two designers sat down to build a beautiful lead gen form for a bathroom company’s showroom. They ended up reimagining the data collection experience, and realized it was one idea they wouldn’t be flushing down the toilet. Today, Typeform is a team of over 300 people from more than 35 countries, with offices in Barcelona, Spain and San Francisco, US.

We’re building a world where brands, businesses, and their communities can have more personal relationships with the people who matter most. To do this, we give people the tools they need to have conversational experiences at scale—because meaningful relationships start with conversations.

From online lead forms and engaging quizzes, to face-to-face encounters in the office, help us build more meaningful relationships, one conversation at a time.

About The Team

At Typeform, the Data team is making data our #1 asset. And we know how important that is— our product helps people collect information in the best way possible, by making it conversational.

That’s why we need you. Marketing Insights is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Marketing Growth swarm in a mission to help our customers understand Typeform and our value proposition, and realise value as quickly as possible in their user journey.

The Marketing Insights Team is focused on unlocking customer acquisition and engagement through continuous quantitative and qualitative insights and analytics. We are responsible for Market Research, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, and development of optimization models to enable data-driven decisions and automated optimizations in Marketing.

Here’s What You’ll Do

About the Role
Derive insights from our customers behaviours & journeys to grow and optimize our marketing efforts as well as identify optimal communication channels and strategies.
Develop and continuously improve our Growth Model: ensure we focus our marketing efforts on the right problem at the right time.
Continuously generate data-driven hypotheses and advocate on testing best practices, contributing to accelerate our testing cycles.
Develop non-production machine learning models to predict user & new customer engagement that will eventually get deployed by a ML Engineer/ ML Expert.
Define benchmarks, goals, and KPIs and help our Data Viz Expert develop dashboards to visualize the marketing funnel from awareness to purchase and assess the impact of marketing campaigns.
Communicate results and insights from your analyses to our top stakeholders, including investors and out Leadership Team.
Collaborate, learn, share, and brainstorm with other data scientists.


Here’s What We’re After

About You
You've got 2+ years of experience as a data scientist in a Marketing Organization.
You have experience with A/B and Multivariate test design and implementation.
You are proficient in programming (Python/R is a must) and building queries with SQL.
You value simple and effective solutions over complicated brain-melters.
You're a great communicator. You can take a complex concept and make it sound simple, using clear visual references to help.
You like taking on big challenges—given the appropriate time and resources.
You're hungry to learn and embrace healthy debate.
You're empathic, enthusiastic, and collaborative.
You enjoy helping others grow through constant feedback and mentorship.
You're fluent in English and eager to work in a multicultural, international environment.


It'd Be Amazing If
You've got extended experience working in the SaaS industry.
You've worked in a company that's committed to fast growth.
You're proficient with Looker.
You have some experience with Scala/Java.
You've got working knowledge of Big Data technologies (e.g. Spark).
You have experience with cloud systems.
You have a proven track record of statistical modeling/applied machine learning with a focus on revenue growth, sales, marketing and/or business development. Examples of your projects may include lead generation, LTV and user segmentation.

Think you’re a good fit? Hit apply—success might be just around the corner 😉

Today, more than 2.5M people from all over the world use Typeform. We celebrate the diversity of our customer base, and we want our employees to reflect those differences. At Typeform, we’re committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We strive to be a more equal opportunity workplace.

Descripción:
Data Scientist in Barcelona
Are you an experienced Data Scientist that wants to join the newest studio of a worldwide games industry giant? Its a unique opportunity to work with well loved classics while also creating the next generation of mobile games all while located on the beach in Spain!
Youll head up the planning, execution and ongoing optimisation of ad campaigns, working closely with the wider team to ensure growth across all of the games. Part of your time will also be focused on the key KPIs which will be achieved alongside MMPs, internal account managers and external agencies.
This studio already has a core team of experienced, diverse and dedicated people but youll be joining only months after the studio opening so will have a real impact on games and studio.

Data Scientist Responsibilities

Work with large, complex data sets to manipulate and analyse behaviour of players
Use your behavioural analyses to provide recommendations for strategic and operational business questions
Work with in-game data to help build game features and product roadmaps
Strive to produce the best games possible using data insights on retention and monetization
Create automated dashboards and reports that will be used by the whole studio to understand the game data and how this relates to the in-game experiences

Requirements For This Role In Barcelona

Background working with data in the games industry, preferably within mobile games
Experience working with SQL especially large, complex data sets
Examples of work with Tableau or similar for analysis and visualisation
An extensive body of work showing off your detail orientated approach and problem solving skills
Experience turning complex concepts into actionable recommendations
Degree level education in a mathematical/quantitative subject
A little bit about the city: Barcelona
Barcelonas stunning beaches, balmy weather and striking architecture are all great reasons to settle in this beautiful city. Home to many restaurants, museums and traditions, theres certainly a lot to explore. One feature the city is certainly proud of is that it is home to 8 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, largely thanks to Gaudis architecture which can be found at various sites citywide.
Barcelonas compact city centre and excellent transport system make getting around trouble-free and commuting time minimal. Home to a flourishing international community, Barcelona is a great city to relocate to if youre hoping to feel at home.

Descripción:
Madbox is a mobile gaming company, creating and publishing its own games worldwide. After two years of existence, Madbox has gathered more than 100 million players, still growing. We are looking for top talents with mad skills, a mad passion and a mad ambition to join us.

We are looking for a passionate and experienced data engineer to join us!

As the first Data Engineer in the team you will be responsible for end to end data pipelines and data architecture for all the Studio’s games.

Based in Barcelona, you will have the opportunity to work with the Data team and the game teams to keep delivering and improving the company's Data solutions. We evolved in a flat-structured creative environment where ownership and accountability are our two mantras. We look for high-energy individuals ready to bring Madbox to a global stage.

What will you do ?
Working closely with the head of data, data scientist, automation team and data analysts to develop and own our data pipelines, infrastructure & roadmap.
Implement high end scalable solutions, cost optimised and with high performance.
Monitor all the pipelines to ensure high availability.
Proactively responsible for data accuracy and reliability for all models and entities.
Mad Skills & Experience Required
Required :
Experience with Big Data systems architecture
Experience in Data Pipeline scripting in python
SQL skills
Experience in cloud platforms GCP/AWS and their data services (Preferable knowledge in GCP Dataflow)
Experience with GIT and Airflow
Bonus : Experience in Typescript and Unity programming (C#)
Note: You will be required to pass a technical test.
You also have
Autonomy and ability to take decisions and make projects move forward while keeping transparency and continuous updates to relevant stakeholders
An analytical mindset.
A good and fluent communication skills: straight to the point, focused on constructive feedback, positive mindset
High interest in tech and Games in general.
Shown leadership in proposing innovative actions to perform to improve globally speaking.
What's the Madbox mindset?
You are a humble yet ultra ambitious individual
You are a team player and a game maker at heart
You are T-shaped and enjoy small structures where everyone has a strong impact
You want to learn and grow in a passionate environment
What we offer?
Competitive salary
Private medical cover
Lunch vouchers
Team events (once we're all back in the office)
Madbox is a fast-growing mobile game company based in Paris and Barcelona, creating and publishing its own games. The story of Madbox started when two video game studios fell in love with each other during the summer 2018.

A few months after the beginning of this promance, Madbox first in-house titles hit the top charts of the App Store and Google Play Store worldwide, ranking in #1 positions in more than 100 countries. After just two years of existence, Madbox has gathered more than 100 million players, still growing fast. To fuel this creative and operations growth, Madbox develops cutting-edge automation systems internally to shorten production times and drive accurately its performance at large scale.

www.madbox.io

Madbox will collect your personal data for the purposes of managing our recruitment related activities. That is why, Madbox may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to recruiting & people teams in Paris & Barcelona. By applying, you expressly give your consent.

Descripción:
Company Description

Adevinta is a global online classifieds specialist, operating digital marketplaces in 12 countries. The company provides technology-based services to connect buyers with sellers and to facilitate transactions, from job offers to real estate, cars, consumer goods and more. Adevinta’s portfolio spans more than 30 digital products and websites, attracting 1.3 billion average monthly visits.

Our leading brands include top-ranked leboncoin in France, InfoJobs and Milanuncios in Spain, and 50% of fast-growing OLX Brazil. Adevinta spun off from Schibsted ASA and publicly listed in Oslo, Norway in 2019. Adevinta is majority owned by Schibsted ASA and employs 4,700 people committed to supporting users and customers daily. Find out more at Adevinta.com.

At Adevinta, we draw on the principles of successful marketplaces to do our job well. We actively exchange ideas, and we’re always learning from each other. We are a company where everyone belongs, and our culture is based on mutual trust. Above all, we keep a strong focus on creating and developing value - because we believe every house can be a home, every person can be useful, and every object can live a second, third or fourth life. And we leverage our scale to help build a sustainable future where everything can find its purpose or a new one.

Job Description

The BI and Data Engineer role effectively and comprehensively manages Adevinta's data set to create dashboards and reports, auditing and ensuring the accuracy of data inputs, and troubleshooting any potential data issues or risks in the systems integrations. Ensures that data and reports are accessible, usable, easy to understand, and appropriately/consistently applied within Adevinta teams. Works with various departments and provides input to the Information Services team regarding what needs to be implemented, optimized, modified, created and prioritized in relation with data.

This mission critical role is placed within the BITS (Business Information and Technology Services) team, in charge of supporting Adevinta Central Functions and Marketplaces in the achievement of its goals with seamlessly integrated and resilient business information and technology services, as well as providing guidance on new trends in productivity and business process automation.

Your main responsibilities as BI and Data Engineer will be:
Develop and maintain reports as well as provide Tableau support to marketplaces.
Provide analytics capabilities to those Adevinta functions that doesn’t have this capability internally.
Work with multiple Adevinta departments and understand their individual needs and objectives.
Manage data, including the creation, update and deletion of data, information and dashboards; commission and decommission datasets based on business needs and priorities.
Process confidential and proprietary information in compliance to information policies.
Build dashboards based on business needs.
Identify trends and statistical behaviours on business information with a focus on growing and improving the business.
Provide training to Adevinta end users on new dashboards, systems and reports.
Identify improvement initiatives in relation with information reporting across Adevinta.
Help the business areas to identify new information datasets and sources that could lead to profitable insights.
Execute the necessary initiatives aimed at implementing the MDM Strategy at Adevinta.
Identify and oversee initiatives for data integrity and normalization within and across Adevinta departments, and within and across systems.
Monitor MDM-related costs and quality.

Qualifications

Your skills and qualifications include:
Solid analytical and logic skills
Experience in Computer Science and algorithm management
Experience with Data Modelling tools
Experience with Tableau
Proficient knowledge of popular and standard data analysis tools and databases, with a high level of knowledge of methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases and systems
Experience in statistical languages and tools
Python development experience
Advanced knowledge in database technologies (e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, SQLServer, SAP HANA and NoSQL databases)
Must show initiative, proactively finding and solving problems
Be a business-focused, creative, innovative, pragmatic, and positive team player
Good analytical and problem-solving skills to visualize solutions
Ownership and result oriented person
Good written, spoken and interpersonal communication skills
Technical and business level English is a must
Excellent organisational, data management and data documentation skills

It Would Be Great If You Would Also Have
Proven experience in projects managing a set of various data sources
Experience with and the ability to troubleshoot large data sets
Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources
Knowledge and understanding of relevant legal and regulatory requirements
Experience in Data Migration / Systems Implementation
Experience with one or more data management tools
Experience with Data Quality & Lineage management tools
Experience with Big Data Management tools
Knowledge on Data Modelling tools
Spanish and French are a highly valuable asset

What Do We Have To Offer

Additional Information
A unique position in an international and dynamic environment
Opportunities to work on a global level, with senior management on strategic issues
Excellent growth opportunities close to top management and their priorities
The chance to be a key player in a growing, highly skilled team
Competitive compensation package
Great colleagues and a healthy working environment

This role will be based in Barcelona with occasional travel to other offices.

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in our company. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Descripción:
What about the Data team?

At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.

In order to achieve such ambitious goals, the Flights Team works together with other departments, in order to ingest large amounts of data from our flights providers - on a busy day, we need to handle over 250k unique flight searches, yielding to terabytes of data on a weekly basis. Such data needs to be ingested, transformed and analyzed, looking for patterns and enabling the Flights Team to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver, such as flight routes optimization, fare fluctuations, improvements proposals as well as determining the best moment to issue a particular flight for our customers. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to improve our performance as a company, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can’t wait to have you on board!

What is our proposal?

Join us as a Data Engineer, based in our Barcelona offices.

Which will be your main responsibilities?
Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions.
Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities.
Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way.
Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure.
Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores.

Requirements
2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Architect or Engineer.
Proficiency with Python. Experience in Java or Scala is also acceptable.
Experience with data warehouses, data lakes and data marts.
Experience with relational databases and NoSQL databases.
Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred).
Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs with product & marketing tracking tools.
Fluency in English.


Benefits
Competitive salary package, in line with the job’s responsibilities.
Immediate incorporation and permanent contract.
Benefits package flexible schedule, trainings, and the possibility of travelling at reduced prices!
And most importantly… becoming part of a highly successful multicultural team!

Sector: Servicios financieros Seguros
Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones
Funciones laborales: Tecnología de la información Consultoría Gestión de proyectos
Descripción:
We are looking to hire software engineers with +5 experience and passion for data, based in Barcelona/Madrid 

Job Description
We are looking for software engineers with at least five years of experience and a passion for data. We expect our (senior) data engineers to keep learning new technologies, architectural patterns, programming languages and machine learning algorithms. They will work with data scientists and are comfortable speaking their language. We are looking for professionals who are enthusiastic about innovation in software engineering and are not afraid to contribute to open-source projects and present their work at technical meetups.
 As we help our clients to target, measure and improve mission-critical business metrics and generate demonstrable return on investment, our (senior) data engineers enjoy a high level of responsibility and immediate client interactions. In addition to technical excellence, our engineers are great communicators equipped with the presentation skills to operate at executive level.
 Above all, our engineers are curious about the big picture and passionate about bringing data to life!
 Our products
Together with data science team we make our customers happy. We design and build data lakes for processing hundred terabytes of data, integrate applications, maintain ML pipelines, help data science team with experiments.
 Our technology stacks
We use Azure, AWS and Google cloud services. In most of the cases we build big data of fast data-oriented solutions, by this reason, we use Kinesis, Lake Formation, Athena, Redshift, Glue, Azure Functions, Events Hub, Data Factory, SageMaker, BigQuery, BigTable, DataFlow etc.
For on premise solutions, we use Hadoop stack, ELK stack, Postgres, Kafka, NoSQL solutions like Cassandra, Redis, Aerospike etc.
We prefer to build applications on Python, occasionally Scala.


What do we offer?
We want to enable you to get the most out of yourself both as a professional and as a person! You will enjoy a high level of responsibility while being guided and mentored by more experienced colleagues. From day one, you will experience a very steep learning curve. Learning on the job will be combined with a bespoke personal development plan and a fit-for-purpose training curriculum.

We highly value and support a healthy work-life balance. As an output-oriented firm, we trust our people to deliver if and when needed. Meanwhile, we also urge them to constantly take ownership over their personal lives and stay healthy, both physically and mentally.

Metyis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. At Metyis we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. You are encouraged to self-identify, on either your application form, covering letter or resume.

Responsibilities:
Engineers complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of digital marketing, eCommerce, Business Intelligence and self-service analytics.
Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints and enterprise organizations.
Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.
Collaborate closely with partners, strategy consultants and data scientists in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.
Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical trainings.
Guide and mentor team members.

Required Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Who are we looking for?
·      3 years of professional experience in software engineering
·      A broad practice in multiple software engineering fields:
Backend and/or frontend development in any programming language of your choice
Design of web services
Algorithms and complexity analysis
Linux system administration, development and production environments
Cloud, container and microservices infrastructures
Software security
Development workflow automation
A strong focus on data processing:
Databases; theory and practice
Distributed data processing
Real-time event processing
Concepts of functional programming
Data privacy and anonymization techniques
Enterprise data warehousing, business intelligence and ETL principles
Statistics and analytics
Machine learning
Speaking Spanish fluently is a must
Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills
Position based in Barcelona and/or Madrid

Descripción:
Are you a specialist in data analysis with extensive experience in collecting, transforming and analyzing data as well as communicating findings across the organization?

In this role, you’ll be… Pivotal in the execution of a three years roadmap to achieve a more preventive, customer focused and data driven Quality approach at Markem-Imaje. This role will specifically focus on Data Analytics and statistical analysis related to Product, Service, Process quality and performance and will be influential in improving those. This position is reporting directly to the Global Quality Shared Services Manager.
You’ll have an opportunity to… work in a cross-functional environment, partnering closely on all levels of the organization to ultimately improve the quality and performance of our products, services and processes using your data analysis, machine learning-based tools and IT skills.
You should possess… a passion for leveraging data to drive decision making across the business and be a forward-thinking individual to look beyond the immediate.

Great package including bonus, career growth and great benefits.

Principal Activities / Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes. Your main responsibilities will include:
•Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
•Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
•Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
•Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
•Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.

Experience & General Skills:   
•Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role including experience as Data analyst.
•Bachelor’s degree in business, Science or Engineering/University degree in Data Analysis.
•Mastering programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
•Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
•Fluent in written and spoken English.
•Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
•SAP CS/SD/MM and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.
•Independent, quick learner with a very structured approach.

At the heart of our technology are our Machine Learning algorithms that help a business to improve performance campaigns. If your profile fits, this is a great opportunity to grow your career at a young and agile yet global company (from over 30 different countries) and have a real impact on daily business with our algorithms. Are you ready to be part of the new unicorn?

Python programming of complex scripts using abstract classes and advanced debugging.

And more!

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Investigación Biotecnología
Descripción:
The Centro Nacional de Análisis Genómico (CNAG-CRG) is one of the largest Genome Sequencing Centers in Europe. CNAG-CRG researchers participate in major International Genomic Initiatives such as the International Cancer Genome Consortium (ICGC), the International Human Epigenome Consortium (IHEC), the International Rare Diseases Research Consortium (IRDiRC) and the European Infrastructure for life-science information (ELIXIR), as well as in several EU-funded projects.

It is integrated with the Centre for Genomic Regulation (CRG), an international biomedical research institute of excellence, based in Barcelona, Spain, with more than 400 scientists from 44 countries. The CRG is composed by an interdisciplinary, motivated and creative scientific team which is supported both by a flexible and efficient administration and by high-end and innovative technologies.

The CNAG-CRG is looking for a data engineer to participate in the development tasks of the RD-Connect Genome-Phenome Analysis Platform (GPAP) using a mix of languages and tools to process and analyse multi-omics data. Technologies currently in use include Spark/hail, Python, Scala, Hadoop, ElasticSearch, Postgres, DataSHIELD and Opal. The work will be mostly geared towards the infrastructure needs of the Solve-RD project, a large-scale European initiative towards solving rare diseases (www.solve-rd.eu ).

The selected candidate will work on the automation of dataflow from sequencers and user submission to the HDFS/Ceph and Elasticsearch clusters. She/he will build data infrastructure to support the analysis of clinical, genomics and other omics data within personalize medicine framework.

Responsibilities
Participate in the design, development and maintenance of the RD-Connect GPAP data engineering part
Automate workflows
Integrate with other databases/platforms (data federation and distributed Machine Learning)
Collaborate with data analysts and software engineers developers
Interact with national and international partners
About The Team

The selected candidate will join the Bioinformatics Analysis Unit led by Dr Sergi Beltran. The multi-disciplinary 20 member Unit is focused on NGS data analysis and tool development, mostly related to human health. The Unit develops the RD-Connect GPAP and participates, among other, in Solve-RD , EJP-RD , Genomed4All , 3TR , ELIXIR , MatchMaker Exchange , GA4GH and Clúster de Valorització d'EGA per a la Indústria i la Societat (VEIS).

Whom would we like to hire?

Professional experience

Must Have
You have at least 3 years working experience as a Data engineer or similar role in Unix operating systems
You have experience with at least two of these programming languages (python, scala, java, clojure, groovy)
Desirable but not required/ Nice to have
You have experience with data version control
You have experience with data governance
You have knowledge of Bioinformatics / High Throughput Sequencing and/or human genetics
You have interest in functional programming
Education and training
You hold a MSc or higher in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or similar
Languages
You are fluent in English
Technical skills
You have experience with software control version
You have experience with task automation
Competences
You are a proactive person
You are a team player
You have highly developed organization skills
The Offer – Working Conditions
Contract duration: Until December 2022 with possibility of extension.
Estimated annual gross salary: Salary is commensurate with qualifications and consistent with our pay scales.
Target start date: April 1st, 2021.
We provide a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructures, and unique professional career development opportunities. To check out our training and development portfolio, please visit our website in the training section .

We offer and promote a diverse and inclusive environment and welcomes applicants regardless of age, disability, gender, nationality, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or gender identity.

The CRG is committed to reconcile a work and family life of its employees and are offering extended vacation period and the possibility to benefit from flexible working hours.

Application Procedure

All Applications Must Include
Pre-selection: The pre-selection process will be based on qualifications and expertise reflected on the candidates CVs. It will be merit-based.
Interview: Preselected candidates will be interviewed by the Hiring Manager of the position and a selection panel if required.
Offer Letter: Once the successful candidate is identified the Human Resources department will send a Job Offer, specifying the start day, salary, working conditions, among other important details.
Deadline: Please submit your application by 8th of March, 2021.

Suggestions: The CRG believes in ongoing improvement and promotes a culture of feedback. This is one of the reasons we have in place, at your disposal as a candidate, a mechanism to gather your suggestions/complaints concerning your candidate experience in our recruitment processes. Your feedback really matters to us in our aim at creating a positive candidate journey. You can make a difference and help us improve by letting us know your suggestions through the following form.
