Puesto ofertado: Data Engineer - Digital music distribution, Python
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
About BMAT 

BMAT started in 2005 when a group of engineers with a passion for music decided to spin-off from an audio research lab in Barcelona. The company started with an idea – to index all the music in the world – and a mission – to better the music eco-system – and a team of nerds eager to learn how to build a successful business. Today the company has grown to more than a hundred people - spread across Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Lima, Los Angeles, Milan, São Paulo, London, Paris, Oslo, New York, Johannesburg, Singapore, Tokyo, and Moscow - that team up to deliver daily 1 million identifications and 3 billion matches to our partners from all over the music industry.
 
 Our Culture 

We love music. It makes our lives a zillion times better. And we want to give something back to her (yes, to us music is a lady). Make her life easier and her future brighter. We apply our scientific, data-infused brains to tell everyone what music has been played – so that creators get the recognition they deserve. We hear everything everywhere and tell everyone who wants to know. ‘What plays around will come back around’ we say. We believe by helping this happen we can make a positive change in the music ecosystem and enjoy talent for another million years.

We are a team of pretty decent people who enjoy working with each other. We’re open-minded and well-traveled, coming from all parts of the world. We like coffee, tea, chai, and mate all the same. We’ve got rappers, producers, cello players, DJs, and songwriters. The passion for music, the excitement for technology and Barcelona as a backdrop has proven to make a good combination. We say there is a BMAT touch. We believe it has to do with being passionate, obsessive, nice, generous, honest, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, intrepid, crazy, extraordinary, creative, agile, human, friendly, smart, witty, talented, naive, optimistic, surprising, sensual, and nerdy, but not very hipster (unfortunately).

 What You Will Be Doing
 As part of the engineering team of the Digital business unit, your responsibilities will be to build, improve and scale the products that power one of the most complete music data processing systems in the world. We use agile values to improve our day to day performance. We are connected to more than 45 digital service providers such as Spotify, YouTube, Apple Music, Deezer or Amazon. They provide us with digital sales reports (DSRs), which we parse, reconcile, match and translate into royalty statements, among others, in order to provide insight to our partners, the collective management organisations and publishers of the world.

In addition, we also provide on-demand audio identification services that enable our partners to be in control of user-generated content (e.g. YouTube, Facebook, SoundCloud) and increase revenues and traceability from videos containing their music.

Our digital distribution system has already processed 162.000 DSRs with 87 billion transactions from over 250 countries, and currently ingests 650 million online music transactions per month
in a horizontally scalable architecture powered by Amazon Web Services. Our main development technology is Python along with some of its frameworks, such as Django and Flask. We also use Docker to speed up our developments and deployments.
 Moreover at BMAT we want to have the most complete music metadata database in the world. As part of our team you will help dealing with tons of music metadata, to help us reach our goal faster, adding value to the team and creating cool stuff.
   All About You

Proficient in Python.
Code with test coverage.
Experience developing ETLs integrating data from different sources.
Experience with entity reconciliation, data matching.
Love digging into (music) data: understand it, find patterns, clean it, find value.
Experience working with document-oriented databases (MongoDB, Elasticsearch).
Linux and Git experience.
Experience with software design life cycle and good practices (Code Reviews, Refactoring).
Forecast software and infrastructure scalability issues and capacity to prevent them.
Good documentation and communication skills.
Proactive team player with high-quality awareness and independent working attitude.
You value a DevOps culture.


Bonus Track

Experience with Docker. 
Experience with AWS.
Experience with Kafka/event-driven architectures.
Experience with distributed systems.
Experience scaling platforms.
Experience with HTTP APIs and frontend apps.

 You Can Enjoy 

Full-time job.
Flexibility on working location and working hours.
Free Spanish and English classes.
Flat hierarchy.
Full autonomy of your duties.
Becoming part of a diverse and multicultural team based in Barcelona obsessed with bettering the music industry.
 
Diverse perspectives drive innovation, and innovation is kind of our thing. Our open-minded and flexible culture organically fosters this diversity. We've learnt that we thrive on learning from each other, so we don't just welcome but actively hire a range of open-minded people from all walks of life. Our team is made up of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, musical tastes, dress sense and time-zones - but we all have one common goal: Making the music world a better place. With equal opportunities for everyone, BMAT is a pretty nice place to work.

Sector: Internet Ocio, viajes y turismo
Descripción:
We are Stayforlong, the first hotel marketplace specialized in long stays. We reward people with amazing discounts the more nights they stay in a hotel! Because we consider that it is unfair to pay the same if you are going to spend more time :) 

We have a wide range of hotels and we collaborate with companies such as Trivago, Tripadvisor, Google Hotel Ads and Kayak.

We have digital DNA. We love challenges, moving fast, thinking out-of-the-box and inspiring people who want to take the company to the next level. Besides, we stand out for our multiculturalism, for being flexible and for working in an agile environment.

Would you like to take part in our #teamforlong? Pay attention to this opportunity! 

Currently, we’re developing our Data department and we need a Data Engineer to let us keep growing our data organization.

Main job responsibilities are:

Build the migration to real time architecture.
Build ETLs and all the infrastructure and engineering behind.
Build and maintain data based processes to help other teams to make better decisions.
You’ll help draw out the product roadmap, design experiments to estimate the impact of future releases.
Monitor daily results and improve KPIs performance.
Explore our data to find growth opportunities.
Build fast data visualizations.
Apply statistical methods (and some machine learning) to improve our metrics, reporting, pricing strategies and increase sales through those improvements.

What you need to have:

You’ve at least 4-5 years of experience as a data scientist, data engineering, data analyst, business analyst or something along those lines.
You’ve got experience building queries with SQL or other query languages.
You can code Python, R or similar languages.
You have experience with Java
You have experience with queue systems, Kafka as a preferred.
You have strong programming skills.
You’re comfortable designing and building data architectures.
You’re comfortable talking about mathematics, statistics or computer science.
You can show us how you applied your knowledge to resolve problems.
You’re pragmatic. You value simple and effective solutions over complicated brain-melters.
You can take a complex concept and make it sound simple, using clear visual references to help.

What we offer:

Permanent contract.

OPM are proud to be working with one of the worldwide leaders in mobile games with an incredibly talented international team based in the diverse and beautiful city of Barcelona. They are looking for a Data Analyst / Scientist to join their team.

The successful candidate will work to understand their gamers’ behaviour, work with the game teams to enhance the product, drive retention & user conversion. You will gain business insights that provide real value to the company by applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming

Strong experience utilising analytics to solve business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in mobile games.

Professional experience implementing data science models using Python, R or Matlab.
Fluent English communication skills, with experience presenting to business stakeholders.

Act as the connection between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure their data is precisely specified, understood and reliable.
Cooperate with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation, and monetisation.

Descripción:
Launched in 2013, ManoMano is Europe's leading marketplace for DIY, home improvement and gardening online.

Co-founded by Philippe de Chanville and Christian Raisson, ManoMano brings together the largest offer of DIY & gardening online products: electricity, plumbing, hardware, frames, indoor and outdoor furniture, tools, etc.

With more than 3500 seller partners and 5 million products, ManoMano operates in 6 markets (France, Belgium, Spain, Italy, Germany, United Kingdom).

Thanks to the success of our fundraising (311 million euros to date), ManoMano now has more than 600 Manas & Manos spread across our 4 offices in Paris (x2), Bordeaux and Barcelona. With a quarter of international staff (24 different nationalities), ManoMano is a real melting pot reflecting our European ambitions. The team is also distinguished by its young and very dynamic spirit with an average age of 31.

Proud to be part of the Next 40 since 2019 (top 40 French startups), we have the ambition to be the n°1 destination for home improvement in Europe.

Joining ManoMano is a great professional and personal experience. It is an ideal environment to put your skills to work on innovative projects on a European scale.

Because people, and especially employees, are at the heart of ManoMano's culture, we are renowned for the optimal working conditions we offer.

Have a look at our Blog : https://medium.com/manomano-tech

Job Description

To consolidate its position as DIY and Gardening online leader, ManoMano has put technology at the heart of its strategy.

We are convinced it is by fluidly delivering qualitative products that we will be able to offer our clients and merchants all the functionalities to revolutionize their online DIY experience.

As a fast growing company, we are always on the look for ingenious and passionate people.

At ManoMano, we love and aspire to
Push often and serenely to production
Monitor code and functionalities (mistakes, product metrics)
Take advantage of containers flexibility (docker)
Leverage cloud scalability (AWS)
Migrate to a micro-services architecture
Cultivating continuous improvement
As Data Engineer you will
Build an efficient and robust architecture to store and make accessible data terabytes, in an hyper-growing environment
Optimize and create data workflows to our Data lake and our data dissemination systems (datawarehouse, APIs, event buses, etc.)
Identify data needs of different teams, especially when launching new projects; design the systems to meet those needs, in a high performance logic
Work and data quality & reliability to ensure we provide trustable metrics to the whole company
Participate or lead futurs projects in a fast growing scale-up
Technical stack in Data Engineering Team
Cloud AWS : S3, Kinesis, DynamoDB, RDS, MSK, ECS, ECR
Data platform : Snowflake (Datawarehouse), Airflow, Snowplow, MariaDB/PostgreSQL
Ops : Terraform, Ansible, DockerMessaging / Realtime ingestion : Kafka, RabbitMQ
Development : Python, SQL
Requirements
3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
Good experience in Python & SQL
Technically knowledgeable / “a doer” - not afraid to DO, participate and help others / you are not afraid to take initiatives and offer new solutions
Innovative and creative
Excellente digital culture and Data Driven
Autonomous and adaptable (desire to work in a fast growing environment / Start-up)
Humble et curious with a big appetite to learn discover and experiment new things
Team spirit and great communication skills
You come to work with good intentions and good vibes

Puesto ofertado: Data Engineer - Digital music distribution, Python
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
About BMAT 

BMAT started in 2005 when a group of engineers with a passion for music decided to spin-off from an audio research lab in Barcelona. The company started with an idea – to index all the music in the world – and a mission – to better the music eco-system – and a team of nerds eager to learn how to build a successful business. Today the company has grown to more than a hundred people - spread across Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Lima, Los Angeles, Milan, São Paulo, London, Paris, Oslo, New York, Johannesburg, Singapore, Tokyo, and Moscow - that team up to deliver daily 1 million identifications and 3 billion matches to our partners from all over the music industry.
 
 Our Culture 

We love music. It makes our lives a zillion times better. And we want to give something back to her (yes, to us music is a lady). Make her life easier and her future brighter. We apply our scientific, data-infused brains to tell everyone what music has been played – so that creators get the recognition they deserve. We hear everything everywhere and tell everyone who wants to know. ‘What plays around will come back around’ we say. We believe by helping this happen we can make a positive change in the music ecosystem and enjoy talent for another million years.

We are a team of pretty decent people who enjoy working with each other. We’re open-minded and well-traveled, coming from all parts of the world. We like coffee, tea, chai, and mate all the same. We’ve got rappers, producers, cello players, DJs, and songwriters. The passion for music, the excitement for technology and Barcelona as a backdrop has proven to make a good combination. We say there is a BMAT touch. We believe it has to do with being passionate, obsessive, nice, generous, honest, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, intrepid, crazy, extraordinary, creative, agile, human, friendly, smart, witty, talented, naive, optimistic, surprising, sensual, and nerdy, but not very hipster (unfortunately).

 What You Will Be Doing
 As part of the engineering team of the Digital business unit, your responsibilities will be to build, improve and scale the products that power one of the most complete music data processing systems in the world. We use agile values to improve our day to day performance. We are connected to more than 45 digital service providers such as Spotify, YouTube, Apple Music, Deezer or Amazon. They provide us with digital sales reports (DSRs), which we parse, reconcile, match and translate into royalty statements, among others, in order to provide insight to our partners, the collective management organisations and publishers of the world.

In addition, we also provide on-demand audio identification services that enable our partners to be in control of user-generated content (e.g. YouTube, Facebook, SoundCloud) and increase revenues and traceability from videos containing their music.

Our digital distribution system has already processed 162.000 DSRs with 87 billion transactions from over 250 countries, and currently ingests 650 million online music transactions per month
in a horizontally scalable architecture powered by Amazon Web Services. Our main development technology is Python along with some of its frameworks, such as Django and Flask. We also use Docker to speed up our developments and deployments.
 Moreover at BMAT we want to have the most complete music metadata database in the world. As part of our team you will help dealing with tons of music metadata, to help us reach our goal faster, adding value to the team and creating cool stuff.
   All About You

Proficient in Python.
Code with test coverage.
Experience developing ETLs integrating data from different sources.
Experience with entity reconciliation, data matching.
Love digging into (music) data: understand it, find patterns, clean it, find value.
Experience working with document-oriented databases (MongoDB, Elasticsearch).
Linux and Git experience.
Experience with software design life cycle and good practices (Code Reviews, Refactoring).
Forecast software and infrastructure scalability issues and capacity to prevent them.
Good documentation and communication skills.
Proactive team player with high-quality awareness and independent working attitude.
You value a DevOps culture.


Bonus Track

Experience with Docker. 
Experience with AWS.
Experience with Kafka/event-driven architectures.
Experience with distributed systems.
Experience scaling platforms.
Experience with HTTP APIs and frontend apps.

 You Can Enjoy 

Full-time job.
Flexibility on working location and working hours.
Free Spanish and English classes.
Flat hierarchy.
Full autonomy of your duties.
Becoming part of a diverse and multicultural team based in Barcelona obsessed with bettering the music industry.
 
Diverse perspectives drive innovation, and innovation is kind of our thing. Our open-minded and flexible culture organically fosters this diversity. We've learnt that we thrive on learning from each other, so we don't just welcome but actively hire a range of open-minded people from all walks of life. Our team is made up of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, musical tastes, dress sense and time-zones - but we all have one common goal: Making the music world a better place. With equal opportunities for everyone, BMAT is a pretty nice place to work.

Job description

benshi.ai's mission is to improve the health of individuals and populations in resource-poor countries through advanced AI applications.

We seek data engineers to join our engineering team. We are interested in individuals with a strong software developer background, and who are knowledgeable about building scalable and robust architecture, tools, data products, and critical data pipelines that are optimized for data science applications. You will have the rare opportunity of building resilient and scalable machine learning products from scratch, together with other talented engineers, to boost global health via cutting-edge ML algorithms.

If you are passionate about building robust scalable data systems, and are excited about using your skills to improve the world, we want to meet you!

Responsibilities:

Develop and automate large scale, high-performance, scalable platform (batch and/or streaming) to drive faster analytics and support the operations of the machine learning models in production. 

Working with data scientists to create and improve data science workflows, i.e. machine learning lifecycle management.

Ability to design large-scale, complex applications and frameworks with excellent run-time characteristics such as low-latency, fault-tolerance and availability.

Partner with analytic consumers and data scientists to build and improve new/existing constructs and solve data engineering problems @ scale.

Key qualifications:

BSc/BEng degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, machine learning or related fields; or equivalent technical proficiency

Solid coding skills in at least two of the following languages: Go, Java, Scala, C/C++, Python

6+ years of experience in software and/or data engineering

2+ years of Spark development

3+ years of experience in Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive etc…). 

Experience on Kubernetes, Docker preferred

Experience with cloud services (GCP, AWS or Azure)

Good knowledge of Data formats (Parquet, ORC etc.) and consensus management systems

Deploy inclusive data quality checks to ensure high quality of data

Experience building early stage robust and scalable products

Attention to detail and effective verbal/written communication skills. 

Working independently while also collaborating and giving/receiving candid feedback

Who We Are

Vistaprint’s Data and Analytics (DnA) organization is working to make our company one of the world’s most well-known and successful data-driven companies. The cross-functional team includes product owners, analysts, technologists, data engineers and more - all focused on providing Vistaprint with information and tools we can use to deliver jaw-dropping customer value. DnA team members are empowered to learn new skills, communicate openly and be active problem-solvers.

What You Will Do

Stuart (Geopost Group) is an eco-friendly 🌱 last-mile delivery company 📦 that connects retailers and e-retailers to a fleet of geo-localised couriers 🚴🏽‍♂️. 🚙. across several countries in Europe.

Our Mission

Build the future of logistics for a more sustainable world shared, efficient and reliable, as conscious consumers value more and more environmental responsibility besides speed of delivery and convenience.

Stuart is growing to fulfil that vision. In 2020 we doubled in size and continue to grow strong.

We are a melting-pot of 450 people working from Paris 🇫🇷, London 🇬🇧, Barcelona, Madrid 🇪🇸 and remote 🌏.

More than 2 000 companies work with us already across Food, Grocery, Retail and Pharmacy to deliver all types of goods, among which essentials for people on lockdown / self-isolating because of the coronavirus. We are at the right moment and the right place to make an impact on millions of people, as home delivery services hit a record high.

Check out what we do in our engineering blog or watch this "join us" video 🎬

The role

We are looking for a Data Engineer 🤖 to take part in the scaling of our data platform and support the company’s growth.

Our Data Engineering team is distributed across 2 locations Barcelona (Carrer de Pau Claris) and Paris (Avenue des Ternes). Stuart is a remote-friendly company, with a team of more than 100 engineers across Europe.

For this role, we are open to candidates who want to live and work in either France, Spain, or the UK.

Our stack currently includes technologies like Apache Airflow, Docker, Apache Kafka, Jenkins, etc. and we extensively use AWS products like S3, Redshift, and Athena.

What will you do?
Design, implement and maintain a solid Data Lake and Data Warehouse that collects, stores, and processes data, focusing on scalability and reliability.
Work closely with the Business Intelligence and Data Science teams to help them design and build machine-learning algorithms and tooling to explore and visualize data.
Grow with us and share https //medium.com/stuart-engineering 🤓


Requirements
Fluency in English
3+ years experience working with Python
3+ years of experience design and implementing data platforms
Experience with Apache Kafka or other streaming platforms
Experience with query engines like AWS Athena, Hive, SparkSQL or similar technologies

Nice to have
Experience in designing data lakes in Amazon S3
Experience with Apache Airflow
Experience with Java/Scala
Experience with Hadoop, Apache Spark, Flink or similar technologies
Experience with data quality processes


Benefits
Great compensation package
Good work-life balance work from home, flexible hours
Learning and training opportunities
Tangible career development possibilities as we grow strong 🚀
Meal vouchers - Tickets restaurant
Monthly gym allowance to use in any gym or for any sport class
Excellent private health care
Stuart Academy 👩‍🎓 to develop your skills
And much more - our HR team is constantly implementing new initiatives!

Want to learn more about us? https //stuart.com/about-us/

After reading all this, just a few last but important words we want you to take on a role you love and we want you to come to a place you’re proud and happy to work every day 💙!

Stuart is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Software as a Service | Digital Experience & Transformation | Bespoke Analysis | Big Data | Prediction

Passionate about developing machine learning models ? Excited about huge performance and behavior data sets ? Eager to join a global leader that enables digital transformation ?

Who we are : Digital Business Insights is a professional services group within Dynatrace, the global leader in Real User and Performance Monitoring

Our vision : We believe Dynatrace data can be used to bridge the chasm between business and IT and help drive business decision making and outcomes

What we do : We help customers understand the right performance data, in the right context and turn that data into business insight which enables them to take the right action to improve overall site performance and user experience that maximizes business outcomes.

How we do it : Bespoke analysis for each customers business and use cases driven by Dynatrace’s Digital Experience Monitoring data

Your role in the team

Develop new Machine Learning models for prediction, classification, and clustering

Design use cases for taking advantage of our huge performance and monitoring data sets

Cooperate with Product Management to integrate your machine learning modules into our core Insights analytics platform and workflow

Your Profile
More than 5 years of experience in building machine learning models (e.g. using techniques like deep neural network, support vector machine, random forest or Bayesian networks)
Familiar with unsupervised learning techniques like k-means clustering, DBSCAN and anomaly detection
Experience with machine learning frameworks like Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Theano, Scikit-Learn, Caffe
Programming skills in a high level language (preferably Python)
Hands-on Team player and proactive person of action with excellent communication skills

You Will Love This Job If
Machine Learning is your passion and you want to drive your own ideas.
You are fascinated by technical challenges and think outside the box.
An international environment is attractive to you.

Our Location?? 🚀 We are in "Torre Glòries" on the 15th and 16th Floor ; currently we are working from home due to Covid restrictions, but we have a beautiful open-space and modern office waiting for you :)

We offer competitive salaries depending on your experience, life & health insurance, merit based salary increase, training programs, awesome and international engineering community and more.

We look forward to your application! Do you want to level up? Apply and let's talk!

Descripción:
If you believe in creating something extraordinary, you’ll fit right in at Hach. You’ll find we’re always looking to improve. You’ll notice we believe that we can be better tomorrow than we are today. Some call it dedication, others call it drive, we call it passion. Hach is here to ensure water quality for people around the world. Want to join us in this mission? We are ready for your best. DIVE IN. HAVE IMPACT.

ENSURING WATER QUALITY FOR PEOPLE AROUND THE WORLD – Providing access to and information about water is our number one responsibility. Both around the corner and around the globe, we are committed to providing innovative solutions that help ensure that communities large and small have water that is safe, accessible and available for all. Develop your skills and grow your expertise while playing a role in improving the quality of life for people around the world. Learn more about how you can make a difference at Hach by visiting www.hach.com.

Predominantly work to be done with a distinctive character:
Responsible for execution and growth of existing RTC monitoring services, including commissioning and optimization activities, and daily monitoring of customer sites.
Deliver reporting to customers at pre-determined cadence that summarizes instrument/process performance and insights
Continually advance, iterate and improve service offerings through discrete pilots and experimentation
Responsible for execution and growth of existing RTC monitoring services, including commissioning and optimization activities, and daily monitoring of customer sites.
Continually advance, iterate and improve service offerings through discrete pilots and experimentation
Advises with a very deep product and application knowledge for a special portfolio and has a very good understanding of technical and chemical processes
Technical support via telephone, email or on-site (e.g.: Sales support, troubleshooting and solving very complex support requests)
Documentation of FAQs in the knowledge database
Implementation of training courses and customer seminars
Knowledge transfer during customer seminars, training and support activities
Achievement of group objectives (accessibility, support quality, response time)
Customer-oriented thinking taking into account business management aspects
Works quickly with problem-solving orientation (number of technical problems, turnaround time)
Achieves a very high quality of work (avoiding second customer call)
Carries out his tasks with empathy
Training and induction of new supporters. Can allocate work and provide subject-related technical guidance to inexperienced team members and influence the effectiveness of their own team
Help expand monitoring services to instrumentation via the Overwatch/ Claros connector project
Work with Data Scientist to expand instrument and process monitoring capabilities to become increasingly more accurate and prevent customer downtime.
Offer simulation/ process optimization services to customers to tackle their most complex treatment decisions via a software partner

DBS & Other
Active participation in the improvement of systems and processes by making suggestions for improvement
Other job-related tasks as specified by the manager

Qualifications
A level of education which corresponds to completed university studies and either several years of professional experience
At least two years of specialised technical school education and many years of specialised professional experience
Several years of professional experience as an experienced supporter or in a scientific or technical profession in a comparable environment
Very good understanding of technical customer processes and applications
Very good understanding of waste water treatment processes in both municipal and industrial applications
High support orientation and structured, results-oriented working method
Very good written and spoken German language skills
Good written and spoken English
Additional languages a plus

Sector: Investigación de mercado
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Gabija Norkaityte (she/her)
Internal Tech Recruiter at GfK - WE ARE HIRING!
Enviar mensaje InMail
Next time you go shopping, think about this: What if brands asked for your opinion on their products before they put them on the shelf? Wouldn’t that be nice? At Netquest we give voice to the consumers enabling them to shape the products and services of tomorrow. How? We deliver consumers’ genuine opinions and data to help companies create better products for you.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Netquest is looking for a talented Data Engineer to join our team. As part of a growing Data & Analytics team you will work to grow and expand our data platform to solve our current and future challenges. You will be working with multiple data sources contributing to transform the data into a business knowledge.

The main responsibilities of this team are:

Design, evolve and maintain the data platform that ingests, stores, processes and exploits data from disparate data sources 
Design, build, and maintain processes and components of a streaming data/ETL pipeline to support both real-time&batch analytics.
Govern all data ingested by the platform and define and implement the data models that support the different analytics needs.

Your main responsibilities will be (in this order):

Design complex queries in MySQL or PostgreSQL, in order to optimize performance of extraction and analysis of big datasets.
Design and implement multi-dimensional model in a distributed database like AWS Redshift.
Develop transformation jobs with an ETL tool like Talend or a distributed computing framework like Apache Spark.
Automation: use of tools like Apache Airflow, AWS Batch or AWS Lambda and bash scripts for the automated management of the data pipeline.
Data governance: be able to organize and maintain a data lake (AWS S3) so that it does not become a data swamp
Analyze the data requirements and define the needed data sources, formats, extraction frequency.
Develop extraction components from different data sources (databases, api, files, etc) with programming languages such as Java, Scala or Python.


 SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
You´re a great candidate if…

You have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
You have at least 2 to 5 years of experience as a back-end developer (Java or Scala or Python)
You’re an ace at data modeling, able to keep into account the needs of multiple users and can code SQL in your sleep, optimizing queries for performance and maintainability
You are knowledgeable with various ETL techniques and frameworks. 
You have been using Amazon WebServices, Azure or similar platforms. 
You are able to work-out effective solutions under uncertain or ambiguous circumstances
You’re always willing to learn something new and embrace a healthy debate.



  It’s a bonus if you have:

Experience with AWS Redshift or other MPPs.
Experience with Talend Data integration.
Experience with streaming platforms like Kafka or Aws Kinesis.
Experience with Apache Spark or Hadoop.
Experience with orchestration tools like Airflow or Luigi.
Experience with AWS Glue and AWS EMR
Experience integrating data from multiple sources including DBs and APIs.
Some experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).


Netquest:

Netquest is among the most advanced and innovative digital data collection specialists worldwide in the market research and analytics industry. We currently have more than 2,000,000 consumers willing to share their behavioral data and give us their opinion in 27 countries.

Our ambition is to be the most reliable, flexible and powerful data source in the market, and contribute to the future of market research through automation and innovation.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Software Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Estás buscando un proyecto revolucionario? Tienes más de dos años de experiencia como Data Science? Te atrae el mundo Startup y la innovación en la educación?

Desde Ethikos 3.0. te estamos buscando, este puede ser tu proyecto.

Nuestro cliente es una plataforma tecno-pedagógica que permite diseñar experiencias de aprendizaje (unidades didácticas y proyectos ABP), fomenta las metodologías activas y el asesoramiento pedagógico de manera que tiene integrado el currículo local, ofreciendo un proceso de creación pautado y una guía pedagógica a cada paso con inspiraciones y ejemplos.

Qué buscamos?

Un Data science que ayude a la organización a la gestión integral de una estrategia de datos en dos líneas de negocio.

Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Extracción, tratamiento y análisis de datos.
Estudio, propuesta de acciones de mejora y medición de resultados, con el objetivo de contribuir en la mejora del desarrollo del negocio.
Definición, medición y automatización de KPI´s, cuadros de mando, objetivos e informes de gestión.
Detección, creación de sistemas de alerta y análisis de desviaciones en los objetivos y KPI´s.
Mejora y mayor operatividad del cuadro de mandos integral.
Desarrollo de modelos de negocio. Cruces de datos y segmentación de información.
Participación en la definición, desarrollo, implementación y automatización de nuevos procesos y proyectos.
Qué requisitos son imprescindibles para el puesto?

Licenciado o graduado en estudios con alto componente cuantitativo (ingeniería, estadística, matemáticas, etc)
Conocimientos en paquetes estadísticos o plataformas de Data Mining
Dominio de Paquete Office (Excel, Access, Powerpoint)
Programación de consultas SQL
Nivel de inglés intermedio-alto B2
Especialista en analítica web.
Experiencia en análisis del comportamiento de los usuarios dentro de la plataforma tecnológica.
Muy valorable experiencia con TABLEAU o similar (BI)
Qué ofrece la empresa?

Formar parte de un equipo multidisciplinario e internacional
Te unirás a un proyecto, innovador y disruptivo, pero no es solo eso, trabajar en pos del futuro, los niños, la educación del siglo XXI
Horario flexible y tardes del viernes libre
Opción de acogerse a nuestro Plan de Retribución flexible
Descuentos GymPass en varios gimnasios, ¡estarás en plena forma!
Otros descuentos (Hoteles, packs de viajes).
Si lo que lees, te resulta interesante, aplica a la oferta, nos pondremos en contacto contigo para darte más detalles.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Data Engineer, Content ML Infra
Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Magdalena Smoleń
Talent Acquisition Partner w Brainly
Enviar mensaje InMail
NOTICE: ONLINE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
LOCATION: BARCELONA OR REMOTELY FROM SPAIN / KRAKÓW OR REMOTELY FROM POLAND
 Brainly is growing and currently helping 350 million students around the world. This is a challenge to data engineering teams as we need to provide data solutions for optimizing and delivering more and more insights about our products and users.
You have a chance to be at the centre of this exciting effort.
 The Content ML Infra team is responsible for providing the AI capabilities of:
Learning new knowledge representations for text and media-rich contents.
Enhancing and automating the content management process.
Ensuring the quality and safety of Brainly’s knowledge base.
 Whom are we looking for?
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer whose work is essential for data science and machine learning conducted research. 
If you like to work cross-functionally with various engineering teams to identify and execute new opportunities in data-driven production environments - you will be a great fit for this role.

What will you do as a Data Engineer at Brainly?
Design and implement scalable ETL pipelines for providing the datasets required for rapid experimenting as well as for production use cases
Establish the data framework to be used by various machine learning and data science technologies
Assemble and transform complex unstructured datasets into features that are digestible for the ML algorithms and maintain the feature store up-to-date
Deploy and maintain the label management system and automate the integration of the data labelling process
Work with MLOps engineers to integrate the ML jobs and services with the wider production system
Build sanity checks and dashboards for monitoring data quality and system performances
Ensure engineering and programming practices among the whole team
 What will you need to be successful in this role?
Required experience:
5 years of experience in a similar position in Data Engineering or related fields
Experience in design, maintenance, and integration of Data Lake and Data Warehouse solutions
Experience with data storage and processing technologies (relational/non-relational databases, warehouses, cloud storage solutions, different processing engines, Apache Spark)
Experience with modern cloud services and serverless architectures (Google Bigquery, Google Cloud Storage, S3, AWS Services)
Experience with SQL, Python, and bash
Bachelor’s degree or above in computer science or software/computer/IT engineering fields
Experience with microservices, REST or GraphQL APIs
English fluency

Preferred experience:
Working knowledge of functional programming and monadic pipelines, Scala
Experience with NLP models, or text analytics, in production
Attributes
Ability to prototype and test suboptimal solutions quickly and iterate up to a final product that can be deployed in production
Be expected to be analytical, accurate but also creative and to come up with your own ideas and suggestions
Team player attitude and clear communications skills
Familiar with agile development and lean principles
 Technology stack you will be working with:
Spark, DataBricks, Glue, EMR, Docker, Kubernetes, SQL, key-value stores, Redshift, Snowflake, Fivetran, Matillion
 Additional details:
Location: Barcelona or remotely from Spain / Kraków or remotely from Poland
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely
Personal development budget 800$ per year + unlimited time off policy for participation in conferences and workshops and access to an online learning platform with courses from Udemy, Harvard Manage Mentor, and many others
Fully paid private health care package
If needed, additional budget for work remote work accessories
 What is BRAINLY?
Brainly is the world's largest peer-to-peer learning community for students, parents, and teachers. At brainly.com, and its group of websites around the world, students connect to both receive and offer help with homework problems and questions. The unique opportunity for students to freely ask questions and gain the confidence that comes from helping others and inspires students to learn in a collaborative community that receives more than 350 million users each month.
Based in Kraków, Poland, with its US headquarters in New York City, Brainly is currently available in 35 countries. The total funding from current investors, including Naspers, General Catalyst Partners, Point Nine Capital, Runa Capital, and Learn Capital equals $150M. More information about Brainly is available on www.brainly.com.

If you have any questions regarding the use of information about you and exercising your rights related to this use, please contact our DPO - privacy@brainly.com. Sector: Logística y cadena de suministro Servicios medioambientales Transporte por carretera o ferrocarril
Descripción:
We are Wind.

Our mission? To make transport sustainable for everyone across the world. We’re putting the fun back into commuting with our e-scooters, and we want you to join us!

Today we are powering over 20 cities worldwide and growing quickly to become a key player in the field of micro-mobility. With the launch of a new state of the art scooter, we are expanding our talented team to reach new heights.

We are looking for a superhero to be our new Big Data Developer to power and expand our BI team in Barcelona. It’s a hands-on and rewarding role which requires a versatile personality and a strong set of technical and project management skills.

Our team has an obsession with offering a unique customer experience. We do this by using the data we generate across the globe to understand our customers better than any other micro-mobility provider. The objective of this role is to accelerate our time to insight by taking the vast amounts of non-structured and structured data we generate every second and transform them into usable outputs. You would fit best in this role if you are eager and qualified to propose and implement data architecture.

If you’re hungry for a challenge, able to navigate the uncharted waters of a new industry, and extremely result-driven…then what are you waiting for? We wanna hear from you!

Every superhero has super responsibilities

You will
Help developing the Big Data Architecture to process our data in AWS
Create new assets to extract features from the (JSON time-series) files from our devices
Assemble a data lake to organise our data assets and configure data marts to consume and modify our consolidated data
Move Data Science applications into production, designing the architecture, developing, testing and delivering robust solutions used in all our location worldwide
Push for adopting the best architectural standards and working ways across the team

You Have
More than 2 years of experience in Python and SQL programming
An engineering degree in Computer Science
Solid experience working with AWS (specially Cloud Formation, EC2, Glue, Kinesis, Lambda and S3)
Experience working with OLAP / OLTP systems and NoSQL databases (preferably Postgres, Redshift, DynamoDB and MongoDB)
Good system analysis, logical thinking, and ability to analyse and solve problems independently
Previous experience with CI/CD in Jenkins/Concourse/AWS CodePipeline
Experience with Git and JIRA
Experience with Spark will be a great advantage
Excellent English

It Would Also Be Great If You Are
Familiar with Data Science Engineering, having had the experience to upgrade Data Science PoC’s into production
Familiar with Linux, shell scripting and containerization of applications (Docker, K8s, ECS)
Familiar with pySpark and Scala
You'll receive:
The opportunity to be part of a growing, international team
Flexible working hours
Team building events
Learning & Development fund, which you can use for taking courses, buying books etc.
A real challenge! (We’re a startup…no day is ever the same!)
Competitive salary
Come as you are! At Wind we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. While for this role we ask that you should be eligible to work in Spain, we remain an open-minded meritocracy. If you are a quick thinker, able to navigate the uncharted waters of a new industry, and extremely results-driven, we want to hear from you!

Descripción:
Context And Mission

The Memory systems team[1] from the Computer Science Department at the Barcelona Supercomputing Center[2] is offering a full-time researcher position. The researcher will work on the project that explores advanced memory systems (HBM, DDR4, 3DxPoint) for high-performance computing (HPC). We strongly encourage the application of candidates who are interested in a close collaboration with industry and contact with cutting edge technology developers.

[1]

[2]

Key Duties
Profiling and performance modeling of HPC applications running on high-end servers with advanced memory systems (HBM, DDR4, 3DxPoint).
Writing technical reports and dissemination of the project results

Requirements

Education
PhD in Computer Science, ideally PhD in Computer Architecture
Strong candidates with MSc in Computer Science are also encouraged to apply

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience
Knowledge of computer architecture
Experience with Unix/Linux environments
Experience with profiling tools: Hardware counters, PAPI interface
Programming languages (C/C++, Python)

Additional Knowledge And Professional Experience
Understanding of memory systems and memory technologies (e.g. DRAM, HBM) is a plus
Experience with hardware/system simulators (e.g. ZSim, Gem5) is a plus
Competences
Fluency in English is essential
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to take initiative
Conditions
The position will be located at BSC within the Computer Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract, a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, tickets restaurant, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Temporary - 24 months renewable
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: Q1 2021

Our client based in the breathtaking Barcelona, Spain is a leading company producing innovative free-to-play games for mobile devices and is looking for a data scientist to join their team. The games are played and highly-rated by millions of people worldwide, placing our company in the ranks of globally-respected game studios.

What does a data scientist do?
Manage data processing procedures on both client/server platforms
Implement telemetry (events) into our games
Influence how data infrastructure and business intelligence tools are used within studio
Establish standard methodologies for data storage, ETL and automation


What We Need From You
3+ years leading analysis on an online product or mobile app (F2P a bonus)
SQL - 1+ year everyday use in practice (specific SQL dialect or database does not matter)
Any practice with data/databases from real life for at least 2 years (data clearing/administration, file import/export, work with MS Excel/Access, data visualization)
Experience with some visualization tool (Tableau or Power BI)
Relation to programming (knowledge of one language) and mathematics
English written and spoken


Appreciated
Passion for video/mobile games
Experienced senior or team leader
Practice with Python or JAVA
Cloud-based experience (Google Cloud Platform, AWS), column databases
Experience from game industry is a plus


Benefits
Newest devices
Breakfast and lunch

Fresh fruit

Is this the role for you?

Sector: Internet
Funciones laborales: Tecnología de la información Ingeniería Otro
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Cristina Cohi 2º
Senior HR Tech Recruiter at XING (New Work SE)
Enviar mensaje InMail
New Work SE - for a better working life

We believe in a world of work where people can find their true self and achieve their full potential. This not only makes individuals more satisfied and happier, it also makes companies more successful. 

Our Data Science team is responsible for turning data into services and products for New Work SE. Around 20 data scientists and engineers work together to create highly scalable solutions which serve millions of users. We bring state-of-the-art algorithms into production by making use of technologies such as Scala, Kubernetes, Hadoop (e.g. Hive, Spark), Akka, Kafka, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, etc. We are an international team with people working from multiple locations in Spain, Hamburg (Germany) and remote. Learn more about our team at: https://bit.ly/data-science-team

At the moment, we are working intensively on projects related to reusable recommender systems components and building pipelines for automated machine learning. We are now seeking an experienced Data Engineer who loves software development, helps with the design and development of scalable components and contributes to search services and recommender systems. We strive for building testable, predictable and simple code. If you want to get things done rather than sit in meetings, and if you like helping others and learning from them, you will have fun in our team!


A challenging task
Design and implement highly scalable services, batch or real-time data processing workflows/components and products which make smart use of data to provide data-driven functionality (in particular: search and recommender services)
Develop code for processing and analyzing large amounts of data (e.g. tracking data, semi-structured data sets, graph data, etc.), bring machine learning models to production and apply big data technology as well as technologies related to distributed systems.
Build, deploy, monitor and operate services within our infrastructure, while automating processes.
Work in a team with Data Engineers and Data Scientists to support the (technical) design, implementation and evaluation of new algorithms, machine learning models and other data-driven features and services.
Use technologies like Scala, Python, Kafka, Kubernetes, Elasticsearch, Cassandra and Hadoop technologies such as Hive, Spark.

A convincing background
BSc or higher degree in Computer Science or equivalent Software Engineering experience
Good programming skills in a JVM based language, like Scala, Java, Closure or Kotlin
Knowledge and experience in implementing scalable software and data-driven services which processes large datasets, using search technologies (e.g., Elasticsearch, Solr, etc.), Big Data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, etc.), data storage (e.g. relational databases, key-value stores) and related data processing technologies (e.g. Kafka, Akka, Play, etc.)
Good knowledge in SQL
Proficient English language skills (German is not required)
Nice to have
Python and relevant frameworks
Previous experience in building recommender systems or search services
At senior level, proven track-record of building rock-solid data-driven solutions (i.e. fault-tolerant, highly reliable features, solutions which scale regarding volume of data, robustness regarding changing data characteristics, re-usable and easily extendable etc.).
Previous experience in working in a distributed setup


An inspiring environment

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Who we are: We are a workforce on-demand company that heavily relies on tech. We integrate the complete process of selecting, hiring, and managing employees, being the first in digitizing all the steps, introducing Artificial Intelligence solutions in multiple phases, obtaining faster and higher-quality service for our clients, and great satisfaction and loyalty for our workers.
Our Impact on Society: Our vision is to create a long-term job security condition for our workers while providing flexible solutions to our clients. We can do this by concatenating different short-term contracts and minimizing–or completely removing–their unemployed time. We want to remove the need for finding a job ever again. 
Data-Driven: Being the owner of the entire hiring funnel, workforce management, and working experience, give us very unique data that we transform into powerful knowledge to make better decisions, improve job-candidate matches, estimate quality and affinity, and share performance feedback with our workers and clients. We are the most advanced workforce on-demand company thanks to our data and the way we use it.
Great Challenges for the Data Team: Integrating very different AI solutions to improve the experience for both our workers and employers (Shift Optimization, Machine Learning algorithms, Quality Score Estimations, Document recognition, etc.), relying on a very powerful ETL that permits endless automatizations while keeping the focus on data quality.
Growth Overview: An annual growth of 170%, available in multiple countries: the UK, Spain, Germany, Sweden, Mexico, Colombia, France, and more are coming. HQ in Madrid with a second big presence in Barcelona and some remote workers in the UK, The Netherlands, and the USA. And finally, some of our great clients are Amazon, XPOLogistics, Cabify, Santander, Just Eat, etc. 
 You will be the main referent of our data architecture, leading the design and implementation decisions of our data pipelines. This role includes the possibility of managing the Data Automation team. 
 The Data Team is very independent of the rest of the Tech and Product teams. We build and manage our services that run our AI models as well as our data storages to quickly process the data we need, and let the Data Scientist performing the “Time Travel” to properly train our algorithms. A quick insight about our architecture and tools:
We are building our new data lake and data warehouse directly in AWS S3, synchronizing the data via DMS, and consolidate it via Hudi. This data will be accessible by multiple Redshift  clusters that allow us to quickly scale-up across all the countries. In addition as data is stored in S3 this could be exploited via Athena or an ad-hoc Spark job. 
We have multiple queue systems from which we consume data coming from the JobandTalent Message broker  while filling up our data storage. 
We use Airflow as our ETL which allows us to break down any complex problem/process into smaller ones. Each component can be implemented directly in Python, or any other language since we could execute any docker container in AWS Fargate. 
We are integrating different 3rd party data (Kustomer, Salesforce, etc.). We keep iterating in the best way to incorporate this data to our Datalake which allow our users to exploit this data.
 You need to have proven experience in these areas, being eager to learn and improve, while enjoying taking responsibility. You need to be very hands-on, able to explore different solutions to our problems and needs.  
 Requirements and Skills
Technical degree preferably in Engineering or Quantitative field.
Experience managing ETL or similar Data Workflows 
Experience in leading data architecture decisions and similar responsibilities.
Previous practical experience with Big Data technologies knowledge, batch and real-time (Hadoop, Spark, Hudi, Spark Streaming, Flink, etc.).
Extensive experience with production-ready code (not scripting code).
Extremely skilled programmer (e.g., unittest, production/staging experience). 
Python proficiency, and ideally experience with other programming languages such as Java, Scala.
Strong knowledge of different data storages (knows pros and cons, understand and investigate the best solution for each use-case).
Strong knowledge of different storage formats (JSON, Parquet, Avro, etc.), understand and investigate the best solution for each use-case.
Streaming data queue platforms knowledge (Kinesis, Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management, as well as the business and technical communities.
A valid work permit to be employed in Spain.
Fluent in English is a must.
 Besides, we are looking for a senior profile that will be interested in:
Managing a team of mid and junior Engineers, taking ownership of the key decisions, introducing new standards and protocols, helping them to grow, etc.
Sharing knowledge inside and outside Jobandtalent writing blog posts and/or giving talks, raising the quality standards of the entire team to grow together.
Contributing to Open Source projects: we are using different Open Source frameworks and libraries, and one of our wishes would be to contribute to some of those projects, dedicating part of our time when possible. 
 Offer in Short
Great ownership of the projects with a direct impact on the product.
Salary in the 55-70k range (wide range, depending on experience).
Transparent Equity package.
Discount on Health insurance.
A yearly budget for Conferences/meetup/self-learning.
Working in an international and multidisciplinary team 
You will be working in the Data Science team (read the last blog posts), together with Full-stack Engineers, Data Scientists, and Data Analysts.

Eurecat Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña

CATALÀ

Eurecat, Centre Tecnològic de Catalunya (membre de Tecnio), aplega l’experiència de més de 650 professionals i dóna servei a més de 1.700 empreses. R+D aplicat, més de 200 projectes realitzats, serveis tecnològics, formació d’alta especialització, consultoria tecnològica, 88 patents, 7 spin-ofss i esdeveniments professionals són alguns dels serveis que Eurecat ofereix tant per a grans com per a petites i mitjanes empreses de tots els sectors. El valor afegit que aporta Eurecat accelera la innovació, disminueix la despesa en infraestructures científiques i tecnològiques, redueix els riscos i proporciona coneixement especialitzat a mida de cada empresa.

CASTELLANO

Eurecat, Centro Tecnológico de Cataluña (miembro de Tecnio), aglutina la experiencia de más de 650 profesionales y presta servicio a más de 1.700 empresas. I+D aplicado, más de 200 proyectos realizados, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica, 88 patentes, 7 spin-off y eventos profesionales son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa.

ENGLISH

Eurecat, Technology Centre of Catalonia (member of Tecnio), brings together the expertise of 650 professionals and serving more than a 1.700 companies. Applied R + D, more than 200 projects, technological services, highly specialized training, 88 patents, 7 spin-offs, technology consulting and professional events are some of the services that Eurecat offers for both small and medium-sized companies of all sectors. The added value provided by Eurecat accelerates innovation, decreases spending on scientific and technological infrastructures, reduces risks and provides specialized knowledge to each company.

Descripción de la oferta

Eurecat desea incorporar a su equipo de BIG DATA ANALYTICS:

DATA ENGINEER

Funciones y Responsabilidades Del Trabajo
Apoyar el diseño, construcción y mantenimiento de la plataforma de datos de la organización, basada en la plataforma OpenStack.
Dar soporte en el desarrollo, diseño e implementación de sistemas de big data para Eurecat.
Participación en proyectos, con clientes externos, en actividades de consultoría y soporte como ingeniero de datos.

Requisitos

Formación
Ingeniero en Informática, Matemáticas, Física, Telecomunicaciones o equivalente con 2 años de experiencia profesional o Máster en este campo.

Experiencia y Conocimientos
Experiencia como ingeniero de datos o ingeniero de software en el ciclo de vida de desarrollo de software.
Experiencia en: Java, Scala o Phyton.
Conocimientos en algunos de los siguientes campos:

Tecnologías de Big Data como Hadoop, MapReduce, Hive, Pig, Spark, Flink, ...
Bases de datos: SQL (MySQL, PostgreSQL, ...) y NoSQL (Hive, Couchbase, Redis, ElasticSearch, Solr ...)
Estructuras de datos, minería de datos aplicada y Machine learning.
Programación de shell scripts

Buen nivel de inglés

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Max Stuart 🎮
Talent Acquisition at BANDAI NAMCO Mobile
 PAC-MAN to Tekken, Tamagotchi to Dark Souls, we are a games company steeped in history and BANDAI NAMCO Mobile is the exciting new pillar of the BANDAI NAMCO Group’s mobile strategy, to grow from the #5 global mobile publisher to #1!  
We offer a truly flat structure, full role autonomy and the creative freedom of a start- up, whilst still having the legacy, resources and stability of BANDAI NAMCO, a global gaming powerhouse. Our goal in Barcelona is to enrich BANDAI NAMCO's list of successful IP's by creating original and innovative mobile games. 
 Games Team 
 Everybody in our development team is first and foremost, a Game Maker and you will be no different. You will be working in small teams to rapidly design, prototype and iterate game ideas from yourself and the team, so although a master of your own discipline, you will still have a huge voice when it comes to concepting and designing Games at BANDAI NAMCO Mobile. Due to this, it is imperative that you can bring a deep understanding of the Mobile F2P Gaming Market. 
 Although an experienced voice when it comes to Video Games, you understand that there is always more to learn from both your peers and from the community. You are flexible and open to change within a fast-paced team environment and a firm believer that world class games begin with a world class team. You understand that processes are not written in stone to be followed regardless, that everything can always be changed and improved, and that change can bring innovation. 

Game Lead

We are currently looking for an experienced and empowering Game Lead to join our growing studio. You will make sure the development of the game runs smoothly and that the team can do their best work. You will remove blocks, manage external suppliers if needed and represent the team within the rest of the company. This role is perfect for a versatile self-starter who understands the concept of servant leadership.

At BNM we make game related decisions as a group effort. Everyone in the team is responsible for delivering the best possible experience. So, whether you're a Community Manager or Coder, Data Scientist or Designer your voice is always heard. While decisions are made like this, it's still important to have someone who can lead and drive the overall development and makes sure that everyone is tuned in and performing as highly as possible.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 15,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than five million lessons.

Backed by some of the world’s leading investors, Preply is on a mission to shape the future of effective learning. Fueled by a belief that live engagement with a teacher is still the most effective way to learn a new skill, Preply is building a personalized learning space that will enable individual learners to reach their goals in the fastest way possible.

Powered by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, Preply now has 220+ employees of over 37 nationalities based between Barcelona and Kyiv. Preply is driven by a culture of experimentation and data-driven learnings, focused on building best-in-class consumer and enterprise solutions.

As the company looks to increase momentum and scale geographically, this is a unique opportunity to join one of the most vibrant and attractive start-up communities in the world.

Preply is looking for a highly analytical person to join a team of talented data scientists who work at constantly improving the understanding of our customers (supply & demand).

As part of this role, you’ll study user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You’d be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

As a Data Scientist, You Will
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace
Produce thorough data analytics across the customer journey, from acquisition to activation, engagement and retention
Increase our customer knowledge through applied analytics, clustering and segmentation
Quantify the impact of the initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap
Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, sharing knowledge and insights across the organization
Design, execute, and evaluate experiments on a global scale (CRM, copy, etc.)
Iterate on our growth strategy (attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modeling, etc.)
Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks
Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team
Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators
Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Datawarehouse and productionize your data pipelines.
Build models aimed at understanding customer behaviour and predicting key metrics such as conversion, retention and LTV
Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards


What We Are Looking For
Experience as an in-house Data Scientist or Data Analyst. At least 3 years' experience, ideally more.
Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.)
Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Spark, Python, etc.)
Previous experience in some of the following Growth techniques: attribution, bidding, segmentation, channels optimization, incremental tests, media-mix modelling
Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills
Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses
Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.
Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must


Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C)
Knowledge of Looker, Tableau or other BI tools
Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.)
Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.)


What We Offer
An opportunity for personal and professional growth, supported by high functioning teams, stellar investors and the exciting challenges that come with joining a company at the start of its growth trajectory;
An environment free of bureaucracy and corporate constraints; a culture where your opinion is highly valued and appreciated;
An open, collaborative, dynamic and international culture;
A monthly allowance for self-development on Preply.com;
A competitive financial package, with generous leave allowance and health insurance


Our Values
Human: We speak honestly and directly with compassion and radical candor. We believe every interaction should be friendly, personalized, diverse and inclusive. Above all, we believe fun should be apart of everything we do
Customer Obsession: We put our customers first by asking for feedback and analyzing the data to build products they love.
Hungry: Our will to win is unmatched. We make bold, data-informed decisions, to quickly deliver value to our customers. We dare to dream big, think like co-owners, and go the extra mile to hire others who share our champion spirit.
Humble: We keep our egos low, constantly learn, and trust in data to make smart decisions. We know that our knowledge is imperfect and incomplete, but not stagnant. There's always more to learn from each other, our customers, and the world around us.
Curious: We are lifelong learners. Our curiosity helps us to view tough situations more creatively. We kill the noise and go deep on insights. We face challenges head on, and consistently seek opportunities to learn more.
Hackers: We’re obsessed with our customer’s problems. We focus on what matters, design with pragmatism, and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions.


Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply.com is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people of diverse backgrounds can thrive. We believe that the presence of different opinions and viewpoints is a key ingredient for our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company. That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Descripción:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.

Data Scientist role:

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital technologies. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your Goals

Your objective would be to re-imagine the future of the industry, and the next generation of predictive process control

Your role will require the extraction, wrangling and enrichment of data from one or multiple sources, online or offline

Develop innovative thought leadership and contribute to the creation of points of view on re-usable models in Supply Chain.

Key Responsibilities

Responsible for the development of predictive models and the generation of data-driven insights to solve industrial problems or challenges.

You’ll be responsible for development, training and validation of mentioned models, and the visualization of the data and model results through dynamic dashboards.

Manage and manipulate data sets, including: variables definition, performing calculations and summarizations, and creating solutions to address client business needs.

Outline and structure the project tasks and best approach, along with team senior members, from the detailed understanding of client’s problem statement and their specific business requirements.

Provide specific training and guidance to development factory to ensure data integration activities around base and feature-enriched tables align with the analytical models.

Develop and maintain analytical models.

Demonstrate a high degree of ownership, accountability for your output and commitment to the task.

Mentor and train junior developers and modelers.

Support Management team on client proposals and other sales activities.

Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with offshore development teams and provide guidance to ensure quality deliverables.

Skills you will need:

You should have working knowledge of process data visualization, statistics/statistical testing, machine learning, data mining, and database structure and management.

Passion in statistical analysis.

Critical thinking and attention to detail.

Statistical analysis/programming in tools like R, SAS, PYTHON, SCADA, Spark, MATLAB, Tensor Flow, Torch, Caffe, Excel, CNTK.

Knowledge in visualization tools like Shiny, Spotfire, Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI.

Knowledge of full life cycle development methodologies
