Descripción:
Anunciado por
Laura Perez Ramírez 2º
Especialista de selección de personal en Grupo MASMOVIL
Enviar mensaje InMail
En Grupo MASMOVIL estamos comprometidos con la sociedad. Las personas son la clave de nuestro éxito y creemos firmemente en la riqueza que ofrece la diversidad cultural, funcional, de edad o de género. Por ello, valoramos a los profesionales por su valía y ganas de aportar, promoviendo la igualdad de oportunidades para todos. Te estamos esperando. Queremos crecer contigo y juntos generar impacto social positivo.



Uno de los principales objetivos de Grupo MASMOVIL es convertirnos en una compañía 100% orientada al dato. Este enfoque tiene muchos beneficios y permite emplear la información de forma estratégica para obtener ventajas competitivas.

Para ello, se están llevando distintas iniciativas y proyectos en distintos ámbitos de la organización, con el objetivo de asegurar la calidad y coherencia de los datos, y proporcionar a los usuarios un mayor grado de autonomía en el acceso y explotación de estos.

Los equipos de IT Data y BI llevan meses trabajando en crear una plataforma única que contenga los datos del grupo. Ahora que la plataforma está lo suficientemente desarrollada, debemos crear las capacidades necesarias en cada tribu (Customer Excellence, CVM, Sale, Prepaid, Customer Care, etc) para sacarle el máximo partido.

En este contexto, queremos incorporar profesionales potentes que centralicen las necesidades de data en cada tribu. Se responsabilizarán de la gestión del dato en la tribu que integren, de cara a obtener insights de valor que ayuden en la toma de decisiones de negocio, generar distintos reportes y dashboards de seguimiento, etc.

Principales responsabilidades:

-Explotación y optimización del dato de la compañía, como de otras fuentes alternativas de información con el fin de realizar informes, contrastar hipótesis y dar respuesta a preguntas de negocio.

-Creación y automatización de informes y dashboards de seguimiento.

-Control de calidad de las bases de datos y análisis realizados.

-Segmentación de clientes.

-Realización análisis ad-hoc extrayendo datos de múltiples fuentes.

-Realización de presentaciones de resultados

-Coordinación con otras áreas de cara a coordinar intercambios de información, metodologías y mejores prácticas.





Requisitos:

Formación Reglada:

Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, informática o Economía.

Experiencia Mínima requerida :

De 2 a 5 años de experiencia en puestos similares

Conocimiento del Sector (deseable)

Idiomas:

Inglés

Conocimientos Técnicos:

Habituado a trabajar con bases de datos y en entornos de explotación del data

Experto en SQL

Experiencia probada en herramientas de BI (Tableau, DataStudio...)

Otros Requisitos:

Buen desempeño en entornos colaborativos

Ciudad de Ubicación:

Alcobendas

Misión del puesto
El/la analista de datos es el/la responsable de dar un servicio a una unidad de negocio para la transformación de datos en información con el objetivo de poder llevar a cabo una toma de decisiones más completa.
Responsabilidades principales del puesto 
Interpretar datos, analizar resultados utilizando técnicas estadísticas y enviar informes.
Desarrollar e implementar bases de datos, sistemas de recopilación de datos, analítica de datos y otras estrategias que optimicen la eficiencia estadística y la calidad.
Captar datos de fuentes de datos primarias o secundarias y mantener las bases de datos.
Filtrar y "limpiar" los datos mediante la revisión de informes informáticos, impresos e indicadores de rendimiento para localizar y corregir problemas de código.
Localizar y definir nuevas oportunidades de mejora de procesos.
Trabajar con la dirección para priorizar las necesidades de información y de la empresa.
Ayudar a definir la implementación de herramientas analíticas.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Software Internet
Descripción:
We’re looking for a Commercial Data Analyst to join our Analytics team, working on a fully remote basis until at least March 2021.

About Carwow

Buying a car is the 2nd biggest financial decision people make after buying a house, and it’s an incredibly complex one. Consumers face many challenges in the process from choosing the right car to buy, to making sure they’re getting a good deal - here at carwow we aim to fix them all.

From an attic to the 6th fastest growing company in Europe in 2018; carwow is an online marketplace making car buying better for everyone. Car buying is one of the last areas to be revolutionised by the internet - here at carwow we’re leading the online revolution. Already we’ve improved car buying for 200,000+ people who have bought £5 billion+ worth of cars with our help.

We’re a highly driven (excuse the pun), energetic scale-up with a team of 200+ based in London, Munich and Madrid. We’re backed by some of Europe’s leading VCs & car manufacturer Daimler (Mercedes-Benz) with over £55m of total funding raised.

We’re constantly asking ourselves how we can make car buying better, so if you’re curious, motivated, and want to help us change the future of our industry, get in touch. It’s the chance to be at the very start of something huge.

The role

As a Commercial Data Analyst within the Analytics team at carwow, you will work closely with our General Managers and Commercial leadership in the UK, Germany and Spain, and wider business stakeholders. carwow’s model thrives on bringing both consumers dealerships together, and this is a unique role sitting at the interface between supply and demand.

You will be able to put your talent and passion of turning complex data into actionable business decisions and doing so in a fast-paced ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities Include
Conduct marketplace analysis - supply & demand balancing, consumer funnel conversion rates, network growth opportunities, dealership churn, commercial model optimisation.
Help to inform, influence, support and execute carwow’s business decisions.
Develop and run quantitative analysis and reports to support our commercial growth efforts.
Produce automated tools and dashboards to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key metrics and experiment results.
Initiate and drive projects from start to finish with minimal guidance.
Manage and work with senior stakeholders in the UK head office and the Commercial teams in the UK, Germany and Spain.
Work with enormous amounts of data!


Requirements
Previous experience with quantitative analysis, preferably for an Internet company (or high volume B2C environment) is essential
Advanced SQL, highly skilled in data analysis and visualisation (e.g Tableau or similar BI tool).
Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Excellent business judgment and strategic thinking/commercial acumen
An excellent communicator with the ability to clearly make sense of complex ideas
A passion for analytics and data
Experience with programming languages (e.g. Python/R) – a plus
Bsc/BA in a relevant field e.g mathematics, statistics, economics, engineering or other quantitative field could be advantageous


Benefits
A competitive salary
Equity in the company (share options)
25 days holiday, plus bank holidays and Christmas Eve
Health Private medical health insurance, subsidised gym membership, free access to Sanctus mental-health coaching sessions
Financial Private pension scheme, salary sacrifice benefits (i.e. cycle to work), Travel Loan
Office A dog-friendly office in Victoria to take advantage of in the New Year (let Mat Watson take you for a spin around our office here) with remote working options
Social Company wide collaboration such as bi-weekly product demos, coffee with the exec sessions, culture club, social events (currently virtual)


At carwow, we appreciate the value that comes from having diverse employees. Whether that be diversity of age, disability, sex, gender, sexuality, pregnancy, race or religion, we strive to create a team where anybody can thrive. We strongly believe a varied workforce creates a more innovative company with a broader perspective. Wherever you’re from, whatever you believe, all we ask is that you have drive and share our company values (you can view them here).

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Venta al por menor Servicios financieros
Descripción:
¿Te sientes identificado con la metodología Agile y tienes ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos? ¿Te apasiona la ingeniería de datos y quieres seguir cogiendo experiencia en una de las empresas lideres en el sector del almacenamiento y transporte de hidrocarburos? Si es así, ¡No dejes pasar esta oportunidad y apúntate a esta oferta!

El Grupo CLH es la principal empresa de almacenamiento y transporte de productos petrolíferos de España, y que además, tras el acuerdo con Inter Pipeline (IPL) para adquirir 15 instalaciones de almacenamiento en Reino Unido, Irlanda, Alemania y Países Bajos, se ha convertido en la principal empresa logística de productos líquidos en Europa. El Grupo CLH está integrado en España por CLH, CLH Aviación y TERQUIMSA (Terminales Químicos, S.A.). Además cuenta con presencia internacional a través de CLH Pipeline System (CLH-PS) Ltd. en Reino Unido, CLH Aviation Ireland en Irlanda y Orpic Logistics Company L.L.C. (OLC) que desarrolla su actividad en Omán.
El Grupo CLH desempeña un papel clave para garantizar a la sociedad un acceso fácil y seguro a los productos petrolíferos y basa su gestión en criterios de compromiso con la sostenibilidad, la seguridad, la eficiencia y la colaboración con la sociedad, como recoge su Misión, Visión y Valores.

Ofrecemos
Salario: según valía y experiencia.
Incorporación a un sólido Grupo multinacional que valora a sus colaboradores
Flexibilidad en horario de entrada y salida
Formación, apoyo y aprendizaje constante dentro de un equipo muy experimentado, con excelente ambiente de trabajo y profesionalidad.
Participar en el desarrollo de las iniciativas ágiles de nuestro HUB Digital, donde utilizamos las tecnologías más punteras en materia de Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Edge Computing, Cloud Computing, IoT, RPA, NLP y otras muchas.
Requisitos
Grado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Económicas o similar
Bases de datos, SQL, procesos ETL, Power BI.
Persona Agile Mindset y con experiencia utilizando metodologías ágiles en entornos de trabajo colaborativo.
Habilidades de comunicación efectiva (Data Storytelling).
Valorable experiencia con ecosistema de Azure y conocimientos de programación con Python, así como formación de Data Scientist.
Idioma Inglés nivel alto (mínimo B2 - 800 puntos en TOEIC).
Experiencia deseable de al menos 1-2 años en tareas similares
Responsabilidades
La persona que buscamos se integraría en nuestro equipo del HUB Digital y trabajaría muy alineada con los Product Owners de negocio, con el ingeniero/a de datos y con el científico de datos, y se encargaría de utilizar en la práctica el planteamiento de infraestructura propuesto por el ingeniero/a de datos, y de realizar todas aquellas operaciones ETL necesarias (Extracción, Transformación y Carga de datos) para que el Científico de Datos pueda desarrollar sus modelos. También sería la persona responsable de estructurar la visualización de los datos, generar informes, así como de la retroalimentación e integración de los modelos generados por el científico de datos para su consumo por parte de negocio (Business Intelligence). Pero en CLH sabemos que la experiencia no lo es todo y por eso valoramos también que tengas entusiasmo por unirte a nuestro proyecto y que seas una persona comprometida, proactiva y con ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos.

¡Por lo demás, nosotros te ayudaremos e impulsaremos en todo momento!

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get To Know Our Team

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In This Role, You’ll Get To
Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.


What You’ll Need To Succeed
Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity


It’s Great If You Have
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL
Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience

Sector: Software Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Returnly

At Returnly, we help brands that care about shopper loyalty offer better product returns. We are a financial technology services company that builds award-winning products that drive repurchase behavior and customer loyalty. We’re backed by smart money VCs in Fintech including some prominent members of the Paypal Mafia. Our headquarters are in San Francisco Financial District and we have offices in Chicago and Madrid. We are on a mission to de-risk online commerce and are building a team of amazingly talented people to help us do it.

About The Role

At Returnly, we value you as a whole person. We care about the skillset you bring to the table, but more importantly, we care about the kind of person you are and the culture and attitude that you bring. As a Lead Analyst, you will work with our Product, Marketing, Data Science, Sales, Customer Success, and Finance teams to define and create meaningful analyses to help drive revenue, fix processes, and monitor impact. You will become an expert in our merchant and shopper data and seek to use that knowledge to provide an enhanced product experience using tools such as SQL, Python, Looker, statistics, machine learning, etc. This is a cross-functional role in which you’ll work with the Director of Analytics as well as the CEO, CTO and other members of Leadership to help prioritize the data projects that will have the biggest impact for Returnly merchants and shoppers.

About You

Here’s what we look for in the attitude department:
You are a seasoned and versatile analytics leader who is passionate about your work
You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
You are proactive and adaptable
You like to solve problems and to fill in the gaps where there are unknowns
You have your own opinions and you are not shy about them, but you also value consensus and strive to achieve it
You lead your teammates by example, you’re the “go to” individual
You’re not afraid to change your mind given new facts, nor are you afraid to admit your mistakes
You thrive in a semi-structured start-up environment with ample opportunity and also plenty of ambiguity
You can wear multiple hats
You have excellent communication skills and are able to explain your ideas clearly and concisely and enjoy sharing them
You are very serious about the quality of your work and you ask no less from your colleagues
You understand and are interested in both big picture and nitty-gritty details
What you'll do
Solve new and challenging data problems around eCommerce returns, payments, credit issuance and settlement, fraud detection, economics of SaaS
Serve as an analytics domain expert: help the team size and prioritize work, identify foundational infrastructure, and communicate across time zones
Be a thought partner to other departments and drive data-informed decisions across the company
Build reports and dashboards that empower stakeholders, enabling them to access data and draw insights in a self-serve manner
Deeply understand our users and their actions; be their advocate and suggest and champion features to help our users have the best possible experience
Help develop data-driven products and services, such as client-facing analytics insights and personalized experiences
Be able to simplify and communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences
Elevate the entire business (Product, Sales, Marketing, Engineering, and Customer Support teams) by analyzing and leveraging data to make recommendations and improvements
Work with other analysts and data science to support business intelligence work from SQL pipelines (Snowflake and DBT) to presentation (Looker)
Mentor and support other analysts
What we're looking for
6+ years industry experience and expert knowledge of SQL
Expert level usage of BI tools (Looker, Tableau, or similar) & Excel/Google Sheets
Analytics experience across multiple company domains such as Product, Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, and Finance
Experience with databases using columnar storage such as Snowflake or Redshift
Experience with web analytics and optimization tools (Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc.)
Experience in designing and setting up experiments to analyze the impact of new products and features a plus (hypothesis testing, multivariate analysis, or Bayesian)
Experience working with developers
Experience with Python or some other programming or scripting language
Familiarity with version-control systems such as Git
Experience with a BI transformation tool such as DBT a plus
Familiarity with *nix environment including bash and command-line tools a plus
Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required
Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken is a must for communicating with a global team
Bachelors or Masters degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience
Prior startup experience
Management experience a plus

Our Values

Diversity - We are diverse, independent thinkers and still one team with one mission.

Openness and empathy - We learn and grow by listening to our customers and each other.

Integrity - We always do what’s right for our customers, Returnly and ourselves - in that order.

Team - EQ is as important as IQ. We make time to help each other out.

Commitment - We are curious and fearless. We own risk, outcomes and everything in between.

We'd really love to hear from you, but before applying please check the following...

Read the values section above carefully and ask yourself if this is a good match for you personally. We want you to be an ambassador of these values!

Please make sure you have included a cover letter as part of your application in addition to an English version of your resume. We want to learn from you and your achievements before we meet you in person!

Candidate Privacy Notice

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Isidoro Boza Moscoso 2º
HR Talent Acquisition at ING Spain & Portugal
Enviar mensaje InMail
This is Us.
 A team of more than one thousand people sharing an idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.
 In today’s world, we know this happens because we are a fully online bank. We were born out of that idea and 20 years on, technology, simplicity and transparency continue to be the ingredients of the recipe that leaves the best taste in our mouths: being more than just a bank, someone useful in the lives of the millions of clients who have chosen us.
 The way we do things also mirrors our eagerness to innovate. We are proud to be one of the very first banks to work with agile methodologies. It doesn’t ring a bell yet? No worries, we will be delighted to tell you all about it. You will find it’s one of those things you’ll want to repeat over and over.
 And although we are based in Spain, we like to cross borders. We are lucky to work with international teams every day across 44 countries, composed of women and men as equal as they are diverse. Because here you are completely free to be who you want to be, love whomever you choose, and even go for pineapple as your pizza topping.
 Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!
  Your role and work environment:
 As Senior Auditor / Data Analyst you will be part of the international Data Analytics team based in both Amsterdam and Madrid in Corporate Audit Services (CAS). CAS is a highly professional organisation with approximately 20 audit teams located across the globe forming a diverse international team of around 400 members. CAS conducts and coordinates audits across all business and risk areas and countries. The Data analyst will join a dedicated Data Analytics team, which supports multiple audit teams (worldwide) in their efforts to analyse business data efficiently and help identify control issues. Furthermore, you will support the development of more advanced analytics-driven audits, working together with the auditors to achieve the best possible results.
You will have an exciting opportunity to learn about ING’s products and services. You will enhance your knowledge and skillsets as you participate in audit engagements across multiple businesses and functions within Spain and the rest of Europe. Working at CAS you will work at the very heart of the ING organisation. This also means that your work will form a base that will be (re)viewed by both regulators and ING executive management.
  Your key responsibilities:
 As Senior Auditor / Data Analyst your role is to:
Develop and implement advanced analytics solutions supporting the audits;
Support CAS audit teams around the world in performing data analytics;
Develop dashboards and reports supporting the CAS Risk Assessment and audit process; and
Deliver trainings to CAS staff on Data Analytics and the use of analytics tooling (Knime).
 What are we looking for?
Preferably (executive) master in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or similar level of thinking;
Advanced knowledge and experience with Knime, SQL, SAS, R, Python or similar languages;
Demonstrated experience in working with large datasets and experience with automation, machine learning or artificial intelligence;
At least 6 years hands-on working experience within an audit or business intelligence function, for instance, with another bank or within a larger audit or consultancy organisation; and
Experience with international and complex organisations, preferably within the financial sector.
You are fluent in English, (fluency in other languages is much appreciated) and you are willing to travel abroad up to 20% of your time, depending on assignments, mainly in Europe.

What do we offer?
 The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest detail.

Check out what is waiting for you!
 Flexible schedule and 100% flexible e-working.
Work or e-work? We have a totally flexible model: choose the one that best suits you.
 Restaurant card.
So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.
 Our house will be your home.
In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, urban orchard, The Good Service (to help you in your arrangements) and much more!
 Life insurance.
We hope you don't need to use it!
 Health insurance.
For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).
 Flexible retribution.
In addition, you can enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through which you can access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…
 Free company shuttle.
It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to work comfortably.
 Banking benefits.
Special loan or mortgage terms after 6 months working at the bank.
And benefit from our pension plan after 2 years with us.
 More health, more sports.
Runners club with your own trainer.
Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.
Physiotherapy service on site.
Gympass.

Sector: Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones
Descripción:
Apply Now

Qualifications
Undergraduate or masters degree or have 1 –3 years of work experience after completing your undergraduate degree
Degree in computer science, telecommunications, or other engineering/technical related field preferred
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and Spanish/Portuguese
Willingness to travel

Who You'll Work With
You will be based in Lisbon or Madrid and will be part of McKinsey Digital.

As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm.

You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.

Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

When you join McKinsey as a Business Analyst (BA), you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest in your professional development. In this role you will work on the best teams to help the best organizations in the world – in private, public, and social sectors – solve their most difficult problems. You will also work with many experts, from data scientists and researchers to software and app designers.
If you are interested in joining a specific practice, please indicate this in your office/practice preference (combinations are possible). To learn more about how we help our clients and where you fit in, visit our careers site.

What You'll Do
You’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement.
This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.

You’ll gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. Business Analysts (BA) receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a Partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years as a BA. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.

We view the BA position as the start of a rewarding, challenging, and highly flexible career with McKinsey. During your first few years with the firm, you will serve as a BA on multiple client engagements and work with a number of colleagues and clients in a range of industry and functional areas. We encourage you to explore different content areas or geographies through a 2 year-long rotation with one of our practices (e.g., corporate finance, social sector, healthcare, operations) or global offices; many do this after two years as a generalist BA.

Following your BA tenure, assuming good performance, you will move into a post-graduate school role. Some BAs will take advantage of the opportunity to get outside experience through a secondment (externship) with a private sector or social sector client with the firm’s support. Others may choose to pursue graduate school with support from the firm.

Rol
Analista de Datos


Requerimientos
Grado Superior en informática, matemáticas o estadística.
Mínimo de 3 años de experiencia en las funciones señaldas.
Imprescindible conocimientos extensos, prácticos y teóricos, de bases de datos. Especialmente SQL Server y MySQL/MariaDB.
Imprescindible habilidades para el análisis de datos (PowerBI, R, Python o similares).
Habilidades de programación para interactuar con BD SQL.
Conocimiento de técnicas de estadística / aprendizaje automático (clasificación, modelos predictivos, agrupamiento).


Deseable
Experiencia con herramientas de presentación y exploración de datos como PowerBI, Oracle Analytics, Cognos, Tableau, Qlik.
Experiencia con lenguajes de tratamiento de datos como R, Python, JavaScript / NodeJS.
Conocimiento de BD Oracle y PL/SQL. Se apreciará también conocimientos de APEX.
Capacidad para exponer los resultados con herramientas gráficas a grupos de interés sin formación técnica. Habilidades de comunicación en público y realizar presentaciones.
Habilidades analíticas para el trabajo con grandes volúmenes de datos.
Atención a los detalles para el tratamiento de los datos, precisión y calidad de los resultados, trazabilidad de las operaciones realizadas, controles de calidad del datos.
Capacidad para valorar el negocio: los resultados de los análisis han de tener una repercusión directa en la mejora del servicio o del negocio.
Base teórica: los analistas de datos tiene que tener habilidades matemáticas / estadísticas para aplicar en el tratamiento de los datos, estimación de datos numéricos, elaboración de modelos y evaluación de resultados.Valorable conocimientos de entornos big data. certificaciones en análisis y presentación de datos de Oracle, IBM, Microsoft, Google; conocimiento en otras tecnologías de bases de datos y lenguajes orientados al análisis.
Conocimiento de algoritmos de minería de textos.Pasión e ilusión por la tecnología. Fuerte compromiso en el desempeño del puesto y el alcance de los objetivos de empresa mediante la mejora contínua de todos los sistemas y servicios. Habilidades de liderazgo técnico y responsabilidad. Persona acostumbrada a trabajar por objetivos. Alto nivel de Inglés y Francés valorable.


Funciones
Toma de requerimientos, diseño y elaboración de modelos de datos, informes y gráficos, tanto para el consumo interno de la compañía como para sus clientes, con herramientas como PowerBI, Oracle Analytics, Cognos, Tableau, Qlik.
Desarrollo de módulos en R, Python, PL/SQL, Oracle ML, Oracle APEX, JavaScript / NodeJS para la extracción, preparación, modelado y presentación de datos.
Desarrollo de gráficos mediante librerías JavaScript para su integración en informes o páginas web.
Labores de gobernanza y calidad del dato relacionados con el tratamiento de datos de la compañía y de sus clientes.

Puesto estable
Salario negociable según valía (acorde a mercado)
Horario de oficina (horario de mañana los viernes y jornada de mañana en Julio y Agosto)

This is Ekkiden

Ambition and innovation are our driving force. We aim high, act quickly, and acquire the wherewithal that we need to achieve our objectives. Our organisation is shaped by the requirements of both our clients and our teams. Becoming a European benchmark requires hard work, quality and respect. We pave our own path, with international teams committed to sustainable growth. We help clients to innovate and we make sure we question ourselves at all times. At Ekkiden everything is possible. Our managers are trained to bring out the best in every team member. If you are daring, creative, and have great people skills, if you want to live an extraordinary human experience and you don’t want to keep reminding yourself why you get up in the morning, it's time to meet up.

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Responsibilities
Work with the team (technical Lead/Architect/other team members) and customer focal point to understand the business need and design/implement the technical data management solution
Design and implement Data Warehouses and Data Lakes solutions, mainly Microsoft Cloud and AWS data services, based on the customers’ business requirements
Design and implement complex ELT/ETL processes using Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory or AWS Glue or others
Design and develop Analysis Services OLAP Cubes and Tabular Views
Develop scripts accordingly to the data need (Stored Procedures with T-SQL, Python or R, eventually PowerShell).
Design conceptual and logical data models and data flowcharts
Design Data-as-a-Service solution, on-premises and Cloud based, based on Data API Gateway and other Cloud services.
Implement Data Catalog solutions
Migrate data from legacy systems to new data platform solutions
Improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
Optimize new and current database systems
Perform other duties as required


What We Are Looking For
+5 years of experience in similar positions
Strong knowledge in C# development
Strong knowledge on Azure Functions
Excellent knowledge in LogicApps and development in Azure
Excellent knowledge of AWS BI and data services
Experience with Data analysis and modelling
Experience with Database scripting (T-SQL, stored procedures, etc.)
Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence modules covering Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Analysis Services (SSAS)
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS Athena/RDS or Redshift
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI
Experience working with OData
Experience working with SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience with Service Management tools (ticketing systems)
Experience with Service Management methodologies (ITIL) and Change Management
Experience with Agile project development
Microsoft SQL Server certification is a plus
Microsoft BI certification is a plus
Fluent in English. Spanish and Italian are a plus


What we offer
Participate in the creation of a European technology and organisational consulting group
A unique, innovative and dynamic working environment
A career path tailored to your personality, both in terms of job position and location
The opportunity to express yourself, assert your opinion and make an impact within our organisation and/or further afield
You say it, you own it. Once your idea has been given the go-ahead, it is up to you to make it happen
A demanding and innovative training program delivered by our greatest experts
Age is just a number, what really matter are achievements. We have a fast-track promotion system for employees who deliver
Our working conditions are concentric with our values and ambitions

Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
C#, Azure, AWS, Data Lake, Data Warehouse

Summary of the role
Amadeus is looking for a passionate and tech-savvy data analyst who is capable of turning data into information, information into insight and insight into an actionable recommendation, enabling data driven decision making.
 The person will be reporting to the Insights & Analytics manager within the Corporate Digital Marketing Unit and will be responsible for developing reporting, performing analyses and communicating actionable insights to business stakeholders, ensuring data quality and accuracy at all time.
 This is a transversal role supporting internal marketing teams, the Digital Operations and the Customer Engagement and Acquisition teams.
  In this role, you’ll
Run analysis
Track traffic, engagement, marketing campaign KPIs and sales funnel performance, extract and move data from variety of data sources and databases
Effectively communicate analytical results to non-technical business stakeholders and make recommendations
Identify patterns and trends
Be an advocate for a data driven mindset providing ongoing consultancy
Manage reporting
Maintain and improve the current reporting framework
Define, track and communicate key performance metrics across departments
Translate vague requests and business challenges into relevant KPIs to produce value-added reports
Ensure accuracy of data
Handle operations and resource management
Resolve analytics related requests from internal stakeholders
Support day-to-day digital analytics operations aligning internal and external teams on priorities and tasks
Coordinate with internal teams on the execution of integrated marketing projects
Test and Learn
Form hypothesis based on analysis and propose experiments for optimization through A/B testing cycles and personalization                                                                             
  About the ideal candidate
Holds a BA or BS
Demonstrated experience of at least 3-5 years as a data analyst or business data analyst
Proficient in web analytics (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc), marketing automation tools (Eloqua, HubSpot, Pardot, etc) and CRM (Salesforce as an example) tools
Understanding of how tagging implementation, campaign tracking and tag management platforms (Tealium, Launch, etc) work
Is proficient in English, Excel and Microsoft Office
Having experience with R, Python or SQL is a plus
Flexibility and ability to learn quickly new tools and new skills
Good understanding of Marketing activities, KPIs and digital channels, with basic knowledge of the Industry.                                                         
Proactive with a problem-solving mindset and attention to detail
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyse large amounts of information                                                                                                                                 
  What we can offer you
Be part of a new team that is growing
Opportunity to be a pioneer
Work in a multicultural team of 17,000+ professionals
Learn and develop your own projects
Be part of one of the world’s top 10 software companies
  Application process
Create your candidate profile in our system and upload your recent resume! Once you’ve applied, you’ll receive feedback within 15 days.
 Are you ready for your next challenge? Apply now!

Company Description

Merkle es una compañía especializada en Customer Experience Management, experta en desarrollar experiencias de cliente únicas y personalizadas a través de diferentes plataformas y dispositivos.

Hacemos analítica desde una visión estratégica, ayudando a nuestros clientes a alcanzar mejores resultados, evolucionar su índice de madurez digital y experiencia de cliente combinando tecnología y la gestión y el análisis de datos para generar una ventaja competitiva. 

 Desde nuestras oficinas en Madrid, Barcelona y Gijón, colaboramos con empresas del IBEX 35, grandes anunciantes y corporaciones de perfil Fortune 500. La base del liderazgo de MERKLE lo forman las personas. Un EQUIPO de TALENTO DIGITAL formado por gente joven, ilusionada, llena de potencial y con unas enormes ganas de hacer bien su trabajo. 

Job Description

En MERKLE apostamos por aquellas personas a las que les gusta salir de zona de confort, que aspiran a encontrarse y superar nuevos retos y que quieren trabajar en un ambiente amigable y donde todos somos un equipo.

Si la fuerza es poderosa en ti: Bienvenido a MERKLE, este es tu sitio

Buscamos personas motivadas, que se propongan retos y que se sientan cómodas trabajando en equipo y proponiendo nuevas formas de hacer las cosas. Personas que disfruten del trato con el cliente en un ambiente donde los datos nos rodean y la interpretación de los mismos es nuestro arte.

Tus funciones consistirán en:

Diseñar, monitorizar y analizar KPIs. 
Optimizar campañas digitales y procesos de conversión. 
Traducir las necesidades de negocio de los clientes a los requerimientos técnicos de las herramientas de análisis. 
Identificar y analizar datos relevantes sobre los usuarios (customer data, procesos de conversión, audiencias y campañas digitales) en los proyectos y servicios asignados, así como validar y diseñar hipótesis. 
Dar soporte y resolver incidencias a nivel de configuración de herramienta de análisis digital. 
Detectar sinergias y coordinar tareas con otros departamentos y stakeholders implicados. 
Definir y liderar proyectos de visualización de datos. 
Gestionar y coordinar proyectos de analítica digital, con capacidad de priorizar tareas y detectar desviaciones. 
Presentar conclusiones de análisis a los equipos de negocio. 
Acompañar al cliente hacia una cultura data-driven orientada a la optimización de procesos y estrategias. 

Te ofrecemos un puesto de trabajo estable, de futuro, con posibilidad de promoción interna.

Trabajamos con clientes grandes, líderes en su sector y con un alto grado de madurez digital.

Queremos que te sientas a gusto por lo que fomentamos actividades de cohesión interna para sentirnos más equipo.

Te daremos formación inicial y formación continua, aunque tu espíritu de buscar por ti mismo y tus ganas de aprender debe ser algo que marque tu desarrollo profesional con nosotros.

¿Te unes al equipo? Te esperamos!!

Qualifications

Al menos 2 años de experiencia en posiciones similares o liderando proyectos de analítica web. 
Uso avanzado de la herramienta Adobe Analytics y/o Google Analytics. 
Perfil analítico, organizado, autónomo, orientado a prevenir y solucionar incidencias. 
Visión de negocio y capacidad para transformar datos en insights accionables. 
Atención a los detalles, proactivo y con capacidad de trabajo en equipo. 
Capacidad para dimensionar y priorizar tareas. 

Other valuable skills: 

Conocimientos de BigQuery y SQL 
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau) 
Nivel medio de inglés (B2 – C1) 
Experiencia trabajando bajo metodologías agile

Te ofrecemos:

Contrato indefinido
Excelente ambiente de trabajo
Seguro médico privado
Horario flexible
Posibilidad de teletrabajar
Fomación continua (Linkedin Learning, Merkle University, etc)

Descripción:
Canadian French QA Voice Tester

Location: Madrid City Center

Would you like to play a part in ensuring the quality of ground-breaking technology for large-scale systems, natural language, big data, and artificial intelligence?

We are looking for a self-starting, proactive problem solver to join our team! You will be working in a very exciting and innovative project for one of the key players in the technology industry worldwide in testing activities, which involves artificial intelligence and wearables.

What will you do?

You will perform linguistic & phonological testing of a voice recognition software in order to ensure it meets the quality specifications.

What would be the requirements for this role?
Be a Canadian French native speaker from Canada or living in Canada for the last years (mandatory).
Canadian-related cultural awareness (pop, formal, geo-political…).
Interest in technologies
Strong attention to detail in spotting spelling, grammatical, user interface, and audio defects.
Mental fortitude and stamina to withstand long hours of repetitive listening tasks.

It would be a plus if you have
Degree in Linguistics or related education is highly preferred.
Previous experience in QA or technology related roles is a plus.
Understanding of linguistics/phonetics is a plus.

What do we offer?
Long-term opportunity to grow in one of the most successful technology consultancy companies all over the world.
Innovative project related with artificial intelligence, wearables and virtual assistants.
Professional and personal growth.
Flexible and open working environment interacting with colleagues from different countries.
Social benefits like health insurance and meal card.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Internet
Descripción:
Somos NEXT DIGITAL HUB, una startup dedicada a acompañar a las empresas en su viaje de transformación digital, haciendo énfasis en la innovación y el diseño. Creemos en el poder de la tecnología para cambiar el mundo y crear experiencias únicas.
 Nuestras principales áreas de trabajo son el desarrollo de software y el mundo Big Data, y estamos en plena fase de expansión.
 En nuestras oficinas de Madrid encontrarás una empresa joven, dinámica y con un inmejorable ambiente colaborativo. Una empresa preocupada por tu bienestar y por tu progresión profesional.
 Buscamos compañeros que compartan nuestra filosofía de trabajo, cultura y valores, y que tengan una gran inquietud tecnológica.

¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?

Nos encantaría que fueses un ingeniero de datos experimentado en la construcción de modelos, la visualización y el análisis de datos capaz de elegir las herramientas del ecosistema Power BI que mejor se adapten a las necesidades del proyecto.
 Esperamos que estés familiarizado con el Star Schema y te sientas cómodo trabajando con Power Query, Power BI Desktop, Dax Studio, Tabular Editor y ALM Toolkit. También nos gustaría que tengas soltura tanto con DAX como con M.
 La administración de Power BI Service Premium y Pro así como Power BI Report Server también estarán entre tus cometidos. Valoramos que tengas experiencia con Power BI Embedded y que te sepas desenvolver con herramientas fáciles de integrar con Power BI como pueden ser PowerApps y Power Automate. Esperamos que hayas trabajado con Power BI REST API y te veas capaz de diseñar soluciones a medida para, junto con las herramientas de Power BI, monitorizar y extraer información valiosa sobre métricas y logs de la aplicación.
 Nos encanta introducir tecnologías nuevas en nuestros proyectos, así que esperamos que seas tecnológicamente inquieto, ansioso por aprender (y enseñarnos) cosas nuevas, y sin miedo a salir de tu zona de confort.
 Buscamos además personas comprometidas con el trabajo de calidad y habituadas a trabajar en equipo. Para nosotros es tan importante que los informes funcionen como que los modelos sean comprensibles, bien documentados, extensibles y escalables.
 También nos gustaría que tuvieses buenas habilidades comunicativas, ya que el puesto requerirá en ocasiones trato con el cliente, y por supuesto valoramos que tengas un buen nivel de inglés.
 REQUISITOS TÉCNICOS:

Buscamos Data Analysts y administradores de Power BI con las siguientes características:

Entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia con Power BI (demostrable mediante prueba técnica).
Soltura con el entorno Power BI Desktop: bookmarks, RLS, custom visuals.
Entre 1 y 3 años de experiencia administrando entornos Power BI (Premium, Pro, Server).
Experiencia demostrable codificando en DAX y M: evaluation context, time intelligence , ALL* family functions, data lineage.
Conocimientos avanzados de Data Modeling: Star Schema.
Conocimiento actualizado del ecosistema Power BI: buenas prácticas, limitaciones, permisos, on-premise gateway.
Experiencia en bases de datos (SQL / NoSQL).
Deseable conocimientos / experiencia en entornos cloud (Azure, Google Cloud o AWS, en ese orden).


¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?

Entorno de aprendizaje continuo con charlas, meetups, certificaciones y asistencia a los principales eventos de programación
Un ambiente joven y colaborativo, donde te sentirás apoyado desde el primer día. Echa un vistazo a nuestro equipo: https://www.nextdigital.es/es/team
Horario totalmente flexible y remote-friendly: apostamos por la conciliación y por modelos de trabajo basados en la responsabilidad y la autogestión
Portátil de última generación
Programa de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte, cheque guardería y seguro médico)
Salario competitivo en función de tus conocimientos y experiencia, revisado anualmente
Vacaciones: 23 días + 24 y 31 de Diciembre + 1 semana en Navidad

Sector: Diseño Servicios y tecnologías de la información Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones
Descripción:
¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos a una persona con experiencia en CRO y analítica digital que impulse el negocio de nuestros clientes, transformando sus objetivos en soluciones de optimización. Queremos incorporar a alguien que sea capaz de expandir el conocimiento de la disciplina de forma transversal entre diferentes equipos, que sea capaz de evolucionarla y que nos posicione como referencia por su capacidad de innovación y su delivery.


Entre las tareas y responsabilidades del rol se encuentran:

Identificar las palancas sobre las que apoyarse para optimizar los canales digitales de nuestros clientes a nivel de conversión, ventas y engagement.
Analizar las visitas y el comportamiento de las personas usuarias en la web, identificar mejoras, lanzar hipótesis y proponer mockups para optimizar las ventas a través de la realización de test y personalización de la web en todos los dispositivos, con especial foco en mobile first.
Identificación y creación de KPIs digitales, fichas de tests, análisis y seguimiento de resultados de los cambios aplicados.
Capaz de sintetizar informes en plataformas de dashboarding y analizando los datos capturados con el objetivo de mejorar la conversión y optimización de los procesos.
Trabajar y colaborar con especialistas en analítica, UX, UI, desarrollo...
Participar en proyectos nacionales e internacionales.


Así que, es posible que seas la persona que buscamos si:

Tienes de 3 a 5 años de experiencia en analítica web y CRO, transformando los objetivos de negocio en soluciones de optimización.
Has trabajado en proyectos con otros países o te apetece hacerlo, para lo que deberás desenvolverte en inglés como pez en el agua (nivel C1/C2).
Tienes conocimiento profundo de herramientas de analítica web, testing, personalización y DMP como Google 360, Optimizely, Hotjar…
Has trabajado también con herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau o PowerBI.
Y, por supuesto, con todo el paquete de Microsoft Office.
Sabes traducir datos complejos en mensajes sencillos, trasladables a personas que no sean tan expertas en analítica como tú.
Eres una persona analítica, organizada y autónoma.
Te orientas a la detección de problemas y solución de los mismos.
Tienes buenas dotes de comunicación, proactividad y actitud positiva.
Tienes disponibilidad para empezar en las próximas semanas.


¿Cómo trabajamos?  

Somos un equipo inclusivo, muy cohesionado, en el que estamos en constante aprendizaje. Nos involucramos en todas las fases del proceso, lo cual mejora el resultado final por la diversidad de perspectivas y especialidades. ¡E intentamos hacer todo eso con una sonrisa!


¿Qué ofrecemos?

Estabilidad y seguridad, con un contrato indefinido y un salario según tu experiencia.
Presupuesto anual de 500€ para formación, nos encantaría encontrar personas que nunca quieran dejar de aprender.
Un ambiente de trabajo positivo con un equipo que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar.
Trabajar con clientes líderes en el mercado e impactar en muchos usuarios.
Colaborar en proyectos con equipos multidisciplinares y multiculturales.
Formar parte de una compañía que apuesta por la analítica digital, y ser parte del establecimiento de la disciplina y de su crecimiento.


Si te suena bien...

Estamos esperando tu candidatura con ganas. Haz click en "solicitar", envíanos tus datos (no tardarás mucho, no te preocupes) y nos pondremos en contacto contigo si encajas con lo estamos buscando.

¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

Descripción:
Who is Equifax?
At Equifax, we believe knowledge drives progress. As a global data, analytics and technology company, we play an essential role in the global economy by helping employers, employees, financial institutions and government agencies make critical decisions with greater confidence.
We work to help create seamless and positive experiences during life’s pivotal moments: applying for jobs or a mortgage, financing an education or buying a car. Our impact is real and to accomplish our goals we focus on nurturing our people for career advancement and their learning and development, supporting our next generation of leaders, maintaining an inclusive and diverse work environment, and regularly engaging and recognizing our employees. Regardless of location or role, the individual and collective work of our employees makes a difference and we are looking for talented team players to join us as we help people live their financial best.
The Perks of being an Equifax Employee?
We offer excellent compensation packages with high-reaching market salaries, pension, along with the works: comprehensive healthcare packages, schedule flexibility, collaborative work spaces, work from home opportunities, and organisational growth potential
Grow at your own pace through online courses at Learning @ Equifax
What You’ll Do
Requirements documentation by conducting application demonstrations with the team, documentation analysis, requirements sessions, documentation and analysis of process maps and description, creation of user stories, analysis of business tasks.
Critically evaluate the information obtained from various sources, unify differences, break down the information obtained at a high level in the detail necessary for the understanding of the stakeholders to identify the necessary requirements.
Proactive and collaborative communication with internal and external customers to analyze functional needs and requirements for the delivery of implementations including documentation such as: Requirements documents, epic documentation, user stories, data models, data mapping and interface designs.
Use experience to define requirements and systems management under the necessary methodologies.
Ability to work simultaneously on several initiatives and provide a weekly report of the activities in the templates used by the company.
Work independently with users to define concepts under the direction of team managers and supervisors managing the delivery of a project if necessary.
Help and propose different options to the current ones for the execution of the plans of the different business units in a satisfactory way.
High analytical skills and product management are required to interpret business needs and translate them into data, application and operational requirements.
Great verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact professionally with interlocutors of different levels in the company (executives, managers and specialists)
Collaborate with development teams, testers, delivery teams, and specialists to define and analyze technical vision.
Act as a link between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Act as Product Owner where required to support delivery teams including backlog management, prioritization and acceptance of the test.
Qualifications
University degree.
Solid experience in the application development and testing cycle.
Small project management experience.
Certification in Project Management or Business Analyst is a plus.
Experience in Agile software delivery methodology. Ability to develop the role of business analyst and Product owner is a plus.
Knowledge of Google Suite and MS Office: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio.
Knowledge of JIRA.
Extra Points for any of the Following
Problem solving, logical and analytical skills and attention to detail.
Motivator, ability to question decisions, negotiator and good communication (verbal and written), delivery of presentations and business reports.
Ability to present complex technical solutions for all levels (executive, management, clients or third parties).
Good organization, time management, prioritization and planning ability.
Capable of taking responsibility, robust, positive attitude, flexible, motivated, focused on delivery and pragmatic.
Ensure that the solution meets the requirements of the business, customer and a third party.
Respond to business requests professionally and satisfactorily
Proactively support teammates and other business teams.
Motivation to do new tasks
Learn quickly to solve new problems in a versatile and firm way
Success Attributes of an Equifax employee; does this describe you?
Accountability
Bravery
Curiosity
Collaboration
Think and act differently
Trust
Ownership
Decide-Execute-Ship
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If this sounds like somewhere you want to work, don’t delay, apply today - we’re looking for you!

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
#About Ironhack

Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way tech education works!

Doesn’t it seem odd that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution? Virtually all industries are pushing the limits on how to do things faster, better, and more efficiently. Yet, for the most part, people feel stuck on a 4+ year (and usually quite expensive) path that often results in an unfulfilling career path.

We empower students to create a new path - one that leads to meaningful careers in software development, product design or data analytics in a fraction of the time and cost of traditional education.

Our higher purpose is to transform the education space to be unapologetically outcomes-driven. Whether students are looking to change careers, get a promotion, skip University, or start their own company, we work tirelessly every day to make sure this path is as quick, immersive, and accessible as possible. Hearing these success stories is what gets us out of bed each day, excited to come to work :)

It’s with this mindset that we’ve become one of the key global players in bridging the digital skills gap, serving both those looking to get into tech, as well as the companies hungry for tech talent.

Quick Facts
Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard grads
Operations in Miami, Madrid, Barcelona, Paris, Mexico City, Lisbon, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Berlin
100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)
Graduated over 6500 students
100+ global team members
Venture capital backed
About The Gig

A large part of the success of Ironhack depends on the data we have. The Data Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring we have good quality and accessibility to our the data, enabling us to make better decisions for our students.

We’re looking for a Data Analyst that will work transforming Ironhack into a more data-driven organization. The role is based in Madrid, although we will work remotely from Spain (we may want to meet onsite from time to time).

Ironhack is becoming a data-driven organization; we are in the early stages of it, so you will be key in achieving it as a Data Analyst.

We Are Working Hard On Three Main Points
Making data available to everyone (developing a platform that provides accessibility and autonomy to the employees to query the data)
Spreading the knowledge of data around the company: an essential part of autonomy is to be able to extract valuable knowledge from the data. That’s why we are training all the Ironhack’s employees on necessary data skills.
Improving the quality of our data: data is useless if the quality is low. We are working hard on being aware of the quality of the data.
In the future, we’ll work also on providing Advanced Analytics to the company, such as forecasting, clustering, and different Machine Learning and statistics techniques. So the challenges are varied, and you will be able to develop yourself in different areas.

You will be close to
Technical aspects of the data such as analysis, quality, reporting, and generation
Non-technical aspects of the data: working on our culture, helping people to be autonomous
You will be responsible for
Definition, analysis, design, and development of data quality models
Definition, analysis, design, and development of analytical processes and models
Training employees in basic data skills such as dashboarding, querying and analyzing data
Developing business cases to focus on the market with higher potential impact
Data lineage and governance
Your day-to-day. We work with agile methodologies, so you will know your priorities, but also you will be responsible for how you plan your day-to-day work.
Your Skills And Experience
At least 3 years of experience as Data Analyst
Degree in a Quantitative field or related courses
Demonstrated knowledge of BI projects
Demonstrated hands-on experience with a programming language (R, Python, etc)
Demonstrated experience on relational databases: design, manipulate and query the data in Postgresql
Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization). Use of Python to transform, clean and store data in different formats.
Analytic models: proven knowledge and experience on classical models (classification, regression, time series, clustering, etc.)
Being a team player is a must
Hands-on experience building a strong governance environment
Experience in working and delivering end-to-end projects independently
Liking and understanding how to work in an agile environment
Comfortable with English speaking
What we offer in the data team
The possibility to learn about many different business processes: we work with the marketing team, education, sales, etc. You will learn what their main processes are and how they use the data
The possibility to work with people from different countries. It is always interesting to know better different cultures
We are a small team with high impact
30 - 35k gross year, depending on the profile
Is this you?
Passionate about education and technology!
Comfortable embracing a culture of constant experimentation
Really positive, upbeat, and social
Encouraged by challenges and enjoy having tons of autonomy with no bureaucratic BS
Likes to work in a small team with a variety of challenges
#Perks
Competitive salary

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
Jobandtalent

About our Business Model 
Jobandtalent is the leading on-demand staffing marketplace in Europe and LATAM that is disrupting the traditional staffing sector. Jobandtalent has successfully digitalized the whole staffing experience including sourcing, interviewing, hiring, clocking and payrolling. Creating novel AI solutions to automate parts of the process and make the best possible decisions.

The process is self fuelled by a clear flywheel effect on Jobandtalent’s marketplace: more workers in the platform allows for more data, generating higher job fulfillment retention rate and higher quality of workers placed, subsequently increasing employers satisfaction that attracts more companies and vacancies into the platform, this allows workers to find more opportunities, improving NPS and word of mouth reach, closing the wheel with more workers attracted to the platform.

About the company

We are headquartered in Madrid, where Jobandtalent was founded in 2009. Since then it has obtained financing worth more than 100 million euros from the best venture capital funds in Europe and globally, becoming one of the most valued Spanish startups internationally with current revenues of over 400 million euros per year. 

Behind our technological platform that employs tens of thousands of workers in great companies like Amazon, Uber, Santander and H&M, we have a team of more than 500 employees distributed in offices in the United Kingdom, France, Spain, Portugal, Germany, Sweden, Mexico and Colombia. The plan is to continue growing at the same pace in current markets and launch our operations in new countries.


About the position
As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Operations Team and your goal will be to analyze, understand, and extract creative solutions for our clients’ needs. Your main tasks will consist of understanding the data, making analytic reports, analyzing these and identifying solutions.

Responsibilities 
Become the data expert on the reporting data model and present findings to the different teams.
Proactively work with internal business partners to conduct ad-hoc queries and ensure their data and reporting needs are being achieved.
Work closely with our key clients to improve our service and their operational processes.
Make decisions and implement solutions based on your analysis. Do daily follow-ups and help your project become a success.

Requirements and skills
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or business.
Not necessary preview experience.
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills with a deep understanding of graphs and visuals
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with different levels of management, as well as the business and technical communities
Exceptional problem-solving skills; demonstrated the ability to structure complex problems and develop creative reporting solutions
Creativity and strategic thinking necessary to master both the daily hands-on analysis and the big picture reporting strategy

What we offer: 

The chance to make an impact in one of the fastest growing start-up companies in Europe.
A global team formed by dynamic, highly skilled and ambitious people.
A competitive salary
Develop your career working in a super exciting environment with a great working atmosphere, international work environment.
Remote & Flexible working hours.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Ana G.
Senior Recruiter & Learning and Development Business Partner at Zircon Way Recruitment
Enviar mensaje InMail
We are looking for a full-time Researcher in Marketing Science Team for one of our biggest clients. In this role you will partner primarily with the business marketing and sales teams, and external research vendors to help plan and deliver world-class research that can drive this leading Social Media start up voice to the market. 

In addition, this role will partner with Measurement Partners, Data Scientists, Brand Strategy, Marketing Creatives and user-growth teams to further align on clear research questions, practical methods, and a focus on scale with hypothesis-driven story-telling. 
 Your responsibilities will include:
Be leading and co-developing with Business Marketing research projects that may touch consumer or creative insights where your ability to bring in unique ways to build research hypotheses will empower the quality of your work. 
Represent the company at industry events, webinars, or other places where your work can come to life. 
Help shape the structure of how this Insights function will contribute to the Global Marketing Solutions organization. 

What we need from you:
Relevant bachelor's degree in a research field with a focus on quantitative methods; graduate degree's in a science, mathematics, operations, business, digital marketing, behavioral psychology, or survey-based research methods is strongly preferred. 
Experience with advertising research suppliers in United States and / or Europe is a must. 
Experience communicating in English and Spanish. 
Proficiency with individual and group based qualitative methods, as well as quantitative methods that include statistical concepts and survey design is a must. 
A track record of 5+ years implementing and managing insights programs for complex organizations. Familiarity with industry research on digital platforms and research providers highly preferred 
Excellent external communication and succinct writing skills are a must. 
Examples of going above and beyond to show how research drives behaviour change inside an organization is a strong plus. 
Intellectual curiosity with the latest research and operational methods needed for this role. 
Experience with SQL, HIVE, R and other statistical packages is preferred. 
 Do you think this job is for you? Would you like to hear more about it? Please do not hesitate to contact me at anagonzalez@zirconway.ie.

Sector: Servicio al consumidor
Descripción:
Verisure, operating under two brand names (Securitas Direct & Verisure) is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Digital Analyst Trainee. The role will part of a growing and talented Technology Team, and will report directly into our Digital Product Manager.
Technology and innovation play an important role in our value creation. It is at the core of the service and operations we provide to our customers. It is what enables our people to do our job, protecting what matters most. But it is also at the heart of our future value creation. It is at the core of the new services we will offer, building on our legacy of value accretive innovation through deploying world-class products and services.  

Strategic context and Value proposition

As the Technology organization is evolving, the Proposition Management department will be responsible for having a strong product & services innovation pipeline; understanding how these new products and services will evolve the positioning of our company, the offering (sales proposition), the sales process and the resulting economics. This department will be defining the new products and services for the company and will be leading projects to create and integrate new products and services in our portfolio (together with R&D project managers)

The Intern for Proposition Management in Digital will work closely with the Group Proposition Management Director, the Technology Strategy Director and the Proposition Management Team in understanding the Digital domain (mainly Verisure App and Verisure MyPages), the performance of our digital services, and designing new digital services in our pipeline. He/She will also get the opportunity to work closely with the different countries in the group.

This role will require determination to deeply understand:
Our business model and the ones of competitors.
Our products and the ones of competition.
Our technology and technology trends that can be applicable.
Our Go To Market (field sales with simple installation)
Our service to customers.
Our content management system for texts and translations.

Responsibilities will include:
Researching the digital app market, competition, providers, consumer habits and present findings to the Proposition team.
Understand performance of current and future product service experiences in the Digital domain
Drive UX content management of our digital services towards Design and Development and coordinate translations from all our markets
Support on product management in the Digital domain
Additionally, he/she will work with the rest of the Proposition Management team in other projects

Location
The position will be based in Madrid (Spain) with Pan European travel expected.

Reports and organization structure
Direct reporting line into the Digital Product Manager.

Candidate profile
Experiences and Qualifications

We see this role as critical for the achievement of Verisure’s growth and organizational transformation goals.
As result, we are looking for a high potential / top performer individual who will combine great time management skills as well as an analytical mind-set. The ideal candidate will be a strategic solution provider as well as operational enabler.

Strong analytical skills
Entrepreneurial and committed, with a strong hands-on approach
Good understanding and passion about technology
Strong interpersonal skills and experience working in an international, multicultural setting
Structured, detail oriented, and capable of understanding the big picture
Strong written and oral communication capabilities for creating and presenting slides
Very fluent in written and spoken English (other languages will be a plus: Spanish, Swedish, German, Italian, French)
University degree (electrical / computer engineering degree are preferred)
Full Time dedication (or almost full time)
Additional complementary skills that will be valued:
Experience in market research and / or analysis of data
Experience in Project / Product management
Experience in UX/UI
Experience in UX writing and translations
Programming knowledge (Java / JavaScript, PHP, SQL / NoSQL, Python, R etc.)

Competencies

Strong analytical skills
Accuracy, attention to detail, and strong willingness to learn
An enthusiastic and high energy individual with a strong drive to create a positive work environment
Independent problem solver that can set priorities, make high quality judgements, and enable efficient decision making
A match to our culture – high energy and flex, fantastic at communication and huge amounts of drive. Collaborative working is key!


Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it’s a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.
Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another’s strengths, investing in and developing our team’s capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.
