Descripción:
Cognizant Analytics Practice

AI & Analytics (AIA) is part of Cognizant Digital Business. Our three key offerings are Data Modernisation, Customer Intelligence, and Operational Intelligence. AIA is responsible for selling (Business Development) and implementing these offerings (Delivery). Out selling point is the way we organize and train our people. The Cognizant skill-pool is extensive and is experienced in coming together to deliver a multidisciplinary solution. It is key we have people with the right skills that are trained on the relevant technologies & methodologies. That is the role of the AIA Guilds and Communities: AIA Architecture, Data Engineering, Data Governance, Data Visualisation, and Data Science.

The Data Science Community is organized by geographies to keep the leaders close to the people they are mentoring and support the local business development effort: UK & Ireland, Germany & Switzerland (DACH), Benelux, Spain & Nordics.

We are looking for a Data Science Practitioner in Madrid. You will be working in a variety of data science settings, using a diverse set of tools to automat computational statistics. Usually the analytics automation is a component of an end-to-end solution and you will collaborate within a multi-disciplinary team. The work the Guild is involved in Europe covers many industries such as Pharmaceutical, Banking, Finance, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecommunications, Utilities & Government.

Lately a significant of work we do is in the Cloud using Python. We are in leveraging Cognizant’s Evolutionary AI solution (https://www.cognizant.com/ai/evolutionary-ai). We constantly adapt to the market needs and are flexible on the choice of technology.

Your Role
This role combines aspects of delivering analytical solutions on customer site or in one of the Cognizant offices, alone or as part of a team. The role will also have a component of ‘Go to Market’ and pre-sales support relying on your knowledge and encouraging you to learn.

When your career progresses, you will get opportunities to design of analytical solutions, lead delivery of analytical solutions, and people management and mentoring.

Key Responsibilities

Work on delivery project as a member of an experienced consulting team developing and applying advanced analytics & Machine Learning methodologies.
Prepare presentations and reports on findings as well as recommend next steps to ensure successful project completion
Seek and develop innovative methods and processes and keep up to date on latest trends, tools and advancements in the area of analytics and data
Take active part in sales support activities such as responding to RFIs and RFPs - support the proactive and reactive sales process by providing the advanced analytics aspect of presentations and responses to clients.
Interacting with the wider European Data Science Guild, the rest of the European Guilds and other Cognizant Business Units globally.
Contribution to & participation in the shaping of the Data Science Guild and its activities

As you develop, you career you will get opportunities to lead and manage teams and become a subject matter expert for an industry or methodology.

Requirements

A university degree in Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or Operations Research area - or the acquisition of such skills through professional experience
Have at least 3+ years of experience in Data Science field
Proven, knowledge and deep experience in quantitative methods (machine learning, natural language processing, image detection, predictive analytics, statistical modelling and forecasting) with strong statistical and mathematical background.
Data exploration and preparation
Hypothesis Formulation, model building, validation and recalibration
Consultative approach regarding identifying client issues and commitment to delivering high quality solutions
Collaborative team player
Know-how in different statistical programming languages such as Python, R, SAS
Ability to work autonomously
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Flexibility to travel
Optional skills that are nice to have but not mandatory include:
Knowledge of KNIME, RapidMiner, SPSS Modeler, SAS
High/Intermediate SQL knowledge.
Knowledge of Bayesian (Belief) Networks (probabilistic graphical models), Neural Networks, Deep Learning, and Cognitive computing.
Knowledge of Technologies like ML Azure / Watson/ AWS / SQL / Teradata / Tableau /other visualization platforms
Knowledge of Agile methodologies

Interested? Please submit an updated version of your resume to carolina.arribas@cognizant.com

About AbbVie

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Summary

From the Business Technology Services (BTS) area we are looking for experts in Data Engineering to join our team based in our Madrid offices. As a Data Engineer, you will have the mission of managing our Data databases to ensure the acquisition, modeling, and visualization of data that will be used to support business decisions aligned with the company strategy.

About AbbVie

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com.

Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Responsibilities
Responsible of data ingestion, modeling, transformation, storage and visualization across the different company data sources, technologies and platforms.
Planning, designing, building and running information management solutions across a variety of technologies (e.g. Palantir Foundry, master data, data profiling, batch processing, etc.)
Ingest data into Foundry analytics platform from external vendors using SFTP
Building data pipelines using Spark and Python by preparing, mapping, joining and stitching ingested datasets
Using programming frameworks/languages like core Spark, Spark Dataframes, Python for data transformation on Foundry
Converting and optimizing existing SQL queries into Spark SQL
Create visualizations in QlikSense
Defining and ensuring data quality of ingested datasets by implementing health and content checks
Build a strong data governance framework by working with global and affiliate stakeholders.
Defining and applying information quality and consistency business rules throughout the data processing lifecycle
Consistently deliver projects in a timely manner. Perform routine and complex tasks competently and independently and generate reliable and consistent results.
Collaborating with information providers to ensure quality data updates are processed in a timely fashion
Ensuring appropriate security and compliance policies are followed for information access and dissemination
Enforcing and expanding use of AbbVie Common Data Model and industry standard information descriptions (ontologies, taxonomies, vocabularies, lexicons, dictionaries, thesaurasus, glossaries etc…)
Produces and maintains required technical documentation associated with work product.
Understand and adhere to corporate standards regarding applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies, including code of conduct, safety, GxP compliance, data security, and the software development lifecycle.
Experience with Hadoop ecosystem(HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hive, Hue) and Amazon Web Services preferred.
Team worker while open to remote working


Qualifications

Qualifications
Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or related discipline.
+5 years of experience in data processing roles such as data engineer, database developer/administrator, ETL developer, data analyst or BI consultant.
Experience programming in languages such as Python and R.
Proved experience managing relational databases (SQL Server, stored procedures, SSIS, SSRS, OLAP cubes, C#, Visual Basic, Oracle or Redshift)
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations (Qlik, Power BI, SSRS, Tableau, etc.)
High level of English (C1)


Highly appreciated
Experience with QlikSense
Experience with Spark

Knowledge of Pharma Industry

Descripción:
¿Estás buscando unas prácticas y te apasiona la programación? ¡Ven y únete al líder francés de Insurtech para cambiar el mundo de los seguros con AI!

Rol

Como miembro del equipo Data Scientist de la oficina de Madrid y trabajando junto con nuestros expertos técnicos, podrás:

Comprender los datos de seguros y los mecanismos de fraude;
Crear los modelos matemáticos asociados;
Implementar, probar y optimizar los algoritmos asociados;
Participar en talleres con los clientes para recopilar comentarios e integrarlos en los modelos;
Aportar continuamente ideas para mejorar la solución.

Tu perfil

Eres nativo en español y hablas con fluidez en inglés (obligatorio)
Tienes habilidades técnicas avanzadas en Matemáticas Aplicadas, preferiblemente en machine learning y/o investigación operativa;
Combinas habilidades de análisis y síntesis; y no tienes miedo de afrontar los problemas complejos y poder explicar todos sus detalles.
Puedes escribir código de producción de calidad;
Capacidad de relacionarse cara a cara a nuestros clientes para hablar de sus necesidades e integrar sus comentarios en su proyecto;
Puedes comunicarte con fluidez en inglés y tu idioma nativo es el español.

¿Quieres saber más?

Para postular, envíanos tu currículum y haznos saber por qué podríamos ser una gran opción para ti.

Esta posición es para ti si ...

Estás buscando unas prácticas de fin de estudios para completar tus estudios superiores (Máster).

¡Estás interesado en un puesto fijo y crees que Shift es el lugar adecuado para comenzar!

Sector: Servicio de información Servicios y tecnologías de la información Telecomunicaciones
Descripción:
We invite you to join Vodafone to build a future together, in a position where you can learn new things every day and have contact with the different business units of the Company, as well as related institutions and public bodies.

VOIS is embarking on a global transformation of data; analytics to enable the VOIS Data Ocean which will enable us to unlock value through machine learning and AI.
The Group Google Cloud implementation provides VOIS with the capability to derive value from its data using complex analytics. As the platform expands and data increases, it will become increasingly more important to ensure that VOIS data is managed correctly adhering to Vodafone and external data and security practices.

The role of the Data Governance/Data Steward is to work with the Architecture, Data Science and Delivery teams to establish technical and processes to manage the data on our platforms. The role of the librarian is to manage data and the policies that apply to it on the platform. The librarian is a hybrid role combining the accountabilities of a data custodian and steward.

Role Interaction
Will work closely with data architect team implement data quality and meta data blue print, with data owners to improve data quality and meta data;
Will work with Data Engineering and Delivery teams to implement solutions
Will work with operations staff to ensure processes and procedures in place to manage data
Will work with data scientist to understand data demands and issues
Will work closely with the Corporate IT System team leading the GCP implementation to ensure full adherence to their principles, rules and guidelines.
Will work with data scientist to understand data demands and issues.
This role will play a key role to enable scaled development teams to meet the delivery needs across multiple service lines.

What you bring?
Understand and used GCP technologies.
Exposure to data lake or data warehouse implementation.
Worked in agile environment.
Experience of preferably with development, database skills as a foundation.
Experience of working in a matrix organization.
Influence and execute using other teams.
Good communication skills.
Why Vodafone?
At Vodafone we are concerned about being a company committed to diversity as an engine of change. We are proud to offer equal opportunities regardless of race, nationality, cultural origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and religious or political beliefs.

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Recursos humanos Aeronáutica/Aviación
Descripción:
Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe’s largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 154 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 82 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe’s greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO₂ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in a multi-disciplined team, working alongside Developers, Designers and Product Owners, who will own their work from the initial idea to the final implementation. We are continually gathering information on travel related events and are looking for someone to help us make the most of a large-scale distributed data system. The role will allow for opportunities to work in a variety of areas such as digital, logistics, predictive maintenance, and anything else that you may think of, or that will come your way.

Requirements

The Person
Big Data Experience with technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Mesos/YARN
Evidence of Data Processing at Scale – designing, developing and continually improving tools
Experience in any of the following areas is a bonus – APIs, Personalisation (classifiers, recommendation & prediction services), automation
Experience designing, developing, testing and continually improving tools which deliver scalable and effective data infrastructure systems
Evidence of delivering continual improvements in availability, scalability, monitoring, concurrency, fault tolerance, latency, automation and related areas
Cloud native system design
Familiar with Hadoop administration, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting
Designing ETL/ Data Load architectures within the Hadoop Ecosystem
Streaming applications design with Storm and Spark Streaming


Required Skills
Develop Spark applications in Java, Scala or Python
Solid experience in SQL and Java / Scala programming
Clear understanding of Hadoop stack, its architecture and configuration
Familiar with Hadoop administration, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting
Experience with cloud architecture (AWS) would be a plus
Streaming applications design with Storm and Spark Streaming would be a plus
Fluent in English


Our tech stack includes (but isn’t limited to)
Hadoop (HDFS, Spark, Impala, Hive, Oozie) - Cloudera
Java, Python, Scala, R
AWS (S3, EC2, EMR)
Flume, ElasticSearch, Kibana
MS SQL Server 2016


Benefits

Flight Benefits

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Venta al por menor Servicios financieros
Descripción:
¿Te sientes identificado con la metodología Agile y tienes ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos? ¿Te apasiona la ingeniería de datos y quieres seguir cogiendo experiencia en una de las empresas lideres en el sector del almacenamiento y transporte de hidrocarburos? Si es así, ¡No dejes pasar esta oportunidad y apúntate a esta oferta!

El Grupo CLH es la principal empresa de almacenamiento y transporte de productos petrolíferos de España, y que además, tras el acuerdo con Inter Pipeline (IPL) para adquirir 15 instalaciones de almacenamiento en Reino Unido, Irlanda, Alemania y Países Bajos, se ha convertido en la principal empresa logística de productos líquidos en Europa. El Grupo CLH está integrado en España por CLH, CLH Aviación y TERQUIMSA (Terminales Químicos, S.A.). Además cuenta con presencia internacional a través de CLH Pipeline System (CLH-PS) Ltd. en Reino Unido, CLH Aviation Ireland en Irlanda y Orpic Logistics Company L.L.C. (OLC) que desarrolla su actividad en Omán.
El Grupo CLH desempeña un papel clave para garantizar a la sociedad un acceso fácil y seguro a los productos petrolíferos y basa su gestión en criterios de compromiso con la sostenibilidad, la seguridad, la eficiencia y la colaboración con la sociedad, como recoge su Misión, Visión y Valores.

Ofrecemos
Salario: según valía y experiencia.
Incorporación a un sólido Grupo multinacional que valora a sus colaboradores
Flexibilidad en horario de entrada y salida
Formación, apoyo y aprendizaje constante dentro de un equipo muy experimentado, con excelente ambiente de trabajo y profesionalidad.
Participar en el desarrollo de las iniciativas ágiles de nuestro HUB Digital, donde utilizamos las tecnologías más punteras en materia de Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Edge Computing, Cloud Computing, IoT, RPA, NLP y otras muchas.
Requisitos
Grado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Económicas o similar
Bases de datos, SQL, procesos ETL, Power BI.
Persona Agile Mindset y con experiencia utilizando metodologías ágiles en entornos de trabajo colaborativo.
Habilidades de comunicación efectiva (Data Storytelling).
Valorable experiencia con ecosistema de Azure y conocimientos de programación con Python, así como formación de Data Scientist.
Idioma Inglés nivel alto (mínimo B2 - 800 puntos en TOEIC).
Experiencia deseable de al menos 1-2 años en tareas similares
Responsabilidades
La persona que buscamos se integraría en nuestro equipo del HUB Digital y trabajaría muy alineada con los Product Owners de negocio, con el ingeniero/a de datos y con el científico de datos, y se encargaría de utilizar en la práctica el planteamiento de infraestructura propuesto por el ingeniero/a de datos, y de realizar todas aquellas operaciones ETL necesarias (Extracción, Transformación y Carga de datos) para que el Científico de Datos pueda desarrollar sus modelos. También sería la persona responsable de estructurar la visualización de los datos, generar informes, así como de la retroalimentación e integración de los modelos generados por el científico de datos para su consumo por parte de negocio (Business Intelligence). Pero en CLH sabemos que la experiencia no lo es todo y por eso valoramos también que tengas entusiasmo por unirte a nuestro proyecto y que seas una persona comprometida, proactiva y con ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos.

¡Por lo demás, nosotros te ayudaremos e impulsaremos en todo momento!

Descripción:
Anunciado por
María Cubillo Esteban
Business Manager / Desarrollo de Negocio IT en TMC
Enviar mensaje InMail
| YOUR CHALLENGES?
We are currently seeking flexible and fast-thinking Cloud Big Data Engineers.
Depending on your expertise and affinity, areas of application may include Retail, TELCO, Energy, IOT Distributed Systems, Mobility and Healthcare. The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you’re able to motivate this to others.

As a Cloud Big Data Engineer in our team you will be challenged with:
Designing and/or building the data model and its complex processing infrastructure that meets the business’s requirements;
Transforming large, complex data-sets into pragmatic, actionable insights;
Leveraging data to identify, quantify and realize tangible business gain;
Having the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapting quickly and taking ownership of your work;
Managing innovative ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.
We focus on delivering quality work, supporting our customers and above all, attitude! That’s why we expect our people to feel at home in all areas of today’s development.


| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?
Perfectly fluent in Spanish, you have a BSc. or MSc. in software engineering, computer science, (theoretical) physics, econometrics, statistics, scientific computing, bioinformatics or comparable background. Degree in Computer Sciences, Informatics or related field required.

During your studies or through professional experience (minimum 3 years of relevant experience is required) you have gained expertise in one or more of the following topics:
Strong technical skills regarding, data(base) modeling, data warehousing and programming;
Strong working knowledge of Python, R, Java, Hadoop, Cloudera, Kafka Ecosystem, Snowflake, Spark, Scala-Spark, Flink, Hive, HDFS, Impala, Kudu, API's, SQL, and / or noSQL;
• Strong working knowledge of Cloud: Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform.
Strong working knowledge of designing and implementing common BI applications, such as Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, Splunk, SAP, SAS, or others;
Proven experience and affinity with designing and building of data processing solutions, data storage solutions, cloud solutions, and / or database management;
Experience with processing large data sets (> 1 TB) is considered a plus;
Knowledge of Agile methods is considered a plus;

In addition to these technical skills developed through your industry experience, you have developed strong soft skills such as good oral and written communicative skills, stress resistance and a team player attitude. Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC is also required.
Your profile matches these expectations? Let’s talk about your plan!


| WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?
Be part of the TMC Software Factory, our Development Center that provides IT expertise and development based on best practices and accumulated experience to all our clients. We excel in agile development and IT engineering.
Who we are?
High Performance Development Center
Technological solutions tailored-fit for each customer
Capability to work with a variety of technologies
Software quality & security compliance best practices
Continuous delivery to customers
Cybersecurity compliance
We invest in technological surveillance


| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?
TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.
At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.
As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?
We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:
You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups

Descripción:
Data Scientist/Científico de Datos en Madrid.
Necesitamos a una persona de mentalidad curiosa a la que le gusten las aplicaciones móviles el video online las redes sociales la publicidad y las marcas. Que se sienta cómoda con los números para poder identificar oportunidades que surjan de los datos.
Fundamental que se defienda bien con Power point y que sepa redactar bien.
Requisitos técnicos imprescindibles
Programación en R.
Experiencia en analítica.
Somos Smartme una compañía con un fuerte componente tecnológico dedicada a obtener procesar y analizar Big Data de los usuarios de Smartphone.
La recopilación de datos primarios a través de dispositivos móviles es una forma precisa de capturar información de los consumidores. La información recabada a través de la tecnología Smartme permite mejorar de forma constante la captación y la retención de los clientes así como tener un conocimiento competitivo continuo sin precedentes lo que permite a los clientes de Smartme mejorar sus resultados empresariales.
El equipo de Smartme joven y dinámico se compone de científicos y analistas de datos con clara vocación y visión de generar propuestas de valor tecnológicas y de negocio.

Estamos buscando un CIENTÍFICO DE DATOS para incorporar en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.
Actividades a desarrollar
Manejo y gestión de redes sociales apoyando al product manager.
Formación en tecnologías y metodologías de tracking para medir y analizar comportamientos de mercado.
Asistencia en la medición de audiencias y gestión de audiencias compartidas.
Medición de eficacia publicitaria.
Apoyo en la elaboración de informes sobre estudios de mercado.
El objetivo es formar a una persona en tecnologías y metodologías de tracking observacional para inferir perfiles comportamentales algoritmos de madurez de posicionamiento mobile de las marcas de cara a establecer diagnósticos de inteligencia competitiva. También conocer nuevas técnicas de análisis de audiencia de eficacia publicitaria predicciones de targets más afines según productos y marcas etc.
El foco de la formación estará centrado en ser capaz de extraer conclusiones de interés para el negocio.
R, Microsoft Powerpoint, python, tableau

Descripción:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology

Job Details

MuleSoft is looking for an experienced Data Architect to join our talented Training & Certification team to strengthen the impact of our data and the consumption of it in our organisation, cross-functionally and for our customers and partners.

In this role, you will help us make the Training & Certification data available cross-functionally by positioning how it can influence business outcomes. You will collaborate with Data Engineers and Sr. Business Analysts and co-own Training & Certification Data Models.

Your expertise in data architecture and business outcomes will be key to understand the impact of the different data scenarios. You will evaluate new and existing data requirements, own and support the completion of those requirements and provide executive summaries of the results.

You will collaborate closely with the Head of Global Data Strategy at MuleSoft Training & Certification to support the design and execution of the strategy and the delivery of the outcomes.

What You’ll Achieve
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Monitor and report on how Training & Certification Data is being used and what business outcomes are driving.
Identify opportunities to use Training & Certification Data to drive business outcomes by working with leaders within our team and cross-functionally with other data owners and stakeholders.
Design and implement a security architecture that will be robust and scalable for future needs
Drive adoption of Training & Certification data and reporting in the team and cross-functionally.
Enable MuleSoft teams on the business value of Training & Certification based on data analysis.
Establish best practices and standardise data across the Training & Certification team.
Recommend and influence the Data Strategy for Training & Certification to maximise performance.
Recommend and implement solutions to improve the quality of the Training & Certification data.
Establish governance in Training & Certification data.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
GDPR and Privacy Data
Design conceptual and logical data models
Become the SME and anticipate future needs
Research and properly evaluate sources of information to understand and define possible limitations in reliability or usability

What You’ll Need To Be Successful
Experience working with cross-functional teams
Proven work experience as a Data Architect, Data Scientist, Data Lead
Experience gathering and analyzing data requirements
Understanding of predictive analysis and data visualization techniques.
Hands-on experience with SQL and Integration Tools
Strong knowledge of database structures and data mining.
Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
Problem solver attitude
Experience working with private and sensitive personal information
Considerate in decision making and the ability to explain processes or choices as needed
Experience in visualisation tools such as Tableau, Qlik or Power BI or equivalent

Descripción:
Westerman is looking for a Senior Data Scientist for one of the most important clients in the Retail Industry in Barcelona.

Job Description
Your role will be to be part of growing team Digital Hub based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.

You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.

This Role Will Support The Following Activities
Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.
Coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Build data-driven models.
Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.
Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create reusable packages or libraries.

Requirements
4+ years’ experience building solutions in the revenue management or in the supply chain space.
4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions.
4+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
4+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
3+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology.
Experience with Azure cloud services is a plus.

Sector: Internet Dotación y selección de personal Recursos humanos
Descripción:
Are you a data-driven engineer who can assist stakeholders on a global scale? Looking for a role that gives you the freedom to create and innovate? Then keep reading…

Our story (the bitesize version)

Here at Just Eat Takeaway.com, we deliver delicious dishes across 24 countries worldwide. From fries in Frankfurt to tacos in Toronto, millions of food-lovers order from us every day.

Our recipe for success is all about tech. From data engineers to backend developers and IT Support experts, our talented tech teams help us continue to innovate and grow.

All About The Role

As our Senior Data Engineer, you're part of the diverse Data Engineering team based at our Amsterdam HQ. The team's goal is to support our existing platform, in addition to creating new components and integrations and ensuring production runs smoothly.

And You'll Also Have The Chance To

It's your job to verify data integrity and transform it into the best format for each stakeholder, using the right tools to support their operational work.
Collect and transform unstructured data from different sources into a structured output – e.g. columnar databases, flat or Parquet/ORC files, NoSQL or streams
Use your skills and best practices to create reliable, frequently/continuously running pipelines.
Create reusable, maintainable and scalable integrations & services, using a cutting-edge cloud infrastructure
Model and test data, implement proper logging and troubleshoot any issues swiftly
Collaborate effectively with team members and other stakeholders in Agile iterative processes

Can you deliver…

Ready to be our next Data Engineer? Here is what we need from you:
4+ years' experience in handling big data pipelines, data warehouses or other (preferably distributed) data stores
In-depth knowledge of Python, including 2+ years' experience
Proficient in working with Airflow
Experience with MPP data warehouses like Redshift, Teradata, Snowflake and databases like Postgres, Oracle, MySQL etc.
Experience in the cloud is preferred (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Skilled in parsing structured and unstructured data. Knowledge of data warehousing is a plus
An independent way of working: you prefer deploying services on the cloud instead of waiting for a DevOps engineer to hand you servers
Passionate about clean code and ideas, and able to strike a balance between development speed and documentation + testing
Fluent English (written & spoken) and good communication skills

Here Is Our Offer

Like the perfect food pairing, your skills and these great rewards belong together:
Competitive salary
An impactful and varied role as part of a talented, diverse team
The chance to join a fast-growing global tech business with flat hierarchies
Opportunities to learn new concepts and develop as both an engineer and an individual
Great team & company events
26 days of holiday per year
Contribution to your travel costs and budget for ordering lunches
Generous relocation package to move to the Netherlands (please only apply if you want to work in Amsterdam)

Don't miss out on this exciting data engineering role. Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Marina Dávila
Tech Talent Acquisition | People & Culture @ GuideSmiths
Enviar mensaje InMail
Software is a vocation for us, not just a job. We bring creative developers together to solve difficult problems in complex environments.
 At GuideSmiths we value amazing technology and even better people: working exclusively with modern technologies and allowing people to find their own space and letting the team form to its strengths. We love challenging work and delivering value, building bespoke software solutions, in a modern and agile way, always striving to accelerate, innovate and succeed for our clients.

We are looking for you!

At GuideSmiths we are looking for a passionate Data Engineer, experienced with Azure or Amazon data offerings, ETL packages and Power BI or similar knowledge, with the willingness to participate in challenging projects as well as being part of our Business development goal based on being the best international software boutique to work with. 

What will you be working at in GuideSmiths on a daily basis?

Your goal will be to work with internal teams to design, develop and maintain data integration, analytics or reporting solutions.
You will be in charge of creating the right solutions for our clients' needs and work with the Architecture and Management teams to deliver the requirements in time and with the required quality
Participate in requirements analysis.
Design clean, scalable solutions with the available tools.
Test and deploy the integrations and reports.
Improve existing solutions.
Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Serve as an expert on these topics and provide technical support.

You may be a good fit if you...

Are an experienced Data Engineer (more than 3 years of professional experience)
Speak English fluently (Provable minimum B2+) as we work with international clients
Are familiar with DataMart, DataWarehouse, DataLake and related infrastructure
Have an extensive experience with Azure/AWS Data Platform including ETL, Analytics and Visualization
Deep expertise of SQL and its different flavors (Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle)
Know visualization platforms (Power BI, Snowflake, Tableau)
Practical experience with data modelling for analytics and reporting
Enjoy working closely with the entire team to ensure that the work attains the highest standards of quality
Follow Agile / Scrum principles

Also, it would be great if you are...

Passionate for data, how to extract meaning from it and how to visualize it in a simple yet compelling manner
Able to work remotely within an international team
Team player
Proactive and excellent communicator
Always seeking for continuous improvement
Problem-Solving.
Clients and results orientation 

What do we offer?

We believe a lot in investing in our people so you’ll get top benefits as a GuideSmiths employee:
Competitive salary
Annual performance bonus
Professional career development
Remote first culture (but you can come to the WeWork offices if you want to!)
Corporate Culture based on Agile development and fluent communication.
Flexible working schedule
Flexible compensation plan with Private Medical Insurance, Restaurant and Transportation credit card or Budget aimed at Training courses based on your needs
Best hardware for Developers (i.e. MacBook Pro and 27-inch screen)

Whom will you be working with?

Carlos Esquivel, Chief Architect at GuideSmits and passionate about technology. His background goes from backend, frontend, database, to cloud technologies in a variety of business scenarios and environments.
José González, Software Engineer and DevOps at GuideSmiths. He enjoys designing platforms and architectures for microservices, creating CI/CD pipelines on AWS and Azure.
 This is just a part of our amazing team! Apply now and you will have the opportunity to learn more about us.

Estamos seleccionando, para nuestro departamento Data Science en colaboración directa con uno de nuestros principales clientes a nivel Internacional, nuevos compañeros con experiencia de al menos 2-3 años en el desarrollo de proyectos y soluciones de analítica de datos con lenguaje Python y/o R para ampliar nuestro equipo, trabajando sobre el desarrollo de soluciones de negocio y modelos de análisis predictivo mediante técnicas Machine Learning e IA.

LLevando a cabo las funciones de Data Scientist especializado en proyectos de ámbito puntero para la creación de soluciones analíticas con el uso de las técnicas de estadística avanzada, machine learning e inteligencia artificial más novedosas.

¿Qué puedes aportarnos?
Experiencia de al menos 2-3 años en desarrollo con lenguaje Python y/o R.
Experiencia en el análisis y creación de solución a seguir en función de la problemática abordada.
Experiencia en el análisis y programación de proyectos BI/BA con técnicas ML.
Motivación y ganas por colaborar en entorno multidisciplinar junto al resto de equipos en la creación de soluciones de análisis para el principal proyecto nacional de ámbito ML e IA.
 Valorable:
Conocimientos y/o experiencia con lenguajes de programación SQL.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos ML y su validación.

¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?
Desarrollo profesional en unidad de referencia de ámbito Business Analytics.
Entorno salarial negociable en función de la experiencia aportada.
Plan de carrera profesional y formación garantizada.

Sector: Petróleo y energía
Descripción:
SENIOR DATA SCIENCE CRO
 Repsol in its ambitious Digital Transformation plan, wants to incorporate a Data Scientist for its Data & Analytics HUB.
 Your Responsibilities will be:
 ·        Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions. 
·        Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. 
·        Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. 
·        Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. 
·        Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes. 
·        Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality. 
·        Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. 
·        Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
 Our ideal Data Scientist: 
 ·        Strong problem solving skills with an emphasis on product development. 
·        Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. 
·        Strong experience with conversion rate optimization (CRO) techniques, Google Analytics, and internet marketing.
·        Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. 
·        Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams. 
·        A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. 
·        We’re looking for someone with 5-7 years of experience, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the following software/tools: 
·        Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. 
·        Experience querying databases and using statistical computer tools: SQL, SAS, R, Python, Tensor Flow, etc 
·        Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. 
·        Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Gurobi, MySQL, etc. 
·        Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc

Your responsabilities:  

Be part of the team responsible for the cross-company "Data Supply Chain" in the Otto Group to ensure the data supply of novel, data-driven business models. 
We want to significantly increase the usability and impact of our data platform for real-time and batch processing within the group - with your expertise! 
Together with your colleagues, you will be responsible for the design and implementation of our new, high-performance and robust BI platform in the Google Cloud for big, fast & smart data. 100% Cloud only.
In addition to processing and preparing the data along its entire lifecycle in our data pipelines of data stream processing, you will also create tools & frameworks for the efficient use of the new BI platform.
With a strong customer focus, we create the basis for all BI applications, a uniform understanding of data, transparency along the data processing and meet all legal and regulatory requirements. True Self-Service BI.

Your requirements:  

Large amounts of data, their high-performance processing and technical innovations are your passion
You have excellent conceptual skills, a quick mind and enjoy working in a team.
You are eager for knowledge and do not only want to develop software, but also to penetrate technical requirements and transform data into knowledge to inspire customers. 
Very good developer skills in Java and SQL as well as possibly first experiences with Scala or Python
Confident handling of relational databases (e.g. BigQuery) and concepts of data warehousing and data modelling as well as initial knowledge of real-time technologies.
Experience in the development of scalable cloud solutions based on AWS or Google (e.g. Google Pub/Sub, Google Dataflow, etc.).
Methodical approach: a clean object-oriented or functional design, tests and monitorability characterize your software. Clean build and deploy processes are important to you 


What's in it for you?

Fast growing company
Be part of a great team
Competitive salary

Agile working methods
Training and Development

Sector: Software Internet Servicios financieros
Descripción:
About Returnly

At Returnly we help brands that care about shopper loyalty offer better product returns. We are a financial technology services company that builds award-winning products that drive repurchase behavior and customer loyalty. We’re backed by smart money VCs in Fintech including some prominent members of the Paypal Mafia. Our headquarters are in San Francisco Financial District and we have offices in Chicago and Madrid. We are on a mission to de-risk online commerce and are building a team of amazingly talented people to help us do it.

About The Role

At Returnly, we value you as a whole person. We care about the skillset you bring to the table, but more importantly, we care about the kind of person you are, and the culture and attitude you bring to the table. As a Senior Full Stack Data Scientist, you will build data products that will affect thousands of customers with the objective to improve user experience, drive revenue and optimize processes. You will find success in this role if you are a seasoned data scientist who enjoys to design, build and implement statistical models, covering the whole process end-to-end from idea to production.

About You

Here’s what we look for in the attitude department:
You are a seasoned and versatile data scientist, who is passionate about your work
You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
You are proactive and adaptable
You like to solve problems and to fill in the gaps where there are unknowns
You are a craftsman in your trade but you understand when “good enough” is enough
You are analytical and have keen attention to details
You have your own opinions and you are not shy about them, but you also value consensus and strive to achieve it
You lead your teammates by example, you’re the “go to” individual
You’re not afraid to change your mind given new facts, nor are you afraid to admit your mistakes
You thrive in a semi-structured start-up environment with ample opportunity and also plenty of ambiguity
You can wear multiple hats
You have excellent communication skills and are able to explain your ideas clearly and concisely and enjoy sharing them
You are very serious about the quality of your work and you ask no less from your colleagues
You understand and are interested in both big picture and nitty-gritty details
What you'll be doing
Solve new and challenging problems around eCommerce payments, credit issuance and settlement, fraud detection, SaaS integration, model serving
Work cross-functionally with some of the best people in different disciplines like data science, analytics, finance, product management, marketing & sales, design
Break down business problems into statistical and machine learning problem formulations
Explore, identify, query and correlate data from several different state-of-the-art data sources (Snowflake, Databricks Delta, Redis, etc.)
Use advanced statistical methods to identify meaningful patterns, producing insights from data
Develop robust classification, function approximation and anomaly detection models based on relational, text, image and time series data
Use feature engineering to extract the best signals for a problem and apply suitable regularization techniques
Develop and write production grade code in Python for our back-end microservices and REST APIs that serve our machine learning applications
Drive quality by writing unit, integration, and performance tests in a continuous delivery environment
What we're looking for
6+ years industry experience
Very good understanding of applied statistics, such as distributions, hypothesis testing, regression, classification, etc.
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-means, k-NN, naive Bayes, SVM, tree-based models, HMM, neural nets, deep learning etc.
Thorough, expert level knowledge of data structures, algorithms, object oriented programming and design patterns in Python
Deep understanding and experience of various technologies, frameworks and libraries in the Python ecosystem
Strong familiarity with *nix environment including bash and command-line tools
Experience with Git version-control system
Strong experience with relational and non relational databases, including SQL
Familiarity of web service technologies and REST best-practices
Basic understanding of distributed systems in a cloud environment, and event-driven architecture
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience
Strong interpersonal and communication skills are required
Excellent command of the English language, both written and spoken is a must for communicating with a global team
Proven track record of shipping models in a delivery-focused environment
Exposure to Amazon Web Services
Prior startup experience a big plus

Our Values

Diversity - We are diverse, independent thinkers and still one team with one mission.

Openness and empathy - We learn and grow by listening to our customers and each other.

Integrity - We always do what’s right for our customers, Returnly and ourselves - in that order.

Team - EQ is as important as IQ. We make time to help each other out.

Commitment - We are curious and fearless. We own risk, outcomes and everything in between.

We'd really love to hear from you, but before applying please check the following...

Read the values section above carefully and ask yourself if this is a good match for you personally. We want you to be an ambassador of these values!

Do you have all the skills required for this role? Can you demonstrate them? Be realistic - we will only consider applications that demonstrate relevant skills and match these role requirements.

Candidate Privacy Notice

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
At Busuu we deal with over 60-Million data events per day and to keep us ahead of our competitors we are looking for motivated senior talent to join us to reach our next milestone.

Working at that scale is not always an easy task, and we know that there are challenges ahead, therefore we are looking for you, who wants to be part of a global expanding project and master the challenges together with us. There are more than exciting times ahead, the perception of EdTech has changed over the last year and more and more people engage with the self-paced, social-interacting learning as we offer it.

We think that you can live up to your passion and honest love for problem solving, at Busuu we support you in your quest for building a legacy, we want you to question the status quo.

As a Senior Data-Engineer we have great things to come into your area of responsibilities.

You will work with other Platform Engineering Members in building scalable RT services, which will operate across different Data Centers. In such an environment Data Quality is key and you will work in an agile Test-Measure-Learn Cycle to improve on it. Constant exchange with PMs, DS and DAs to understand their data needs will help you to take architectural decisions for our data lake.

You will work with your team on data-pipelines to collect and generate insights that help millions of people achieve their language learning goals. You will participate in enhancing our big data environment, currently we operate at over Billion requests per month, with cutting edge tools.

At Busuu you will become part of a fast growing and rapidly innovating company with strong mission and values.

What Makes An Amazing Data Platform Engineering At Busuu
Strong knowledge of SQL
High proficiency in Python, ie. pandas library
Comfortable working in a Linux environment with Docker
Query optimization for distributed/analytical databases like Redshift, Google BigQuery, Vertica, Greenplum
Streaming data technologies like Kinesis, Kafka, Dataflow
Data pipeline tools like Airflow/Luigi
BI tools such as Tableau/Looker
Data modelling and data warehouse design
Ability to work outside your comfort zone, take a problem and solve it with as much or as little support as you need.

Nice to have:
Remote work experience
Experience with debugging DB performance issues

What can you expect working at Busuu Spain?

You will be based in our new Madrid Office, and have the opportunity to travel to our HQ in London for short-term visits when travel is safe.

We work in a colocated setup, meaning that we expect remote workers to join the team in their assigned office every then and now.

At Busuu we know that when we work hard we should find time to relax and have fun, this is why we encourage our members to join our quarterly team events, to build personal relationships with your peers. Being a part of Busuu - How do things work:

We are acutely aware that we are in unprecedented times and like all companies we need to adapt to this in order to safeguard our Busuu community. In order to do this we are constantly reviewing the government guidelines and adapting accordingly to accommodate the physical and mental wellbeing of our employees. In the current global climate, some of our team events are virtual and some of our benefits have been amended.

We offer several special perks to our employees, which are:
Competitive salary
Work from home Policy
Bonus scheme
Training budget
Private healthcare
Access to Busuu
Premium
Free online workout and wellness platform (Adidas Running + Asana)
Free breakfast and snacks


What Happens Next

We aim to have a simple and speedy hiring process and we want to make sure that we are right for you as much as the other way around. The hiring process is as follows:
CV application review - We will review it as quickly as possible and update on the next steps
Let's chat - Quick chat about your experience and the role, we are looking to understand both how we can help you and how you can raise the bar at Busuu
Technical challenge - You will be asked to take on a short tech challenge and then present it back to the team. We are interested in how you think and how you approach problems rather than any one 'right' way of doing things.
Face-to-face and meet the team - You'll be asked to come in and have deeper interviews with the Busuu team, plus the chance to learn more about us, our culture and values.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
This is Ekkiden

Ambition and innovation are our driving force. We aim high, act quickly, and acquire the wherewithal that we need to achieve our objectives. Our organisation is shaped by the requirements of both our clients and our teams. Becoming a European benchmark requires hard work, quality and respect. We pave our own path, with international teams committed to sustainable growth. We help clients to innovate and we make sure we question ourselves at all times. At Ekkiden everything is possible. Our managers are trained to bring out the best in every team member. If you are daring, creative, and have great people skills, if you want to live an extraordinary human experience and you don’t want to keep reminding yourself why you get up in the morning, it's time to meet up.

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Responsibilities
Work with the team (technical Lead/Architect/other team members) and customer focal point to understand the business need and design/implement the technical data management solution
Design and implement Data Warehouses and Data Lakes solutions, mainly Microsoft Cloud and AWS data services, based on the customers’ business requirements
Design and implement complex ELT/ETL processes using Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory or AWS Glue or others
Design and develop Analysis Services OLAP Cubes and Tabular Views
Develop scripts accordingly to the data need (Stored Procedures with T-SQL, Python or R, eventually PowerShell).
Design conceptual and logical data models and data flowcharts
Design Data-as-a-Service solution, on-premises and Cloud based, based on Data API Gateway and other Cloud services.
Implement Data Catalog solutions
Migrate data from legacy systems to new data platform solutions
Improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
Optimize new and current database systems
Perform other duties as required


What We Are Looking For
+5 years of experience in similar positions
Strong knowledge in C# development
Strong knowledge on Azure Functions
Excellent knowledge in LogicApps and development in Azure
Excellent knowledge of AWS BI and data services
Experience with Data analysis and modelling
Experience with Database scripting (T-SQL, stored procedures, etc.)
Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence modules covering Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Analysis Services (SSAS)
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS Athena/RDS or Redshift
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI
Experience working with OData
Experience working with SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience with Service Management tools (ticketing systems)
Experience with Service Management methodologies (ITIL) and Change Management
Experience with Agile project development
Microsoft SQL Server certification is a plus
Microsoft BI certification is a plus
Fluent in English. Spanish and Italian are a plus


What we offer
Participate in the creation of a European technology and organisational consulting group
A unique, innovative and dynamic working environment
A career path tailored to your personality, both in terms of job position and location
The opportunity to express yourself, assert your opinion and make an impact within our organisation and/or further afield
You say it, you own it. Once your idea has been given the go-ahead, it is up to you to make it happen
A demanding and innovative training program delivered by our greatest experts
Age is just a number, what really matter are achievements. We have a fast-track promotion system for employees who deliver
Our working conditions are concentric with our values and ambitions

Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
C#, Azure, AWS, Data Lake, Data Warehouse

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Adrián Fernández Jurado 2º
People, Culture & Recruitment en Paradigma Digital
¿Quiénes Somos?

Después de 15 años de experiencia, de sumar más de 600 profesionales a nuestra familia y de trabajar mano a mano con 120 clientes, podemos decir que nos sentimos orgullosos de contribuir al éxito digital de las compañías más importantes de nuestro país.

Con oficinas en Madrid y Barcelona buscamos compañeros que compartan nuestra cultura y valores para incorporación en un equipo ágil y multidisciplinario.

Estamos muy orgullosos del excelente nivel técnico de nuestros equipos pero estamos aún más orgullosos del entorno flexible y humano en el que trabajamos. Además, Paradigma tiene un alto compromiso con la diversidad y la inclusión, ¿te apetece unirte a nuestro equipo?

¿Qué buscamos?
 Función en el equipo:

Identificación, interpretación y combinación de fuentes de datos.
Análisis dinámicos y continuados de aspectos estratégicos.
Identificación y descubrimiento de patrones de comportamiento según los datos analizados.
Definición y aplicación de algoritmos.
Aplicación de técnicas de Machine Learning (clasificación, regresión, clustering, redes de neuronas y reducción de dimensionalidad)
Creación de contenedores.
Desarrollo de sistemas de despliegue de modelos.  

Perfil, experiencia y conocimientos.

Experto en estadística, físico y/o modelos matemáticos aplicables a la explotación, análisis de datos y definición de algoritmos.
Experto en materia de computación distribuida, establecimiento y definición de modelos predictivos.
Experto en software de analítica y explotación y/o presentación de datos.
Experto en análisis estadístico, Machine Learning, Deep Learning.
Experto en productivización de modelos de razonamiento basados en Aprendizaje Automática.
Conocimiento del ecosistema Azure para Machine Learning.
Conocimiento sobre Docker y Kubernetes.
Experiencia en diseño de modelos de datos tanto en entornos relacionales como no relacionales (NoSQL).
Más de 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de Big Data, realizados con tecnologías:
Machine Learning en Python (tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn, pandas),
Machine Learning en R, Machine Learning
Diferentes tecnologías para la utilización de notebooks (Jupyter, Zepelin)
Spark Mllib.

 ¿Qué ofrecemos?

o Flexibilidad y trabajo en remoto: En los tiempos que corren, sabemos que lo único importante no son los proyectos o las fechas de entrega. Mantenerse en un entorno seguro, con la familia y amigos, es nuestra prioridad. Por eso, fomentamos la conciliación con una jornada flexible y teletrabajo.
o Libertad y responsabilidad: Somos una no-company y creemos firmemente en la responsabilidad, en el trabajo sin jerarquías, en la autogestión. Llevamos desde nuestros inicios trabajando de forma ágil y podemos decir que esta fórmula… ¡funciona!
o Últimas tecnologías: trabajamos con las tecnologías más punteras para las empresas más importantes del país.
o Lifelong Learning: Para nosotros es fundamental estar actualizados y a la última en tecnología. Tenemos seminarios online internos, coordinamos grupos de meetups, organizamos Open Space y participamos en los principales eventos nacionales con charlas. Además, contamos con clases de inglés y ayudas para cursos, eventos y formaciones.

Sector: Petróleo y energía Energía renovable y medio ambiente Ingeniería industrial o mecánica
Funciones laborales: Atención al cliente Ingeniería Gestión de proyectos
Descripción:
Inteligencia de clientes B2C - MADRID

Buscamos personas con experiencia como Data Scientist en Inteligencia de Clientes B2C, para integrarse en el equipo de Endesa en Madrid.

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos la empresa líder del sector eléctrico español y el segundo operador del mercado eléctrico en Portugal.

Nuestro principal negocio es la comercialización de electricidad. También somos un operador relevante en el sector del gas natural y desarrollamos otros servicios relacionados con la energía.

Desarrollamos nuestra actividad fundamentalmente en el mercado de España y Portugal. En menor medida, comercializamos electricidad y gas en otros mercados europeos así como otros productos y servicios de valor añadido (PSVA) relacionados con nuestro negocio principal.

Somos una compañía que apuesta por una cultura energética más sostenible y estamos comprometidos con nuestra responsabilidad de contribuir de forma activa a la construcción de un futuro energético inteligente.

Trabajamos para liderar la transformación tecnológica en la que se encuentra inmerso nuestro sector. Para ello contamos con la sólida posición industrial y la fortaleza que nos da pertenecer a un gran grupo multinacional, el Grupo Enel, al que nos unimos en el primer trimestre de 2009.

El Grupo Enel, que posee el 70,1% de Endesa, es una compañía multinacional del sector de la energía y un operador integrado líder en los mercados mundiales de electricidad y gas focalizado en los mercados de Europa y Latinoamérica.

En Endesa contamos con casi 10.000 empleados y prestamos servicio a 11 millones de clientes.

¿Qué se hace en la Business Line y en la unidad?

La unidad de Inteligencia de clientes se encarga de obtener información útil para el negocio a partir de los datos brutos.

Las responsabilidades incluyen:

- Creación de modelos de datos que apoyen a las tareas analíticas

- Creación de modelos analíticos

- Gestión de proveedores externos de servicios

- Interpretación de necesidades de negocio en procesos de datos

Entorno complejo y de necesidades cambiantes, relaciones con diferentes unidades de negocio de B2C y de Endesa, así como con equipos de sistemas, participando en proyectos críticos a nivel de compañía.

Asimismo, los productos de datos generados deben alinearse con los objetivos comerciales del segmento B2C, todo ello bajo la metodología Agile/Kanban imprescindible para este puesto.

¿Qué vas a hacer?

Trabajarás en  un equipo de Data Scientist y Data Experts especialistas en Machine Learning y herramientas de Big Data.

Participarás en  procedimientos de recolección y extracción de datos.

Interpretar y analizar problemas de datos

Desarrollo de sistemas analíticos y modelos predictivos

Automatización de procesos

Apoyar al desarrollo de herramientas de visualización de datos y creación de informes

Experimentar con nuevos modelos y técnicas.

Alinear los proyectos de datos con los objetivos de la organización en colaboración con el Chapter de Advanced Analytics.

Trabajar bajo una metodología Kanban.


Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas


¿Qué conocimientos y experiencia van a ser considerados?

Será requisito indispensable para la ocupación de la posición que cuentes con la siguiente formación y/o conocimientos:

Grado en ingeniería informática, matemáticas, estadística o similar.

Experiencia demostrable en puestos de similar responsabilidad en áreas de Market/Clientes

Experiencia comprobada como Data Scientist o función similar.

• Conocimiento sólido en Machine Learning.

• Conocimiento de técnicas de visualización y gestión de datos

• Fuertes conocimientos y experiencia en análisis estadístico y el modelado predictivo

Nivel de inglés fluido.

Herramientas técnicas

SQL , Python y/o R nivel avanzado
Deseable Linux, Shell script nivel medio


Se valorará:

Deseable postgrado en Big Data o similar.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

- Contrato laboral:

Apostamos por el desarrollo y la estabilidad de las personas que trabajen con nosotros, por lo que desde el principio se ofrece un contrato laboral indefinido.

- Salario:

En Endesa contamos con una estructura salarial, que se establece en relación al puesto concreto y la trayectoria profesional de la persona.

Promovemos un nuevo enfoque de negocio centrado en el equilibrio entre la vida laboral y familiar de todos nuestros empleados, que está basado en los valores de la confianza y la responsabilidad.

El objetivo es lograr los mejores resultados con una mayor flexibilidad, junto con un impacto positivo en el medio ambiente. Bajo esta premisa, contarás con una jornada laboral flexible y la oportunidad de poder trabajar desde fuera de la oficina.

El smartworking es una nueva forma de vivir el trabajo que pone a nuestros empleados en el centro, permitiéndoles trabajar desde casa o donde quieran, respetando la seguridad y la confidencialidad.

- Retribución flexible:

Una retribución flexible que te permitirá elegir, en base a tu situación y preferencias, entre distintas opciones como cheques de comida, guardería, seguro médico, transporte, etc.

- Beneficios:

> Oportunidad de desarrollo

> Medidas de conciliación: Contarás con una tarifa eléctrica para empleados, ayuda de estudios para ti y tus hijos, posibilidad de acceder a anticipos y préstamos y acceso a múltiples planes de formación.

- Promover la salud:

Apostamos por el bienestar físico y psicológico de las personas que trabajan con nosotros, por lo que tendrás a tu disposición el Programa Entrénate, que fomenta el deporte y salud, mediante el cual podrás participar en actividades de fitness, yoga, competiciones deportivas, etc.

¿Cómo va a ser el proceso de selección?

El proceso es muy ágil y sencillo, el cual se compone de varias fases que se irán estableciendo en función de los requisitos de la posición.

Llegado el caso, Teresa del equipo de Endesa, y Miriam del equipo de Randstad valorarán tu candidatura y contactarán contigo para conocerte más en detalle y así avanzar en el proceso con la posible realización de una prueba técnica y/o de idiomas, para posteriormente concretar una entrevista de selección.

Si crees que esta posición supone una oportunidad de desarrollo y un reto para ti, ¡no lo dudes e inscríbete!

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una empresa energética multinacional, uno de los principales operadores integrados de gas y electricidad del mundo, así como uno de los principales productores de energía renovable.

Trabajamos en los 5 continentes, siendo aproximadamente 69.000 personas a lo largo de todo el...

Want to be part of challenging projects and learn in a friendly, collaborative environment? This challenge is for you!

We are looking for a Java Developer who wants to join a growing company with a very cool team full of clean code followers.

First things first... top project details!

Company / team: who would not love finishing a daily and going straight to a Nerf battle? And have a meeting in Mordor? Or to participate in a paella contest, canyoning or going to an event in Poland? You'll find a place to grow and learn in an international environment! You will work in a squad with the PO, Tech lead, developers, QA and a Data Scientist.

Your mission 🚀

You will be part of an agile team of amazing developers, and even better people!

Gympass and football, basketball, paddle and runners team.

Parties and team building events.

If this is you – holy cow! 🐄

If this is also you – JACKPOT! 🍒🍒🍒

You have the ability to adapt to different environments and projects.

Sector: Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Azahara Prieto
Talent Acquisition Manager en Aplazame
En Aplazame estamos buscando Senior Data Scientist



¿Quiénes somos nosotros?

Aplazame es una FinTech parte del grupo WiZink Bank que ofrece financiación instantánea para compras online y offline. Sin papeleo, sin letra pequeña y sin llamar a tu banco. Sólo tú con tu móvil y en cuestión de segundos.

Nuestro objetivo es ofrecer productos financieros simples, transparentes y justos que merezcan la confianza de la gente y les permita comprar con flexibilidad. Si quieres participar en el reto que supone trabajar y aprender en una de las historias de éxito más importantes del panorama nacional, queremos saber de ti.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Investigación de mejoras de los modelos existente: propuesta de hipótesis, investigación y conclusiones *accionables* son nuestro ABC.
Desarrollo de nuevos modelos que no existían previamente para los cuales hay que plantear soluciones interesantes. Por ejemplo, sistemas de recomendación, optimización de canales de marketing, medición de A/B testing con multi-armed bandits o detección de anomalías son algunos de los retos que tenemos que resolver.
Desarrollo Python, hacemos ciencia de datos y por lo tanto hacemos software (bien). Estamos trabajando duramente para que a final del Q1 cumplamos el  Joel Test en su totalidad
Comunicación y más comunicación con el resto de las áreas. Somos un equipo cross que permea en toda la compañía y tiene afán de transmitir.
Participar en la mejora del plan estratégico y añadir ideas al backlog es parte de tu responsabilidad. No somos un producto sencillo y hay retos en todas partes que requieren soluciones ingeniosas. Trabajamos muchísimo con los equipos de producto para crear una visión a largo plazo de productos basados en datos.

¿A quién nos gustaría encontrar?

Puedes ser tú si tienes una experiencia mínima de 5 años preferiblemente en productos cercanos al crédito en checkout, con conocimiento sobre fraude online y riesgo crediticio.
 Es indispensable:
 Manejo *muy* fluido con el stack típico de DS en Python y facilidad para aprender nuevas herramientas.
Conocimiento estadístico, especialmente en escenarios complejos como estimación con datos censurados o muestreos no aleatorios o rare event sampling. Preferimos entender que ocurre debajo del framework.
*Buen* Python: Si crees que el diseño y el estilo es algo más que estética este es tu sitio.
Trabajo en equipo y capacidad de comunicación: no somos rockstars, trabajamos con muchas otras personas, las entendemos y nos hacemos entender.
Curiosidad intelectual por resolver problemas complejos y no totalmente definidos.
 Tendremos muy en cuenta, pero no es estrictamente necesario:
 Conocimiento en scoring de riesgos y fraude y en la industria financiera.
Experiencia con modelado bayesiano, toma de decisiones secuencial y reinforcement learning.
Uso de A/B testing en productos online.
Conocimiento en sistemas de recomendación con diversas fuentes, especialmente históricos (Collaborative Filtering) y descripciones (NLP + Content-Based)
 Otros aspectos relevantes:
 Conocimientos de arquitectura e ingeniería, especialmente en AWS y administración de contenedores con Kubernetes
Uso de ciclos de vida de MLOps con herramientas como Kubeflow, MLFlow.
Experiencia desarrollando servicios web

¿Cómo trabajamos en Data?
Tenemos unos valores como equipo que no son meras palabras para las ofertas de trabajo, guían nuestras decisiones día a día. Es importante que las conozcas porque hablan mucho de cómo y por qué trabajamos.

Excelencia técnica: (intentamos) hacer todo bien o muy bien. Como en todas partes, tenemos limitaciones de tiempo que nos impiden tener todo en perfecto estado. Pero tendemos a mejorar con la excelencia como objetivo.
Curiosidad intelectual y crecimiento personal: Hacemos ciencia, somos inquietos, tenemos curiosidad, nos hacemos preguntas que nadie nos ha preguntado y damos respuestas que nos sorprenden a nosotros mismos. El aprendizaje es el principal motor de tu propio plan de crecimiento personal.
Zero ego: Ego is the enemy. Para hacer ciencia se tiene que separar al autor del resultado. No nos enamoramos de ninguna idea y todo es mejorable, siempre. Está permitido decir al CDO que sus ideas son terribles.
Trabajo en equipo: los problemas y éxitos de cada uno son de todos. Colaboramos de forma autónoma y nos interesamos por los retos de nuestros compañeros (de Data y otras áreas)
Autonomía responsable: somos muy flexibles con la forma de trabajo de cada uno: trabajo en remoto, de forma asíncrona, permitiendo la conciliación y la autonomía en la ejecución. La responsabilidad es la otra cara de la misma moneda. Todos confiamos en cada miembro y en su responsabilidad individual con el equipo y su trabajo.
Ownership: No intentamos cerrar las historias de usuario y olvidarnos del contexto, tenemos visión panorámica de dónde encaja nuestras piezas en la maquinaria de Aplazame. Hablamos con quien haga falta para que sea un éxito de principio a fin.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Salario fijo de entre 55.000 y 70.000 euros anuales + 20% de bonus anual
24 días laborables de vacaciones al año.
Bolsa individual de 1.000 euros al año para formación, además de días para asistir a eventos
Seguro médico de Sanitas para ti y tu familia subvencionado en un 75%.
Pagos al 0% TAE con Aplazame para empleados.
Horario flexible. Jornada intensiva los viernes y en julio y agosto, para disfrutar tus tardes. 
La posición está basada en Madrid pero actualmente trabajamos en remoto la mayor parte del tiempo. También estamos abiertos a full remote.
Un sprint de innovación al año dónde trabajamos en aquellos retos que les parecen más interesantes al equipo.
El equipo que necesites para hacer tu trabajo a gusto.
Ambiente de trabajo ágil, moderno y flexible con unos compañeros excepcionales y muy buen rollo.

¿Cómo será el proceso?

Si crees que puedes encajar en esta oferta, nos encantaría hablar contigo. Inscríbete aquí o envíanos un email a jobs@aplazame.com. Añade toda la información que consideres relevante para tu candidatura: pruebas de trabajo como repositorios, colaboraciones con proyectos o competiciones de ciencia de datos o cualquier otra cosa de la que te sientas orgulloso. Dinos qué te motiva a unirte a nuestro equipo. ¿Crees que eres la mejor persona que podemos encontrar para el puesto? Cuéntanoslo.

Si tu propuesta nos resulta interesante, nos pondremos en contacto contigo para realizar una entrevista inicial. Así nosotros podremos conocerte y tú tendrás la oportunidad de preguntarnos todo lo que quieras saber. Si todo va sobre ruedas, tendrás una entrevista y una prueba técnica, además conocerás al equipo con el que podrás comentar todas tus inquietudes técnicas y comprobar si somos un best fit acorde a tus intereses.
