Descripción:
Deloitte, como Firma líder en la prestación de servicios profesionales en España y a nivel mundial te ofrece la oportunidad de participar en proyectos vanguardistas en empresas líderes. Actualmente, precisamos incorporar perfiles de Data Engineer para integrarse en sus oficinas de Madrid y de Barcelona manera indefinida.

¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales? En el equipo de Specialized Technology Engineering de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación, disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnología del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial, el mundo del Dato, Ominicanalidad, Realidad Digital, entre otras. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord .

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en proyectos de transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios Cloud como en herramientas de integración
Utilización de conocimiento previos de herramientas, frameworks y plataformas de integración de datos, para el diseño y la implementación de pipelines de ingestión, transformación, data quality y aprovisionamiento de datos en diferentes ecosistemas (cloud, onprem, big data, EDW, etc)..
Stack Tecnológico : Data Pipelines (ETL, ingestion, etc), Data Quality, Data profiling, Data Lineage,Gluecode mastery, Cloudera & Hortonworks (ecosistema Hadoop), Amazon (lambda, glue, S3, Kinesis), Azure (Data Factory, Datalake, Databricks, Deltalake), GCP (Cloud Storage, Dataproc, Dataflow), SQL (Oracle, MSSQL, MySQL, etc.) Shellscripting, linux & windows platforms, Informatica DEI, DQ Kafka (+kafka connect, +kafkaSQL)
Formación: Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Módulo Superior en Desarrollo de Aplicaciones o titulaciones técnicas similares.
Nivel de inglés Alto
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y de espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales
Maximizar la conciliación entre tu vida profesional y tu vida personal con programas de flexibilidad laboral (horario flexible, trabajo en remoto…)
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extra laborales (campeonatos de eGames, concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Forma parte de Deloitte, una compañía multidisciplinar en la que desarrollarás todo tu talento. What impact will you make?

Julia Sanchez Sanz 2º

Our offer

Se precisa una persona altamente especializada en Analytics, formará parte de un equipo de científicos e ingenieros de datos para resolver problemas interesantes del mundo real que realmente marcan la diferencia.

Requisitos

A continuación se describen las principales actividades y funciones que se deberán llevar a cabo en el desempeño de este puesto:
Master o doctorado en ciencias, informática, matemáticas o ingeniería con más de tres años de experiencia en proyectos reales de analítica.
Experiencia profesional aplicando ciencia de datos, análisis, aprendizaje automático y técnicas computacionales.
Conocimiento en el sector energía, será valorado la aplicación en Trading, Refino y Marketing
Un entusiasmo genuino por usar la ciencia de datos para resolver problemas complejos, y una comprensión de los algoritmos, métodos de procesamiento de datos y técnicas de visualización requeridas.
Experiencia en Big Data y Base de Datos (SQL y noSQL).
Experiencia en entorno cloud (Azure)
Conocimientos avanzados de inglés para poder comunicarse de manera fluida con los equipos y en los proyectos internacionales en los que el área de Analytics participa.
Conocimientos específicos:
Feature & Engineering de la información input que permita una explotación optimizada de la data para crear un dataset que pueda ser consumido por el algoritmo.
Diseño E2E de algoritmos, desde su realización bajo estándares optimizados, hasta la puesta en producción del mismo
Fuerte background en desarrollo de algoritmos complejos usando técnicas de Machine learning.
Desarrollos Python como científico de datos y como programador.
Experiencia en la manipulación, procesamiento y extracción de valor de grandes conjuntos de datos desconectados.
Conocimiento práctico de colas de mensajes, procesamiento de flujo y almacenes de datos de "big data" altamente escalables.
Gestión, liderazgo y Scrum:
Experiencia en liderazgo de desarrollos y en trabajo en equipo.
Buena cualidades comunicativas y cooperativas para propiciar una buena interacción en un entorno de trabajo ágil
Capacidad de resolución y de trabajo bajo presión.


Responsabilidades

Responsable de desarrollos de analítica avanzada con técnicas de Machine Learning y Deep learning
Liderar y coordinar las tareas de desarrollo.
Generar la documentación del detalle de funcionamiento de la aplicación, así como de los resultados de los test de regresión.

Descripción:
Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.

To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture

Check out all of our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us

This is a customer facing role, owning the overall technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft Azure Infrastructure and Applications Development Platform. You will own the Cloud Infrastructure and Azure Applications Development technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots.

The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers.

#CustomerSuccess

Responsibilities

Understand customers' overall applications portfolio, IT and business priorities and success measures to design implementation architectures and solutions (Microsoft and 3rd party solutions) using PaaS, DevOps & Advanced Application coding
Apply technical knowledge and customer insights to create a modernization roadmap. Architect solutions to meet business and IT needs, ensuring technical viability of new projects and successful deployments, while orchestrating key resources and infusing key Infrastructure technologies (e.g. Windows and Linux IaaS, Security, Networking, etc.), and Application Development and DevOps technologies (e.g. App Service, containers, serverless, cloud native, etc.) as appropriate
Ensure all solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment
Develop deep relationships with key customer IT decision makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates
Be the Voice of the Customer; Share insights and best practices, and connect with Engineering teams to remove key blockers
Assess the Customers' knowledge of Azure platform and overall cloud readiness to support customers through a structured learning plan and ensure its delivery through partners
Collaborate with other Cloud Solution Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform
Maintain technical skills and knowledge of market trends and competitive insights; collaborate and share with the technical community
Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities

Qualifications

Professional Experience

5+ years of success in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications required
Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior IT executives in large or highly strategic accounts. Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects. required
Problem Solving. Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required
Collaboration and Communication. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams, ensuring successful implementation of customer projects. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management, Database administrators and Data Scientist) required
Technical
Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management required
Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios in enterprise-wide environments (including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud) required
Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following:
Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions (i.e. Windows and Linux IaaS, SAP, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, OSS, containers and Infra as a code technologies) required
Cloud application development solutions (e.g. PaaS, Serverless, API Management);
Container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry);
Continuous integration technologies (e.g. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure for DevOps, Chef, Puppet);
Web application server technologies, cloud application design, software architecture and practices; (design/development/deployment, Agile, SCRUM, ALM)
one or more of the following programming languages: C++, C#, Java, Node.js, JSON, PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby on Rails, Pig/Hive
Experience using integrated development environments (e.g. Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Eclipse, XCode, WebSphere) targeting Android, iOS, Linux, Windows, public clouds (i.e. Azure, AWS) required
Experience with scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management, serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry etc.), API management, microservice frameworks etc.
Software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure DevOps, GitHub). preferred
Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of cloud development platforms preferred
Partners. Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs preferred

Descripción:
Job Description

Clarity’s mission is to bring social impact to markets . Our disruptive tech tool allows systematic measurement and optimization of the social impact of investment portfolios, and our proprietary methodology provides a deeper understanding of the needs of the population and gives a comprehensive view of how those needs are covered by different economic actors. Together, the tool and the methodology will improve the allocation of the World’s capital to human needs.

People at Clarity don’t "talk" ethics and values, we "live" values by example. Our international team is constantly embracing the challenge, solving problems, driven by the purpose of helping investors optimize the social impact of their portfolios. Together, we can become the “gold Standard” offering solutions to all society stakeholders — we're just getting started.

Would you like to join an international and fast growing Startup where you can play an important part in shaping its future? How about an opportunity to take part in next-generation social impact solutions in a highly collaborative work environment, where space for professional development is taken very seriously? Interesting, right? Keep reading!

Requirements

Requirements

We are looking for an individual to conduct research on Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) ratings for private companies and national governments.

The Social Impact researcher should possess exceptional analytical skills and thrive in an entrepreneurial setting as you will be required to lead, leading research workstreams, thinking critically and maximizing scientific rigor in you work. The ideal candidate should love having different types of problems thrown at you, be able to quickly digest and understand the key issues and the main objectives, and provide advice and guidance on how best to proceed.

Location: Madrid or remote.

Key Responsibilities

Role

The ESG Researcher’s role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities

The ESG researcher will be responsible for ensuring that the ratings we provide to clients are statistically and methodologically sound.
Compare methodological options for calculating ESG ratings and identify trade-offs.
Explore statistical properties of datasets and identify relevant insights for rating construction and/or interpretation.
Write code for calculating ESG ratings.
Conduct checks and validation tests on calculated ESG ratings.
Identify and propose continuous improvements and refinements to the rating calculations.
Prepare reports and presentations of document findings.


Qualifications
Deeply passionate about social impact.
Advanced degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, math, or other applied quantitative field. Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree and a strong record of success doing similar work will be considered. PhD would be desirable.
3+ years of relevant work experience, including designing and conducting quantitative research and analyzing data. Experience in the financial services sector will be a plus.
Outstanding quantitative and critical thinking skills.
Significant experience with Python or R. Experience with additional programming languages a plus.
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative.
Decisive and action oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when short of information, and has a high level of energy and stamina.
Complete fluency in English (minimum C1)
Intellectual curiosity and sense of humor.


Benefits

What We Offer

People are one of Clarity’s main assets. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values .
The team comprises professionals from leading consulting and banking firms, MBA graduates from top business schools, entrepreneurs and PhDs.
Clarity’s Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum.

We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work.
Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.
Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.
Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.
Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.
Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).

We care about our employees. We think that every effort has to be rewarded and want them to feel comfortable with us.
Salary proposals are between 10% and 15% above benchmark gross compensation.
Benefits: We are offering a large benefits package for the team, considering their needs and interests.
Stock/ Phantom: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That’s why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with phantom stock options.

We are a US company with a Spanish subsidiary. We have amazing offices in Madrid and NYC.

Our investors believe in us and share our goals. We are a leading startup thanks to public and private funding .

Clarity Has Received Several Awards
Young Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017.
Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open Talent.
Top 2 start-ups with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017.
One of the most innovative Spanish companies by NeoTec.
One of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation Lab.

We regret that due to the high volume of applications we are unable to acknowledge every application. We will contact those candidates who successfully meet our requirements for the position and have been chosen to continue in the recruitment process within the next days .

Job Description & Summary
In PwC Deals we help our clients to successfully carry out a transaction, whether it is buying or selling a business or company, and creating value through their merger, acquisition, financing, divestment and restructuring processes.

Our Financial Decisions and Analysis (FDnA) team delivers additional insight for decision making. We use our people's range of industry experiences with a commercial mindset and deep technical skills to produce rapid, pragmatic and clear outcomes for our clients.

If you are able to see beyond the data, and you like to think independently, creatively and freshly...
If you approach problems from different angles and enjoy an analytical and data-driven approach to problems...
... then PwC Deals can offer a solid career in an area of growth where you will face all kinds of intellectual challenges and will be part of an international team formed by great specialists and consultants working together to solve the most challenging projects in the environment of mergers and acquisitions.
We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with 2-5 years of experience that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data, and help our clients make smarter decisions. Your primary focus will be in collecting and processing data, applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality analytics solutions integrated with our services.


Responsibilities
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods: clustering, classification and regression
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner (data visualization)
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
Perform clustering and regression analysis
Develop GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and Text Analytics solutions


Skills and Qualifications
University Degree in STEM disciplines: Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or Engineering and Master Degree in Data and Analytics.
Experience required in Data Analytics, Deals and/or Strategy departaments. 
Proficiency in Spanish and English.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as Power BI, R, Python, IBM SPSS Modeler, SAS Enterprise Miner, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable.
Proficiency in SQL and Database Management techniques.
Excellent applied understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Random Forests. 
Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Good communication skills, both written and oral
Data-oriented personality.

Descripción:
¡Lo conseguimos! Por quinto año consecutivo, certificados como mejor compañía donde trabajar en España, ¿te apetece empezar a disfrutar?
#TopEmployer #Bestplacetowork.
 Technology & Advanced Solutions (T&AS) es el área de everis dedicado al desarrollo de proyectos de transformación digital bajo un ambiente disruptivo, innovador gracias a la aplicación de las soluciones o tecnologías más emergentes del mercado. Somos el top of mind de nuestros clientes.
 ¿Te gusta estar a la última dentro del mundo del dato? ¿Te apasiona la tecnología y la innovación?
 Ofrecemos la oportunidad de crecer profesionalmente en proyectos punteros, innovadores y tecnológicamente complejos en clientes de diferentes sectores, adquiriendo conocimientos en las más avanzadas tecnologías.
 Buscamos Cloud Data Engineers con experiencia en el desarrollo de aplicaciones de datos sobre ecosistemas Cloud, con una pronunciada vocación técnica, capacidad de aprendizaje y dispuestos a enfrentarse a nuevos retos tecnológicos.
 Se valorará el conocimiento de metodologías ágiles, DevOps y soluciones NoSql, aunque si no dispones de ellos, te formaremos y cogerás rápidamente las dinámicas porque lo utilizamos en todos los proyectos.

Nos gustaría que tu experiencia estuviera ligada a lo siguiente:

Experto en soluciones sobre plataforma AWS (EMR, Glue, S3, Redshift, Athena, etc) o Azure.
Al menos 3-4 años de experiencia en desarrollo de software en proyectos de datos.
Experiencia en haber participado en proyectos complejos.
Experiencia en la conceptualización, diseño e implementación de arquitecturas de datos.
Conocimiento contrastado de Java, Python, Scala o Spark, Databricks.
Conocimientos avanzados de Base de Datos (relacionales, NoSql,…)
Conocimiento de integración continua y DevOps (Jenkins, GitLab,..) y IaC (Terraform)
Experiencia en metodologías ágiles.
Pasión por el trabajo en equipo.
 ¿Qué vas a hacer?

Gestión de cliente y networking interno y externo.
Gestión de proyectos complejos y liderazgo de equipos multidisciplinares.
Responsabilidad en la toma de requerimientos del cliente.
Liderar proyectos de desarrollo complejos garantizando la calidad de las entregas, y haciendo que el equipo crezca en todos los ámbitos.
Trabajar con un equipo humano y técnico sobresaliente.

Participarás en el desarrollo de aplicaciones de datos sobre arquitecturas cloud, trabajarás en aportar soluciones tanto streaming, como batch, dentro de equipos agile multidisciplinares, conceptualizando la solución, definiendo y aplicando la metodología de uso de la tecnología.
Trabajamos en entornos smart working, flexible, con máxima conciliación, oficinas nuevas y equipos horizontales. En everis abunda la buena gente y buen ambiente, donde se rema en la misma dirección para que todas las personas desarrollen su carrera profesional, con revisión anual y feedback continuo. Además, contarás en un mentor que te ayudará en cada paso y/o decisión que tomes.

En everis creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad. #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Si quieres conocernos, no dudes en apuntarte.

Sector: Equipos informáticos Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.

To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture

Check out all of our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us

This is a customer facing role, owning the overall technical relationship between the customer and Microsoft Azure Infrastructure and Applications Development Platform. You will own the Cloud Infrastructure and Azure Applications Development technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots.

The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture discussions with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers.

#CustomerSuccess

Responsibilities

Understand customers' overall applications portfolio, IT and business priorities and success measures to design implementation architectures and solutions (Microsoft and 3rd party solutions) using PaaS, DevOps & Advanced Application coding
Apply technical knowledge and customer insights to create a modernization roadmap. Architect solutions to meet business and IT needs, ensuring technical viability of new projects and successful deployments, while orchestrating key resources and infusing key Infrastructure technologies (e.g. Windows and Linux IaaS, Security, Networking, etc.), and Application Development and DevOps technologies (e.g. App Service, containers, serverless, cloud native, etc.) as appropriate
Ensure all solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment
Develop deep relationships with key customer IT decision makers, who drive long-term cloud adoption within their company to enable them to be cloud advocates
Be the Voice of the Customer; Share insights and best practices, and connect with Engineering teams to remove key blockers
Assess the Customers' knowledge of Azure platform and overall cloud readiness to support customers through a structured learning plan and ensure its delivery through partners
Collaborate with other Cloud Solution Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform
Maintain technical skills and knowledge of market trends and competitive insights; collaborate and share with the technical community
Be an Azure Platform evangelist with customers, partners and external communities

Qualifications

Professional Experience -5+ years of success in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications required
Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with senior IT executives in large or highly strategic accounts. Experience in managing various stakeholder relationships to get consensus on solution/projects. required
Problem Solving. Ability to solve customer problems through cloud technologies required
Collaboration and Communication. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams, ensuring successful implementation of customer projects. Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences (Senior Executives, IT management, Database administrators and Data Scientist) required
Technical
Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management required
Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios in enterprise-wide environments (including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud) required
Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following:
Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions (i.e. Windows and Linux IaaS, SAP, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, OSS, containers and Infra as a code technologies) required
Cloud application development solutions (e.g. PaaS, Serverless, API Management);
Container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry);
Continuous integration technologies (e.g. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure for DevOps, Chef, Puppet);
Web application server technologies, cloud application design, software architecture and practices; (design/development/deployment, Agile, SCRUM, ALM)
one or more of the following programming languages: C++, C#, Java, Node.js, JSON, PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby on Rails, Pig/Hive
Experience using integrated development environments (e.g. Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Eclipse, XCode, WebSphere) targeting Android, iOS, Linux, Windows, public clouds (i.e. Azure, AWS) required
Experience with scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management, serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry etc.), API management, microservice frameworks etc.
Software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure DevOps, GitHub). preferred
Competitive Landscape. Knowledge of cloud development platforms preferred
Partners. Understanding of partner ecosystems and the ability to leverage partner solutions to solve customer needs preferred

Buscamos un perfil de Data Scientist con experienca en negocio

About Our Client

Nuestro cliente es un laboratorio lider en su sector con más de 1.000 empleados en España.

Job Description

Sus principales funciones incluyen:
Observar y analizar el comportamiento del negocio actual y futuro en las regiones donde la Compañía está presente
Participar en proyectos comerciales y estratégicos de la compañía relacionados con la expansión internacional
Detectar best practices de otros competidores a nivel global y establecer acciones

Asegurar la toma de decisiones acorde a la estrategia de la compañía
Asegurar el buen uso del dato dentro del departamento
Asegurar la cultura de análisis y colaboración dentro de los equipos comerciales

The Successful Applicant

Se valorará la experiencia previa (mínimo 3 años) en puestos similares.

Puesto ofertado: EXPERIENCED POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCHER ASSOCIATED WITH SYNERGY GRANT TOMATTO RESEARCH PROJECT
Sector: Enseñanza superior Investigación Biotecnología
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
DUTIES
Development and implementation of new computational codes to study attosecond dynamics in molecules.
Computer simulation of the first steps of charge transfer in donor-acceptor systems in collaboration with the experimental groups involved in the project.
Description of the coupled electron-nuclear dynamics in these systems.

Benefits
Envisaged duration of 4 years, full-time.
The work will be carried out preferably from 1 May 2021 onwards.
Gross salary: 32.000 euros/year (estimated cost for the project 43.484 euros/year).

Selection process
Applications should be sent electronically to click apply .
The subject of the mail should start with the Ref. followed by your family name and name:
(ie. subject: Ref. TOMATTO Smith John).
One compressed file (in PDF format) including the following documents:
Motivation letter (max. 1 page),
Short curriculum vitae (max. 2 pages including the 5 most relevant papers and invited talks as well as the prizes or other major achievements, etc.)
Letters of reference may be requested during the evaluation process.
Shortlisted candidates will be called for a personal interview.

Offer Requirements
REQUIRED LANGUAGES

ENGLISH: Good

Skills/Qualifications
PhD in Physics or Theoretical Chemistry, with a specialisation in methodological development or computational simulation.
Postdoctoral research experience of at least two years in computational simulation methods for processes occurring in the attosecond range.
Knowledge of numerical methods, computer programming (Fortran, C, Matlab, Python, or other related), and programming and optimisation techniques for HPC.
Advanced English level. Strong communication skills.

Descripción:
Shift Technology is reinventing insurance claims automation and fraud detection with AI. We help insurers fully automate more claims, deliver a great customer experience while protecting against risk, and accurately identify suspected claims fraud, making investigative teams more effective and reducing fraud losses.

Since our launch in 2014 in Paris, we've raised over $100M with Tier 1 investors, opened offices in Boston, Tokyo, Singapore, London, Madrid, Mexico, and Sao Paulo, currently work with more than 80 insurers globally. If you are excited about joining a fast-growing insurtech innovator with a passion for excellence and global culture, Shift is the place for you.

YOUR ROLE

As a Pre-sales Consultant, you will partner with various internal and external teams to present overall business-driven technology solutions to prospective and existing clients. Your technical expertise and communication skills will allow you to align and leverage resources to optimize our sales cycles.

Your Responsibilities
Analyze technical and business data to determine the ideal customer for a given product before its launch
Conduct discovery sessions directly with prospective and existing clients to gather business and technology requirements
Enable Sales and Account Management teams' operational success by crafting pitches, as well as designing and presenting demos to decision-makers.
Respond to technical questions received via RFPs and/or RFIs in an accurate and timely fashion.
Assist in the creation of account configuration documentation and statements of work.
Collaborate with Shift's internal teams to develop the overall solution: Product, Engineering and Data Scientist
Participate in strategy meetings with Marketing teams and Product teams
Successfully manage multiple prospect sales and existing client engagement opportunities simultaneously


You've Got What It Takes If You
Have Insurance, fraud, and claims experience
Have strong experience in a client-facing role
Have experience in full-cycle software implementation projects, ideally in SaaS.
Have excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills, and capable of interacting with people from different levels and cultural backgrounds
Can coordinate with the delivery and engineering teams all the delivery activities and act as an escalation point for all development issues specific to the project
Are able to work independently with general supervision


Required Skills
Native Spanish Speaker, and fluency in English
Minimum 3 years of pre-sales experience, preferably in FSI vertical
Computer Engineering degree or equivalent
Familiar with C#, Javascript, Less, Visual Studio Code


EEO Statement

At Shift we thrive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We hire and trust people without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria. Shift is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Descripción:
It takes the brightest minds to be a technology leader. It takes imagination to create green energy for the generations to come. At Siemens Gamesa we make real what matters, join our global team.

Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join us in creating a better future for our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.

The Digital Venture Lab is where all our SGRE functions run alongside to support and to drive our common efforts and initiatives, fueling SGRE's digital transformation. We focus on our people and business opportunities, driving a digital strategy that creates a true advantage leading us into the future of digital offerings and optimized operating models. The Digital Ventures Lab provides access to a unique ecosystem of digital natives, data sciences, developers, universities, startups, and other corporates & partners to accelerate the digital transformation of Siemens Gamesa.

How To Contribute To Our Vision

Successful candidates will have a demonstrable track record of being a self-starter and achieving their goals in the face of challenges, with a desire to enhance and improve the organization that you work for, and a passion for understanding how change initiatives can utilize bi-directional information exchange channels to target users and enhance their technology adoption, utilization and proficiency.

Skills
Experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.- Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
What You Need To Make a Difference
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets. Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role- Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.- Experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka, etc.- Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Cassandra.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experience with AWS and/or Azure cloud services - Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.- Experience with Reporting Tools like Power BI, Tableau etc.- Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Preferred Interpersonal Skills
Good verbal and written communication skill
Team Player experienced working in agile environments
Problem solving and decision-making – working with others to identify, define and solve problems, which includes making decisions about the best course of action
Strong conceptual strength, strategic thinking, problem solving, technical, and analytical skills.
Ability to ask next level questions anticipating business inquiries and performing root cause analysis
Education

Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.

In return of your commitment we offer you...

Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come.

We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality.

We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsidized lunch, employee discounts and much more

Empowering our people

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future?

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other Information

If you have specific questions about the position or regarding the recruitment process, please send the recruiting team an email via Shoaib.khan@siemensgamesa.com. Please mention the Job ID in the email.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation.

This wealth of diversity is what makes Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy more innovative, creative, sensitive and committed to society. Our diversity is what makes us who we are, and we are immensely proud of that.

Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy believes that we all have the right to be treated with dignity and respect in the workplace regardless of our race, nationality, ethnicity, religion, beliefs, sex, sexual orientation, gender, circumstances of pregnancy or parental leave, age, disability or marital status.

We seek to promote respect for the law, equality and inclusion for our employees in order to ensure that there is no discrimination by reason of race, gender, marital status, ideology, political opinions, nationality, religion or any other personal, physical or social condition.

Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy offers a truly flexible and inspiring place to work, with a global presence and a commitment to providing a working environment in which every employee can develop their potential and maximize their contribution.

Descripción:
Data Analyst/Scientist - SGT (

Número De Puesto

2100000K )

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US

At Santander, you can be part of one of the largest transformations the World is experiencing in the past several decades. We are transforming our Technology function, with 500+ new hires planned for this 2020. And we are changing how we work and how we design and develop products and services globally.

This change is only possible with people like you, who will help us to raise the bar. We aim to bring technologists, passionate professionals who live and breathe technology, who will be constantly seeking different ways of doing things, learn a new language every year, keep old computer parts and reuse them in strange projects around the house, continually tinker with electronic gadgets of all sorts, and be considered the geekiest person around by all their friends and family. That might be a bit of exaggeration, but you get the idea of what we are looking for.

And on top of a meaningful job, we care about you. At Santander, this means creating a workplace that respects your individuality and supports you to enjoy life outside work. You will enjoy flexible working conditions, a global well-being program, BeHealthy, and will be entitled to spend a certain number of hours each month volunteering.

What You Will Be Doing

We are looking for a person with solid technical and statistical background and able to understand cybersecurity concepts and develop detection algorithms.

As a Data Analyst/Scientist, you will be responsible for clean, prepare and manipulate the data, build and train the analytic models, test and improve the resulting data. It is necessary to have basic knowledge of different big data tools for data management and data bases as well as good programming skills .

We need somebody like you to help us in different fronts:

Some experience on Data Modelling (from row data to structured data). Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization). Use of programming tools to transform, clean and store data in different formats. Analytic models: proven knowledge and experience on classical models (classification, regression, time series, clustering, etc.) Experience on data ingestion processes and transformation scripts will be considered an interesting added value Development of services enabling users to access and consume data

Cybersecurity

Basic security concepts (OS, Networking, User Authentication, Firewalls, etc.) WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Experience & Education

Technical Upper Grade Educational Cycle 2+ years on Data Modelling and Data Preparation (Cleansing and Standardization) SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Required

Big Data: some experience working with: HDFS and Spark (desirable Kafka, Hive) SQL and No SQL databases General knowledge of Public Cloud Services (knowledge of AWS/Azure services) Programming Languages: comfortable with Java and Python (optionally Scala, R) High level of English.

What We Offer You

Flexiworking: we have more than 10 flexibility measures to facilitate the balance between professional and personal life, such as flexible entry/exit time or telecommuting. Daily lunch grant: you can have your meal at the restaurants of Santander Group City or use the take out option. You will be part of “Familia Santander”: with special financing conditions in mortgages and other financial products. Access to “Santander Contigo” program: to help you and your family when you need it giving support on different issues such as legal and emotional advice or management, up to a 24-hour personal assistant. Flexible Benefits Plan: you can advantageously obtain different benefits such as health insurance, kindergarten, training courses/masters or the Public Transport Card of Madrid. Prime office space, with on premise gym, hairdresser, convenience store and many other amenities. Multiple discounts for e-commerce, trips or restaurants with Santander Benefits platform. Life insurance Parking , which includes places for bicycles and electric cars. Equality Plan And more important: a team proud of diversity and concerned about sustainability. ABOUT US

We are the Technology and Operations team for Santander Group. We are convinced of the importance of technology that is aligned with the requirements of the business and that our work not only brings value to users, people and communities but also fosters individual creativity. Our team of over 2,000 people in 7 countries (Spain, Portugal, UK, USA, Mexico, Chile and Brazil) develops and/or implements financial solutions across a broad spectrum of technologies (including Blockchain, Big Data and Angular among others) on all kinds of onpremise and cloud-based platforms

These Are The Key Factors That Multiply The Actions Of All Our Employees

At Santander you will enjoy #TheSantanderEffect. Here, with only a small action or a simple idea, you can do great things. We offer you the advantages and the means to contribute to the progress of more than 140 million people around the world.

Meaningful Impact - Where the effect of your work makes a difference and helps people to prosper Personal and Professional Growth - The chance to develop through world-class training, challenging work, and different roles Respect - Be part of an organization that cares – about its people, its wider community, and the environment Co-worker quality - Work with inspiring professionals who are leaders in their field

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Petróleo y energía Servicios financieros
Descripción:
DNV GL Energy Systems division is seeking a Junior Wind Energy Data Analyst to join our Project Development and Analytics team in Spain . This role is to enhance capabilities and increase resources of the Project Development and Analytics (PD&A) team , which is responsible to support developers from the prospection phase, development, and operation. Energy production assessments, both pre construction and operational, are the main service we provide to developers, investors, operators or lenders.

Key tasks:
Analyzing wind and other climatic data
Analyzing SCADA data and alarms
Monitor performance issues of a wind farm
Predicting wind farm energy production
Writing technical reports and communicating results to clients
Collaborating on the preparation of service proposals and follow up with clients as required
Collaborating and briefing with colleagues worldwide on technical topics.

Position Qualifications
Degree in a relevant Engineering or Atmospheric Science, Physics or Mathematics field
Fluency in Spanish and English (written and verbal).
Technical competencies:
Aptitude in the statistical analysis of data including relevant tools and software
Strong mathematics, analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency with MS Office Word/Excel/Access
Ability to use Excel spreadsheets and macros efficiently for analyses and reporting
Strong overall computer skills and ability to learn multiple software tools
Programming in R or Python languages is highly valued
SQL and Relational Data Bases knowledge is highly valued
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark and Azure Cloud platform is valued
Knowledge of GIS, mapping tools and map formats is valued.
Optionally:
Experience in performing pre and post construction energy production assessments
Experience with SCADA data analysis.
Personal characteristics:
Customer centricity, putting the client in the center of everything we do
Commercial focus, finding application to any technical purpose
Digital mindset
Detail-oriented and passionate for efficiency and innovation
Ability to meet goals and milestones according to company specifications
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously to a tight budget and schedule.
We offer:
Medical Scheme
Commuting Allowance
Meal Ticket or Meal allowance
Life Insurance
Pension Plan
Kindergarten Allowance
40 Hours per week with Flexible Schedule.

Company & Business Area Description

DNV GL Energy Systems delivers world-renowned advisory services to the energy value chain including renewables and energy management. Our expertise spans onshore and offshore wind power, solar, conventional generation, transmission and distribution, smart grids, and sustainable energy use, as well as energy markets and regulations. Our experts support customers around the globe in delivering a safe, reliable, efficient, and sustainable energy supply.

Equal Opportunity Statement

DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Recursos humanos
Descripción:
Seleccionamos científico/a de datos para formar parte de un importante proyecto de Bussiness Intelligence de la compañía. La persona seleccionada formará parte de un equipo avanzado de trabajo encargado de un Servicio de analítica de datos para un segmento comercial de una operadora telco.

Funciones
Análisis, diseño y construcción de estudios adhoc y su posterior transformación a informes recurrentes tanto en Excel como en PowerBI, automatizado en ocasiones con Python.

Requisitos Imprescindibles
SQL: Conocimiento con experiencia demostrada - Independiente del RGDB - (Puede ser con cualquier base de datos relacional: Access, Mysql, Postgre, Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, sybase...)
EXCEL experto: Capacidad para realizar: pivot tables, recuperar datos de diversos orígenes, gráficos (estáticos y dinámicos)

Requisitos Valorables
Conocimiento y con experiencia en algún lenguaje de programación (aparte de pl-sql o sql scripting que damos por hecho por el punto anterior). Tener experiencia programando en cualquier lenguaje habilita para el aprendizaje rápido de cualquier otro. (VB, java, python, php, perl...).

Requisitos Muy Valorables
Experiencia en tareas sencillas de automatizaciones (scripts en python, powershell, shell scripting, perl, MS-DOS...), planificación de tareas, flujos de ETL.
Valorable experiencia en: BO (SAP Business Object) - Teradata - consultas de usuario.

Competencias Personales Requeridas
Capacidad analítica, para realizar ejecuciones periódicas con detalle para detectar errores, irregularidades e incidencias, sin olvidar nada. Persona orientada al trabajo en equipo y con buenas habilidades comunicativas para interrelación con cliente.
Qué te podemos ofrecer?
Puesto estable en una empresa consolidada en el mercado con más de 37 años de experiencia, responsable y comprometida con nuestros empleados/as, en el que las personas constituyen el primer valor de la compañía.
Participación en interesantes proyectos tecnológicos para clientes de primer nivel, que te permitirá desarrollar una carrera profesional acorde a tu posición.
Beneficiarte de un plan de formación que abarca tanto el área técnica como el desarrollo de habilidades y de idiomas.
Proyecto estable de sector de telecomunicaciones y de gran alcance que nos permite definir tu puesto de trabajo a la medida.
¡Si estás interesado en formar parte del #InycomTeam no dudes en apuntarte a esta oferta de empleo!

Y no olvides visitar nuestro perfil de twitter, @empleoinycom , para estar al tanto de nuestras ofertas de empleo y novedades, así como de formación, noticias y curiosidades...

Puesto ofertado: Power BI Data scientist & analytics (100% remoto)
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestra familia!

UST se preocupa por la seguridad de sus empleados y, ahora más que nunca dada la nueva situación, hemos reforzado nuestras operaciones. UST ofrece teletrabajo a los empleados y también otras modalidades de conciliación con las que podrás acumular suficiente tiempo para equilibrar tu vida personal y laboral. UST además, cree fuertemente en la Diversidad y la Inclusión como la forma de mejorar su fuerza de trabajo operacional, por lo que si tienes Certificado de Discapacidad, esta es tu empresa!

Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer con más de 20.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 25 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías a través de proyectos end-to-end, consultoría y soluciones propias.

¿Qué buscamos?
¿Qué buscamos?
Para nuestra área de SMART Data estamos buscando incrementar nuestro equipo del área de proyectos internacionales con un perfil de Data Scientist con un alto grado de experiencia con PowerBI. Imprescindible nivel alto de inglés, ya que se trabajará en un entorno internacional y se utilizará este idioma a diario.

Requisitos:
- Perfil senior con experiencia en PowerBI desktop, Power BI Report Builder, DAX Studio
- Conocimientos de Snowflake, SQL Server
- Nivel de inglés fluido (cliente internacional, necesidad de comunicación oral y escrita a diario)
- Capacidad analítica. Dada un especificación sea capaz de diseñar e implementar la solución, persona autónoma


Deseable y valorable: Poseer Certificado de discapacidad, en grado igual o superior al 33%

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación para que tengas acceso a un amplio catálogo multidisciplinar.
Estabilidad y carrera profesional dentro de nuestro Centro de Excelencia donde podrás participar dando cobertura a varios proyectos de la compañía.
Entorno internacional y contacto directo con compañeros referentes en las tecnologías core de la compañía, con los que podrás compartir conocimientos.
Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas del que podrás beneficiarte al referenciar profesionales que se incorporen a la compañía.

Y además...
23 días laborables de vacaciones y jornada intensiva en verano.
Salario competitivo y beneficios sociales (tarjeta restaurante y seguro de accidentes).
Programa de Retribución Flexible para que puedas adaptar tu retribución según tus intereses (cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online con profesores nativos, seguro médico…).
Horario flexible y teletrabajo por proyecto, actualmente por la situación actual se ofrece jornada completa con teletrabajo y otras medidas de conciliación.
Tarifa plana con los gimnasios que tú elijas, cerca de tu domicilio o de las oficinas.
Fruta en la oficina.
Te damos vacaciones los días de Nochebuena y Nochevieja.

Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición, ¡te estamos esperando!

Design your lifestyle as a top freelance data engineer, with the freedom to work however, wherever, on your terms.

Freelance work is defining the careers of today's data engineers in exciting new ways. If you're passionate about working flexibly with leading Fortune 500 brands and innovative Silicon Valley startups, Toptal could be a great fit for your next career shift.

Toptal is an elite talent network for the world's top 3% of developers, connecting the best and brightest freelancers with top organizations. Unlike a 9-to-5 job, you'll choose your own schedule and work from anywhere. Jobs come to you, so you won't bid for projects against other data engineers in a race to the bottom. Plus, Toptal takes care of all the overhead, empowering you to focus on successful engagements while getting paid on time, at the rate you decide, every time.

As a freelance data engineer, you could join an ever-expanding community of experts in over 120 countries, working remotely on the projects that meet your career ambitions.

That's why the world's top 3% of developers choose Toptal. Data Engineers in our elite network share:
At least 3 years of professional experience in Data Engineering
Project management skills
A keen attention to detail
Full-time availability is a strong advantage

Descripción:
DxD Applications & IT Solutions , línea de negocio de consultoría tecnológica de Deloitte, busca Senior Data Engineers con experiencia en Apache Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Hive... para incorporarse a nuestro equipo de Big Data dentro de nuestro porfolio de Analytics & Cognitive tanto para las oficinas de Aragon (Huesca y Zaragoza) como de Sevilla. Participaras en proyectos nacionales e internacionales formando parte de un gran equipo de trabajo multidisciplinar.

Sí… eres un apasionado/a de la tecnología y no te da miedo enfrentarte a nuevos retos, te gusta aprender y experimentar con lo último en tecnología y eres capaz de definir soluciones completas con grandes volúmenes de datos, y si además ya has trabajado con alguna de las cloud más potentes del mercado como son Azure y AWS este es tu sitio.

Perfil:

Experiencia Profesional de al menos 3 años en proyectos de Big Data.
Stack Tecnológico Big Data: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Impala, Kafka, Sqoop, Cassandra, Cloudera, Informatica BDM, Impala, Python, Flask, BBDD NoSQL…
Stack Tecnológico Cloud:
Azure: Azure SQL Database, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure HDInsight y Power BI.
AWS: Amazon Athena, AWS Glue, Amazon S3, Amazon Aurora, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon EMR, Lambda functions, Amazon Elasticsearch Service, Amazon Redshift y Quicksight.
Formacion: Licenciatura o Grado (Ingenierías), Modulo Superior o titulaciones técnicas similares.
Buen nivel de inglés.
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y de espíritu de equipo.

Con nosotros….

Formaras parte de un grupo de expertos internacionales con amplio conocimiento en el mundo Big Data, donde nunca dejaras de aprender y tendrás la posibilidad de formar.
Contaras con un plan de carrera personalizado que te permitirá seguir desarrollando tu potencial y especializarte.
Cada año podrás seguir progresando gracias a la revisión anual de tu categoría profesional y salario en función de tu desempeño.
Tendrás participación en la implementación de herramientas y buenas practicas de desarrollo en proyectos que apuestan por tecnologías punteras.
Explotaras tu potencial gracias al plan de formación continua adaptado a tus necesidades e inquietudes tanto a nivel técnico como de habilidades de idiomas.
Posibilidad de certificarte en las últimas tecnologías Big Data (Cloudera, Azure, AWS, GCP…)
Tendrás la oportunidad de formar parte de un equipo joven, dinámico y con un excelente ambiente de trabajo. Organizamos eventos a lo largo del año donde podrás conocer compañeros/as y ampliar tu red social!
Por otro lado, dispondrás de un plan de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant/guardería/Transporte, descuentos, promociones especiales para empelados y uno de los mejores seguros médicos del mercado, talleres de responsabilidad social…Y si te interesa mejorar tu inglés, ¡podrás asistir a clases de forma gratuita!

Si te sientes identificado/a con algunos de los anteriores puntos estaremos encantados de conocerte y hacer hueco para ti entre nosotros.

Somos una empresa con una plantilla joven, proyectos punteros y con ganas de hacer cosas nuevas, ¿te puntas?

¡No lo dudes, ven a Deloitte! What impact will you make?

On behalf of Perfect Channel, we are looking for an Agile Business Analyst to join our Malaga team on a full-time basis.

Responsibilities:
We’re a growing organisation and we ask everyone to roll their sleeves up and get on with what needs
doing, regardless of their role. However, in general, you will be:
Assisting the Product Owner to ensure epics, features and user stories are clearly communicated and can be estimated and worked on by development teams
Collaborating with development teams to further refine user stories and acceptance criteria,
including identifying technical, unspoken and non-functional requirements
Gathering and generating insights to advocate data-driven recommendations
Signing off on working software and demonstrating it to internal & external clients and
stakeholders
Providing business analysis support to the Product Owner, business sponsors, SMEs and testers
Discovering the root cause(s) of pain points and turning problem areas into business opportunities
Use proven tools and techniques such as Impact Maps, Story Maps, user process flows, Kano and
MoSCoW methods, to develop, document and prioritise epic and feature requirements
Mapping, analysing and validating information flows and user journeys within our platforms and
software
Facilitating workshops with a wide range of attendees at all levels of seniority
Questioning everything, the delivery of business value, in line with business’ needs and “big picture” goals
Sharing knowledge and expertise across teams

Requirements:
We know that the role of Business Analyst can differ across organisations but we expect you to be able to articulate how you’ve done these things at previous organisations.
You can demonstrate experience of working with Agile engineering teams to successfully deliver
software
Have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your ideas; from both a technical and a business point of view
Have a strong focus on high-quality customer experience with both the client and their customer
Can demonstrate outstanding analytical ability and demonstrable experience of solving complex problems and issues
Proven experience of the ability to manage and resolve conflict with stakeholders
Experience in driving continuous improvement and innovation within and across teams
4+ years’ experience in similar role with demonstrable experience in product management or business analysis
Educated to degree level or equivalent work experience
Professional certification in business analysis, agile methodologies or project management (e.g. IIBA, CSPO, Prince2)
Experience with Digital eCommerce projects and luxury brands

What's in it for you?
Job opportunity where you can apply your skills and grow professionally in an incredible team
Variety of knowledge sharing and training opportunities within a successful growing company
Unique working environment, with cool and nicely located offices, with warm atmosphere which creates positive working conditions
Competitive salary
Long-term employment with 23 working days paid vacation and other social benefits

Sector: Subcontrataciones/Offshoring
Funciones laborales: Análisis Recursos humanos Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
Transcom Worldwide is one of the leading global customer experience companies, supplying local and global clients in multiple markets. With our global footprint and forward-leaning customer experience solutions, we serve our clients via different channels like voice, chat, social media, etc.

An exciting opportunity with this dynamic and fast-growing business awaits the right candidate in the role of Global Reporting Analyst for Business Intelligence and Talent Acquisition/HR department. This role is waiting for someone who is passionate about the data, but also about working in an international busy and dynamic environment and who has the drive to get things done - accurately and precisely!

As our Reporting Analyst, you are responsible for supporting the Global BI and TA/HR Teams in reaching performance targets and constantly improving the Transcom way of recruiting by providing sufficient, broad, and insightful analyses. Sharing and using your knowledge of systems, data presentation methods, insights on results, comparative analyzes in different countries.
 The position will be proactive by developing the TA and HR reporting strategy and setting up accurate measurement matrixes. What we are looking for is someone with a deep knowledge of Talent Acquisition software and BI reporting tools and or dashboards that support management in executing their business decisions with a high amount of precision and consistency. Not only proficiency in data analysis, but also the ease of learning new systems (ATS, etc.), and highly developed communication skills enabling professional presentation of the data and having the ability to cooperate with stakeholders from various levels and positions within the organization are critical components for this role.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Data analytics for Talent Acquisition dashboards and Looker (business intelligence tool),
Develop reporting for executives - data analytics progress + ad hoc reporting,
Proactively measuring, tracking, analyzing, and reporting with actual and historical data, ability to imagine the financial impact on an organization based on delivered data,
SME Recruiting reporting portal focusing on data quality + on-time delivery,
Data gathering and consolidating,
Participating in the ATS selection by covering the data availability/accuracy dimension,
Creates and maintains Daily, Weekly, and Monthly Sourcing and Recruitment reporting, trackers/templates,
Created and maintains TA Dashboards,
Maintains daily Sourcing and Recruitment productivity report, hourly report,
Working hand in hand with HR analytics in analyzing operational figures.

Analysis

In-depth analysis specific to Talent Acquisition,
Examine and questions the contents of the report, and confirms the accuracy of the reports, interprets and provides a summary,
Recommend strategic analysis needed to achieve department and company goals.

Process Improvement

To guide and support the development and deployment of the agreed People – Process – Technology long-term strategy rollout,
Support Recruitment Process Leads to process improvements and implementation.
Suggest proactively on Reporting improvement areas which include automation,
Support the business in terms of disputes on reporting,
Always meet or exceed commitments when engaged in existing and/or new projects,
Identify value-added opportunities to increase client revenues and work with marketing in their implementation.

Job Requirements:

3-5 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position,
At least 2 year(s) of experience with HR Analytical Systems - good to have,
 Bachelor's/University Degree, Others or equivalent.
Experience with Dashboard and metric reporting tools such as Looker (preferred), Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or Domo.
Knowledge of Talent Acquisition systems (ATS), KPIs, and metrics.
MS SQL Server Reporting Services and/or MS SQL Server Analysis Services,
High organization skills and attention to details, being customer-oriented and responsive,
Requires excellent communication skills both written and oral and knows how to create a common ground for your plans with your stakeholders at all levels within the organization,
Presentation skills with the ability to create presentations in PowerPoint,
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, strong process management orientation, systems thinking, and problem-solving capability.
Experience in the BPO industry is a plus

Does it sound interesting? We’re waiting for your resume!

Descripción:
Description

On behalf of Perfect Channel, we are looking for an Agile Business Analyst to join our Malaga team on a full-time basis.

Working within Perfect Channel, a company that delivers marketplace technology to enterprise size customers for commodity, financial, predominately B2B environments. It counts amongst its customers Christie’s, CarNext, Lloyd’s of London, and other worldwide-recognized brands. If you are passionate about creating great software and want to work somewhere, which favours a pragmatic focus on being effective and doing things well, then Perfect Channel could be the place for you.

To be successful in this role you will need excellent communication skills and be able to build trusting relationships across internal and external stakeholders. You will be responsible for working with Product Owners and development teams to define and document solutions.

Responsibilities

We’re a growing organisation and we ask everyone to roll their sleeves up and get on with what needs
doing, regardless of their role. However, in general, you will be:
Assisting the Product Owner to ensure epics, features and user stories are clearly communicated and can be estimated and worked on by development teams
Collaborating with development teams to further refine user stories and acceptance criteria,
including identifying technical, unspoken and non-functional requirements
Gathering and generating insights to advocate data-driven recommendations
Signing off on working software and demonstrating it to internal & external clients and
stakeholders
Providing business analysis support to the Product Owner, business sponsors, SMEs and testers
Discovering the root cause(s) of pain points and turning problem areas into business opportunities
Use proven tools and techniques such as Impact Maps, Story Maps, user process flows, Kano and
MoSCoW methods, to develop, document and prioritise epic and feature requirements
Mapping, analysing and validating information flows and user journeys within our platforms and
software
Facilitating workshops with a wide range of attendees at all levels of seniority
Questioning everything, the delivery of business value, in line with business’ needs and “big picture” goals
Sharing knowledge and expertise across teams


Requirements

We know that the role of Business Analyst can differ across organisations but we expect you to be able to articulate how you’ve done these things at previous organisations.
You can demonstrate experience of working with Agile engineering teams to successfully deliver
software
Have excellent communication skills and are able to clearly articulate your ideas; from both a technical and a business point of view
Have a strong focus on high-quality customer experience with both the client and their customer
Can demonstrate outstanding analytical ability and demonstrable experience of solving complex problems and issues
Proven experience of the ability to manage and resolve conflict with stakeholders
Experience in driving continuous improvement and innovation within and across teams
4+ years’ experience in similar role with demonstrable experience in product management or business analysis
Educated to degree level or equivalent work experience
Professional certification in business analysis, agile methodologies or project management (e.g. IIBA, CSPO, Prince2)
Experience with Digital eCommerce projects and luxury brands


What's In It For You
Job opportunity where you can apply your skills and grow professionally in an incredible team
Variety of knowledge sharing and training opportunities within a successful growing company
Unique working environment, with cool and nicely located offices, with warm atmosphere which creates positive working conditions
Competitive salary
Long-term employment with 23 working days paid vacation and other social benefits

Puesto ofertado: Generalist Business Analyst - IT Services Group
Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Who We Are

The Workshop is a tech company that develops intuitive software for the online gaming industry. Our motto is to move “Fearlessly Forward” together. Cooperative innovation is at the center of everything we do – from our games, new products and technologies, to how we collaborate and share inspiration with one another.

What We Believe

We understand that great ideas come from great people, and great people thrive when they’re trusted to challenge, change, improve, and perfect our products and processes. Our forte lies in the diversity of our skills – and that comes from the diversity of our people.

Our commitment to you

The Workshop is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, where we all learn together, trust each other, and value collaboration. We welcome candidates of all genders, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, age, nationality, belief (or lack thereof), and programming language preference. As an equal opportunity employer, we offer a friendly, supportive working environment for all. It’s a place where you can try new ideas, take risks, and enjoy the support to move Fearlessly Forward.

Your mission

The Generalist Business Analyst will be part of the ITSG Product group and will be key in guaranteeing cohesive and updated products, services, and processes at the ITSG team level. She/he will need to work with several different areas at the ITSG level providing BA assistance in processes and services documentation. We need a team-player with excellent interpersonal skills, structured, organized, oriented to objectives, and able to work with autonomy and propose solutions to problems.

What you’ll do
Collecting, classifying, and documenting information regarding company services and systems.
Generating Standard Operational Procedures.
Act as a trusted advisor for ITSG teams for documenting their processes and requirements
Supporting, coordinating, and tracking changes.
Policies definition
Interaction with Customers and management of their expectations
Reviewing the quality of the deliverables from a business point of view.

What you’ll bring
3+ years analyzing and documenting requirements for products and transformation projects
Experience coordinating analysis work using various documentation techniques to produce detailed specifications
3+ years experience in workflows analysis
Experience as a technical writer will be valuable
Familiar with Agile methodologies
Ability to work remotely with business and product stakeholders spread across different time zones.
Out of the box thinker with the ability to find solutions to problems and blockers.


What's In It For You
Challenging and fulfilling work at an innovative, global company that uses cutting-edge tech
Global work experience in an agile methodology
International, friendly and inclusive multi-cultural environment (over 35 nationalities that speak altogether almost 30 languages!)
Competitive salary and relocation packages for you and your family
Flexibility of working from home/office to stay both safe and collaborative
Flexible working hours, well-being programs, learning and growth opportunities
Team building events, learning labs, Hackathons/Designatons
Opportunity to shape the tech community inside and outside of The Workshop, mentoring and sharing knowledge with others
