Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Telecomunicaciones Software
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Juan García
CTO & CPO at Predictiva
Enviar mensaje InMail
Your mission
  Predictiva develops disruptive products based on Artificial Intelligence and Big data to transform Contact Centers, Fintech and Ecommerce industries.

Our candidate will be responsible for creating and managing the infrastructure of our data platform for our revolutionary product UPBE, which is our super detective that can tirelessly audit and interpret thousands of voice interactions between call center agents and customers.

The Data Engineer will work within our fantastic Data Science team and will collaborate with our Software and DevOps Engineers to help our company reach our goals through advanced analytics and machine learning by using text data and audio calls.

This role offers an excellent opportunity to work on the new leading edge software technologies in the market (Big Data, Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Automatic Speech Recognition) with a highly competent team in Málaga.

NOTE: This is a permanent position based in Málaga, Spain where we currently have a hybrid work model (office & remote). We have now an awesome brand new office in one of the best ecosystems in Málaga city (“The Green Ray”), super well connected by Metro, bus and car.
  Your activities
  Support data needs of multiple teams and internal/external products.
Optimize and even re-design our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. Build the infrastructure required for optimal ETL of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional and non-functional business requirements.
Deployment of machine learning models into production environment.
  Your key skills
  Good communicator, good documentation skills, team player.
Self-motivated, self-disciplined and result-oriented
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent customer service and team collaboration skills.
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or related field.
Upper intermediate English
2+ years of experience in a similar role
3+ years of experience with data scripting languages (e.g Python, R etc.)
Solid hands-on skills in sourcing, cleaning, manipulating, analysing, visualizing and modelling real data
Strong experience with Database design (SQL/noSQL) and BI tools (Tableau)
Excellent understanding of data science concepts with a successful track record of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Hands on with ETL tools
Good knowledge of Amazon and/or Google Cloud infrastructure.
Experience with Agile software development methodologies.
  Extra desirable skills
  Experience working in command-line Linux environments.
Elastic Search
Data pipelines (Kafka)
Experience with Docker. Kubernetes (K8S) would be a big plus

Sector: Software Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Company Description

ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.

Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.

But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.

It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.

At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fourth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.

Job Description

We are looking for a Python Data Engineer who will be responsible for writing, debuging, maintaining and testing our products (existing ones, new modules on existing applications or completely new products). Working with other stakeholders (senior developers, dev managers and technical leads, analysis, test, project management, product owners) to complete the work on the agreed timelines and with the required quality.

Main Responsibilities
Designs and build component-based applications in a web/internet delivery environment, alone or with other developers I or II.
Works on new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure.
Scopes, implements, tests and deploys new features and versions of core applications, databases and utilities.
Performs hands-on coding and assists in the design of solutions.
Raises issues during development cycle (running late, blockers, lack of analysis, etc.)
Prepares reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software when asked by his/her managers.
Provides documentation of user's requirements, development of user stories, and estimates when requested to do so.
Assists with providing third-level support to business users.
Helps with code reviews.
Writes design technical documents.
Mentors Software Developer Engineers I.
Participates actively in planning meetings, retrospectives, daily stand ups, and other meetings as part of the software development process.
Updates progress in our systems (i.e. move items to the right status, remaining effort, etc.).

Qualifications

We are ideally looking for an experienced Data Engineer with the following:
Bachelor’s degree preferred in Computer Science or other relevant field and demonstrable related experience.
Working knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle.
Expert in object-oriented programming concepts, unit & integration testing, data and relational databases, technical database design, web architecture and application servers.
Strong ability to document development including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications.
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies helpful.
Strong skills of design patterns.
Deep understanding about performance and scalability implications in the development process and experience with performance monitoring tools.
Ability to install complex software patches and upgrades.
Ability to review code written by others and provide feedback and recommendations to follow coding guideline.
Able to provide estimates.
Demonstrated ability to write technical documents including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications.
Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures.
Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology.
Be able to design considering operational costs.
Desire to lead a work stream coordinating a small team of developers.
Ability to do a risk analysis.
Independently productive being able to face most tasks on their own and understand when they need to ask for help.

Additional Information

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

Job Description & Summary

PwC, Firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio.

La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Analytics y Business Security Solutions.

En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics perfiles de Manager para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado.  

Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PwC en Málaga, Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo.


Perfil: con más de 6 de años de experiencia. Requisitos:

- Ingeniería Superior: Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas o similar.

- Experiencia en tratamiento de grandes volúmenes de datos, en entornos tradicionales o Big Data.

- Conocimiento en marcos ágiles / scrum y éxito comprobado trabajando en un entorno ágil.

- Conocimientos en Python.

- Experiencia en desarrollo de modelos analíticos, machine learning, data mining.

- Integración de sistemas.

- Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server...)

- Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua.

- Metodologías ágiles.

- Capacidad para gestionar equipos.

- Nivel alto de inglés

A career within Data and Analytics Technology services, will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations uncover enterprise insights and drive business results using smarter data analytics. We focus on a collection of organisational technology capabilities, including business intelligence, data management, and data assurance that help our clients drive innovation, growth, and change within their organisations in order to keep up with the changing nature of customers and technology. We make impactful decisions by mixing mind and machine to leverage data, understand and navigate risk, and help our clients gain a competitive edge.

Job Description & Summary

PwC, firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio.  La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Analytics y Business Security Solutions.

El equipo de Data Analytics cuenta con profesionales con más de 10 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de analítica avanzada y su aplicación a entornos productivos. También se cuenta con una plataforma propia de big data desarrollada con los componentes más actuales a nivel tecnológico que permite un rápido y eficiente desarrollo de modelos analíticos.

En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics profesionales con perfil de DevOps para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado.

Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PWC en Málaga. Este Hub es el Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics de PWC en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo.


Requisitos

Grado o Ingeniería en Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas, Física, Estadística

Formación (máster, postgrado) en Cloud computing o Big Data
4-6 años de experiencia en administración de plataformas cloud, preferiblemente con plataforma, aunque también valorable Amazon AWS, Google Cloud...)
Administración de sistemas: Preferiblemente Linux
Automatización de procesos
Scripting con Python, Powershell, Shell script, …
Integración de sistemas
Bases de datos, tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server…)
Herramientas de gestión de configuración e integración continua
Sistema de control de versiones Git.
Metodologías ágiles
Deseable conocimiento de tecnología Apache Spark y Hadoop
Nivel alto de inglés
Valorable certificaciónes: Architecting Microsoft Azure Solutions y/o Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions

Securitas Direct es el líder del mercado europeo en la protección y seguridad de personas para hogares y pequeños negocios, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes con un equipo de más de 18.000 empleados, presentes en 16 países de Europa y América Latina. En Verisure Securitas Direct hemos creado las innovaciones más disruptivas del mercado, las cuales se han convertido en estándar para la industria y el sector.

Nuestro ADN: Pasión, Compromiso, Innovación, Trabajo en Equipo, Confianza y Responsabilidad.

El puesto:

Reportando directamente al Manager del área de Business Intelligence dentro de Administración & Finanzas, tu misión como Analista de Datos BI será la ayuda al cliente interno a la mejora de toma de decisiones, ayudando a identificar el problema de negocio y desarrollando la solución más adecuada, a través de la analítica del dato.

Principales funciones

Automatización de Informes mediante la creacion de Dashboarding.
Estudios ad-hoc sobre el DWH Coorporativo para la ayuda de seguimientos de proyectos:
Análisis & Creación de KPIs de Negocio.
Prospección y análisis de nuevas variables.
Creación de Dashboard de seguimiento.
Entendimientos de procesos de Negocio, para una posterior creación de la lógica mediante un procedimiento en SQL y la obtención así de los KPis de seguimiento.

Requisitos de la posición

Titulación universitaria superior: Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar. 
Experiencia mínima de 2-3 años como consultor en proyectos de BI y Reporting, o en funciones similares que capaciten al candidato/a en el desarrollo de las funciones indicadas.
Dominio leguaje SQL y experiencia con BBDD (Oracle, Sybase, SQL Server,…).
Experiencia con herramientas de Reporting sobre todo Power BI o Business Objects.
Conocimientos de herramientas Open Source (Python, R,…) .
Herramientas Office: Excel, Access.
Clara Orientación al Cliente.
Persona proactiva, analítica y con buena capacidad de comunicación.
Requisitos valorables
Creación de Modelos Estadísticos de Optimización o de Segmentación.
Conocimiento en otras herramientas de reporting similares (Microstrategy, Qlik, Tableau,... ).

Sector: Servicio al consumidor
Descripción:
¿Eres de los que se basa en datos para tomar casi todas las decisiones del día a día? ¿Consideras que con datos la gestión de personas es mucho más eficiente?

Si para ti el proyecto perfecto incluye PERSONAS y DATOS... ¡QUEREMOS CONOCERTE!

Presente en 16 países de Europa y América Latina, Verisure Securitas Direct es la compañía multinacional líder del mercado en protección de hogares y pequeños negocios. Diseñamos nuestra propia tecnología y apostamos por la innovación constante para ofrecer productos y servicios de seguridad de alta calidad y fiabilidad.

Estamos buscando un/una HR Data & Reporting Analyst para incorporarse al equipo de People Analytics en Gestión de Personas.  Creemos firmemente que, usando correctamente los datos de nuestra organización, podemos tomar decisiones más acertadas y creativas, así como gestionar eficazmente el talento de nuestra Compañía.

Tu misión como HR Data & Reporting Analyst será ser responsable de los datos maestros de Recursos Humanos y de su organización, así como apoyar en la definición del governance y de los procesos de mantenimiento de estos, y ser capaz de analizar estos datos de empleados y candidatos para explicar, predecir y optimizar procesos de Recursos Humanos y ayudar a negocio en la toma de decisiones.

Entre tus principales funciones se encontrarán:

Reporting: Dashboard mensuales, análisis recurrentes y estudios puntuales en colaboración con otras áreas de Gestión de Personas, negocio y el área de planificación estratégica.
Analizar, interpretar y cruzar datos de RRHH con datos de negocio: diferencias de medias, correlaciones, regresiones lineales, series temporales, clustering, árboles de decisión, etc.
Generar y auditar bases de datos y reportes sobre datos de personas, para las diferentes áreas de negocio y también para los departamentos especialistas de Gestión de Personas: realizar cruces, extracciones, transformaciones y consolidaciones de datos.
Tratamiento y gestión del dato en la planificación de personal. Análisis y reporting de headcount y KPIs globales por área de negocio.
Actuar como garante de los datos y dar aviso a HRBPs y resto de equipos, cuando el mantenimiento sea incompleto, asegurando la calidad de los datos.
Comunicar y asesorar a la Dirección sobre los resultados de los análisis realizados: presentar las conclusiones obtenidas del estudio realizado y así adelantar tiempo en la toma de decisiones importantes que ayuden a la empresa en la consecución de objetivos de negocio.
Colaborar en la gestión de proyectos de HR Analytics con proveedores.
Si te gusta el trabajo en equipo, tienes una fuerte orientación al logro y la gestión y manejo de la información y te gusta exponer tus resultados ante diferentes colectivos... ¡Te queremos en nuestro equipo!

Requisitos:

Titulación universitaria.
2 años mínimos de experiencia en posiciones de reporting, data mining, analytics, o similares.
Experiencia en gestión de BBDD, extracción de KPI´s, reporting ad hoc a diferentes áreas y departamentos.
Dominio experto de Excel y Power BI.
Conocimiento de sistemas de gestión y ERP´S. Manejo de Workday, y conocimiento de Meta 4 muy valorables.
Nivel medio-alto de Inglés.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle, organización, planificación y priorización.
Capacidad de comunicación e influencia.
Capacidad de trabajo, colaboración y trabajo en equipo.
Inquietud, proactividad, constancia, rigurosidad y disciplina.

Sector: Seguridad e investigaciones
Descripción:
Para uno de nuestros clientes, Verisure Securitas Direct, líder del mercado europeo en monitorización con alarmas inteligentes, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes con un equipo de más de 13.000 empleados, operando en 16 países, 12 en Europa y 4 América Latina, estamos buscando un Data Scientist. La persona seleccionada formará parte de la práctica de Advanced Analytics del departamento de Customer Experience y se responsabilizará de desarrollar y productivizar analítica avanzada y algoritmos Machine Learning / Deep Learning que ayuden a la toma de decisiones con una visión enfocada en el cliente y la eficiencia operativa, así como al descubrimiento de insights.
La sede de trabajo será en Pozuelo de Alarcón (Madrid), España, pero sus funciones se realizarán para el conjunto de países del Grupo Verisure Securitas Direct.

Misión del puesto
Se encargará de la comprensión y tratamiento de fuentes de datos de diferentes entornos y, por ello, necesitamos un alto nivel de limpieza y procesamiento de los datos para su correcto consumo mediante un algoritmo predictivo. La persona trabajará con datos operativos, datos técnicos de los dispositivos y datos relacionados con el perfil del cliente, debiendo asegurar una ingeniería de datos de entrada que permita crear un conjunto de datos optimizado para su consumo por los algoritmos.
Entregará, periódicamente, avances relacionados con el análisis descriptivo de conjuntos de datos y el descubrimiento de conocimientos y será responsable de todo el proceso E2E del algoritmo de Machine Learning / Deep Learning, desde su realización y diseño, bajo estándares optimizados, hasta su implementación (PaP); estableciendo reglas para monitorear tanto el proceso de implementación como la bondad de ajuste del algoritmo.
Deberá, asímismo, mantener un contacto continuo con los países del Grupo, los equipos de IT y Operaciones para llevar a cabo los proyectos y respetar los plazos establecidos.

Principales responsabilidades de la posición
1. Encargado de todo el ciclo de los algoritmos de predicción. Desde la recolección de los datos, tratamiento o pre-procesamiento de los mismos, creación y elección de los algoritmos, evaluación y puesta en producción, determinando de forma óptima la operativización de los outputs.
2. Realización de algoritmos Machine Learning y Deep Learning con datos de negocio, imagen y audio (datos estructurados y no estructurados) con el objetivo de mejorar tanto la experiencia de cliente como la optimización de la operativa.
3. Mantenimiento, re-calibración y optimización de algoritmos en Producción.
4. Realización de análisis ad-hoc avanzados con data sets de gran magnitud con información relacionada con el cliente, la operativa y señalización técnica.
5. Ownership en la identificación de aspectos en los que el área debería trabajar con miras a mejorar la experiencia de cliente con eficiencia operativa utilizando la analítica avanzada.
6. Transformar, enriquecer y preparar los datos para su análisis y visualización.
7. Apoyar a los distintos países del Grupo Verisure Securitas Direct en la realización de analítica avanzada (Machine Learning / Deep Learning).
8. Participar y desarrollar la práctica de Data Science dentro de la compañía.

Principales requerimientos
Carrera de Ingeniería, Estadística o similar
• Experiencia previa de 3 a 5 años en un puesto equivalente o consultoría.
• Alto conocimiento de algoritmos de aprendizaje automático y aprendizaje profundo
• Alto conocimiento de técnicas de preprocesamiento de datos y optimización de datos
• Conocimiento de lenguajes y herramientas como (Python, R, SQL, Amazon Sage Maker, S3, Redshift)
• Experiencia trabajando con un gran volumen de información y con diferentes fuentes de datos.
• Español e inglés: C2 (hablar, leer y escribir con fluidez)

Puesto ofertado: Consultor de Analítica Avanzada - Securitas Direct
Sector: Seguridad e investigaciones
Descripción:
Para uno de nuestros clientes, Verisure Securitas Direct, líder del mercado europeo en monitorización con alarmas inteligentes, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes con un equipo de más de 13.000 empleados, operando en 16 países, 12 en Europa y 4 América Latina, estamos buscando un Consultor de Analítica Avanzada. La persona seleccionada formará parte de la práctica de Advanced Analytics del departamento de Customer Experience y se responsabilizará de liderar proyectos de analítica avanzada y algoritmos Machine Learning / Deep Learning que ayuden a la toma de decisiones con una visión enfocada en el cliente y en la eficiencia operativa, así como al descubrimiento de insights de negocio.
La sede de trabajo será en Pozuelo de Alarcón (Madrid), España, pero sus funciones se realizarán para el conjunto de países del Grupo Verisure Securitas Direct.

Misión del puesto
Trabajando con un Data Scientist, se responsabilizará de la gestión de los proyectos que liderará, abarcando el ”end to end” de la analítica avanzada:
1) Arquitectura de datos;
2) Algoritmia y Analítica;
3) Integraciones Tecnológicas (ej. Industrializaciones de los algoritmos, integraciones con sistemas, etc.);
4) Integraciones Operativas. Asímismo, podrá encargarse de realizar analítica avanzada en primera persona, proporcionando conocimientos profundos cuantitativos y cualitativos sobre el uso y el funcionamiento de nuestros productos y servicios, y la calidad y el rendimiento de la experiencia del cliente en una variedad de puntos de contacto y conjuntos de datos.
Realizará, periódicamente, presentaciones sobre los avances de los proyectos que lidera en cuanto a insghts analíticos y al estado del proyecto, incluyendo presentaciones a la alta dirección para la toma de decisiones críticas.
Deberá, asimismo, mantener un contacto continuo con los países del Grupo, los equipos de IT y Operaciones para llevar a cabo los proyectos y respetar los plazos establecidos.
Principales responsabilidades de la posición
1. Estratégico: a. Responsable de identificar, con una visión enfocada en el cliente y en la eficiencia operativa, según las necesidades de la empresa y del proyecto, el mejor enfoque para llevar a cabo las soluciones. b. Responsable de comunicar el comportamiento / resultados de algoritmos a la empresa con un significado de negocio. c. Proporcionar recomendaciones para planes, programas, estrategias, políticas y presupuestos. d. Colaborar en el proceso de evolución de mindset de la empresa hacia la Inteligencia Artificial.
2. Proyecto: a. Responsable de coordinar proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial con distintas áreas de la compañía en distintos países del Grupo. b. Responsable de garantizar la implementación del ”end to end” de los proyectos de Inteligencia Artificial: 1) Arquitectura de datos; 2) Algoritmia y Analítica; 3) Integraciones Tecnológicas; 4) Integraciones Operativas; ayudando a identificar y solventar los riesgos técnicos y operativos.
3. Gestión de Equipos: a. Guiar y dirijir al Data Scientist para completar todos los entregables del proyecto.
b. Coordinación en la realización de algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial con equipos conformados por Científicos de Datos y Analistas de Negocio dentro del departamento de Customer Experience y en otras áreas de la compañía tanto en España como en los distintos países del Grupo.
4. Advanced Analyst: a. Capaz de desarrollar análisis cuantitativos avanzados utilizando una variedad de programas / software para respaldar evaluaciones predictivas. b. Capaz de realizar análisis complejos, que incluyen optimización, análisis de texto, aprendizaje automático, modelado de ciencias sociales y análisis estadístico, modelos y técnicas estadísticas paramétricas y no paramétricas.
5. Datos: a. Responsable de impulsar la calidad de los datos en los países y para los proyectos que liderará. b. Responsable de identificar soluciones respecto a la calidad, disponibilidad y gobernanza del dato en la empresa que impacten los proyectos de IA que liderará.

Perfil que buscamos:
• Licenciatura en estadística, matemáticas, física, informática o ingeniería, o en un campo relacionado.
• Experiencia previa de 3 a 5 años en un puesto equivalente.
• Conocimientos estadísticos, de algoritmia, lenguajes de programación y ecosistemas big data.
• Conocimiento integral de proyectos E2E de Inteligencia Artificial.
• Amplio conocimiento y comprensión de técnicas avanzadas de estadística, aprendizaje automático y minería de datos que le permitan resolver problemas estratégicos y proporcionar información empresarial práctica utilizando datos y un enfoque cuantitativo / científico.
• Experiencia de trabajo con conjuntos de datos grandes y complejos aplicando tecnologías de big data y lenguaje de script, incluidos Python, Java y C / C ++.
• Conocimiento y experiencia en gestión de proyectos (metodología Agile).
• Conocimiento y experiencia en lenguajes como Python, R.
• Conocimiento y experiencia trabajando en ecosistema de ciencia de datos y plataforma de datos como Amason Sage Maker, Google Cloud, BigQuery, Dataflow, etc

¡Si crees que cumples con el perfil, inscríbete y déjanos conocerte!

We are growing our Requirements Engineering / IT Business Analyst Team in Vigo and are looking for new colleagues who will bring their consultative and analytical experience spiced up by technical skills.

And by technical skills we mean that you have a solid experience working in web-development projects interpreting clients wishes into technical specifications for the Development team.

If it sounds like you, read on...

Your Tasks  

You will be the link between our customer and our development teams and translate business requests to technical requirements and into technical concepts.
You will write business requirements, testing software, executing operational tasks and providing project management support while strengthening your technical acumen and business consulting skills. 
You will take responsibility for the conception and design of web-based solutions in the digital marketing domain, designing, testing and launching the technology that meets fully the business need. You will truly be a game changer for our clients.
You will also be brainstorming with the client at the outset of a project, then acting as an assistant project manager as the project progresses.
You will support the analysis and implementation of requirements along the entire software development cycle.
You will document and present the solutions implemented with your team for internal and external stakeholders.

What is required?

Strong verbal and written English skills (C1 and higher)
First hands-on experience with web-based content management systems (CMS)
Solid technical understanding of web development and web application integrations
Able to translate business requirements to technical solutions
Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS / JavaScript and / or web-relevant programming languages 
Experience in the creation of wireframes / mock-ups for IT applications 
Experience in the analysis of IT processes and the structured creation of requirements for IT systems
Knowledge of software modelling methods (UML, flow charts, use cases...), methodologies and process models in software development
Eligibility to work within the EU and/or Switzerland

What makes us smile when looking at your profile

Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud (AEC) products, especially Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Adobe Analytics (AA), or Adobe Campaign (AC)
Knowledge in the area of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) 
Motivation to work in a distributed, international team
Experience in using tools like JIRA / Confluence
A proactive mind-set, ability to share your ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm and an open mind which is looking for continuous improvement
You are not afraid of giving and receiving feedback

What we can offer you:

Permanent contract
30 working days of vacation for all employees
Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs
Recognition bonus system
Continuous training and coaching
Free language classes to polish your English or help you with your Spanish
Young and international team
Private health insurance
Sponsored gym membership
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarden and transport)
Apple work equipment
Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Sector: Artículos de consumo Recursos humanos Venta al por menor
Descripción:
En 1969 diez pequeñas cooperativas de consumo decidimos unirnos en un gran proyecto. Era el único modo de seguir adelante con nuestra filosofía de ofrecer productos básicos de calidad a un precio competitivo, así como de garantizar empleo estable. Más de 50 años después, EROSKI es una de las principales empresas de distribución de España y mantenemos vigente un modelo socio-empresarial distinto, el modelo cooperativo. Un modelo que se respalda en la alta participación y el protagonismo que tenemos en la gestión del día a día todas las personas que formamos parte de la cooperativa, tanto socias de trabajo como socias de consumo. Grupo EROSKI está formado, a cierre del ejercicio 2019, por 1.645 establecimientos entre hipermercados, supermercados, gasolineras, ópticas, agencias de viajes, tiendas de ocio deportivo… y alrededor del 80% de las 28.939 personas que trabajamos aquí somos mujeres. En consonancia, su presencia es mayoritaria (72%) en puestos de responsabilidad, así como en los órganos de gobierno de la cooperativa. Del total de trabajadoras/es, 9.258 somos socias/os de la cooperativa. ‘Contigo’ es la forma de expresar el sentimiento cooperativo, de resumir la preocupación por la salud y el bienestar; supone buscar siempre el ahorro para el consumidor sin que éste tenga que renunciar a la calidad; ‘Contigo’ implica apoyar lo local allí donde hay una tienda abierta, escuchar las necesidades o sugerencias del consumidor y buscar permanentemente una experiencia de compra positiva.

Funciones

¿Te apasionan los datos? ¿Te gusta pensar en formas de crear soluciones que respondan a la mejora y la eficiencia?
Te insertarás en el departamento de análisis de datos para la mejora de procesos de las diferentes unidades de negocio, te encargarás de resolver los diferentes casos de uso de analítica avanzada.
Participarás en la definición, verificación del diseño y dimensionamiento del proyecto para abordar el proyecto de principio a fin, desde el desarrollo hasta la puesta en producción del modelo desarrollado.
Trabajarás en un equipo multidisciplinar, junto con el negocio, acompañamiento dl proveedor y soporte técnico.

En Eroski, abordamos un nuevo reto, mejorar la eficiencia de proyectos de aprovisionamiento en la cadena de suministro

Nos dirigimos a personas con una titulación universitaria superior (Preferentemente en Matemáticas, Estadística o Ingeniería Informática, Posgrado o formación similar en Big Data, Business Analytics o Analítica Avanzada. Conocimiento lenguaje de programación R.). Nos gustaría que tuvieras conocimientos de lenguaje de programación Python, Conocimiento en el manejo de herramienta de visualización de datos: Qlik, Tableau, Power BI o similares, Conocimiento arquitectura de Big Data y modelo de datos, Conocimiento gobierno de datos, conocimientos del sector retail

Contrato de 1 año
Trabajar en una de las empresas de distribución más importantes de España, con un modelo organizativo único, el modelo cooperativo.

Business Analyst

Main Responsibilities
Understand and manage P&L infrastructure and analysis for International Business – working with Finance and Commercial Operations to define, build and improve P&L management systems.
Translate business needs into technical specifications and work with the Business Intelligence Team to develop reports and dashboards in Power Bi
Coordinate the implementation of reports and visuals requested on an ad-hoc basis
Understand and analyze business KPIs to determine areas for improvement
Model data and metadata to support ad-hoc and pre-built reporting
Work with the BI Team to design, development, and maintenance of ongoing reports, dashboards and analysis in order to drive key business decisions.
Partner closely with Commercial Business Partner and Finance Manager to address business needs for insights and analytics
Drive improvement on data ingestion, transformation and publication to ensure confidence in the systems we build.
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Generate P&L forecasts from historic data using the appropriate methodologies and software to visualize the results
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis of P&L results and forecasting and suggest actions for improvement
Work with the BI team to automate existing excel reports with Power Bi
Be the champion of business analytics and the use of existing reporting tools, specifically Power Bi
Detect areas where there is lack of knowledge and develop training to address those needs.
Document guidelines and procedures to consume existing Power Bi reports/dashboard


Skills Required
Fluent in English
Proven analytical skills (able to perform Trend Analysis, Root Cause Analysis, and other statistical analysis)
Strong knowledge of MS-Power BI
Good interpersonal skills, proper written and verbal communication skills. Must have the ability to present his/her work to senior business leaders
Must have a positive attitude to work with key Business Leaders and to be able to provide and receive feedback as a key element for continuous improvement
Proactive, with the ability to work independently (i.e. under little supervision) and driven by project results
Creative and innovative, oriented to generate new ideas for improvement
Must have the ability to handle large amounts of work, focused on finding solutions
Must have the ability to handle short-notice requests and quick turnarounds with a positive attitude
Must be a well-organized professional (well structured)
Must have a good knowledge of working on a project environment – e.g. with defined timelines, scope and limited resources


Knowledge And Experience Required
Academic background in business, finance, engineering or similar
Must have experience working with operations dashboards and databases
1+ years of experience working with MS-Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of MS-Excel and MS-Powerpoint
Must understand business intelligence concepts and how to provide business insights
Knowledge of statistics, forecasting and trend analysis is desired
Knowledge/work experience with salesforce.com is a plus
Project Management knowledge/certification is a plus
Experience in Sales, Finance and/or Operations is an advantage

Description

Junior Data Analyst

Why YOU want this position

Since our founding as a groundbreaking provider of oil & gas data, we have evolved our solutions to cover oil & gas analytics, trading & risk, and business automation for customers across the energy industry. Enverus represents this growth while bringing us closer together as one team. Enverus delivers business-critical insights to the global energy industry through a state-of-the-art SaaS platform built on industry-leading data and energy analytics. Our solutions deliver value across the entire energy value chain, empowering customers to be more agile, efficient, and competitive. The range of energy industry participants we serve includes exploration and production (E&P) companies and related businesses such as oilfield services, midstream, capital markets, power generators and utilities, energy traders, and downstream commercial & industrial energy consumers.

We are currently seeking a highly driven Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Chicago. This role offers the opportunity to join a rapidly growing company delivering industry-leading solutions to customers in a dynamic and fast-growing sector.

Performance Objectives
Data QA on new integrations prior to release using
Our front-end software
SQL Server databases/back-end tools
Development documentation
Work closely with the data team when issues are found during QA
Data QA on changes made to an existing data set prior to release
Participate in the data integration process by focusing on metadata additions and updates

Competitive Candidate Profile
Detail oriented
Excellent communication skills
Comfortable working with a global team
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Basic SQL Server experience is a plus (selects, updates, deletes, joins)
Knowledge of financial and/or energy market is a plus

Requisitos

El gran arquitecto de datos debe poseer las aptitudes necesarias para combinar las capacidades de plataformas y fuentes de datos heterogéneas de todo tipo de datos (estructurados, no estructurados o semiestructurados), y definir las normas y políticas para la gestión de esos datos y su difusión a los distintos agentes.
Debe poseer experiencia práctica en la extracción y el procesamiento de datos en tuberías (incluidas las plataformas de procesamiento en tiempo real o en corriente) y experiencia demostrada en sistemas, marcos e instrumentos relacionados con el análisis de datos y la presentación de informes. Conocimiento de la arquitectura e infraestructura nativa de la nube, incluyendo el SDLC y específicamente el proceso de construcción y despliegue de grandes soluciones de datos.
Deseable experiencia en marcos de contenedorización y orquestadores como Docker y Kubernetes.
Experiencia y conocimientos en la industrialización, instalación y despliegue de sistemas de inteligencia artificial y ciencia de los datos (como modelos de aprendizaje automático, sistemas de procesamiento del lenguaje natural o chatbots)
Buen conocimiento de los sistemas de información.
Conocimientos probados en consultoría de TI.
Fuerte capacidad de preparación y redacción de consultoría técnica.
Competencia en la comunicación en un entorno multilingüe.
Capacidad de trabajar en un entorno internacional y multicultural.
Capacidad demostrada para hablar, escribir y leer con fluidez en inglés (C1)

Funciones

Responsable del diseño e implementación de grandes soluciones de datos basadas en nuevas tecnologías y plataformas para problemas empresariales complejos.

Prestación de asesoramiento y asistencia en cualquier esfera relacionada con la adquisición, el suministro, la entrega, el mantenimiento, el despliegue, el alojamiento y la utilización eficaz de los sistemas de información y sus entornos

cuestiones de seguridad relacionadas con los proyectos de sistemas de información.

Seleccionamos científico/a de datos para formar parte de un importante proyecto de Bussiness Intelligence de la compañía. La persona seleccionada formará parte de un equipo avanzado de trabajo encargado de un Servicio de analítica de datos para un segmento comercial de una operadora telco.

Funciones
Análisis, diseño y construcción de estudios adhoc y su posterior transformación a informes recurrentes tanto en Excel como en PowerBI, automatizado en ocasiones con Python.

Requisitos Imprescindibles
SQL: Conocimiento con experiencia demostrada - Independiente del RGDB - (Puede ser con cualquier base de datos relacional: Access, Mysql, Postgre, Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, sybase...)
EXCEL experto: Capacidad para realizar: pivot tables, recuperar datos de diversos orígenes, gráficos (estáticos y dinámicos)

Requisitos Valorables
Conocimiento y con experiencia en algún lenguaje de programación (aparte de pl-sql o sql scripting que damos por hecho por el punto anterior). Tener experiencia programando en cualquier lenguaje habilita para el aprendizaje rápido de cualquier otro. (VB, java, python, php, perl...).

Requisitos Muy Valorables
Experiencia en tareas sencillas de automatizaciones (scripts en python, powershell, shell scripting, perl, MS-DOS...), planificación de tareas, flujos de ETL.
Valorable experiencia en: BO (SAP Business Object) - Teradata - consultas de usuario.

Competencias Personales Requeridas
Capacidad analítica, para realizar ejecuciones periódicas con detalle para detectar errores, irregularidades e incidencias, sin olvidar nada. Persona orientada al trabajo en equipo y con buenas habilidades comunicativas para interrelación con cliente.

¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?
Puesto estable en una empresa consolidada en el mercado con más de 37 años de experiencia, responsable y comprometida con nuestros empleados/as, en el que las personas constituyen el primer valor de la compañía.
Participación en interesantes proyectos tecnológicos para clientes de primer nivel, que te permitirá desarrollar una carrera profesional acorde a tu posición.
Beneficiarte de un plan de formación que abarca tanto el área técnica como el desarrollo de habilidades y de idiomas.
Proyecto estable de sector de telecomunicaciones y de gran alcance que nos permite definir tu puesto de trabajo a la medida.

¿Quién es nuestro cliente? Especialistas en consultoría IT y soluciones digitales a medida.

Tasks
Funciones
Responsible for the design and implementation of big data solutions based on new technologies and platforms for complex business problems. The big data architect should possess the skills to combine the capabilities of heterogeneous data platforms and sources of all types of data (structured, unstructured or semi-structured), and define the standards and policies for the management of this data, and its dissemination to different actors. Should possess practical experience with data extraction and processing pipelines (including real-time or stream-processing platforms) and demonstrated experience in systems, frameworks and tools related to data analytics and reporting. Knowledge of cloud-native architecture and infrastructure, including the SDLC and specifically the process of building and deploying big data solutions. Desirable experience in containerization frameworks and orchestrators such as Docker and Kubernetes. Experience and knowledge in the industrialization, installation and deployment of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science systems (such as Machine Learning models, Natural Language Processing systems or Chatbots).
Provision of advice and assistance in any area associated with the procurement, provision, delivery, maintenance, deployment, hosting, effective use of information systems and their environments
Provision of security technical consultancy, security assessments or other security matters associated with information system projects.
Technical risk analysis.
Provision of technical consultancy, technical expertise, technical evaluations in relation with information systems


Requirements

Requisitos
Good knowledge of information systems.
Proven knowledge in IT consulting.
Strong capacity in preparing and writing technical consultancy.
Proficient communication skills in a multilingual environment.
Capable of working in an international/ multicultural environment.
Proven ability to speak, write and read fluently in English (C1)

Minimum 10 years of relevant technical consultancy and experience in last 15 years

Descripción:
Descripción

En Kids&Us buscamos constantemente personas con talento y comprometidas con nuestro principal objetivo: lograr que los niños aprendan inglés.

Nuestro equipo de profesionales HQ son personas apasionadas por los grandes proyectos y retos, comprometidos con la enseñanza de los niños y niñas. En nuestras oficinas centrales se respira un ambiente joven y dinámico en el que seguro, te sentirás como en casa.

¿Quieres formar parte de Kids&Us?

Como “Analista de datos”, en la dirección de Método y Calidad de Kids&Us, serás el responsable del tratamiento de datos y resultados generales de la red para facilitar su lectura a otros departamentos y permitan el análisis de estos para la toma de decisiones, así como la definición de KPI’s de la compañía.

A Grandes Rasgos, Tus Funciones Serán
Extracto y cruce de datos elaborando los informes y presentaciones correspondientes en el ámbito de Calidad y de gestión de Red.
Elaboración y preparación de documentación a presentar al Comité de Dirección.
Análisis en profundidad y elaboración de presentaciones de estudios realizados.
Elaboración de estudios según necesidades.
Detección de alarmas.
Soporte en la definición de Planes de Acción, así como su impacto.
Requisitos mínimos

Formación
Formación universitaria en estadística i/o calidad.
Experiencia mínima
Entre 2 y 3 años en puesto similar.
Idiomas
Inglés: Nivel alto – C1
Castellano: Nivel usuario
Catalán: Nivel usuario
Conocimientos necesarios
Conocimientos en tratamiento y análisis de datos
Altos conocimientos de Excel
Dominio de SPSS o similar.
Fecha de incorporación: 04-03-2021

Abengoa (MCE: ABG/P:SM), compañía internacional que aplica soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras para el desarrollo sostenible en los sectores de infraestructuras, energía y agua.

Se requiere incorporar a una persona para realizar beca en el área de IT como Data Analyst en sus oficinas de Sevilla.

Ofrecemos incorporación al equipo de diseño de soluciones IT de Abengoa en coordinación con el equipo de desarrollo, participando en proyectos de BI, RPA, BigData, ML e Inteligencia Artificial y con acceso todo tipo de recursos y servicios Cloud (azure, amazon, etc.).

Conocimientos valorables: sistemas distribuidos y modelado de datos; minería de datos y machine learning; herramientas de visualización de datos; codificación con Python y/o R.

Enviar mensaje InMail
The Digital Department is focused on the analysis, development and maintenance of tools, data analytics and automating business processes in Atexis. We strive to improve our colleagues working life through the use of modern technology.
As JAVA Programmer Analyst, you will be a part of a development team focused on the analysis and improvement of an existing tool we’re actively developing for our international customers.
The team is dynamic, providing the chance to collaborate and support on different projects and business processes and allowing you to participate in the selection of the best technological solutions based on the project’s requirements. 

Your new Tasks and Responsibilities:

To analyze current systems and applications and get acquainted with required evolutions.
To document and analyze customer requirements, comparing them with the existing application.
To perform a gap analysis between the current application and the new requirements.
To participate in the solution design for change requests.
To identify and suggest technical and development tasks necessary to meet the defined solution.
To collaborate in the time estimation of the tasks to be performed under each change request.
To participate in the development and testing of the change requests.
To ensure the change requests goals are met.
To interact with the functional analysts and customers to clarify requirements and manage expectations.
To actively participate in an international SCRUM team.

Your Skills and Experience:

At least 3 years of experience in JAVA development. Preferably 5 years.
Experience working with JAVA Swing.
Experience in Requirements Definition and Analysis.
Experience in Technical Gap Analysis and workload estimation.
Knowledge of XML and XML related tools and tech (XPath, XQuery, BaseX).
Good English level (B1-B2).
Comfortable working in SCRUM teams.
.
Key Information:

Permanent contract or freelance.
40 hours/week (7:00-15:00h).
Training on the job.
Private healt insurance.
Starting date: March 2021.

Anunciado por

Enviar mensaje InMail
The Role

We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to shape, drive and aid with the maintenance and reform of our internal systems as well as identifying better tools to improve our data products. You will be providing support to the content data operations in the UK and Seville and liaising with the product owners and engineers in Autodata to review and streamline the tools and technology to bring efficiencies and better customer outcomes.


What You’ll Do

Identifying and evaluating relevant technology solutions and tools to solve business problems, exploit opportunities and drive forward continuous improvements
Act as liaison and participate in defining technology tools and solutions to solve complex, multidisciplinary business problems with long-term implications
Comfortable operating in a business that is underpinned by all things ‘data’
Working cross-functionally with operations (data content) and technology teams
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise requirements to senior stakeholders
Requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (Agile, not waterfall)
Solid technical background, exposure to a software development environment and proven experience having worked in Agile and Scrum
Experience in a wide range of business analyst skills (e.g. use cases, user stories, requirements traceability, process mapping)
Able to break down complex business problems from epics into user stories
Balance technology and business issues as well as communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts
Develop, define, and build technology business cases that will enable business and technology change
Participate in business process and technology initiatives to improve business performance
Excellent understanding of technology life cycles and the concepts and practices required to implement effective technical business change.
Evidence of troubleshooting and solving problems in a highly technical customer focused service environment
Strong problem-solving ability and a willingness to roll your sleeves up to get the job done


What You’ll Bring

Proven track record of having work in Agile environments and having delivered technical transformational change
Over 3 years of experience in a product owner / senior business analysis role.
Proven ability in requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (e.g. use cases, user stories, process mapping, etc)
An ability to conduct tools research and gather requirements that will support the business case. Define outcomes and benefits realisation as part of the business case
Adept at removing blockers and finding ways to overcome constraints/difficulties
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise options and potential solutions to your peers and the leadership team
Able to work cross-functionally with business and technology teams

Descripción:
Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.

En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.

Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.

Algunas de tus responsabilidades:


Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data

Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares

Participación en proyectos para grandes clientes


¿Te unes al Big Data | Accenture Technology team? ¡Aplica online!

#BigDataNinja

Titulación técnica: Informática u otras con experiencia equivalente (Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física, otras ingenierías, etc.)

+2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.)

Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.)

Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)


Valorable:


Experiencia en AWS o Azure

Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.)

Descripción:
This is Ekkiden

Ambition and innovation are our driving force. We aim high, act quickly, and acquire the wherewithal that we need to achieve our objectives. Our organisation is shaped by the requirements of both our clients and our teams. Becoming a European benchmark requires hard work, quality and respect. We pave our own path, with international teams committed to sustainable growth. We help clients to innovate and we make sure we question ourselves at all times. At Ekkiden everything is possible. Our managers are trained to bring out the best in every team member. If you are daring, creative, and have great people skills, if you want to live an extraordinary human experience and you don’t want to keep reminding yourself why you get up in the morning, it's time to meet up.

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Responsibilities
Work with the team (technical Lead/Architect/other team members) and customer focal point to understand the business need and design/implement the technical data management solution
Design and implement Data Warehouses and Data Lakes solutions, mainly Microsoft Cloud and AWS data services, based on the customers’ business requirements
Design and implement complex ELT/ETL processes using Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory or AWS Glue or others
Design and develop Analysis Services OLAP Cubes and Tabular Views
Develop scripts accordingly to the data need (Stored Procedures with T-SQL, Python or R, eventually PowerShell).
Design conceptual and logical data models and data flowcharts
Design Data-as-a-Service solution, on-premises and Cloud based, based on Data API Gateway and other Cloud services.
Implement Data Catalog solutions
Migrate data from legacy systems to new data platform solutions
Improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
Optimize new and current database systems
Perform other duties as required


What We Are Looking For
+5 years of experience in similar positions
Strong knowledge in C# development
Strong knowledge on Azure Functions
Excellent knowledge in LogicApps and development in Azure
Excellent knowledge of AWS BI and data services
Experience with Data analysis and modelling
Experience with Database scripting (T-SQL, stored procedures, etc.)
Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence modules covering Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Analysis Services (SSAS)
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS Athena/RDS or Redshift
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI
Experience working with OData
Experience working with SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience with Service Management tools (ticketing systems)
Experience with Service Management methodologies (ITIL) and Change Management
Experience with Agile project development
Microsoft SQL Server certification is a plus
Microsoft BI certification is a plus
Fluent in English. Spanish and Italian are a plus


What we offer

Descripción:
The role
We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to shape, drive and aid with the maintenance and reform of our internal systems as well as identifying better tools to improve our data products. You will be providing support to the content data operations in the UK and Seville and liaising with the product owners and engineers in Autodata to review and streamline the tools and technology to bring efficiencies and better customer outcomes.

What You’ll Do
Identifying and evaluating relevant technology solutions and tools to solve business problems, exploit opportunities and drive forward continuous improvements
Act as liaison and participate in defining technology tools and solutions to solve complex, multidisciplinary business problems with long-term implications
Comfortable operating in a business that is underpinned by all things ‘data’
Working cross-functionally with operations (data content) and technology teams
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise requirements to senior stakeholders
Requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (Agile, not waterfall)
Solid technical background, exposure to a software development environment and proven experience having worked in Agile and Scrum
Experience in a wide range of business analyst skills (e.g. use cases, user stories, requirements traceability, process mapping)
Able to break down complex business problems from epics into user stories
Balance technology and business issues as well as communicate appropriately with both technology and business experts
Develop, define, and build technology business cases that will enable business and technology change
Participate in business process and technology initiatives to improve business performance
Excellent understanding of technology life cycles and the concepts and practices required to implement effective technical business change.
Evidence of troubleshooting and solving problems in a highly technical customer focused service environment
Strong problem-solving ability and a willingness to roll your sleeves up to get the job done

What You’ll Bring
Proven track record of having work in Agile environments and having delivered technical transformational change
Over 3 years of experience in a product owner / senior business analysis role.
Proven ability in requirements elicitation, prioritisation and management (e.g. use cases, user stories, process mapping, etc)
An ability to conduct tools research and gather requirements that will support the business case. Define outcomes and benefits realisation as part of the business case
Adept at removing blockers and finding ways to overcome constraints/difficulties
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to summarise options and potential solutions to your peers and the leadership team
Able to work cross-functionally with business and technology teams
Attributes and Characteristics
Structured and self-organised
Analytical skills
Relentless customer centric mindset and approach
Process-driven mind-set and problem-solving skills
A technical aptitude and interpersonal skills
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Your mindset, attitude and values will be essential to success, with proactivity, collaboration, thought leadership and product expertise at your core

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
CARTO is making a huge impact on some of the most important global corporations (Google, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Vodafone) developing custom solutions on top of its powerful geospatial platform.

We are looking to incorporate to our Solutions Team a creative professional eager to work with data engineering, helping us to define automated solutions to ingest, analyze and process terabytes of spatial data with the ultimate Cloud Native platform.

Do you have a passion for solving the most cutting-edge customer problems with data and analytics? Do you want to be part of a high performing team at a rapidly growing tech company with an awesome culture? Do you have expertise and demonstrated success dimensioning and defining geospatial solutions? If so we want to talk to you!

Some our current challenges are solving problems like: design high scalable platform to calculate optimized routes of gas&oil pipelines over terabytes of spatial data and hundreds of constraints in seconds, predict revenue for simulated stores in a whole country applying ML techniques, or process, aggregate and enrich billions of transactions across the globe to serve them in a real-time application.

From smartphones to connected cars, location data is changing the way we live and the way business happens. Everyone, from business analysts to data scientists, use our software and location data to understand where and why things happen, optimize business processes, and predict future outcomes.

Backed by leading VC firms Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, CARTO is poised to lead the location intelligence (LI) space.

This position is based in our Sevilla office, although we accept candidates working remotely.

You Will
Work with an experienced team to build cutting-edge data processing systems that feed beautiful maps and meaningful geospatial apps for international customers.
Research, arrange and aggregate terabytes of data to get the most accurate insights for CARTO customers. Don't count data, make data count.
You will learn everything there is to know about mapping technology and how companies around the world are using CARTO to gain insights through location and predictive analysis.
Build scalable ETL pipelines based on platforms like Prefect or Airflow in an elastic cloud infrastructure.
You will be able to self-promote and become a tech leader, who will be a referent for the rest of the team.
You are
A human being with an insatiable thirst for learning.
Quick to grasp new concepts and quick to take on new challenges.
Experienced building ETL processes with Python and familiar with the Python Data Analysis stack: Pandas, Numpy, GeoPandas, Scikit-learn, etc.
Ideally, experienced with large databases and data warehouses like BigQuery, Redshift or Snowflake.
Someone who has enjoyed working with various databases and has solid SQL foundations.
Mature in your approach to software development, in how you test, fine tune, and document when required.
A skilled communicator, and fluent in English.
Willing to contribute to our culture of openness, constant feedback, and iterative improvement.
We offer
Competitive, results-based compensation.
Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment.
Private medical insurance and stock options.
Growth prospects at a truly welcoming multicultural and multilingual company with a supportive, team-work oriented work environment.
An opportunity to get in early to a company that will be category defining, backed by the same VCs that have backed companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox and Cloudera.
A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we’re sharing it with the world.
To Apply

Provide us your resume and explain your interest. Be sure to let us know why you’re a great match for this role and for CARTO!

Do you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.

A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.

To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq).

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria Industria farmacéutica
Descripción:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.

We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Reverse Translation) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To
Develop and apply computational methods for in-depth analysis of stratified patient data to gain mechanistic insight into driver mechanisms
Collaborate with disease stratification and target identification teams to leverage stratification results to impact discovery of novel therapies
Perform integrative analysis to derive validation-ready target hypotheses, linked to clearly defined patient subtypes
Contribute to the identification of suitable in-vitro models and validation scenarios
Collaborate experimental teams on iterative validation of therapeutic and mechanistic hypotheses

Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.
Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).
Experience analyzing high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etc
Experience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageous
Attention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.
Verbal and written English language fluency.

Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.

The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

This is Ekkiden

Ambition and innovation are our driving force. We aim high, act quickly, and acquire the wherewithal that we need to achieve our objectives. Our organisation is shaped by the requirements of both our clients and our teams. Becoming a European benchmark requires hard work, quality and respect. We pave our own path, with international teams committed to sustainable growth. We help clients to innovate and we make sure we question ourselves at all times. At Ekkiden everything is possible. Our managers are trained to bring out the best in every team member. If you are daring, creative, and have great people skills, if you want to live an extraordinary human experience and you don’t want to keep reminding yourself why you get up in the morning, it's time to meet up.

Role: Data Engineer with C#

Application from women are particularly encouraged !

Within an international environment, we are looking for a Data Analyst to deliver on-going project implementations and support for existing Business Intelligence and Reporting Services implementations under the Microsoft SQL Server technology platform and strong knowledge in C# development.

Responsibilities
Work with the team (technical Lead/Architect/other team members) and customer focal point to understand the business need and design/implement the technical data management solution
Design and implement Data Warehouses and Data Lakes solutions, mainly Microsoft Cloud and AWS data services, based on the customers’ business requirements
Design and implement complex ELT/ETL processes using Integration Services (SSIS), Azure Data Factory or AWS Glue or others
Design and develop Analysis Services OLAP Cubes and Tabular Views
Develop scripts accordingly to the data need (Stored Procedures with T-SQL, Python or R, eventually PowerShell).
Design conceptual and logical data models and data flowcharts
Design Data-as-a-Service solution, on-premises and Cloud based, based on Data API Gateway and other Cloud services.
Implement Data Catalog solutions
Migrate data from legacy systems to new data platform solutions
Improve system performance by conducting tests, troubleshooting and integrating new elements
Optimize new and current database systems
Perform other duties as required


What We Are Looking For
+5 years of experience in similar positions
Strong knowledge in C# development
Strong knowledge on Azure Functions
Excellent knowledge in LogicApps and development in Azure
Excellent knowledge of AWS BI and data services
Experience with Data analysis and modelling
Experience with Database scripting (T-SQL, stored procedures, etc.)
Good knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence modules covering Integration Services (SSIS), Reporting Services (SSRS), Analysis Services (SSAS)
Good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS Athena/RDS or Redshift
Familiarity with Microsoft Power BI
Experience working with OData
Experience working with SharePoint 2013/2016
Experience with Service Management tools (ticketing systems)
Experience with Service Management methodologies (ITIL) and Change Management
Experience with Agile project development
Microsoft SQL Server certification is a plus
Microsoft BI certification is a plus
Fluent in English. Spanish and Italian are a plus


What we offer
Participate in the creation of a European technology and organisational consulting group
A unique, innovative and dynamic working environment
A career path tailored to your personality, both in terms of job position and location
The opportunity to express yourself, assert your opinion and make an impact within our organisation and/or further afield
You say it, you own it. Once your idea has been given the go-ahead, it is up to you to make it happen
A demanding and innovative training program delivered by our greatest experts
Age is just a number, what really matter are achievements. We have a fast-track promotion system for employees who deliver
Our working conditions are concentric with our values and ambitions

Aptitudes y experiencia deseadas
C#, Azure, AWS, Data Lake, Data Warehouse

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Atención sanitaria y hospitalaria Industria farmacéutica
Descripción:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. Informatics & Predictive Sciences at CITRE performs innovative computational research to inform decisions across all stages of drug development. Areas of research include computational and network biology, machine/deep learning, cheminformatics, predictive modeling, patient stratification, and method development for analysis and interpretation of biological and real-world data. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.

We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Sciences (Network Biology) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To
Devise network approaches to gain insights from large-scale datasets of molecular profiles of cancer and other disease areas. These profiles include genomic and transcriptomic data, but also involve epigenetic regulation, phenotypic (CRISPR) screens and single-cell measurements
Develop innovative computational tools and methods to elucidate mechanisms of disease and predict model the effects of (combinations of) treatments
Collaboratively apply these methods to impact the clinical development of pipeline compounds and the discovery of novel therapies

Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications.
Expertise in scripting/programming (e.g. R, Matlab, Python or others) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. Bioconductor).
Advanced mathematical and statistical skills. Machine learning expertise a plus.
Familiarity with methods for high-throughput biological data, e.g. RNA-seq, WGS/WES, ChIP-seq, proteomics, etc
Experience with high-performance computing, including cloud computing, would be advantageous
Attention to detail and capacity to communicate technical/scientific concepts clearly and concisely to audiences of varied backgrounds.
Verbal and written English language fluency.

Please, attach a cover letter with your motivation for applying to this role, this would be highly appreciated in order to consider your profile for this opportunity.

The position advertised is fixed-term (24 months) and based in Seville, Spain. These positions present a unique opportunity to experience research in an industry setting and to contribute to helping patients with unmet medical need, while performing cutting-edge research and maintaining close ties to academia.

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.
