Descripción:
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

CITRE, based in Seville, Spain, is Bristol-Myers Squibb's research institute in Europe, and link to the European research community. In close collaboration with our in-house laboratory, we look to set a new standard in rational design of novel targeted therapies for well-defined patient segments.

We Are Looking For An Enthusiastic, Creative And Collaborative Research Scientist, Predictive Science (Integrative Multi-Omics) To Join a Multi-disciplinary Team To
Develop and apply computational strategies to mine large-scale collections of molecular data of cancer and other disease areas, such as (single-cell) transcriptomic and (epi)genomic data
Implement and critically evaluate novel methods, using e.g. deep learning, to represent and extract features from multi-dimensional, high-content data
Develop integrative methods for multi-layered single-cell measurements
Build robust and efficient solutions using on-site or cloud-based infrastructure
Collaborate with computational and experimental scientists to derive and validate insights of therapeutic relevance

Requirements
PhD in a relevant discipline, accompanied by original research publications
Experience analyzing omics and single-cell data
Strong grasp of scientific programming languages (e.g. Python, R) and relevant libraries and software (e.g. TensorFlow).
Strong technical and theoretical foundation in computational methods
Demonstrated ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to audiences with diverse scientific backgrounds
Previous experience using cloud-based computing and software engineering frameworks (e.g. Docker, Git). Experience with GPU programming a plus
Verbal and written English language fluency.

Descripción:
Job Description

Buscamos gente como tú: ¡Que disfrutas de tu trabajo, aceptas retos para llegar más lejos en tu carrera, te sientes orgulloso de pertenecer a una compañía Top Employer, te gusta el trabajo en equipo y colaborar con tu experiencia para que todos seamos mejores en nuestro día a día!

¿Quieres recibir formación en últimas tecnologías y tener la posibilidad de certificarte de manera gratuita?
¿Quieres trabajar en un ambiente dinámico, con proyectos de gran envergadura aplicando tecnología de última generación y trabajar en equipo con profesionales de primer nivel?.

Buscamos en Málaga, Sevilla y Alicante personas apasionadas por los datos en todas sus formas y procesos…. Extracción, transformación, procesamiento, visualización… Para esto, estamos especialmente interesados si además, tienes experiencia en tecnologías del Universo Microsoft On-Cloud.

Servicios asociados con Azure Data Platform
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake Store
Azure Blob Storage
Azure SQL DB
Azure Synapse Analytics
Azure Databricks
Ta mbién muy valorable que tengas conocimientos en técnicas de Big Data, sobre todo usando Spark, Python o Scala.

Las condiciones que te ofrecemos en Avanade son las siguientes:
Horario que te permitirá conciliar vida laboral y personal.
Participación en proyectos importantes para clientes de primer nivel nacional e internacional.
Una atractiva remuneración compuesta por un salario bruto anual y un programa de beneficios corporativos y retribución flexible.
Te esperamos: ¡Avanade es tu compañía!.

About Avanade

Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 29,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. We welcome all, and seek talented individuals who can bring their whole self to work, build inclusive teams and encourage diversity inside and outside the organization. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Contribute to genetics-driven drug discovery in a range of disease areas (auto-immune, neurological, cardiovascular and others)
Develop novel approaches to combine genetics evidence with additional layers of data, e.g. single-cell data sets, to link genetic variation to phenotypic properties

Descripción:
Join our team as a

CRM Data Analyst

Mataró

Are you ready to go further?

Reliable. Competent. Thanks to mutual cooperation, we ensure that a healthy optimum is always attained, both professionally and personally. These qualities have turned the HARTMANN GROUP into one of the leading international providers of medical and hygiene products. The secret of our success? Scope for development. We offer our just over 10,000 employees in more than 30 countries the opportunity of participating in shaping our common future. Take advantage of your new scope of action in the Sales & Marketing area at LABORATORIOS HARTMANN S.A. in Mataró.

CRM Data Analyst

Responsibilities

Your area of responsibility:
Prepare data analysis in order to have proper decisions within the sales division.
Demonstrate a “hands-on” approach as the Data Expert for the sales & marketing team (external and internal base info for the business management).
Implementation of business intelligence tools.
Help on Sap Analytics Cloud rollout.
Act as L2 support in Salesforce CRM (train teams on new functionalities, detect data gaps, escalate issues if exist).
Develop Business Intelligence culture around the organization.
He/she will report to the BI Manager.
What We Look For
Bachelor’s degree in Statics, Mathematics, Economics or Political Science.
Master’s degree with a focus on Data Analysis (Data Science, Data Analytics or Big Data).
Computer Knowledge of compliance Salesforce, SAP Analytics cloud, Excel, Minitab and SPSS.
Fluent communication skills in English
Minimum 1-2 years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in working on international teams.
Good communication skills with the ability to train.
Proven consulting skills with the ability to align technical proposals with business strategy.
Good people skills with experience of work with teams in a matrix organization.
Are you ready for an internationally successful company? Do you appreciate the benefits of an outstanding market position? Then start your career at HARTMANN now. With us, attractive framework conditions and excellent training opportunities await you. After all, our greatest potential is your personal development.

Department: Sales & Marketing

If you are interested in the position, please contact Marta Ortego

Email: marta.ortego@hartmann.info

Sector: Cosmética
Descripción:
¿QUIÉNES SOMOS?
Freshly Cosmetics es una marca digital de cosmética natural y saludable. Somos una startup nacida en Febrero de 2016 con una visión muy clara, revolucionar este sector y acelerar la transición hacia una cosmética que beneficie a las personas y a nuestro entorno. 
Somos una empresa con un e-commerce propio focalizada en una fuerte presencia en redes sociales y con una estrategia en la que el cliente es el centro de una experiencia única. Actualmente tenemos dos marcas en el mercado: Freshly Cosmetics, productos que cubren la rutina diaria de cosmética y que incluyen también Freshly Kids para los más pequeños, e Identy Beauty, nuestra marca de maquillaje.
Para Freshly Cosmetics nuestro equipo es lo más importante, por eso nos esforzamos en sumar talento con actitud y ganas de cambiar las cosas. Creemos que hay otra manera de trabajar, por proyectos, en equipo y en la que cada uno de nosotros decide cómo y cuándo organiza sus responsabilidades. Apostamos por la flexibilidad y el crecimiento personal y del equipo para crear el entorno perfecto disfrutando día a día haciendo lo que más nos gusta.
 ¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?
En Freshly Cosmetics buscamos 3 cosas: talento, compromiso y pasión.
Trabajarás en un entorno dinámico e innovador con la misión principal de captar y retener usuarios de la marca de Freshly Cosmetics en España, a través de los canales de publicidad online. Transmitir los valores de marca, propuesta de valor y novedades, teniendo en cuenta la optimización de sus métricas.
Las principales tareas y responsabilidades a desarrollar se basarán en:
Desarrollo de la estrategia de las campañas mensuales de ads en los diferentes canales, incluyendo planificación y distribución del presupuesto.
Revisión y optimización de campañas de forma constante para ajustar las métricas a los objetivos.
Ideación y creación de contenidos para las campañas de digital advertising.
Integrar las campañas de comunicación de Freshly Cosmetics en acciones con Digital Advertising.
Crear y preparar audiencias, detectando los públicos para impactar con ads así como las tendencias a aplicar en el sector.
Extraer conclusiones y mejoras del análisis de métricas e implementarlas para conseguir los objetivos de facturación y retorno de la inversión definidos. 
Identificar de forma continuada retos del área y necesidades de Freshly, así como proponer soluciones a los distintos retos abiertos.
 ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?
En Freshly Cosmetics tendrás la oportunidad de:
Trabajar en una startup dinámica, en crecimiento y en plena expansión internacional.
Trabajar con flexibilidad horaria gestionando tu tiempo y tus responsabilidades.
Desarrollar tu plan de carrera con nosotros y crecer día a día, personal y profesionalmente, haciendo lo que más te gusta.
Innovar en vez de competir.
Descubrir Freshly Park, nuestra oficina diseñada para potenciar al máximo tu creatividad y el trabajo en equipo.
Olvidarte del tupper con nuestro servicio de catering diario y tener siempre a mano café, té y fruta fresca.
Equipo portátil propio, monitor de 24'' y todas las facilidades que necesites para el desarrollo de tu trabajo.

 ¿CUÁLES SON LAS CONDICIONES?
Estas son las condiciones laborales de la vacante:
● Contrato inicial de 1 año y conversión a indefinido.
● Contrato a jornada completa con horario flexible.
● Trabajo por áreas de responsabilidad.
● El servicio de cátering no tiene coste para el equipo y además tenemos mútua médica privada y sesiones de fisioterapia incluidas. 
 ¿DÓNDE ESTAMOS?
Nuestras oficinas están en Freshly Park, en la calle Nicaragua n. 36 de Reus (Tarragona).


¿CUÁLES SON LOS REQUISITOS?
 Los requisitos que buscamos para esta vacante son:
● Haber trabajado previamente con las herramientas que serán la clave de tu día a día: Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Bing y Criteo.
● Ser una persona apasionada por la escritura y la ortografía, tendrás que enamorar a nuestros usuarios con tus copys.
● Pasión por los números y el Data Analyst. Las métricas serán la clave en tu posición.
● Demostrar talento, compromiso y pasión por tu trabajo.
● Tener ambición con el proyecto y su crecimiento.
● Implicación y muchas ganas de trabajar.
 La única manera de hacer un gran trabajo es hacer aquello que más te gusta.

Descripción:
Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.

En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.

Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.

Algunas de tus responsabilidades:


Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data

Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinares

Participación en proyectos para grandes clientes

+2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.)

Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.)

Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)


Valorable:


Experiencia en AWS o Azure

Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.)

Experiencia en proyectos para grandes clientes

Puesto ofertado: Business Analyst, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) - OPEN TO LOCATION
Sector: Biotecnología Servicios médicos Investigación
Descripción:
Job Description Summary

The role of the MES Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible of understanding and influencing the provision of demands delivered with Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) applications globally.

This role is responsible for ensuring that the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing are consistently modelled and architected to enable the business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to enable continuous improvement and ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

The individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and liaise with the solution delivery teams to deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that solutions meet business objectives and align with TGS strategy. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD’s MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Partner in the definition of the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate digitalization for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD’s MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company’s manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, assess proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain strong relations with the solution delivery organisation and our external partners.
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Manage and facilitate TGS’ partner teams to ensure delivery provides the desired outcomes
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS’ Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD’s enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in MES technologies and processes in emerging, as well as improvements to existing, investments by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing digitalization journey and Manufacturing analytics capability.
Coordinate and support resolution of critical tickets

Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together.

Puesto ofertado: Senior Business Analyst, MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems) - OPEN TO LOCATION
Sector: Biotecnología Servicios médicos Investigación
Descripción:
Job Description Summary

The role of the MES EDHR Senior Business Analyst within TGS Central teams is to serve as the person responsible for analyzing demand as well as the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Electronic Device History Records (EDHR) area globally.

This role is responsible for driving and shaping demand, as well as ensuring the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions to manufacuturing enabling business adoption of the MES tools to digitize site manufacturing and quality processes to collect, store, analyze, and respond to, data recorded to ensure that products are being manufactured in accordance to our policies, procedures, and applicable regulations.

This individual will conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that business priorities are shaped, prioritized, and delivered. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together to contribute to the manufacturing digitalization agenda for the Operations and Quality business functions.

This position reports directly to the Global Business Partner for MES.

Job Description

The objective of this role is to actively partner with the business Operations and Quality teams (including the business process networks) to understand their strategic priorities and work to identify ways that TGS can support and advance those objectives. Primary responsibilities will include:
Developing a deep knowledge of BD’s Production & MES environment, including key driver goals, short- and long-term roadmaps, key personnel, etc.
Establishing value-adding, strategic partner relationships for themselves and for the entire TGS function
Define the standard capabilities and solutions used to facilitate EDHR for manufacturing sites, ensuring BD’s MES design contains appropriate functionality to enable manufacturing sites to achieve the company’s manufacturing operations and digitalization objectives.
Partner with the SMEs in the Operations and Quality teams to plan new joint initiatives, evaluate proposals, and determine how they fit into roadmaps and priorities
Foster and maintain a network of MES EDHR process integrators across BD within plants and WW business units, including training, coaching and supporting associates implementing MES solutions.
Identify and define new opportunities to leverage technology and/or process re-design to advance business strategies that directly contribute to driving revenue growth, cost optimization and/or risk mitigation and compliance.
Develop strategies for optimal deployment and adoption of new technology capabilities, services and solutions across the business and/or the end-customers.
Work with other TGS Business Partners and TGS’ Core Areas of Delivery to ensure that solutions are not siloed and that they are informed by, and are integrated with, BD’s enterprise roadmaps
Ensure projects and initiatives are delivered, providing consistent and effective communication on status and managing escalation and avoiding risk.
Build Knowledge and capability in MES technologies and processes in emerging technology, as well as improvements to existing investments, by keeping abreast of industry trends and Subject matter expertise in usage of new trends such as AI and ML in the context of Manufacturing and Industry 4.0 initiatives.
Support the business in the strategy and startup of their Manufacturing digitalization journey to facilitate EDHR and Manufacturing analytics capability.
Measure and communicate value realized on a periodic basis through defined and agreed upon metrics and supporting analysis.
Provide support for site manufacturing, quality and engineering related activities including master data, transaction processing, and data interface between MES and Control Systems working with worldwide and local engineering, operations, continuous improvement and plant IT teams.
Serve as a continuous connector. Energized by a role that is focused on partnership and facilitation. Operates through the lens of what can we do to simplify and improve things.
Working with our IT partners to coordinate MES functional support and resolution of critical tickets.
Understand and leverage the Idea to Realization (I2R) process for IT solution delivery including demand management, change control, project management, software validation and the whole System Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Train, coach and support plant associates implementing the standard MES solutions, working with them to plan, schedule, and execute MES implementations and upgrades.
Work with IT and Security teams to ensure system implementations are compliant to latest standards and policies for secure industrial networked systems.
Understand sites use of SAP and other ERPs related to manufacturing, and integration with MES.
Identify opportunities to leverage technology to reduce the burden of manual entry of data.
Must be willing to travel in US and internationally.

Qualifications
Must be willing to travel up to one week per month (international & domestic)
The ideal candidate will bring a combination of strategic understanding, both business and technology experience, exceptional relationship building skills and solution-oriented mindset together. In addition, this person should also possess:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Accomplished in multiple process and technology capabilities across the Manufacturing, and Quality functions, ideally in the Med device sector.
SAP Production Planning, Execution & Quality functional experience
Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) implementation and support experience required
Familiarity of Manufacturing Batch/Device History Records, ideally in the Med device sector.
Knowledge of FDA 21CFR Part 11, understanding of System Development Life Cycle and software validation procedures: IQ, OQ, PQ.
Passion for forward thinking digital transformation.
Ability to map joint organizational vision and long-term thinking, imagination, and idea generation
Ability to communicate complex business / technical challenges in a simplified manner
Must be a leader who can influence stakeholders in written and oral communications
Must have experience and knowledge of change management principles and methodologies and can formulate new programs to generate excitement and engagement
Familiarity with continuous improvement and project management approaches, tools, and phases
Exceptional ability to lead change using positive and collaborative methods
Highly collaborative work style which includes working effectively across all organizational levels
Experience working in a highly matrixed organization and in overcoming ambiguity
Leading by example, mentoring, and motivating others all around you
Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Excellent judgment and decision-making
Able to align and work with diverse global stakeholders
Strong humility, listening, creativity, and negotiation skills
Accepts ownership
Ability/experience to work in a multinational, multicultural business environment

Other Desirable Skills/Experience
5+ years experience working in a highly automated manufacturing environment
Industrial networking and connectivity to PLCs for data acquisition, VLANs, Firewalls.
Programming skills in some of the following; Apriso Process Builder, SQL, JavaScript, Microsoft .Net, HTML & XML are a plus
Understanding of big data technologies, data analytics, automation, cloud computing.

Job Purpose:
The primary purpose of the role is to provide first level support to Tech Data colleagues, assisting in the creation of all types of incidents and service requests, and resolution of more complex and technical incidents and service requests, ensuring customer satisfaction in all steps of the process.The role will include creating new incidents and service requests, gathering additional data from the requestor, performing all levels of troubleshooting and resolution.Where necessary the analyst will escalate incidents and requests to other levels within the Service Desk or to other teams in IT.This level requires the most advanced technical knowledge of the Tech Data environment and applications.The analyst will also lead improvement initiatives within the service desk, play a role (not leading) in major incidents, will have higher troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills and experience.This level will be expected to mentor entry level associate service desk analysts and assist the Service Desk Team Leader in running the team.

Remote work is possible
Responsibilities:
Assists team in meeting individual, team and organizational service level agreements and customer satisfaction.Primary role to meet this goal is to ensure that incidents and service requests are managed in a timely fashion. Resolves the majority incidents and service requests using existing knowledge base documentation and tools. (60%)
Leads improvement initiatives and assists the team leader in running the service desk team. (20%)
Mentors more junior Service Desk analysts (10%)
Participates in training to continually increase technical, customer service and interpersonal skills needed to meet service requirements and enhance customer satisfaction.Continually strives to learn and share knowledge. (10%)
Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
Relevant work experience.
Bachelor's Degree with IT or technically related field of study required.

Degree in Computer Science or other applicable IT areas
ITIL Foundation
Basic Microsoft O365 knowledge
CompTIA A+

Able to recognize and attend to important details with accuracy and efficiency.
Able to communicate clearly and convey necessary information.
Possesses strong multi-cultural interpersonal skills.
Possesses strong organizational and time management skills, driving tasks to completion.
Able to quickly learn new systems and technology.
Cultural Competency Requirements:

Within Tech Data diversity is one of our fundamental shared values. We are a multi-cultural environment and we pride ourselves on being a welcoming place of work where we celebrate inclusion and champion people from a multitude of backgrounds.

Join our team to connect the world with the power of technology!

Anunciado por
Jorge Gaite Pastor
Responsable de Organización y Filiales en Departamento de Recursos Humanos en INFORMA D&B
Enviar mensaje InMail
Misión:
La generación de conocimiento a partir de las informaciones existentes en la base de datos de INFORMA, utilizando técnicas avanzadas de tratamiento de datos, algoritmos basados en el aprendizaje automático y herramientas de transformación de la información.

Responsabilidades del puesto:
Establecimiento de objetivos, en cada uno de los procesos de modelización que se realicen.
Captura y gestión de datos, construyendo las bases de datos necesarias para la elaboración de los modelos.
Diseño de los modelos, seleccionando las metodologías especializadas en cada tipología de modelo (ej. Propensión, riesgo de cese, de impago).
Desarrollo y codificación de los modelos, incluyendo el tratamiento de datos, programación en lenguaje R, SAS o similar, testing y documentación.
Ejecución de los modelos (automatizada) de forma periódica (diaria, semanal o mensual).
Mantenimiento y recalibración periódica de los modelos.
Documentación de los modelos.

Requerimientos:
Formación: E. Universitaria 1º ciclo (Diplomatura – Grado – Ingeniero Técnico). Estadística Aplicada, Doble Grado Economía-Matemáticas y Estadística.
Idioma: inglés (nivel medio).
Conocimientos:
o Data mining y Machine Learning: Avanzado.
o Lenguajes de programación especializados como R, SAS o similar: nivel avanzado.

· Formación Complementaria:
o Especialista en sistemas basados en Big Data como Hadoop y/o Spark.
o Habilidades de comunicación.

Experiencia mínima:
Se valorará la experiencia profesional previa en al menos uno de los siguientes puestos:
• Como Científico de datos con al menos 4 años de experiencia.
• Como Profesor especializado en estadística con al menos 4 años de experiencia.

Descripción:
DescriptionWallapop was founded in 2013. We are the marketplace for second-hand goods in Spain. With more than 8 million searches per day and over 10 million users across Spain with a catalogue of several hundreds of millions of products, we exist to empower people to promote a more conscious and human way of consumption. We achieve this by bringing together the scale and simplicity of classifieds with the convenience and the reach of the marketplace to create the world’s best unique goods trading platform.Wallapop takes pride in having an open culture, where every opinion matters and everybody contributes in many different ways; through different internal cross-functional clubs aligning with people’s passions and interests. We count 26 nationalities within our employee base and we operate in 2 languages: Spanish and English - this makes us pretty fun and special. While in most cases we are not attached to one language or the other, we encourage talent to embrace both languages and be able to operate outside their comfort zone. To ensure success we facilitate group and individual Spanish and English classes as part of our working day.Our company values are:We are One Team: Communicative, trusting and inclusiveWe Dream & Deliver: Creative, impactful, pragmaticWe Aim for Simplicity: Intentional, uncomplicated, humbleWe Learn & Grow: Constructive feedback, curiosityWe organize ourselves into topic teams and embrace agile practices.The ChallengeAs a Wallapop Data Scientist, you will take ownership of the Data Science and Machine Learning initiatives related to a Product area (Search, Personalization, Trust & Safety) and work together with a team of Data Scientists to deliver the best solutions.You will work closely with Product Managers, developers, researchers, and other Analysts to understand the product requirements and suggest possible data/ML solutions. You will then gather the data needed for the problem at hand, prototype, build, and test a robust and scalable architecture to solve it, and integrate it within the Wallapop platform. You will also coordinate with the team for the testing and performance of the solution, and plan the following iterations.Additionally, you will have the freedom to work on internal research projects that could ultimately become data products or insights, and be valuable for the platform. With the huge amount of data we have at hand (structured, unstructured, numerical, text, images), there many opportunities to grow, and many paths to explore.You will be part of a growing Analytics team (15+) reporting to the Head of Analytics.What You Will DoTake responsibility for the DS and ML initiatives in a Product area.Work with a multidisciplinary team to identify opportunities, potential enhancements, gather requirements (product and tech).Work with a team of Data Scientists to explore and build the best solutions (performance + scalability).Take ownership of the complete Machine Learning Workflow: ideation, data processing, model training and testing, deployment, monitoring and iteration.Proactively suggest research and prototype new data ideas.What We’re Looking ForBachelor or MsC degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or another quantitative field.Experience building ML solutions for real-life problems.Strong coding skills (Python is a must, but other languages are also valued), capable of building robust ML software.Proficient in SQL, capable of getting the data required from the appropriate sources, and build data pipelines if needed.Experience with common libraries and frameworks such as Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch.Understanding of different ML architectures in domains such as NLP, Image Processing, Graph analytics, Neural Networks, etc.Experience with BI visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, or others).An analytical, challenging and innovative mindset.Rigorous & quality driven personality.Proactive, autonomous and a team player.Communicative, capable of explaining complex solutions to peers and stakeholders.Fluent spoken and written English.What Would Impress UsBuilding data products for Search, Personalization, Fraud Prevention, Forecasting.In online marketplace, or tech company.Working with AWS framework (Redshift, S3, Lambdas).Working with cloud MLaaS solutions, such as Amazon SageMaker (preferably), Google AutoML, Microsoft Azure ML.In MLOps, productionizing and maintaining ML solutions.Working with Big Data technologies (Spark).Working with GIT and collaborative software development.Wallapop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Our hiring process: * PLEASE NOTE THAT DUE TO THE CURRENT COVID19 SITUATION ALL INTERVIEWS TAKE PLACE REMOTELY OVER HANGOUTS*Intro Call - ran by talent acquisition. It will take 30-45 minutes and will focus on giving you more information about the role and the company as well as going over your experience and expectations.Take-home test - you will be assigned a test that consists of a practical case to solve and an online coding test assessing your technical skills required for the role, you have up to 5 days to complete both parts.Practical interview - ran by the hiring team and relevant stakeholders across other functions. The focus will be on assessing your ability to apply your skillset to the wallapop context.Competency Interview - ran by talent acquisition and hiring manager. We will focus on gaining insights and understanding of how you operate in the workplace and your fit to our values. This usually takes 45 min to 1 hour.Offer - should you be the right candidate, your offer will be discussed over a call with talent acquisition and will then be confirmed in writing. What we will offer youFlexible working hoursReduced hours on FridaysPersonal learning budgetEnglish/Spanish lessonsEncouraging, fun and team-focused offsite trips twice a yearTeam building activitiesPrivate Health Insurance (Cigna)Gym discountsFree office sports classes (currently online weekly classes due to the covid situation) Other benefits paid from the gross salary (kindergarten check, food check, transport check).Extended maternity/paternity leaveNew born or adoption bonusReferral Program & charity donationTax AdviceFree shipping and bumps plan monthly on the wallapop product As we are currently all working from home for the foreseeable future, Wallapop contributes 30EUR towards your wifi monthly as part of your salaryOne-off payment based on compensation package to go towards setting up your wallahome officeJob SummaryID: 3F6B2558FCDepartment: Analytics

Descripción:
CCC is currently looking for a Data Analyst. You will be performing data analysis and turning data into information to understand strengths or shortcomings and improve our business. The Data Analyst will retrieve data sets from a variety of sources (e.g., the operational databases of our products, our data warehouses, as well as third party systems such as Salesforce) and study multiple aspects of these data in the various contexts of our business. Another aspect could be the ability of a particular data set to provide appropriate answers in an operational business context. Yet another need could be the interpretation of patterns in the data and the discovery of trends to provide insights. Apart from the ability to manage and analyze data, the Data Analyst is expected to create narratives using visualizations and other reporting techniques to inform our business. This position requires a blend of analytic mindset, communication, and business acumen along with critical thinking.

What You Will Be Doing

Respond to business inquiries by providing analysis for specific business questions

Work with team members (e.g., Business Units, Product Management, Engineering) to collect and analyze data

Identify and interpret patterns in the data and discover trends in various business areas (e.g., Customer Support, Client Engagement, Operations)

Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients

Use dashboards, graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data

Report against established KPIs to establish baselines and measure the effectiveness of business decisions

What You Need To Have
Programming skills in one of the major programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Python
Good knowledge of SQL
Programming skills specifically for data analysis in any language or environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Clear verbal and written communication skills
Good knowledge of ETL techniques
Reporting and data visualization skills
Degree in Engineering, Science or other relevant fields; advanced degree preferred but not required
Copyright Clearance Center (CCC) clears the path to integrated data and information, accelerates knowledge and advances copyright. With a history of innovation and growth in a dynamic market, a passionate and dedicated team, and a deep commitment to building next-generation content and licensing solutions using the very best technology and talent available, we offer the stability of an ongoing business in an entrepreneurial culture—all while providing very competitive benefits. CCC’s success starts with our team - smart, dynamic, talented professionals whose contributions matter.

As a global leader in voluntary collective licensing with 40+ years of industry experience, CCC sets the standard for an efficient global rights marketplace. We continue to build unique solutions that help organizations navigate vast amounts of data to discover actionable insights, enabling them to make informed decisions. We’re always learning, developing new skills, and exploring new and better ways to help society clear a path to information, discovery and the next big idea.

Here is what some of our employees have been recently saying about working at CCC:

“I'm required to be at the top of my game. I thrive when expectations are high and challenges are numerous, but I know I have the support I need.”

“We get the chance to work with people around the world, not only internally, but externally, building fantastic relationships and international experience.”

“I am able to work cross-functionally with very intelligent people to fulfill needs and opportunities of employees and customers. I know I make a difference daily.”

Valls, T, ES

Purchasing Manager - Data Scientist

About Us

Lear Corporation is ranked #147 on the Fortune 500 with world-class products designed, engineered and manufactured by a diverse team of talented employees. As a leading supplier of automotive seating and electrical, Lear serves its customers with global capabilities while maintaining individual commitment. With headquarters in Southfield, Michigan, Lear maintains 261 locations in 39 countries around the globe and employs approximately 169,000 employees. Lear is traded under the symbol [LEA] on the New York Stock Exchange.

Your Responsibilities

Responsible for the procurement of commodities through the development and implementation of commodity strategies plans and the management of supplier relationship
Drive saving strategies
Management and coaching of a team of buyer(s)
Develop a team to focus on activities that will bring the most of value for Lear
Process purchasing requisitions ensuring no backlog
Translate business problems into statistical/scientific questions
Suggest a variety of approaches and communicate pros/cons
Build models, algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts to generate savings.
Identify new uses for existing data
Research sources for for complementary data acquisition
Collaborate with the rest of the purchasing teams to improve achievements of their objectives.
Implement procurement strategy and policies.
Forecast procurement needs.
Create and implement KPI’s.
Track Purchasing activity and measurements

Your profile
University degree with Master in Data Analytics.
Experience in a BIG4 Or in a multinational savings driven environment.
3 Years experience in data science/purchasing/procurement.
Previous experience managing a team and using python are a plus.

Puesto ofertado: Raman Spectroscopy and Data Analysis Scientist (PhD)
Sector: Nanotecnología Biotecnología
Descripción:
We're hiring a Raman Spectroscopy and Data Analysis Scientist!

Come join a creative and multidisciplinary team dedicated to investigate and develop innovative biomedical devices based on nanobiotechnology, photonics and Lab-on-a-chip.
In this position, you will contribute to improve the health, well-being, and safety of people.
You will help us to for analysing large quantities of data, but also to register spectroscopic measurements in the laboratory, contribute to design and prototyping development of spectroscopic equipment, and provide guidance and technical support to the team.
  What’s the job?

Preparing and analyzing samples using different spectroscopic techniques; mainly Raman and SERS spectroscopy, but also fluorescence or UV-Vis spectroscopy
Data analysis from the registered spectra. Multivariate Data Analysis and Nonlinear Minimization
Formatting and automating the formatting of data. Encoding data formatting and data analysis algorithms
Working with scientists, likely physicists and engineers, to develop optical/spectroscopic systems
Assisting with troubleshooting issues relating software data processing
Coordinating instrument maintenance and repair
  To be considered for the role you should have a Bachelor, M.Sc. and Ph.D. level qualification or equivalent experience in relevant field of study, e.g. Physics, Optical Engineering, Materials Sciences or Nanotechnology; mostly preferably Physics.
  What experience and skills you should cover?

Expertise in Raman spectroscopy and deep understanding of spectroscopic techniques, such as fluorescence and UV-Vis spectroscopy
Experience in optics for spectroscopy and microscopy. Understanding of how Spectroscopy /Microscopy setups work (optical components and imaging hardware)
Skilled on hyperspectral data analysis. General Programming skills, data manipulation and mathematical statistical scripting (e.g. Matlab, Python, OriginLab, Labview, etc.)
Experience with image acquisition and analysis programs, such as ImageJ or Fiji
Multivariate Data Analysis (e.g. PLS Toolbox, PCA). Mathematical / Statistical data evaluation methods and algorithms (e.g. Excel, PSS, Sigma plot, or Origin Lab)
  Preferred but not essential:

Nanophotonics and nanobiotechnology knowledge
Experience in optical and electronic microscopy (TEM, SEM)
Experimental design, including Design of Experiments approaches
  Competences:

Idea generation, problem analysing and solving ability
Strong communication, data presentation and visualization skills
Fluent English and Spanish
  What we offer?

Competitive salary
Indefinite contract (6 months of trial period)
Full-time job (free Friday afternoons)
Immediate incorporation
Great opportunity to develop your skills within an innovative company
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
Join a creative multidisciplinary team in a healthcare company dedicated to transferring basic science outcomes to marketable products
  If you meet the previous requirements, do not hesitate to apply! Send us an e-mail with your CV. PDF or video cover letters will be really appreciate it!

Descripción:
Offer Description

The Institute of Chemical Research of Catalonia (ICIQ) is seeking highly talented Postdoctoral Researchers in the framework of the MSCA-COFUND I2: ICIQ Impulsion programme .

I2: ICIQ Impulsion is a postdoctoral innovative research programme designed for experienced researchers looking for further opportunities and career development in research. The third call for applications will be open from March 1st to April 30th, 2021. The Call is addressed to experienced researchers with at least one year of postdoctoral experience that have not lived in Spain for more than 12 months in the last 3 years.

Reference

RESEARCH PROJECTS AVAILABLE:

ICIQ CAT-2101

Name of the hosting group(s) & Group Leader(s): Prof. Pau Ballester - Prof. Antonio M. Echavarren

Title: Transition Metal Catalysts Containing Phosphorous Ligands Based on Calix[4]pyrrole and Resorcin[4]arene Cavitand Scaffolds

Reference

Title: New strategies for selective chemical modification of peptides and proteins

Reference

Title: Efficient Silicon/Organic and Perovskite/Organic Solar Cells

Reference

Title: Renewable solar fuels generation based on light driven molecular redox catalysis

Title: Development of Photo(electro)catalysts for CO 2 Conversion to C2+ Products

Reference

Name of the hosting group & Group Leader: Dr. Elisabet Romero

Title: Design of Bio-Inspired Systems for Solar Energy Conversion to Fuel

Ref ICIQ EN-2105

Title: The Role of Coherence in Enhancing the Efficiency of Photosynthesis

Sector: Enseñanza superior Investigación Productos químicos
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
The Institute of Chemical Research of Catalonia (ICIQ) is seeking a Postdoctoral Researcher to join the Suero research group. This position will be funded by the European Research Council – ERC project CARBYNE (865554).

ICIQ is committed to performing excellent research at the frontier of knowledge in the broad area of chemistry (Catalysis, Artificial Photosynthesis, Activation of Small Molecules, Photovoltaics, Functional Molecular Assemblies and Chemical Biology, from either theoretical or experimental perspectives). The institute also aims at training the future generation of scientists by offering high-quality educational programmes to master, PhD students and postdoctoral researchers (Full details on

Our mission is to lead, from the vantage point of molecular science, cross-strategies for solving major social and economic challenges, such as climate change and sustainable supply of energetic and raw materials, thereby contributing to the establishment of a knowledge-based economy and improving citizens’ quality of life in our influence area.

Description of the project: The art of organic synthesis and reaction discovery relies on logic-guided thought processes that often involve hypovalent carbon reactive species and their corresponding stabilized equivalent forms. However, not all of the possible carbon reactive intermediates and their reactivity rules have attracted the same attention by the synthetic community. This is mainly because of the perception of the lack of synthetic utility and importantly, because of the challenges associated with controlling its extreme reactivity and lack of efficient sources. The main goal of this project is to invent and develop new chemical reactions based on equivalents of carbyne species –the monovalent carbon species–, able to transform feedstock & fine chemicals into complex organic matter. Our initial works on carbyne equivalent generation and metal-carbynoids were recently published (Nature 2018, 554, 86; JACS, 2019, 141, 15509)

We are looking for a self-motivated, creative and independent individual that fulfill the following requirements:
PhD in Organic chemistry or related field.
Proven track record in discovery and development of novel catalytic concepts.
Experiences in photochemistry, photocatalysis, metal-catalyzed C–H bond functionalization, radical chemistry or asymmetric catalysis.
Proven good level of written and spoken English.
Strong commitment for scientific excellence.

Responsibilities
Discovery and development of new chemical reactions based on equivalents of carbyne species.
Writing reports, preparation of scientific articles, and presentation of results in group meetings and conferences.
Maintenance of laboratory equipment.
Complete documentation of research results.

Benefits

We offer:
A full-time 1-year contract with possibility of extension.
Remuneration according to individual’s qualification/experience
Incorporation: it can be negotiated

Additional comments

The candidate must submit (a) a cover letter highlighting the interest in the position in the Suero research group, (b) a full CV including a research summary highlighting the most significant results, and (c) the names and emails of at least two referees that might be willing to write down a recommendation letter.

Offer Requirements
REQUIRED EDUCATION LEVEL

Chemistry: PhD or equivalent
REQUIRED LANGUAGES

ENGLISH: Good

Sector: Logística y cadena de suministro Recursos humanos Servicios financieros
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
Assistant Researcher
Almeria Spain, MSc or PhD level
Full time

What are you going to do?

What are you going to do as an Assistant Researcher Postharvest?

As Assistant Postharvest Researcher, you will support researchers by coordinating experiments and performing data analysis. You will also do research about postharvest traits using several model crops. Your main objective will be the routine work of the laboratory and you will collaborate in projects as soon as your development in the position allows it. You will develop yourself while doing storability tests, quality analysis or taste panels. In addition, you will provide all data collected to Project Leaders. You will work in an international team under the supervision of the Postharvest Researcher and close to the Breeders and Sales Team.

Your power

Your power
You are research minded and interested in working in the seed sector. You are able to make sense of large datasets and see possibilities for the practical application of the results. You are able to both transfer and translate information between different research disciplines and to understand their needs. Furthermore, you are eager to learn and open to feedback.

In Short, You
MSc studies in Biochemistry, Biology or Agronomy
Experience and knowledge on technical lab equipment and on data-analysis & statistics.
Knowledge on Data Analysis Systems
The international nature of this position requires a fluent level of english.

Our power

Our power

Enza Zaden is a vegetable breeding company that develops vegetable varieties. We produce and sell the seeds of these varieties all over the world. Both for conventional and organic growers. Our goal is to grant people access to healthy vegetables. Anywhere in the world. Every day, more than 460 million people worldwide eat our vegetables. So, we are getting there ... but there is still enough work to be done! Of course, we look further than present needs. In 2050, when there will be about 10 billion inhabitants on our planet, we also want to make sure that people have access to healthy vegetables. To achieve this, our vegetable breeders work with the best that nature offers. Supported by state-of-the-art technologies to speed up our breeding process. And that is really necessary, because currently the development of a new vegetable variety takes at least 6 years. We focus on higher yield, resistance to diseases and pests and climate extremes such as heat and drought. And on taste, shelf life and nutrients. The results? Strong, healthy tasty and climate-proof vegetable varieties with higher yield per square meter and less need of crop protection products or fertilizer. In short, sustainability is truly in our DNA.

Contact

Interested?
Please, send your application to our HR department
More information: contact María Vázquez E-recruitment@enzazaden.es

Apply now!

Sector: Transporte por carretera o ferrocarril Manufactura ferroviaria
Descripción:
Req ID: 73672

We create smart innovations to meet the mobility challenges of today and tomorrow. We design and manufacture a complete range of transportation systems, from high-speed trains to electric buses and driverless trains, as well as infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a truly global community of more than 36 300 people dedicated to solving real-world mobility challenges and achieving international projects with sustainable local impact.

Position name

Data Scientist Monitoring Engineer

Location

Madrid

Duration

Permanent

Position Purpose

Be a part of the task’s execution within the Digital fleet management department, looking for the improvement of the reliability of the fleet and ensuring the accomplishment of the different KPIs and quality requirements established by the Board and the maintenance plans. In this position it is essential to have experience as Data Scientist.

Organizative Estructure

The employee will be part of the Digital Fleet Management department inside depot. The chosen applicant will be inside the depot.

Responsabilities

Support technically drivers and station located personnel.

Support technically depot personnel in order to reduce repairing times.

Logs, events and incidences analysis to define/coordinate corrective actions to take.

Creation of different reports (contractual/technical. Etc.) in order to explain incidents.

Creation of Tableau Reports

Support the development of the diagnosis tool. (Health Hub)

Cooperate in the in the organization of the corrective maintenance both in depot and the stations.

Creation and management of the different fleet retrofits in order to improve the reliability.

Cooperation in the implementation and development of new tools to monitor new subsystems and improve the effectiveness of the tasks done in the depot.

Verify the correct execution of the maintenance plan, proposing improvements.

Test different elect mechanical components.

Update KPIs.

Notify incidents that are likely to lead to Safety issues in the fleet.

Quality, Environment, Safety and Health normative accomplishment.

Medida

Contractual KPIs

Global deployment of the monitoring systems in the fleets.

Education Requirement

Electrical / Electronic / Automatic Engineering

Higher degree Electronics / Mechatronics / Industrial Maintenance

Other Requirement

Spanish

English: oral and writing.

French: (desirable) level intermediate

Experience

At least 2 years of experience in industrial maintenance environment position.

Experience as Data Scientist.

Experience in electrical design

Knowledge of Office Package.

Knowledge of Python and R programming languages are valuable.

Technical maintenance and railway, automotive, aeronautic normative knowledge are valuable.

SAP knowledge is valuable.

Sensor and Big Data knowledge are valuable.

Database knowledge is valuable.

An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.

Desde VIEWNEXT buscamos gente como tú: innovadora, con talento y con ganas de mejorar cada día en nuestro entorno.

¿Qué buscamos?
Buscamos un Data Engineer con conocimientos y experiencia en el diseño y desarrollo de Dashboards en Tableau, partiendo de maquetas del usuario como interfaz a la información cargada, para formar parte de un gran proyecto tecnológico en el sector de farmacéutico.

¿Por qué Viewnext?

Integrarte en una compañía del grupo IBM con más de 4500 trabajadores.
Formación específica a cargo de la empresa una vez iniciada la relación laboral.
Integración en proyectos para diferentes e importantes clientes.
Plan de formación continuo, desarrollo profesional y plan de carrera definido adaptado a ti.
Plan de retribución flexible acorde a tus necesidades (seguro médico privado, cheques formación para estudiar idiomas, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte...).
Integración en un equipo de profesionales motivados, en un ambiente de trabajo innovador y dinámico.
Modelo de gestión sostenible y políticas de igualdad efectiva, ambientes de trabajo abiertos e inclusivos.
Alto grado de autonomía, horario flexible y posibilidad de realizar teletrabajo.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad
Descripción:
Anunciado por
Beatriz López Gómez
Chief People Officer en artyco | the data driven company
Enviar mensaje InMail
En artyco ofrecemos una propuesta de valor data-driven al mercado: somos expertos en analítica de datos de clientes y en el diseño y ejecución de estrategias basadas en el dato y en la relación cliente-organización. Gestionamos el ciclo completo del dato en el marketing relacional y lo hacemos para algunas de las principales empresas de este país.

Para seguir construyendo este proyecto necesitamos a un Data Engineer con formación en Informática, ITIS, IT, CFGS DAI o ASI.

Si te interesa nuestro proyecto estas serían algunas de las funciones que asumirías junto con tu equipo:
Desarrollo de ETL con Microsoft SSIS y Azure Data Factory.
Extracción, manejo y análisis de información mediante SQL avanzado.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos analíticos y de Data Warehouse y/o de DataLake.
Procesado recurrente y eficiente de datos.
Monitorización, evolución y resolución de incidencias en procesos de datos.

Nos gustaría que tuvieras experiencia en:
Implementaciones de modelos avanzados de SQL con optimización del rendimiento y eficacia de las consultas.
Desarrollar procesos ETL con SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS - Microsoft), y valoramos muy positivamente la experiencia en otras herramientas de procesado ETL.
Desarrollar y/o mantener Data Warehouses y/o Data Lakes.
Traducir procesos de negocio a procesos y modelos de datos.

Un plus para nosotros sería que además tuvieras:
Experiencia en alguna herramienta de BI (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView).
Experiencia en herramientas cloud de procesado de datos o tecnologías Big Data.
Formación específica avanzada en Business Intelligence y/o Big Data.
Conocimiento y/o experiencia en Big Query.
Conocimiento de gestión de las plataformas Azure, AWS y/o Google Cloud.

¿Qué buscamos en ti?
Que muestres interés por mejorar de forma continua y adquirir nuevos conocimientos.
Que tengas curiosidad y ganas de avanzar y profundizar en entornos Cloud y Big Data.
Que busques información de forma constante y que muestres creatividad e innovación, flexibilidad, habilidad analítica y tolerancia a la presión.
Además, tenemos una serie de competencias que son fundamentales para artyco y sus valores y que definen nuestra orientación en el trabajo:
Aprendizaje continuo
Calidad del trabajo
Capacidad de aprender
Colaboración
Compromiso en la organización
Comunicación
Franqueza – Confiabilidad – Integridad
Nivel de compromiso- Disciplina personal – Productividad
Proactividad
Trabajo en equipo

¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Formar parte de un gran proyecto con mucho potencial y con historia
Proyectos interesantes y novedosos con clientes de primer orden
Modelos de trabajo muy flexibles (localización, horario y trabajo remoto)

Protección de datos personales
Los datos personales que facilite en esta oferta, serán tratados por ARTYCO COMUNICACIÓN Y SERVICIOS, S.L con domicilio en C/ Playa de Liencres, 2 Edif. Londres, Oficina 1º 3, Parque Europa Empresarial, 28230 Las Rozas (Madrid),(en adelante, ARTYCO), con la finalidad de gestionar su solicitud de candidatura en el presente proceso de selección.
La base jurídica que legitima este tratamiento es su consentimiento. Sus datos se conservarán durante el plazo de 1 año. Si no desea que sus datos sean conservados durante este plazo podrá
ejercer su derecho de supresión o revocar su consentimiento. Sus datos personales no serán cedidos a terceras personas salvo obligación legal.
Usted podrá ejercer en cualquier momento sus derechos de acceso, rectificación, oposición, supresión, limitación, portabilidad o revocar su consentimiento, dirigiendo una comunicación por escrito a la dirección postal indicada aportando fotocopia de su DNI o documento equivalente, identificándose como candidato y concretando su solicitud. Asimismo, en caso de considerar vulnerado su derecho a la protección de datos personales, podrá presentar una reclamación ante la Agencia Española de Protección de Datos (www.aepd.es).

Sector: Enseñanza superior Investigación Administración gubernamental
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
Offer Description

Agrienvironment is a project co-financed by the autonomous government of Castilla y Leon and FEDER with the ultimate goal of raising the Unit research profile to the national award status of Severo Ochoa and Maria de Maetzu excellency awards. The project is currently on-going and, hopefully, it will be renewed by 2023. We are looking for an established researcher in the fields of plant biology, microbiology, agricultural sciences or similar knowledge areas. With the ability to develop his/her own research lines and relocate to Salamanca, Spain. The objective also being to leverage the synergies between existing research groups. More information about the groups at

The post will be initially for a 6 month probational period and one additional year of financing available. It is critical to have a powerful CV to have options towards a progression into the University Career in the Spanish System.

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Biotecnología Industria farmacéutica
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
Bioinformatician

Paramount have partnered with a major new start up in Oxford that has made exceptional progress in the field of cancer diagnostics. Harnessing breakthrough technology from one of the most renowned academic institutions in the world, they are dedicated to making cancer diagnostics more sensitive, accurate and cheaper than ever before. Due to a recent substantial funding round, this exciting Biotech is now looking for talented and highly motivated Bioinformaticians to join their R&D team.

The ideal candidate will bring a deep knowledge of various statistical approaches required to analyse and interpret NGS data and will drive the creation of novel methods. We are looking for an enthusiastic Scientist with excellent communication skills, who thrives when working in a collaborative team environment.

Responsibilities May Include
Creating and implementing novel methodologies and algorithms to enable the analysis of DNA sequence and methylation data for a range of R&D projects and clinical-grade assays
Analyse and interpret sequence data to improve understanding of product performance and clinical utility
Supporting wider teams with experimental design and clinical studies, as well as project requirements, planning, execution and reporting
Working in close collaboration with the software team to support in writing production ready code
Skills And Experience Required
A PhD in Bioinformatics, statistical genetics, applied mathematics, statistics or related field.
Experience in scientific programming, in particular python and/or R.
Excellent statistical skills with post doctorial or industry experience of working with NGS, WGS/WES or DNA Methylation data
An understanding of cancer genomics would be desirable (but not essential)
A background in genomics lead diagnostics technologies would be desirable (but not essential)
Strong team-working skills with previous experience of completing collaborative projects on time and within budget.
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) with the ability to communicate complex ideas and information to a range of stakeholders.
Enjoy working towards challenging goals in a fast-moving environment where on-time delivery of results is a high priority.
This is a really exciting opportunity for a Bioinformatician or Statistical Geneticist who wants to work on truly breakthrough science and make a real impact on the lives of cancer patients. Alongside working amongst some of the brightest minds in this field, the successful candidate will receive a competitive salary package and flexible working options. To be considered, please email your CV to Emilie Francis at Efrancis@pararecruit.com.

Key words: Oxford, Biotech, Startup, Oncology, Cancer Genomics, Diagnostics, Epigenetics, Statistical Genetics, Bioinformatics

Paramount Recruitment Limited provides services as an agency and an employment business. We regularly have similar roles in this area. Please see our website for details or send your CV in to us to find out the latest opportunities. By applying for this position you agree to our privacy policy which can be found here: https://www.pararecruit.com/legal/privacy-policy/

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Biotecnología Industria farmacéutica
Descripción:
A healthcare company is in search for a Clinical Research Scientist to support their development team in the area of clinical research. This is an opportunity to help and drive forward effective therapy for patients.

Job Responsibilities
Developing and designing studies to determine the clinical value of compounds in development and interpreting the results of these studies under the guidance of the senior R&D team
Writing research protocols for clinical studies
Preparing scientific reports and presentations related to clinical trials
Reviewing and assessing research proposals for investigator-initiated studies
Coordination of communication and collaboration with the relevant scientific and regulatory partners
Interpretation of study findings
Delivering end of study reports and publication/presentation of results

Skills And Requirements
A PhD in a scientific field, preferably in the areas of psychology or psychiatry, is desirable. Equivalent education and/or experience are acceptable
Relevant experience in conducting and designing clinical trials in the areas of psychiatry, neurology, or neuroscience
Experience of working in industry is highly desirable as is a broad understanding of the pharmaceutical industry and the clinical development process
Strong analytical and statistical skills
Experience with authoring scientific documents
Well-developed communication skills appropriate to the target audience, promoting effective decision-making where necessary
Project management experience is desirable
Passion for working collaboratively and learning new skills
To Apply
Proclinical is a specialist employment agency and recruitment business, providing job opportunities within major pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies.

Nombre empresa: Fundació Institut d'Investigació Sanitària Illes Balears (IdISBa)
Puesto ofertado: Researcher for the RADIX program in Precision Medicine
Sector: Enseñanza superior Investigación Administración gubernamental
Descripción:
Offer Description

The Health Research Institute of the Balearic Islands calls for the hiring of a researcher for the RADIX program in precision medicine, within the IdISBa-Janssen project.

The RADIX program aims to attract research talent so as to promote the hiring of young talented researchers and the learning of transversal competencies (entrepeneurship, leadership, and communication) for carrying out the research tasks related to precision medicine within the Institute's strategic lines of research.

Role & Functions
To lead and manage the research team.
To develop research programs related to their area.
To develop new lines of research and improve the existing ones.
To carry out and promote publications of national and international impact.
To obtain competitive projects.
To produce and transfer knowledge with an impact on the population health and the health system.

Design your lifestyle as a top freelance data engineer, with the freedom to work however, wherever, on your terms.

Freelance work is defining the careers of today's data engineers in exciting new ways. If you're passionate about working flexibly with leading Fortune 500 brands and innovative Silicon Valley startups, Toptal could be a great fit for your next career shift.

Toptal is an elite talent network for the world's top 3% of developers, connecting the best and brightest freelancers with top organizations. Unlike a 9-to-5 job, you'll choose your own schedule and work from anywhere. Jobs come to you, so you won't bid for projects against other data engineers in a race to the bottom. Plus, Toptal takes care of all the overhead, empowering you to focus on successful engagements while getting paid on time, at the rate you decide, every time.

As a freelance data engineer, you could join an ever-expanding community of experts in over 120 countries, working remotely on the projects that meet your career ambitions.

That's why the world's top 3% of developers choose Toptal. Data Engineers in our elite network share:
At least 3 years of professional experience in Data Engineering
Project management skills
A keen attention to detail
Full-time availability is a strong advantage

If you're ready for a career shift to impactful freelance work, take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form.

Puesto ofertado: Researcher in Marine Spatial Planning and Marine Ecosystem Services
Sector: Gestión de organizaciones sin ánimo de lucro Investigación Producción alimentaria
Funciones laborales: Investigación Análisis Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
AZTI is a scientific and technological center that develops high-impact transformation projects with organizations aligned with the United Nations SDG 2030. Our purpose is to promote positive change for the future of people, contributing to a healthy, sustainable and integral society.

We specialize in the marine environment and food to provide cutting-edge, value-added products and technologies based on sound science and research. With 40 years of experience and a track record endorsed by more than 1,316 indexed publications, we base our excellence on our research staff, of which 58% are PhDs. We also have a presence in 45 countries, three offices in the Basque Country and a team of more than 280 employees.

AZTI is a member of the Basque Research and Technology Alliance (BRTA), an alliance made up of four collaborative research centers and 12 technology centers that seeks to stimulate collaboration between the organizations that make it up, reinforce the conditions to generate and transmit knowledge to companies with the intention of contributing to its competitiveness, energizing the industrial fabric and projecting the Basque scientific-technological capacity abroad.

[MAIN FUNCTIONS]

Collaborate in work and research related to marine spatial planning, evaluation and mapping of ecosystem services and conservation of marine ecosystems.

Sector: Servicios financieros Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Descripción:
About us

RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. The company’s products allow clients to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by systematically incorporating the effects of public information in their models or workflows. RavenPack’s clients include the most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers in the world.

We are searching for a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist to join RavenPack’s Human Resources Team.
As a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will be devoted to recruiting profiles at a national and international level; developing and implementing sourcing strategies that lead to the achievement of business objectives. You will be reporting directly to the Talent Team Manager and will interact with hiring managers to develop and deliver a talent acquisition strategy and execution plan to hire top talent. 

Due to current COVID-19 restrictions, you will start working remotely, but eventually, this position will be based at our beautiful office in Marbella, Spain.

Responsibilities for a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist:
Source and recruit high-quality talent for open positions within our organization.
Serve as the liaison between candidates, hiring managers, and Human Resources staff.
Set up hiring processes, scorecards, interviews, and analytics for each process. 
Communicate with the recruiting team, participate in recruiting best practices and provide accurate, thorough documentation on the candidate via applicant tracking systems and other documentation tools.
Prepare job postings, specifications for recruitment agencies, and other materials in accordance with the organization’s recruitment standards.
Partner with management to anticipate the hiring needs of the various departments to ensure coverage on all current and future open positions.
Maintain an active and ongoing pipeline of quality candidates in support of business needs.
Execute recruiting strategies to deliver top-quality talent and meet hiring plans in a timely and consistent manner.
Monitor and report on recruitment for all talent acquisition and achieve weekly and monthly goals and metrics.

Requirements:
The ability to communicate effectively in English and Spanish, both in writing and verbally is a must.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Human Resources, or a related field is required.
Minimum of three (3+) years’ of recruiting experience
Experience working with multiple teams: Tech, Product, Sales, Operations, Marketing, Data Scientist.
You have a long-term mindset: You do not find a candidate to only fill a position, you think about the whole company picture.  
Ability to build and maintain candidate pipelines for long-term hiring needs.
Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems required.
Proficient in Google Suite.
Proactively come up and implement ideas in order to improve the hiring funnel. 
Data-driven professional: you discuss hiring funnels in numbers and conversion rates. 

What's in it for you?
Flexibility on when you can take your vacation, but remember you will be living in a dream place 365 days!
Team of Superstars! We are proud to gather an international and diverse team of talented professionals (ex-Silicon Valley executives, Lispers, and more).
Motivational leadership: Here your job title doesn’t matter, we all sit together and work for the same goal. 
Competitive compensation, ongoing training, and growth opportunities.
International and dynamic environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)
Beach just in front of our office. If you need a break, cross the street and go for a walk!
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Nivel de experiencia
Intermedio
Sector
Servicios financieros Servicios y tecnologías de la información
Tipo de empleo
Jornada completa
Funciones laborales
Recursos humanos
